author: Brandon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2016
review_content: Pretty disappointed. It hasn't even been 6 months, and one of the ports don't charge anymore. TBH, after doing some review reading, I was excited about this charger.  I bought one for myself and one for my friend. I'm not sure how his is doing or how often he uses it (I don't think that should matter regarding the ports, I can understand if the battery dies over time....hopefully not a short amount of time).  I usually use it over the weekends, and took it on another weekend trip to find my self short a charging port. Definitely annoyed!EDIT 11/08/16: I was contacted by their customer service team the following day after writing this review. Their team was very pleasant to deal with and quick with their responses. Within a day or two, they've already sent out a replacement for the faulty PowerCore 20100 I purchased a couple of months ago! If all goes well, I'll be updating this review again! Great customer service from Anker!EDiT 2/16/17: Anker's customer service is second to none! The replacement works as it should, but the wire would not charge the PowerCore.  After contacting their customer service team again, they were happy to replace the faulty wire sent with the replacement PowerCore. Great company that cares about their customers. I just wish products nowadays lasted longer, but regardless, I'll be buying their products again.
title: Don't expect much after a couple of months...

author: Rik Hanssen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2016
review_content: After fully charging the Anker PowerCore 20100, I ended up running my own personal test to see just how many full charges I could get on my Samsung Galaxy S7.Everyday, for 5 days in a row, I would allow my phone to drain as much as possible as you can see below....then the next morning I would charge my phone using only the Anker Powerbank until it was fully charged.Here are the results!*Charge #1 = 15% to 100% power in 1 hour 35 mins. (4 solid lights)*Charge #2 = 20% to 100% power in 1 hour 30 mins. (3 solid lights)*Charge #3 = 08% to 100% power in 1 hour 45 mins. (2 solid lights)*Charge #4 = 03% to 100% power in 1 hour 50 mins. (1 solid light)*Charge #5 = 20% to 100% power in 1 hour 25 mins. (1 Blinking light)The next morning (on day 6), I tried recharging the phone again while the 1 remaining light on the Anker Power bank was still blinking .....It basically went from 14% to 21% power before the Power bank ended up running completely dry.So all in all I was able to get "5 Full Charges" from this one Power Bank with my Samsung Galaxy S7.Hope this helps anyone who is undecided on pulling the trigger!
title: Samsung Galaxy S7 Approved!!!

author: Elec geek
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2018
review_content: Here is a story of the amazing customer service of this Anker bunch!I bought this unit in March of 2017. I have not used it too may times. But, occasionally I have charged Iphone, Ipad, and some portable speakers. It would basically charge all of them with a single charge to the PowerCore. Very nice!In May of 2018, I noted that when charging, the unit would get to the point where the last LED was blinking, but the lights would never turn off. Other than this, the ability to charge other devices seemed to be unchanged. However, this charging behavior made me wonder whether this was an indication of a potential failure beginning. Therefore I contacted Anker since I was still in their 18 month warranty period (just).I have to say that working with them has been nothing but a pleasure! They responded to me the same day via email. Asked for a few other troubleshooting steps, and then sent me a new one after the extra steps did not resolve the issue. And......they  let me keep the initial PowerCore which of course still works (for the time being)! Amazing.I am extremely pleased with this company and will continue to do business with them. Highly recommended.
title: Here is a story of the amazing customer service of this Anker bunch

author: Shab
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2018
review_content: Loved this powerbank when I initially received it (ordered in Feb 2018) and it has only been a few months and a USB port has already stopped working. I tried to use different charging cables, thinking it was the cable that was faulty but cables work with wall charger, just not the portable charger. Disappointed because this product had wonderful reviews and I really liked the high charging capacity and the small sleek design. Previously I owned portable charges with similar charging capacity but they were much more bulky. I guess my search for a great portable charger continues.
title: Great product initially but one port stopped working after 3 months

author: Steve Wise
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2018
review_content: We purchased two or three of these and for several months they worked really well. However now we cannot charge them at all. Hopefully someone from Anker reads this review.Update: Following this review I was contacted by Anker and they sent out two replacement batteries. The batteries worked well for 10 months then wouldn’t charge and we did in fact recharge with an Anker multi charging port (works great no problems) and Anker cable. Maybe these backup batteries only last a bit less than a year or so, though that’s not what I expect as a consumer. Otherwise, Anker puts sells solid speakers we own, among other Anker products. This is why I’m so disappointing about these backup chargers.
title: We purchased two or three of these and for several ...

author: Gladius
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2015
review_content: Anker PowerCore 20100 – Review by a Frequent Flyer Business TravelerMost of us would agree that we all carry or own multiple devices in this day and age and they all need frequent (1x /2x/3x times a day) recharging after continuous usage. I personally travel a lot for work and I find myself needing battery juice for my devices on a very frequent basis. I carry 2 cell phones and 1 tablet for work.I obviously own couple of power banks to charge my phone during my flights or at the airports. I always thought it would be great if one these days they made a power bank which could charge all my devices few times and it wasn’t so heavy.  Well, guess what Anker PowerCore 20100 is the answer.First and foremost, the capacity of this device is amazing and recharging of your devices is superfast. The unit itself comes pre-charged to about 75%came charged, so you can start using it out of the box.My test: After recharging it to full 100%, I took it with me on my business trip. I was able to charge my Samsung S6 and iPhone 6 at the same time (from 30% to FULL 100% in less than 2 hours). The Power Bank still had more than 50% juice left.  I quickly plugged in my Samsung Tab S and charged it from 70% to Full 100% in less than 40 mins. I was surprised to see that the unit still had more than 50% juice left. Long story short, it took me full 2 days and almost 7-8 device recharges to drain it down to less than 25%. This unit has massive battery capacity. Since then I have ran multiple tests on this unit and it has NOT failed once to impress me.As far as size of the unit, I own old version of the Anker powerbanks and few other units from other manufacturers.  This one is a great improvement. This is probably good 25% lighter than older Anker models and it’s not as shiny as older models. I like the looks of this one better. Anker smartly got rid of the flash light feature which was nothing but a small LED. I personally never used that feature in my older model.The four status LEDs are great and pretty accurate to show the status of battery charge left.  Two USB ports allow charging, it’s rated at 2.4amp per port and total of 4.8amp. I think that’s pretty accurate during my testing. The unit comes with a single USB-to-micro cable and is charged via micro USB input on the side. It appears to be pretty well built unit that is both durable and attractive.For recharging the unit itself, it can take somewhere from 8-10 hours. Best is to leave it plugged in overnight and you will have an enormous power capacity for the busy day or even the week ahead.Anker customer service is the best I have seen, they are quick to respond and accommodating. The unit itself is backed by their 18 month warranty.Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with the battery pack and highly recommend it.  It's a great battery backup for those on the go or even at home if you don’t want long recharging cords from power outlet to your desk.Bullet Point Analysis:------------------------------------Great For------------------------------------ Business Travelers Families on vacation Busy Moms & Dads on the go Considerate co-workers who want to help colleagues with their charging needs at office =) College Students on long class schedules International travelers------------------------------------The Pros------------------------------------ Great form factor for the amount of battery power it packs Power capacity to charge your phone throughout the week (6-7 times) Accurate charging status and battery level LEDs Automatic power off PowerIQ feature to automatically route power to the device plugged in Excellent value for cost------------------------------------The Cons------------------------------------ None I can think of for what it promises. May be charge my laptop too =)------------------------------------The Specs------------------------------------ Dimensions: 6.5 X 2.5 X 1 Output: 2 USB/ 4.8A total Input: 5V / 2A About 1” bigger than Samsung S6 and 1.5” bigger than iPhone6 Substantially lighter than any other power bank with same capacity in the market. Capacity is as promised You can use your existing cell phone charger to charge the device------------------------------------Summary------------------------------------I think it’s established that in today’s digital and multi device environment our devices are power-hungry at all times. I have seen people at Airports, Hotels, Coffee Shops, Office Receptions, Disney World, Museums (yes), Casinos etc plugged into power outlets. Phones and tablets are more advanced but they need battery juice and manufacturers have conveniently taken spare battery option out of the devices e.g. Samsung.This Anker Power Bank makes perfect sense to carry for all your smart phone and tablet charging needs. You can't beat the battery capacity, size, weight, price for the use you will get out of it and to add its backed by a good company who listens to their customers.  I would say go for it!Please do let me know if this review was helpful to you. If it was not, let me know why in the comment section. I promise that my review is fair and honest.------------------------------------
title: Anker PowerCore 20100 – Review by a Frequent Flyer Business Traveler

author: K. Floyd
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2017
review_content: I Have had this charger for 1 year and the battery charge has declined.  When I first got it I could recharge my iPhone 6 4 times before needing to recharge the battery.  Now it charges once and stops reporting it's charge.  When I plug it in to recharge it immediately shows 3 of 4 charge lights.  I expected this to last more than 1 year.
title: Started out great...  Went downhill

author: Christina
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2018
review_content: THIS IS A FIRE HAZARD!  Purchased this in October 2017. First used in February 2018, plugged it in & it popped loudly & a puff of smoke emitted from the charger making both the power cord & the charge extremely hot & useless!  The electrical outlet was also extremely hot!  Wrote to Anker through the Amazon forum & have never heard from anyone.  THESE WERE RECALLED IN 2016 & evidently the problem is not fixed. SAVE YOUR MONEY!!
title: FIRE HAZARD

author: C. Olin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2016
review_content: Bought this when it was released, given the specs being advertised. Unfortunately, it doesn't charge @ 2A or even close to it. It's not an issue with a cable -- I've tested several cables that all charge at around 1A - 2A on another Anker device, as seen in the attached pictures.I've reached out to Anker for assistance and received no help. I'll be sending this back.EDIT 04/2016: Anker reached out to me in private over a month ago, shipped me a new PowerCore free of charge and I confirmed that it was properly putting out over 1A. In addition to this, they replaced an older model PowerCore that had stopped working and I assumed was out of warranty, so I had taken it apart to diagnose what was wrong with it (bad capacitor). Not only did they ship me a replacement, but they let me keep the broken PowerCore so I could harvest the 18650 batteries from it.This is quality customer support and they probably ate a little bit of profit in assisting me. Not only am I raising this review to five stars, I will continue to consistently buy from Anker.
title: originally received a dud, but Anker's customer support really went above and beyond in assisting me

author: Ralph Sula
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2018
review_content: Packaging : The portable charger came in neat. In a nice blue box, no dents or damage at all shown on the box. Comes with1 x Anker portable charger1 x Case1 x USB1 x ManualDetails :●●●● = 100%●●●○ = 75%●●○○ = 50%●○○○ = 25%• The portable charger cannot be charged while being used.• You don't have to press the button for it to start charging. It automatically charges your phone.• 5 Star customer service ! If you have a problem with your portable charger.• It is very slim. 6.5 x 2.4 x 0.9 In• Capacity : 20100 mAhPlease vote helpful if this was helpful to you :)
title: Best portable charger !

author: Abraham Garcia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2017
review_content: After 17-18 months of use, the charger now charges very slowly, about 3% every 30 minutes. It is odd that this happened right when the warranty was set to expire. Meanwhile, I have another, less expensive Anker charger that has lasted for more than 2 years and works just fine.I contacted Anker's customer service department, and they told me they couldn't do anything since the warranty has expired.
title: less expensive Anker charger that has lasted for more than 2 years and works just fine. I contacted Anker's customer service dep

author: Tim Huffman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2018
review_content: The battery worked well for about 2.5 weeks. But after that the charger would stop charging devices. At first it would stop after 30 min, but eventually it would stop charging after 5 seconds. My wife and I were traveling, so there were a few times our phones almost died because it wouldn't charge them.  A few museum visits were spent with me hitting the button to make it charge every five seconds and plugging and unplugging cords over and over.Note: We didn't drop the battery, kept it safe and dry, didn't over charge it, didn't run it down multiple times. Also, the cords worked on other devices, so it wasn't the cords. Some wiring must have come loose inside. A fine battery while it's working. But $50 is steep for a product that stops working in weeks. Not satisfied. We had used similar products from this company and had good results. But maybe the quality has gone down! Alas.
title: Stopped working after a few weeks

author: Michael
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2018
review_content: I am writing this review almost 18 months after purchase. I bought the battery June 2017 for a world tour and it performed beautifully in all conditions. I charged it on some of the worst power grids around the globe and it wasn't till the Philippines when she just couldn't take it anymore and just stopped taking a charge. The battery charged my electrical devices but wouldn't take a charge so while I was in the Philippines I came back on Amazon and researched Anker warranty. Now, this is my 9th Anker battery I've purchased from Anker Direct on Amazon and until now I've never had an issue, not one. I've given them out as gifts and everyone loves them. So, I emailed Anker with the requested purchase information and after an individual named Julia asked me a few questions a new Anker Battery was sent to my house in America and arrived exactly one day before I flew in from the Philippines. I can say that Anker's products are top notch but the real test of a company is do they actually support their warranty . This process was smooth and they even sent follow up emails to make sure that I was happy with my new replacement. I will definitely be buying all my cables, chargers and batteries from Anker in the future.
title: Great battery and even better warranty guarantee!

author: Chaos
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2018
review_content: I've had this for eight or nine months now. It was purchased mainly to keep my phone and iPod charged while skiing in frigid temps. In hindsight, I should have gone with the single port because it takes up less space and isn't as heavy, but I am still happy with my purchase. Ended up having a crazy awesome winter skiing for weeks at a time (thank you previous employer for firing me!!!) and I did not have to recharge this during the weeks I was gone. That in and of itself sold me.However, a couple weeks ago something happened that made me want to write a review. I was an idiot and accidentally left it sitting on a table outside for a couple days and it rained quite a bit during that period. It definitely, without a doubt, got pretty wet. I nearly cried thinking it was doomed and would never work again. But ya know... it still had battery power. I couldn't believe it. I plugged my phone into it, it started charging my phone. WHAT??? I plugged it into the wall to charge it, it started charging. I have not had to recharge it since and it still works!!!And THAT is why I will be an Anker customer for life. Takes a licking, keeps on ticking. Thank you, Anker, for making such great quality products instead of cheap garbage that doesn't last. 10/10 - would recommend to everyone who will listen.
title: Non-bias review

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2017
review_content: I pluged and chraged the device for 8 hours. When it was time for me to use it when im on the road. The device wont charge my phone. The Anker Powercore is either broke or not charging.I was so disappointed, luckily I had a wall plug charger on hand.
title: Anker Fail

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2019
review_content: This has been a great battery for my use.  I use it a lot for travel and it gives me the ability to charge my iPhone and my iPad while traveling.  With the two charging ports, it has also been useful when my grandson and I so all day Pokemon Go events to charge our iPhones.The only thing I might do differently now is spend the money on an Anker Charger with USB C PD capabilities so I could put a charge on my MacBook Air while traveling.Update: March 2019One of the ports is no longer charging when I plug it in.  One of the useful features was the ability to charge two devices at once and that no longer seems to be an option.  One of the ports still works well.  I have contacted the online Amazon/Anker support for resolution since the battery is still under its 18 mos warranty period.  When/If I hear back I will update with resolution.Update: March 2019I contacted Anker support on Sunday and by Monday morning I had an inquiry email from customer support with regards to my issue.  The battery was replaced and I had the replacement in hand by Friday.  Excellent customer support and product.
title: Has been a great product (one year in I have issues)**Updated

author: Left Coast
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2018
review_content: UPDATE: The company actually sent me a brand new one and I could not believe it!!! I didn’t even have to send the old one back in. I will not buy another one from anywhere else besides Anker after this experience. Anker, you have a customer for life. I also plan to get these for family members as Christmas presents/stocking stuffers. Never thought about it till they hooked me up!! Batteries come with 18 month warranty! I love how beautiful, slim, and white it is. When others see it they think it’s big but it charges my phone fully at least 5 times. And more if I can stay off my phone long enough to charge.I wonder if they come with a warranty? I see in my purchasing history that I buy one about a year, but not fully a year. It is a great battery and as large as this one is it charges my phone fully like 4-5 times pending if I’m on it still or leaving it alone to charge. I don’t like that I have to keep purchasing one a year but I guess that’s the way life has become. You used to get something fixed now we just replace replace replace.
title: Anker is hands down the best portable charging company I have ever bought from!!!

author: Max Baun
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2017
review_content: Bought this item for my girlfriend for her birthday, as she has been wanting a portable charger for awhile. I have heard great reviews about Anker and have bought several of their charging cables before.She loved the battery pack and says it works like a charm to charge her electronics while on the road and off the grid! However the first two times we charged the pack, it took nearly 36 hours to reach a full charge. The most recent time we tried to charge the pack she plugged it in on a Tuesday night and unplugged on Friday morning with only 3/4 lights illuminated. We have tried charging it on multiple charging blocks to a similar result.The battery pack maintains a charge for 5-6 iPhone charges, but if you are looking for a convenient pack you only have to remember to plug in the night before a long trip, this is not the one. We may just have a defective model, as most other comments don't seem to have this issue.She also seems to think that this battery pack has zapped her iPhone 5 battery - it used to hold a charge for an entire day, but ever since she started using this battery pack it can only hold a charge for an hour or two. Has anyone else experienced this issue?
title: I have heard great reviews about Anker and have bought several of their ...

author: Tom Mart New York
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2018
review_content: It's been charging for two days. Only one light flashes constantly. When I try to charge the phone, nothing happens.Update.I contacted customer support with my problemA few days later the defective power bank was replaced by a new one. I am very satisfied with the customer service work. For the last two years I have never met such an attentive attitude to the customer as in this company! Highly recommended. Thank you guys, you're the best!
title: Working good!

author: Vcm
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2017
review_content: I bought my anker charger in march 2017 now September 2017 and the charger is no longer charging! It just blinks one light even when I charge for the entire day! What the heck! I'm so disappointed with this product!
title: I'm so disappointed with this product

author: HonestP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2017
review_content: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS CHARGER! I used to have an older version/model with less charging power which we ran to the ground in a few years.  As a local semi celebrity in the Washington DC area, my girlfriend and I use our phones a lot!  We do facebook live, lots of pictures and videos.  We also have iPads and a Samsung tablet.  Not to even mention the many times we've bailed our friends out of not having a charger nearby hahahaha.This charger is amazing.  It does take a bit to charge, at least 12 hours + but when it does, even a heavy user like myself has juice for at least a week.  I love the IQ feature which to me means, it knows when charging is needed so it turns on and off and you don't have to worry about turning it on or off or worrying about it losing its charge for nothing.  That's peace of mind.  I love that it has 2 USB ports to charge two devices at once and I love the charge level indicators.  It's only 4 little lights so each one is 25%.  I very rarely let it drain completely as I like to keep it at 100% as much as I can unless I'm out with no access to charging it or no time.  Absolutely recommend it.  The Anker brand has proven to me in the last few years since using it that it is a solid brand you can trust and rely on.  I've even ordered some of their cable to use with this, they are of the best quality and well designed/material.
title: NO ELECTRICITY TO CHARGE YOUR MOBILE DEVICES, NO WORRIES...ANKER HAS YOUR BACK!

author: Pesty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2018
review_content: UPDATE REVIEW 9/15/2018:  After I posted my original review below Anker reached out to me and sent me a new PowerCore.  Got the new one in the mail and it only showed 75% capacity as well.  I let it charge a few devices before it was completely drained and plugged it in to charge. This one, thankfully, charged to 100% and was able to charge several devices until completely drained.  Again, I plugged it in to charge, and again it charged to 100% capacity.  Anker customer service was great and did right immediately after I made the original post.  It does take a bit to recharge (at least 6-8 hrs) compared to my other power packs, but I'm assuming it's because it is larger than the others.  I knocked it down from full 5stars for the inconvenience, but would have given it a 4.5.  Otherwise, great product and great customer service.ORIGINAL REVIEW: Bought this before going on an overseas business trip. Was 75% charged when it came in so I plugged it in to charge overnight before my trip. It still showed only 75% the next morning before my flight but figured it would get me through the flight. It did get me through but would not completely charge during my trip. It would only charge to 25% during my trip. I figured it was because I was overseas and maybe the outlets weren't outputting what it needed to properly recharge. Long story short, got back stateside and it still will not charge completely and continues to charge to only 25% even after sitting plugged in for over 2 days. Unfortunately, I returned after I was able to return for a refund.
title: Wouldn't charge completely, but Anker fixed the problem

author: Ian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2018
review_content: My anker phone charger was malfunctioning in less than 24 hours!!  I unboxed it and let it charge overnight but it only lit up to 3/5 dots charged.  Then, the very next day it was turning off and on inconsistently.  i'm very upset because i was stoked for this thing! it will play a huge role in my life if it works haha.  I heard Anker's customer service is great so that's why i'm giving it 2 stars instead of the dreaded 1. I want a replacement, i NEVER send things back but this is just ridiculous. I paid $40 for this - the more expensive one because i didn't want a cheap one that doesnt work, but sure enough this doesn't consistently work. so frustrating.  The two times it did work, it charged my phone in record time! from 10% to 99% in 1 hour!! i was very impressed at first but then disappointed at how quickly it malfunctioned.  If this thing is more consistent, i will use it every day and recommend it to others.Anker, will you please message me so i can send mine in for a replacement? I'm sorry to hassle y'all like this but i expect to get my money's worth. Especially since y'all are "Amazon's Choice". Thanks for reading -  this is my first amazon review haha.  wish it was more positive - but if y'all help me out i will gladly upvote my review.  Thanks :) - Blake
title: Malfunctioning within first 24 hours!! :(

author: Mac
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2018
review_content: Pretty sure my unit is defective, i have let it charge for over 24 hrs, not consecutively, but at 8 or so hour intervals without absolutely any use in between and the unit just keeps blinking on the 4th power light indicator, its like it never seems to register a complete charge. Reached out to support and all i was given was some random generic email response that read the charging best practices. How is that supposed to fix a bank that doesnt finish charging? I am going to request a return and refund on this thing if they dont offer an exchange for a working unit.
title: Does not fully charge!

author: C. Freeman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2018
review_content: I don’t recommend this brand at all. I’ve purchased three Anker external chargers, and have been disappointed with all three. They work great at first, but within a few months they all had issues with their charging ports. The cord has to be wiggled “just right” or the battery won’t charge. After a few more months of dealing with that, it just doesn’t charge at all. Very frustrating! Waste of money. These should be marketed as disposable external batteries. They only work for a few months.
title: They only work for a few months.

author: Michael Green
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2019
review_content: I purchased this battery pack exactly a month ago, and it is already failing. While I do appreciate that it holds a massive amount of charge, which is great for travelling, the device has become a bit cumbersome to deal with. About every minute or two, as I’m charging my iPad, despite the fact that the battery pack has a full battery, the battery pack turns itself off. That means that every minute or two, I have to reach down and press the button to turn the battery pack on again. It has become a nuisance and a distraction. I had high hopes for this product given the numerous positive reviews, but it seems that I may have just received an ineffective unit.
title: Battery pack turns off automatically every minute while charging iPad

author: Thinh D. Le
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2020
review_content: Bought this external battery to charge my devices on hiking excursions in hot, desert climates in CA and AZ. Needed to charge a very low battery on my phone on a recent hiking trip. This battery does not function in hot, desert climates (for temperatures in the 90's and above). Plugged in my phone hoping to get a little juice. The battery would only charge for a few minutes then it would inexplicably turn off and go into sleep mode. Kept having to press the wake-up button on the side to get the battery to resume charging my phone. Could only get a few percent of charge on my phone and the external battery would invariably go back into sleep mode. Constantly had to repeat waking up the battery so it would resume charging my phone. Could only get a few percent of juice to my phone...enough to make a quick call. Thank God it was not an emergency situation. Otherwise, I would have been screwed. This product let me down in a big way and I have no confidence in it to take it on a outdoor adventure ever again. Only seems to work when I'm at home in my air conditioned house. This external battery is an unreliable, junk product that will leave you hanging when you need it the most. Don't buy!!!
title: Really let me down when I most needed it...junk product!!! Don't buy

author: Billy Breakaho
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2018
review_content: I bought this power bank for an upcoming trip that I had. I used the charger two times before the trip and everything worked fine. In the middle of my vacation, the cable / cord that Anker included with the battery failed. I had to go to buy another cable. This has happened to every single charging cable that I've purchased from Anker. The two metal tabs that holds the cable in your phone / device, either stay recessed or break off. Anker has great customer service,  in the past they have replaced all of my cables that I purchased from them, but every single cable they replaced has failed. I don't buy charging cables from Anker anymore. I buy my cables from Rampow because they have a lifetime warranty on their cables. The actual battery works great. I've also purchased the smaller version of this power bank, a car charger, and a 6 port wall charger from Anker and they are awesome. Just keep in mind that if you buy this power bank you're probably going too have to buy a decent cord(s) to go with it.
title: Great battery, Bad cable

author: G. Yanez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2018
review_content: I am returning the Anker PowerCore 20100.  I bought it for a 18 hour road trip across 4 states.  Two 2 days on the road and it juiced up my  Android phone just fine.  Even though my phone heated up a lot, it was convenient. I could keep driving without having to stop on the road to plug into a power outlet. Once I got to my destination hotel, I recharged it with a Rampow wall adapter and Ankar USB.  HERE IS WHY I AM RETURNING IT. ---  When I needed it the most, during a massive thunderstorm, stuck in my truck on the side of the freeway in a strange town, the Powercore would not charge my phone --my phone had 1% power.  I finally got to a McDonalds to charge on my phone.  After I got back home, I switched out the Ankar USB cord and used a Rampow USB cord and it works better but my phone runs hot.  Disappointed.  It wasn't reliable when I really needed it.  So I will keep looking for a better solution.
title: Nice power source but unreliable and overheated my Android phone.

author: WTK00
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2019
review_content: Bought it, charged it for 24 hours, verified full charge, headed to airport where I attempted to charge my phone. It charged phone for 3 minutes then stopped, after trying a couple of times I call customer support (poor name for what it is) they had me reset the battery and they again.....no go. They offered to replace the battery (I'm going to Asia for 3 weeks leaving in 45 minutes so this option doesnt work), or refund my money. I immediately said to myself, self this is a company that excels at customer service....but alas, they must first receive the broken one prior to issuing any type of refund. To recap, I bought it, I charge it, I try to use it, doesnt work, I call customer service and they dont service me at all. I understand that companies cant go around issuing refunds without receiving their poor quality devices. They have to do testing to improve the product. But I bought this product specifically for this trip and now I'm heading onto a 16 hour flight with no way to charge my devices. I saw a lot of positive reviews on this device, so it is possible you won't have an issue. But be warned, buy it and test it at least two weeks before departure. Not a great experience.
title: Be warned

author: Noswal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2018
review_content: I hope someone from Anker read this.  I love your products but this one went bad only 3 months after warranty period.  Anker said it was highly unusual to have one die so soon and I actually agree that Anker products don’t usually die this quick.  However Anker would not do anything to help including honoring the warranty or even giving a modest discount on a new product.  Anker if you want to be top notch and you can see how much your loyal customers are purchasing hopefully you will read this and change your internal policies
title: I love your products but this one went bad only 3 ...

author: Jieyi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020
review_content: The battery change charge my phone from 20% to 100% in about an hour at least three times before needing to charge again. It is also discreet and comes with a mesh pouch I store the cables with battery pack. It is insanely heavy to be in a purse though. It is also too bulky for any cute small purses. I use it to charge both my iPhone and iPad throughout the day during school. The battery lasted me three years of use with no issues at all. However, its the fourth year and it stopped charging my devices. The battery pack is fully charged, but it won’t charge my devices. I tried to continue using it for as long as I could and brought it out with me hoping that it would work when I needed it to, but the fact is that it’s not going to work anymore. The lights will show that it’s fully charged, but once I plug it into a device, the lights will turn off immediately. I’ve also googled for support and solutions. Apparently, if this happens within your 18 months of warranty, you should be able to get a replacement. I was unlucky for it to happen so late, but I’m also glad that the battery life lasted this long without any issues.
title: Great battery, minor issues.

author: elliebellie00
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2019
review_content: I purchased this charger originally for a camping trip across the country. It's a great size and weight and I was really excited when it arrived. When it finally came time to use it, I plugged in my phone, the lightning bolt showed up and everything seemed fine. A couple of minutes later I looked and it wasn't charging anymore. I hit the side button to wake the charger back up and check it's status to see if it was drained but it was still at 100%. My phone starting charging again when I hit the button, but minutes later was once again not charging. It was a total bummer since I was on a mountain camping and hoping to take a lot of pictures, but I get that technology isn't perfect and things happen.When I got home from my trip I returned the charger and received a replacement, hastily. I've used it a handful of times, not many, and all of a sudden it's doing the exact same thing. It's 100% full but won't charge my phone for more than a minute or two at a time unless I continuously hit the side button on the charger.I'm sure it's a great product if you get one that works, it has all of the right specifications. I'm just not interested in maybe having battery power, or maybe not. Looks like I'll be searching for something more reliable.
title: Won't continue charging item after 2 minutes

author: Nathan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2018
review_content: Cannot recommend this highly enough.I'm glad that I purchased the 20100mAh version, vs a smaller version.  We took this on a 2 week trip outside the country, where we didn't always have access to power.This device recharged our iPhone 6s' & Kindle many times on a single charge.  I was impressed how long this device worked before needing to be recharged.  It does take several hours to be fully recharged, but it has such an excellent capacity that it is well worth the wait.  I think I only need to recharge it 1x throughout our entire 2 week trip.Build quality is excellent.  It feels premium in your hand.  Doesn't seem to ever get hot or overheat.Having 2 USB outputs is also a great bonus.I also have Anker's 1ft long iPhone cable,   Anker PowerLine+ Lightning Cable (1ft) Durable and Fast Charging Cable [Double Braided Nylon] for iPhone X / 8 / 8 Plus / 7 / 7 Plus / 6 / 6 Plus / 5s / iPad and More (Gray)          , which is also well worth purchasing.  This short cord eliminates having a mess of cables everywhere if you need to charge your phone & use it at the same time.
title: Fast charging & incredible battery life for traveling

author: Garandguy76
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2017
review_content: For starters, I own MANY of Anker's products including the QuickCharge 3.0 car charger, several of their USB cables, their LC90 flashlight, 15w solar panel charger, QuickCharge 3.0 desktop charger, as well as a few other products. I just ordered a new pair of their bluetooth headphones. Anker NEVER let me down and has earned my hard earned money. If I need some kind of cable or power product, I always look at Anker first.That being said, this battery pack is absolutely no exception. I figured between power outages, and the occasional travel with the kids, I should have a solid battery pack for our electronics. I've also discovered that I have several other items that charge via USB and this battery charges everything. I have a set of GMRS 35 mile radios which charge via USB on the charging dock. This pack charges them up without breaking a sweat. Even my small emergency radio can be charged via USB. I'm discovering that a lot of my things can be charged from this pack, which is a great investment.It's got some solid weight to it. If you insist on packing light, you might want to consider a smaller pack from Anker. If you're looking for a lot of power in a small package, this one fits the bill. The two USB ports put out some great power at the same time. I've charged my Moto G4 Plus from zero to 100% in roughly 1 1/2 hour with the phone turned off which to me, is impressive. The four blue lights on the outside indicate how much of a charge you have and there's also a button you can press to get the power indicator lights to tell you how much juice you have. For the outdoors, I'd recommend purchasing a 10ft USB cable so the battery can stay in your pack, giving you more than enough cable to have handy for your GPS, radio, or phone. Anker makes some VERY nice cables that are perfect for the sportsman and the outdoors.For the family, this thing can be a big lifesaver, providing essential power during an emergency or family trip when the kids need some more tablet time or during a power outage. This also comes with a carry pouch and a 3ft USB cable which is a big plus. The only downside to this pack is the recharge time. It does take considerable time to recharge it (roughly 8-10 hours), especially if it's completely drained. In my personal opinion, I believe the slow charge is to ensure the pack charges efficiently and correctly, just like a traditional battery charger. I'd recommend charging this pack overnight and it'll be ready to roll in the morning. After using this pack for several months, I'd recommend it to anyone without reservation, especially for it's battery strength and size. This is just about as much power as you can take with you in a small package and it hasn't let me down once. I'd buy another one with zero hesitation.
title: You can't find this kind of portable power, at this price, that performs like Anker products perform.

author: The Technological Consumer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2018
review_content: One of my all time favorite Anker purchases.  We have 2 of these 20,100 mAh chargers and the 10,000 mAh Anker charger.  I have been using my 20,100 mAh charger almost every day for the last 18 months.  My wife also has one and uses hers often also.  We have the 10,000 mAh as a smaller option.  Basically, I never have to deal with having a dead phone battery.  Nice for long flights or travel days where you won't always have access to power.I am getting ready to upgrade to the 20,000mAh PowerCore II soon.  This unit has been amazing but I think it is getting towards the end of it's life cycle.  Its taken a lot of falls and been through hundreds of charge cycles but still performs.  Great value and highly recommended.
title: Great charger.  A travel necessity.

author: S K Hoppe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2018
review_content: Portable Charger Anker PowerCore 20100mAh - Ultra High Capacity Power Bank with 4.8A Output, External Battery Pack for iPhone, iPad & Samsung Galaxy & More (Black)          I read instructions.  Opened the box, unboxed it all, saw there was two lights on power check, so I decided to power it up.Decided to charge it off my laptop (plugged in too), and while I have 2 USB ports on one side of the laptop, the connection to my wireless mouse was on the other next to it. I plugged in the power bank and the mouse stopped working.  I unplugged the wireless dongle and put it back in and it was fine. It was freaky. Why would a battery mess up my USB ports? BTW, my laptop is fully charged and is plugged in to charge the phone and the Anker.The instructions say the best charging is through an Anker power dongle.  I have no idea if any of the wall chargers I have are Anker or not, but as I just started working on my pc I figured it can just sit next to me and I can figure out if it gets hot.  My actual phone is also charging off the laptop of another USB on the other side of the laptop.The instructions say also that this is not quick charge cord. I guess that and the size is why it takes long to charge.  I honestly don’t think for the capacity of this bank it should take much longer.  I had a smaller powerbank over half the size, which died way out of warranty, so I took the chance on this one, and that one took about 6 hours for full charge.Ugh, to think I just moved my hand over and bumped the USB area and my mouse won’t work anymore. Goofy. I gave up and put in a wall charger for the night. After I picked it up I noticed that the mini, not the USB, the power to plug to charge is warm.  My other Power bank never got warm or messed up my USB.  I placed it in an area I can monitor in case the warm turns to hot or not. And I moved my hand over the USB plugs after this and no disconnections.Currently, the wireless dongle for my mouse is fine, mouse works, powerbank is charging across the room.So the next day the whole power bank is charged, lights off, and no hot spots on cables or bank, all lights light when power is pressed, good. I take the power bank with me and my S5 mini (yes, I am still limping along with this….) and I used Anker’s cable.  I had to run around and thought to test this.  I plugged my phone into the charger and when I started with 57% and I looked about ½ hour later it was 56%! I unplugged the cable from both the bank and the phone, reattached both, wiggled it until the phone told me it was charging,  and found the phone now charging and in about 1 hour I was 100%.This bank is huge compared to my phone, but I love that I can leave it in my purse or in a jacket pocket in case I need this. I think I just have a faulty cable.  With what I did so far, do you agree? Faulty cable? I  contacted Anker too.So the last few days I have been testing it. Still with the OEM cable, and placed it carefully in my bag, already attached to the phone. Again it was 50 or so percent and without taking the phone out, no emails or text or calls, and within an hour charged. The Anker showed 100%.  The next day I just tossed everything into my bag and no charging of phone. Had to take it out and re-plug it all and then the charge started fine and I had 100% in about an hour.The phone has now charged, even if it is freaky, up from 50-100% and shows full charge still.  Wigging is not good = I want secure connections. But I am thrilled with the performance of actual charging.Update 08/19/18I did contact Anker and here is a bit of the exchange:A: We regret to hear that you have some issues with your PowerCore 20100mAh. Actually, we also felt strange about the problem that when charging the PowerCore 20100mAh via the laptop, your mouse does not work. We never heard this issue before.As for the hot issue, please be advised that while using this battery, a little warmth is normal; but if it becomes too hot, it could indicate a fault. We normally suggest the customer use the 5V/2A wall charger to charge this PowerCore 20100. It generally takes 10-11 hours to be fully charged with a 2A wall charger, and 20 - 21 hours with a 1A wall charger. If you are using the laptop to charge it, the recharging time will be longer.In order to help us better record the problem, would you please try plugging in a different cable to charge your phone? Then we could know whether the problem lies in the output port or the provided cable. Does that make a difference? Please let us know the results.Me:  I used a new USB/mini cord with the power bank. Worked not any better. Had to wiggle and unplug and replug into both ports. Disconnect and reconnect my phone until charging happened. Then charged until I moved it.So the next day I let the USB/mini cable sit in the bank all night. I did not charge the bank.The next day;Checked the lights, all 5.Used new USB/mini cord, connected my phone, nothing, and switched back an forth. All nothing.A: Though we have strict control on quality with numerous inspection, on occasion a problematic product might make it out. Therefore, I have arranged a new PowerCore 20100 to your address. It generally takes 3-5 days to deliver to the destination. When you receive it, you could test it. And we will highly appreciate it if you could let us know how it works for you.To save your time, we do not need this product back on this occasion :) Hope the replacement arrives soon and works like a charm for you! Have a nice day!Me: That is great . Thanks.A: ~ a replacement is sent, I recycled the other one ~ BTW, the cable is fine it will charge anything I put on it....~~~Me: The new powercore 20100 is working great.  I can charge it from my PC and it doesn't affect my mouse.  It charges my phone many times and I am quite happy.So now I can just attach my phone, toss it all in a bag, and in about an hour my phone is charged. I am very happy with the powercore and Anker support.  To all, don't suffer with a less than stellar work from this, contact Anker.
title: First was broken, new one is Wonderful! I recommend, see update

author: Lisa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2020
review_content: I loved this charger when I first bought it.  It was powerful and charged my phones quickly.  It was heavy, but I travelled a lot with it on planes.  I bought it in December of 2018.  In about a year's time, I noticed that whenever I tried charging the Anker, it would take longer and longer for it to fully charge.  I did't think much about it at first and thought maybe it was the socket or the connecting cord was loose.  Well, It is September 19, 2020, and I'm writing to say that it just got worse and worse.  I've been charging it for 4 days and it is about 1/8 charged.  Of the 4 lights that indicate it is fully charged, only 1 lights up-after 4 days of it being in the socket.  I'm very disappointed.  Others have complained about this too.  I was hoping this wouldn't be my experience but it is.  I won't buy this and probaly wont buy another Anker product again.
title: stopped working

author: Lisa98
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2019
review_content: I’m a flight attendant so I wanted to get a portable charger.  I’ve noticed there’s mixed reviews on this one and I’m one of the unlucky ones.  When I first received it it had 2 blue lights so I charged it up to 4 blue lights no problem in abt 24 hours.  I’ve charged my iPhone 6s maybe 4 times with it . It’s back down to one blinking blue light and I’ve been charging the Anker for 48 hours and it’s still at just one blue light.  I haven’t even had the thing for two months and amazon says it’s too late for return. I spent $50 on this anker it should last more than one time!!  I also read that the customer service is great well we will See because I am not happy whatsoever.
title: NOT HAPPY

author: andrew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2019
review_content: Ive been supporting anker for several of years now. I had one of these stolen and I didn't hesitate to order it again and even bought another one at the same time for a friend. Even got their 4-USB wallcharger (which got stolen too at the same time) and although I haven't replaced it, it was awesome and quick. And their kevlar Cables for iPhone are way better and that has lasted me over a year now. Y'all probably know about the great customer service. I have never used it because I'm bad about contacting support but they'll always replace your faulty product no questions asked, which probably doesn't happen often because they're built pretty solid.now I didn't talk much about the product but read the description. it does exactly what it does. The only thing I can offer that they don't mention is how long it retains charge. Once I lost my charger in the truck and forgot about it for a month... in WINTER! When I found this bad boy again it retained its full charge. How awesome is that?No regrets buying this product.
title: Anker FTW

author: Adba M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2018
review_content: Traveled to Asia and back through China to Thailand. This power bank was checked at every single stop (total of 6) and passed without problems. Being a 20000mA power bank it’s a good thing. *Able to charge iPhone 8 Plus 3 times.-2 stars for being completely useless while being charged. My other much cheaper power bank is able to charge my phone while the unit is charged.This doesn’t allow you to do that even if there is plenty of juice in the unit.Update. Battery is now dead. It’s been a couple of years
title: doesn’t charge when charged

author: aznboyz408
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2020
review_content: I've been a loyal fan of Anker for 8 yrs now. This power bank works great and weight only 354 grams or about 12.5 ounces... That's fantastic for 20,100 mAh. It does what it says and that's the bottom line. As for quick charge, it's the fast charge of previous gen aka roughly about 12W fast charge, it can charge a Samsung Note 8 from 1% to 50% in 45mins and 100% after about 2.25 hrs. Its pretty awesome overall at a reasonable price, the only drawback I can think of is it's a lil outdated & slow compare to similar capacity new models from anker. It charges via micro usb (super slow to charge up even when paired with a 30W wall charger) and has 2 usb A output ports of 2.4amp each. If I would buy another power bank, it'd be the new similar model from anker with updated ports & fast charge gen 2 which support a 45W output port via usb c.
title: Great Power Bank, even after 3 yrs of usage.

author: W. Dietrich
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020
review_content: WOW!  I was traveling from Las Vegas to Des Moines by car.  My phone is several years old and doesn't hold a charge.  Honestly turning it on loses 10% of its battery. My car charger had a GPS plugged in as well as Amazon Car Alexa to stream music and answer weather questions.  So my phone needed to be on to help stream and allow me to talk.  I bought the battery the day before I left it was slow to charge and probably took a full day. I plugged in my phone after 4 hours in the car and left it plugged into the battery the entire time.  When I got to Des Moines my phone was at 100% and I still had half a battery left for future charging.  This battery is so awesome and compact that it slid underneath my emergency brake.  It was a life saver for a long drive and I do not hesitate to recommend
title: Kept my phone at 100% plugged in and used non stop from Las Vegas to Des Moines

author: Linda A.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2018
review_content: I needed a powerful recharging bank for traveling, and I’ve used Anker products before and I’ve always been happy with them, so I selected this size. Not too huge, not too expensive.I used this solely on a one week vacation, and I recharged the bank three times (overnight), trying to keep up with two heavy use iPhones and two moderate use iPads. I didn’t feel that was enough for 4 devices, so I got a second one for hubby to use.  Two of these is perfect for our usage requirements. They work as promised, I’m getting about 7 re-charges on my phone OR about 2-3 recharges on the iPad, depending on how drained it gets.I got one white and one black so I can tell them apart and keep track which one has been used, etc. I’m happier having one big bank instead of carrying a handful of 1X and 2X use smaller banks. Well worth it for me!
title: Very happy with (nearly 😉) unlimited power!!

author: A Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2019
review_content: This charger seemd to work fine at first. I took it with me on a trip where I’d be off the grid and then never used it again for over a year. Now it will charge my iPad Mini 4 only ONCE, that’s it! There’s no juice at all after that. I’ve tested it several times to make sure. There’s not even enough power to begin to charge my iPhone 8. I charge it overnight and the blue lights are blinking indicating it’s charging. I’m very disappointed!Update: 5/23/2019.  Anker replied saying that since it's 2 months out of the warranty period they have no intention of replacing this defective item! I only used this thing ONCE! I then set it aside and only recently decided to check it out again and that's when I noticed right away that it doesn't work as claimed. It will charge my iPhone 8 only ONCE! It will charge my iPad Mini 4 only ONCE!Update 5/29/19: A lady from  Anker contacted me and said that they wanted to 'make itbright' by replacing my defective unit. She said that she thinks I'll be very pleased with the new one. What can I say? I feel much better. She said that it will arrivevwithin 3-5 business days. I'm satisfied now. And I'm very impressed.
title: Barely Used and it no Longer Works!

author: Kelly G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
review_content: I bought this product for a 4 day hike in Peru.  It was my fault for not testing that it worked before the trip (I charged the device before the trip, but I assumed that is all I needed to do), but on the plane I immediately realized that it wasn't charging my phone (Samsung S9).  When I got to my destination I charged the device over night again and spend multiple days buying new USB cords, but none of them helped the device recharge my phone.  I ended up buying a cheap power bank and it worked with all of the usb cords that I had with me.  It is almost 2 years since I purchased this product and I held on to it because throwing away something that hasn't been used is hard for me to do.  I made one last attempt and gathered all the USB cords in my house to give them a test, but the phone isn't charging.  I would suggest testing this with your phone as soon as you get it instead of packing it away for a trip, like I did.  Hopefully you will have better luck and not end up with a pretty brick.
title: Didn't work with Samsung Galaxy S9

author: Doug Marke
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
review_content: Anker sent me a free replacement battery pack after the original showed some very strange behavior. No proof of purchase, no need to return the original, just confirm my address via email and a fresh one arrived in the mail. I've truly never had to put less effort in to getting a warranty replacement product. The replacement pack works exactly as advertised.Original post:I have an LG G6. I'm able to recharge four times off this battery pack. However, I had a really strange experience with charging cables. I have several type C cables that all work fine with wall chargers, but only one will work with this battery pack. The rest begin charging then stop after two minutes. I've never seen anything like it. I have to plug /replug to begin charging again. My solution is to just use the cable that doesn't do this, but having a battery pack that doesn't work with some cables for no reason is frustrating at this price level
title: Only works with some cables: UPDATE

author: Micah Gay-ya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2020
review_content: Honestly wish I bought this sooner! It's weight and size is not bad for it's charging capabilities. Actually this doesn't ship to HI so sadly if I wasn't able to ship it somewhere else I'd be really sad. But the good this is, is that I was landing somewhere to be able to travel with it. I just wish it came with some type of cord instead of just the charger. When I first got it, it was already pre-charged like all of the comments said. However, it does take a while to fully charge. I take this with me everywhere and I don't ever really need to charge it. It's more of my backup emergency charger in case I forgot to charge my ipad.When I'm at work and my ipad is at 10% I use this and in no time it's completely charged or I charge it to where I can function with it for the remainder of my day. It still would have 3-4 life lights left so I wouldn't need to recharge. When I took it on my trip, it didn't weigh me down and I didn't feel like it was too heavy of an item to take around NY with me so that's a plus! I definitely recommend this product. Just don't forget to bring a charging cord to charge your items with because it does not come with one! Also, a strong enough power brick to charge this!
title: WISH I BOUGHT THIS SOONER

author: Mark M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2018
review_content: I bought 2 of these back in 12/2016 for my kids as their phone batteries frequently died while at school and they did have easy access to charger them.  I looked at different brands of chargers and Anker had a good reputation.  I settled for the powerful 20100 mAh model since it had more capacity and quicker charging.  My kids rave about their chargers and swear they charge faster than using a wall or car charger.  They tell me that they get 4 or more complete charges (0% to 100%) on one fully charged battery which is exceptional.  The only gripe they have is that the charger is quite heavy and feels like they are hauling around a brick but that's a small price to pay for always having backup power readily available.  Anker is a brand that I trust and I have purchased several of their other items and have not been disappointed.
title: Powerful Charger

author: Garrison
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2018
review_content: I have used many different portable chargers and this one makes the list as one of the best. The capacity of this thing is absolutely amazing! I can go a whole day doing various multimedia projects and not have to worry about running out of juice (I use this to help charge my iPhone, iPad, GoPro's, and DJI drone controller when I am on location for various shoots without a power outlet). I have not had any issues with the durability of this device and when I am on the go I am usually just tossing it into a backpack and it has held up after a year of on the road use. I like that it case with a little bag which helps to keep it from getting scratches and can hold the charging cable for the portable battery and a charging cable for your device.(ps be aware the it does take a while to charge this battery if it gets down to 0%)
title: Great Portable Charger

author: Ernest V. More
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2019
review_content: I first bought this product on 24 Aug 2017, the Anker PowerCore 20100.  It stopped working by mid October 2018.  So it lasted a tad over a year.  Not great but I used it daily and it only cost $40.I decided to buy two newer models from Anker but I found them too big, designed more for laptops, or too small.  So I decided to buy the Anker PowerCore 20100 again.  This time it was $50.I bought this item 12 November 2018.  The Amazon return window closed 31 January 2019.  My credit card return window ended 10 Feb 2019.  This item stopped charging altogether 100 days later on 20 Feb 2019.  However, I contacted Anker and they sent me a new device for free even though it was over a 100 days.  They stand behind their products and do everything to show that to the customer.  I recommend!  Buy with confidence.
title: Reliable seller even when problems occur.

author: Michael Turner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2020
review_content: So far, both units I've purchased through Amazon have precisely the same exact issue.  They push a charge until they no longer feel like it (let's say whatever you're charging is at 60%.  You plug in the ANKER charger, sometimes it instantly initiates a charge, sometimes you have to push the button.)(Then it frequently, not every time will charge for maybe 10 minutes, no specific amount, then stop charging), you push the button again, same procedure, then again, then again.  Same damn thing over and over until you resort to going 'old school's.  I have 2 that I purchased directly from ANKER and they work flawlessly.  Every damn time!
title: DO NOT PURCHASE ANKER PRODUCTS FROM AMAZON

author: RosyRazly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2020
review_content: Well I literally got this yesterday to replace my old one (different brand) that I’ve had for 6+ years that I used on a daily basis and loved dearly. I’ve owned quite a few portable chargers and never had a problem with any of them....This one charges for literally a minute before shutting off repeatedly. I charged it for about 18 hours before first use, but still, it constantly shuts off. I bought this Anker because I’m usually happy with this brand, but this one is completely useless.
title: It doesn’t work

author: Tom M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2017
review_content: We recently bought this battery for an upcoming trip, and wanted to give my version of Rick Dotson’s charging time review that’s at the top of the review list for this item. I ran my test with an S7, but not depleting the battery as much as Rick did, since I don’t normally use that much battery at a time. With a 2.1A USB wall charger, it takes roughly 10 hours to charge. Honestly, I wouldn’t recommend using a charger with less than 2A as it will take much longer to charge. This will be powering an S7 and an S8 and I’m very happy with the charging time. Both phones have a 3000mAh battery. From the lower percentages, it charges quickly up to about 70%, then it charges more slowly.(****) = Battery light meter after charge completedCharge 1: 28%-100%, 1h 44m, (****)Charge 2: 35%-100%, 1h 42m, (****)^Charge 3: 20%-100%, 1h 46m, (***)Charge 4: 20%-100%, 1h 46m, (**)Charge 5: 20%-100%, 1h 35m, (*)Charge 6: 11%-82%, 1h 13m, (--)^^(^ = Forgot to remove phone from charger for a few extra minutes after charging finished)(^^ = Battery meter was blinking from about 20%-82% when it died)I did a test with both phones charging from it, however it was overnight, they were left on the charger, and consumed more battery than they normally would if removing after 100%. I believe the battery pack charged both, and depleted after about 1.5 charges apiece on both, but again, they were sitting on the charger all night.Size/Weight: It’s about the size of a glasses case, slightly longer. It’s not ‘heavy’, but it does have a small amount of noticeable weight and it’s not uncomfortable. I can put it in my front jeans pocket and it sticks out slightly. If you were to put it in a backpack you’d probably not notice it that much. It comes with a soft/mesh drawstring carrying case.We look forward to being able to use our phones on a long plane ride, and a long bus ride!
title: I wouldn’t recommend using a charger with less than 2A as it ...

author: The Matt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2020
review_content: This is great portable charger. I take it out and about with me every day to keep my phone juiced up. This a hefty little unit and there’s 4 little blue lights on the battery to indicate how much juice the battery has left. The blue lights will also light up one by one while charging and stay lit, and when the unit’s finished charging the 4 LEDs will turn off completely...probably a power-saving feature designed to protect the Anker’s battery from overcharge. The battery takes literally all day to charge up to full capacity, but I plug it in several times a week, never draining it completely. I keep it in the provided mesh drawstring pouch because this Anker battery back is slippery and I’ve dropped it a couple of times, scratching it up; however, it’s pretty durable. I recommend this Anker charger.
title: Keeps My Phone Charged All Day

author: Katelynn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2020
review_content: I’ve always heard great things about Anker power bars so I finally decided to invest in one right before I took a 10 day long camping trip. I didn’t know how often I’d be around an electrical outlet and sometimes it was days, so having this really helped me out! It’s a tad heavy, but fit in my hiking backpack perfectly and worked very well! I charged my phone every day for 4 straight days before I was able to plug the Anker in to recharge it. It wasn’t dead yet but I didn’t know how long it would be before I could charge it back up so I just did it anyway.Highly recommend!
title: Great battery life, easily packed for travel

author: JennS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2019
review_content: We have loved owning this power bank. We first bought one 1.5 years ago and it worked amazing. We were always impressed with how fast it charged our devices and with how many charges we could get out of it before it died. I'm glad we chose the 20100 because we can charge two devices at once.We ended up losing the first one we had, so a few months ago we ordered another one, same model. This one didn't seem to work as well as the first did. It charged more slowly and one of the ports eventually stopped functioning. I finally contacted Anker and they responded well within 24 hours, apologized for the defect, and had a new one to me within a couple of days. I was very pleased with their customer service and that they stand behind their 18 month warrenty. The replacement works great.
title: Great quality charger, excellent customer service

author: Rene Aguilar-Delgado
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
review_content: Up until I purchased this portable charger, I had strictly purchased Mophie portable chargers. After using this portable charger for some time, I concluded that Anker has a better product than Mophie. This conclusion is directly stemmed from Anker's PowerIQ charging, which puts them far ahead of their competitors.This portable charger charges my phone incredibly quick. Although, the battery seems to diminish quicker as a result. I would recommend buying a power bank of this capacity, especially if you are a university student that does not always have the option to use an outlet. This has been quite a useful product when I am late for a lecture, but my phone is close to dying. In addition to buying this charger, you also receive a soft case that aids in protecting the portable charger from scratches.The power bank is heavy, stemming from the fact that it is a 20,100mAh capacity portable charger. If you will be carrying this product in a backpack I heavily recommend this capacity. Although, if you are going to be carrying it around, such as on a social outing, I recommend one of lower capacity, which in turn is lighter.I extensively recommend purchasing this product or other Anker portable chargers that have PowerIQ charging.
title: Would Recommend!

author: Luis Sanchez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2017
review_content: This little guy has come in handy for many a concert, as well as vacations! Nothing sucks more than lining up for a show hours before, only to get to showtime with 10% battery life. With this, I can binge Netflix or go on social media while I wait, charge the phone simultaneously, and be ready to take a ton of pics and videos.More recently, this has saved me during my trip to Iceland a couple days ago. Using the GPS on my phone, as well as data, is a quick way to drain the phone battery, but carrying this around relieved me of that worry. It's also slim enough to fit in my flight bag that I always carry with me (L:7 inch, W:5 inch, D: 1 inch), and I've never had an issue with security when going through venue checks or anything of the sort.
title: A literal lifesaver!

author: IRONCROSS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
review_content: What the heck happened to Anker?  Bought ten of these for a long trip and all of them won’t charge any of the families phones past 80%. Phones range from iPhone 6s to XR. I used to buy only Anker, but will have to look somewhere else now. So disappointed.  I strongly don’t recommend
title: Big name now, POOR QUALITY.

author: marty steves
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2017
review_content: This is the second Anker I have purchased through Amazon  First I purchased the smaller one now the bigger one  I rely on these batteries to fly every three weeks to go visit my son so that I have a way to charge up my iPhone or iPad while I’m flying.  The first one  work great but then failed A month later the second one failed  which is much larger  stopped working after 45 days.  These products comes with such high ratings  I don’t know if I’m just being very unlucky but I’m hoping that the manufacture will contact me and send me a new ones so that hopefully I have better luck and can  give you a new review and a better rating  Unfortunately both failed after the 30 day return warranty with Amazon  i’m hoping the manufacturer will read the review and reach out to me
title: Hoping for manufacture support

author: Joshua N Nichols
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2018
review_content: I've had the PowerCore 20100 for a couple of months now, and I love it! It is a wonderful, portable charger that even inspired my wife to pick up an Anker charger. As with all Anker products that I've been able to use over the past year or so, this product exceeds what you would expect. I've charged both my wife's and my iPhone X simultaneously, was able to get a pretty good charge on an iPad Pro, charged my Apple Watch, and even my Bose QuietComfort headphones (obviously, not all at the same time, there are only two ports). The two ports are very convenient, especially when I have to carry my personal cell phone as well as a cell phone for work. Anker makes great products, and if you're looking for a portable charger, I would definitely recommend using one of the chargers made by Anker.
title: Anker Charger Exceeds Expectations

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2020
review_content: So first let me start with saying that I purchased this product about a lil over a year ago and it has surpassed my expectations in every way. Originally I was using cheap store bought portable chargers that maybe lasted 2 months if I was lucky, after so many chargers later I decided ok I'll spend some more on what's considered a decent charger. Well let me tell you this is one of the best portable chargers on the market, my portable charger was left in the sun, outside, and had even been banged up a few times on hikes and it still never failed to live up to it's performance, even after a year later it would charge my phone just as quickly as when I purchased it and this was something I used on a daily which included, road trips, hikes, work, and outings. This portable charger will just never let you down, and it's beceause of that I become a recurring Anker customer, these products are all well made it's almost impossible to dislike an anker product, you probably have a higher chance of winning the lottery than being unsatisfied with something Anker has made.  All in all this is something screams reliable, unfortuanetly mine was stolen out of my car by some jerks not too long ago I mean granted this product is so good it's not too surprising someone would steal it if the chance were to arise, but yea this something I 110% reccomend buying.
title: Reliable is an understatement

author: Darwin Castro
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2020
review_content: i buy this ithem two times and i cant believe the i have the same problem it only work for one minutes and stop working incompletely , the light wend off and never work again.omg this is worst than i though  so here is what happens.i buy the first charger like 3 weeks ago i did not used until a week later and stop working.so wend i was gonna return the ithem amazon ask me if i one my money back or i want another charger so i say yes onother charger.so the second charger i was charge 00.00$ so the second charger have the same problem is the first one so it those not work at all.so now  i want to return and get my money back because the second charger was a pice of cra**  and guess how much money im getting back  (00.00$) yep i call costumer service and they are close because of covib 19 so i guess i have to wait a few months to get my 45$ buck back .f this f product
title: i buy this product 2 times and it did not work at all.

author: Vonnie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2019
review_content: So I wanted to wait a little bit to put my review on, so I can try it out. Well I have taken it on a hiking trip up a mountain. I have also used it in several situations. Through conference or classes so, I feel comfortable giving a good review on this. I have seen several professional hikers use this product and brag about how many days that it can hold out. Depending on how much you use it everyday. I can tell you my first full charge on it after I got it lasted me well over two weeks. I like to take a lot of pictures. So I was going up a mountain trail taking several pictures. Put my charger on close to the top between pictures and it did remarkable. Then the very next week I went to a conference and forgot my home charger. I had this charger for class so I put my phone on it overnight while I slept. To make sure I could get up the next morning and be able to go get another charger. I'm still running on the same charge from when I originally got the charger. When charging it gets a little warm but it does not get hot. To put a good charge on it it does take a little bit longer but that charges going to last you a very long time. I also like that it comes with a hard case and the net case so I don't always have to have the hard case with me. It has two different types of ports that you can use making it very versatile for all devices you want to charge. I would highly highly recommend this charger. I have never found one that works as well as this one does.
title: Awesome

author: Tiffany Rae
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2019
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.           The Anker portable charger is what I use, not only for travel, but also in my everyday life. I use it to run my business and to ensure my family and friends can always get ahold of me.This charger is slim and lightweight, so it fits nicely in my purse (thanks for the soft case so it keeps it clean in my messy purse, too!). It charges my iPhone 8 about 7-8 times before I have to recharge it.We've taken this on a few trips - TSA never has a problem with it.
