We took it on road trips to concerts (had to see Brendon Urie and Panic! At the Disco in Dallas, Houston and Austin). They let me in just fine and it allowed me to record the entire concert.We also took it to Disney World twice. What was so great is that the first trip, it allowed all five of us to keep our phones charged up. And more than 1 person can charge at a time! LOVE it.I also take this with me everywhere - to restaurants, athletic events, etc. I never have to stop and plug into a wall somewhere. And it's SO fast! Charges much faster than my wall outlet or my car.
title: I Rely on This Portable Charger a TON for Home and Travel

author: Eri Bri
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2019
review_content: I’m reading a lot of reviews of people saying it doesn’t charge but it does. *FIRST YOU HAVE TO PLUG THE CORR IN THE USB PART FIRST AND THEN PLUG THE PORT INTO YOUR PHONE.* If you do it the other way around, it will not work. At least not for me. The initial charge to charge the battery took about half a day but it is what it is. My phone holds about 4-6 charges with this and it charges my phone fast. I appreciate that it came with a little mesh carrying bag.
title: PLEASE READ!

author: Kara Johnson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2020
review_content: I’ve bought anker products in the past with no issues with any chargers.  I was now looking for something that could charge my device in short order even while it was being used.  This one did just that - outstandingly well.  And when I wasn’t using it, even faster.On the other hand, this charger did not even charge fully.  Using the four lights to indicate the level of charge, it never got past the second light and even that never was “full” -.always flashing.  I used its own cord and tried different plugs and outlets with no difference.  I even left it charging for well over 24 hours straight!  So even though it’s a strong and quick charger to my devices, it didn’t last but one or two charges before it had to be plugged back in.
title: Fast charger but no battery life

author: Muhammad Robiul Alam Robi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2019
review_content: I'm using this product for almost 2yrs now. I mostly use this in vacation when I'm travelling. So not using it regularly. The phone I use is still the same throughout these years. But interestingly, i noticed that it can full charge my phone 3 times when in the beginning it could charge it for 5 times. Although it says, it can hold 20100mAh. But it shows that it can only hold 15000mAh at the beginning and gradually the capacity reduces. FYI, the battery capacity for my phone battery is 3000mAh. It's a Samsung S8
title: Battery life decreases after multiple use

author: Adam S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2019
review_content: Every time I turn around, this battery charger has stopped sending current to my phone. I plug it in, turn it on, ensure that it's charging... then come back later - sometimes just a few minutes later - to see if it's still charging. NOPE. For some reason, it's no longer charging, even though I haven't touched a thing.  Same thing with different cables. Same thing with different devices. My god, how hard is this to get right??  I want to set it and forget it, and come back later to find it all charged up. I've owned several of these types of external battery chargers over the years - this one was probably the most expensive, and probably the most finicky. NO GOOD. Sending back.
title: TERRIBLE

author: Paul S. Joseph
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2020
review_content: I love this little (big) thing.  It's not really that little.  It's long and heavy, but boy is it worth lugging around!  My wife and I bought this for a trip to Disney that has now been postponed (Thanks COVID-19!  Grr!)  Our plan was to use this battery to charge our smaller batteries when they run out.  Instead, we've been using it on walks and using it around the house when we don't want to tether our phone to a wall.Oh my this thing is powerful!  I charged our phones a couple of times and an iPad and it still displayed 2 out of 4 lights of power left.  I definitely feel secure in my digital power when I have this little guy with me.It takes FOR-E-VER to charge.  Even when I use an 18w charger it still takes hours and hours to top off.  You definitely want to charge it the night before you'll need it.Finally, mine is red.  It looks super cool!
title: So much power!

author: Ella
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2019
review_content: Updating my review to five stars, because Anker seriously has the best customer service out there! They reached out and replaced my defective portable charger with a new one. I can honestly say I love it. If your hesitant on purchasing I say go for it! It’s definitely worth it.Giving an overall three stars because it takes FOREVER to charge the portable charger. I can get about almost 3 charges before having to recharge the power bank again. Although I noticed that if I do charge my phone with this power bank my battery dies at an unusually faster rate than normal. My husband also tested it on his phone and it was the same result- battery dies much faster after being charged with anker. So can’t say I’m a huge fan of this, plus it’s a pretty heavy bank...which I would be fine with if it actually worked. Additionally this battery pack is not convenient for  traveling because it takes ALLL day for it to fully charge (and I mean all day as in 24+ hours and mines still doesn’t reach all bars. For some reason it won’t fully charge). Love anker chargers but this portable power bank is just okayyyy or maybe I just received a defective one. Cant say I would recommend.

author: Jennifer J. Watters
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020
review_content: This is an amazing little charger!I purchased this product in August 2016.  Pokemon Go came out in June 2016, and I was playing frequently for long periods of time and this charger was just what I needed to keep playing all day. This charger was extremely reliable.  Didn't take long to charge, and the charge never decreased in output.  I have purchased other Anker portable chargers after purchasing this one.  The other chargers  I purchased where larger versions of this one.  This one was always my favorite, since it was a little smaller, but was dependable. It fit well in my back pocket, wasn't as bulky or heavy as the larger ones.I have continued to play Pokemon Go and other cell phone games since I purchased this charger in 2016. This charger has been used frequently since it was purchased. There were times that I would use it during the day, charge that night so I could use it again the next day.  I don't know how many times I have charged it over the past 4 years, not every day, but at least once a week if not 3-4 times a week.  This charger has two ports, and I frequently would have two devices connected charging. I tried to completely drain the battery before recharging it.This week the battery bit the dust. I am not able to charge it. I have tried different cables and wall adapters, and no luck. It lasted 4 years. Warranty is 18 months. I am disappointed that it finally bit the dust, just because it was my favorite. I have gone through more cell phones than Anker chargers since I purchased this charger.I am going to purchase the current version of this charger to replace the one that just died.  Amazing product, long life, excellent reliability, strong charging capability for the life of the charger.  I highly recommend this charger and brand of chargers!
title: My first portable charger, great investment!

author: Outdoor Nut
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2018
review_content: I originally ordered this product for my daughter and she was so happy with it, I had to get one for myself.  I wanted a way to charge all my USB chargeable devices.  My cell phone, head lamp, camp string lights and, spot light have all been run off of or charged from the 20100 mah power bank.  I have found that the storage capacity is more then enough to charge and power all my equipment.  Over all I am very pleased with the 20100 mah power bank.  If you are thinking of recharging it with the Anker solar panel get the 26800 mah power bank instead.  From the feedback in other reviews, the 20100 drops to a trickle charge from the solar panel when a cloud blocks the sun and stays at a trickle even though the sun comes back out.  The 26800 mah power bank does not do this and resumes full charging power.  I have asked Anker if it is safe to charge my 20100 from a 26800 mah power bank and they said yes but do not recommend it.  Not sure why though.  As we said in the military 2 is 1 and 1 is none.  I will have two power banks which will giving me way more power then I will need without recharging them.
title: Love the power!!!

author: Josh Lehan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2020
review_content: Great battery. Although there are newer models available, I like this one, it’s the perfect size for my pocket. It also has a nicer feel, the newer batteries are made of a slicker, slippery plastic that makes them easy to drop. You do not want to drop a lithium-ion battery! I’m buying another of these older batteries because the ports broke internally on my previous copy of this battery. The plastic piece broke inside, and so the metal is out of place, and it no longer makes contact with the cable. This is a shame, because it’s a great battery and has kept a good charging capacity all of these years, but unfortunately the ports couldn’t stand up to me bouncing them around in my pocket with cables attached.
title: Great battery, buying again after ports broke internally

author: Haley A.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2019
review_content: Will update if I’m ever able to use this.I purchased 3 of these chargers for my family for vacation next week. Each came with half way charged (which is totally fine, wouldn’t expect them to arrive fully charged) BUT I opened all 3 chargers about 2 days ago and none of the USB adapter to charge the portable chargers work (1 didn’t work at all and the other 2 worked for about 10 minutes each then stopped charging the device).... had to find other chargers to use.I would expect the portable chargers to be fully charged in maybe an hour or two (given they came 1/2 charged).... lol WRONG. I have been charging all 3 off and on for a few hours (maybe 2-4 hour periods for probably a collective 10-12 hours each device) since I opened them about 2 days ago and only one appears to be 3/4 charged FINALLY. The other two are still only 1/2 charged. INSANE. It’s too late now to order from a different brand since I go away tomorrow but just very disappointed that none of the 3 seem to be able to charge.
title: Would recommend a different brand

author: Greg Florey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2020
review_content: DECEMBER 2019I'm a bicyclist. I've ridden over 9,000 miles since December 2016. I absolutely abhor having a discharged phone when I'm riding, so I bought the Anker PowerCore 20100. It arrived around Thanksgiving 2017, and I've used it every time I ride since then - without fail! If I have a fully charged phone when I get rolling, my Anker will last 3-4 days on a single charge, keeping mu phone at 100% during the rides. It still works! I only use the 2 amp charging because I listen to music and run the cycling app, and the only issue I've ever had is cable failure. This is an excellent product!JULY 2020Way back in November 2017 I bought my first Anker 20800 battery because a friend had given me his used one when he got his new one. I loved how it worked and lasted for days charging my phone, so I bought one for myself. Now two years and seven months later, I finally wore my Anker battery out. Since my purchase, I have used my Anker on every bike ride, which is over 5,500 miles (that's a minimum of 600 hours, not including my non-bike use!). I also use it every time I ride transit, go to a meeting, or happen to be anywhere without a wall outlet because having a low battery on my phone is a pet peeve of mine. I love my Anker battery! I'll be ordering a replacement today.
title: Excellent portable battery charger!

author: Jim Lesieur
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2020
review_content: This thing will hold a charge for a long time so if you don't use it all the time it is still good to use.  Seems to recharge my old iPhone 6s Plus about 6-7 times on one charge.  Just got an iPhone SE 2020, not sure how many times it will charge that but probably very similar.  It is somewhat heavy so definitely not something to put in your pockets, but good to put in your suitcase for travel.  I got it as a backup after a multi-day power outage, and find myself using it just to top off or if I am not close to an outlet and want/need to keep using my phone or iPad.  No complaints so far!
title: Great battery!

author: Stephanie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2020
review_content: 2 years ago I would have written a stellar 5! It was a great product, charged 3 kids iPads and 2 phones for 2-3 days without needing recharge.  HOWEVER, not now!!! I bought originally for trip to Disney. Since that tome I have probably used it 5 times in 2 years! It won’t even fully charge my phone and 2 iPads on a single charge now. I called customer service, they have an 18 month warranty, so because I am now a few months out of the warranty they will give 10% discount on my next purchase!?!? Not acceptable! For a product that was barely used and had great reviews (and worked great in the beginning) but be permitted to at $50 just say “sorry” here is 10% for a product we can’t stand behind, but you can buy another... nope. I will look for another brand at better cost and long term coverage or rebate. I do not recommend
title: It will die the minute your warranty is over, not worth the $$$ long term

author: Alex
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2019
review_content: This power bank didn’t even make it to 6 months. It was great, and then out of nowhere it stopped charging my devices. The power bank is fully charged (4 bars), and it lights up when I press the button. But I have even tried different devices and cords. Nothing is charging.Very disappointing because I brought it on my 4 month long European trip and I’m only 2 weeks in. Really hoping to get a replacement.**EDIT**I emailed them requesting an exchange under warranty and they said they will not help me since I am in the UK. Also, they need to inspect my device first, which is fair. However, they will not pay for the shipping since I am out of the US. They will not even send me my replacement to the UK even if I pay for my own shipping.This leaves me no choice but to just buy a new battery pack. Extremely disappointing. Hopefully Anker sees this and just issues me a refund. I do not care for an exchange anymore.
title: Stops working in less than 6 months

author: ijuh778AZ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2019
review_content: I've seen some other reviews that say this charger stopped working for them after a few months, but that must be a faulty product. I've had my Anker charger for 1.5 years and it still works like I got it yesterday. I travel quite a bit for work and live in a large city and commute by public transit/foot to work every day. This charger gets a lot of use in my life and has saved me more times than I can count. I've never actually recorded how many charges I get out of it, but it's at least 5 charges on my iPhone 8. It also reaches a full charge pretty quickly.If I had one complaint about the charger, it would be that it's heavy, so if you're looking for something light, this isn't the one. I also own a smaller Anker charger that is a little larger than a tube of lipstick and that one is perfect for when I need something small and light, but it doesn't get nearly the power this one does.I highly recommend this charger for anyone who travels a lot or regularly finds themselves without a wall charger option nearby.
title: The best portable charger I own

author: Q. Robinson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2019
review_content: UPDATE 4/21/2020: Even though the seller sent me a replacement free of charge it the Anker was still unable to charge my cellphone consistently. It was only able to do this if another device was also charging. This became a huge problem as I travel (pre-pandemic) often and was almost stranded a few times because I couldn't charge my phone long enough to call a car service. I eventually found a different device that was listed in a Popsugar add: PowerAdd Pilot 4Gs 120000 mAh. It was only $22 and I wish I'd seen it sooner so I could have originally bought it or returned the Anker. This charger ALWAYS charges my cellphone whether it's on 4G or wifi so the issue was clearly the Anker and not my phone. The PowerAdd has a lightning port which I don't really need so I'm going to buy the updated model which has USB, lightning, and micro-usb ports. I'll give my old one to my partner who has a work iPhone.UPDATE: After my review the company reached out to trouble shoot my issue. They sent a replacement charger at no additional cost. I still had some charging issues--my phone not charging when 4G is on, but they said this is likely an issue with my phone and not the charger. All in all I am much more satisfied, but I do wish it had a port for MacBooks. I'm going to need a adapter in order to charge my laptop when I'm out.PREVIOUS: I bought this for travel--I take several business trips a year and often have multiple meetings in a day and need to charge in-between. Previously, I was using the rechargeable battery that came with my AWAY suitcase but didn't want to overuse it/save it for trips. So far I've only used the PowerCore with my cell phone and whether or not it will actually charge it is hit or miss. Often it starts charging for a few seconds and then stops. The high ratings have me puzzled. I mainly bought this because it was reasonably priced and had such a high rating. I'm not sure it's worth keeping.
title: Another Update!!! Hit Or Miss

author: JKR
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2018
review_content: This is the 2nd Anker Portable Charger we’ve ordered and, unfortunately, both of them have stopped working. Neither will hold a charge after using them for only a couple months. Such a bummer that we have to go with a different company now, especially with the high price of each charger.
title: Stops holding charge after few months

author: NiftyNest
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019
review_content: I bought this charger for my 14 year old daughter to take on a seven day trip to California with her school. I wasn't sure how often she'd be able to charge her phone while she was gone. We got it charged up the day before she left, and it held it's charge until the evening that she came home. I'm super impressed with the quality, and loved that it wasn't a large and bulky thing for her to carry around in her backpack. It came with a nice bag as well to keep it from getting scratched and such. I would absolutely recommend this charger. It's the best and we look forward to using it again and again.
title: Works So Well!

author: Dillon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2018
review_content: This is my first experience with a power brick of any sort. I bought for the main purpose of charging my iPad and iPhone while on the go. The battery takes a very long time to charge but I assume that is simply because it lasts a very long time and stores a lot of power. I’ve charged fully one day and carried for a week without use and the battery still had full juice.The battery is somewhat sizable and strange to carry. It comes with a small case that I like to keep the charging cable and the iPhone/iPad cable rolled up and tucked away in which is nice.Overall great value and I would very much recommend if you are consideringIf you have any questions about this review please email me at ReviewOne23@gmail.com!
title: Great value - must have for someone on the road

author: Adam
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2019
review_content: I received this on 4/19. It was wonderful at first. It came with 2 blue lights (50%). I charged my phone several times on it before going to 1 light. I fully charged it to 4 lights, it worked great yesterday. Today 4/22, i try charging my phone again. It is now turning off about 30 seconds after turning it on. The 4 lights come on, then go off after 30 seconds and stops charging. Very disappointed.The unit does feel very nice, I thought it would be bigger than it is. It is fairly heavy, I have a smaller one that is a little more portable. I was mainly looking for something to keep in my office or throw it in the car when several people need to charge up.
title: Received a dud...

author: michael fede
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2018
review_content: Won’t find a better charger .. I have two now we’ll one is for my awesome wife . But they work great , this things will charge a phone 3-6 times super quick .. I charge mine once a week and charge my phone and headphones daily and often a coworkers phone durning that week .I will add this we are from Nc My wife is a nurse who often has the wake up long before we do 4- 430. In the most recent hurricane hit losing power was a major ordeal for her.  Me traveling a lot for work not being there was kind of a headache for past storms .. we were splitting the use of one charger till I saw the path this storm was gonna take . We new power would be out and could be out for days... one simple cheap solution solved a major issue that’s stress was well on its way to compounding that issue. The solution was this charger , we knew no matter what that she would have power for at least 3 days for her phone and anything else that can run off a usb outlet witch these days can be a light the phone laptop and so on .... can’t say enough good things about it . If you buy a diff brand it it works this well and last yrs I want to see you post right on here so I know about it .
title: The best

author: TL
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019
review_content: Convenient and not too bulky. Right size for keeping in backpack or carry on but too heavy for keeping in a purse.Many phone charges' worth when it's full but after having this about 7 months, it takes a LONG time to fully charge - like one day per "dot" where 4 dots = full charge.The cable that comes with this is short and the connector bends easily.The amount of time it now takes get this fully charged is what I find most frustrating and reason to look for an alternative.
title: Now takes a long time to charge

author: Shrubbin Cole
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2018
review_content: I've owned one of these since the release of pokemon go in 2016 and portable 1000  mAh one. Since last year I made the switch and always bring this one with me in the majority of places.Pros:-I've brought it to Mexico for a week and a half on a single charge and was able to power my phone and my cousins when the hotel we were at had sketchy electrical outlets (it fried her hair straightener).-I've brought it on a 3 (3 weeks) domestic trips this summer and only had to charge it twice. During the entire time I would use it at night since my phones been draining its battery and haven't had time to drop by an apple store. Though my phone would drain quickly, I'd charge my phone twice a day using the battery. By the end of the week I'd notice my battery reaching a little under half way capacity and sometimes I'd forget to charge it at the airport.-I work and go to school so  I sometimes have 8 hour work days and 6 hour school days packed into the same day.  Since sometimes I'm often on foot and have no access to outlets, this has saved my phone a handful of times throughout the day.-My clumsy ass has a tiny purse that barely fits the battery, so often enough if I don't take the extra second to stuff it in place it often starts poking out of my bag and has fallen out a few times. There's only one sign of scuffing in the 2 years so far.-I've charged my phone and my friends on the times I play pokemon go so, that's a perk. It does charge noticably slower for obv reasons.-Like my car, I never like to leave my battery under half full. The only time that I tried draining it - it made a good 6-8 full phone cycles (iPhone 6) before the battery depleted.-Texture of it is great, I can't tell if it's cause it's matte but I hate the glossy slippery batteries cause I'm so clumsy.  It's easier to keep a grip on this one.-This battery knows to idle and not let it drain constantly when nothing is plugged in. I've had other batteries that drained regardless.Cons:-after 2 years one of the ports is starting to give out and not charge and I couldn't find any debris in the port. It still charged but it's noticeably slower to the other port.-It will take some time for it to recharge, be patient. (I often charge it at work for 7-8 hours)-It's pretty thick? I own other batteries that are way smaller and lighter than it, but that's not a huge con to me though I may need to get a bigger bag. Unless you're wearing cargo shorts or have big pockets, this probably will fall out of your pocket. If you're a girl a tiny cute purse would barely fit this.- I've brought it camping a few times and I'm not sure if this matters but obv, if there's extreme heat its probably bad for the phone and the battery. On a few occasions my phone has refused to charge, and my battery has refused to power anything until it cooled down.-On my most recent trip internationally, I did get hassled about the battery and it was confiscated.  As I'm planning to go to Hong Kong next year & japan, I'm uneasy about what to do with my backup battery.
title: Durable and hasn't diminished in performance

author: John robinson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2020
review_content: This charger is small enough to take with you in your jacket pocket, or keep in your car's console, on the bedside table or wherever you might a quick charge for your phone, tablet or other USB devices. And the best part is that it will charge any device you attach to it in about a 1/3 of the time it takes from a charger plugged into your wall outlet! Gotta have it. Use it in an emergency, on a hiking trip, camping, in your car, around the house! Super portable , recharges super fast, lasts super long and looks pretty cool too! Buy one!
title: Super Fast!

author: Joseph Estrada
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2019
review_content: First off let me start off by telling everyone that I am an Anker junkie. I have started to buy a lot of their products from cables, to car chargers, wireless charging pad, and now a Power Bank.Though, when I first purchased this item it did not work for my iPhone XS Max at all. My phone for some odd reason froze up and went completely dark. I unplugged it from the Power Bank and I could not get the display to come back on. I had to do a hard reboot to get the phone to respond. Needless to say I thought it was my phone at first so I tried other cables and I tried to plug it directly into the wall. Other cables used with the Power Bank still froze up my device and I had to repeat the hard reboot. Though, my phone worked plugged directly into a wall with all the cables that I had tried.So, I dreaded the nightmare of having to contact Anker customer support because I have had bad experiences with other companies customer support. It has always been a back and forth game of who is at fault for the reason why it is not working with your device. I was expecting that they would tell me to take my phone to Apple to have them diagnose it or something crazy. Luckily, that was not the case at all! Shelly worked me with me throughout the entire process and she was amazing. Unfortunately, the replacement that they had sent me did not work either and I was not sure what the issue could be. I really wanted to stay with Anker and not go with another product. I travel a lot and it is easier to have a Power Bank for those times when it is needed. They sent me a third replacement and that one worked perfectly! No more issues and I am able to charge both my iPad Pro and iPhone.Thank you to Shelly and Anker customer support for the hard work in getting the issue resolved.
title: Travel Companion

author: Retired in FL
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2018
review_content: Only gave 3 stars because I have bought other Anker products before and they were outstanding. Have had this portable charger for 11 months. After 6 months it will not hold a charge. If I charge it and use it right away, it’s fine. But leave it fully charged on the counter not hooked up to anything  and 24 hrs later no charge. Perhaps I just got a bad one but not sure I will try another.Update 9/9/18Anker read my review and contacted me with 24 hours of posting it. Sent out a new PowerCore almost immediately! It’s working fine. I am so impressed with the Customer Service of Anker. Friendly, quick to respond and totally surprised at how fast they replaced their product. They definitely stand behind their product! Thank you Shae for great customer service. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
title: Poor battery life

author: Kyle G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018
review_content: I travel for a living, and have always needed a portable charger. Finding plug ins at airports or on planes can be a hit or miss. Having long days of work then directly hitting a travel day can not always allow time for charging. This thing literally never dies. Longest lasting charger I have ever had. I was out in London all day, phone nearly dead and had to go straight to the airport.  for a 9 hour flight back to the USA. This charger charged my phone the ENTIRE flight, then on my service car my coworker needed to charge his phone. I had meetings all day and then a dead phone and I charged my phone to a full 100% again! This is a MUST HAVE PRODUCT.
title: THIS IS A MUST HAVE!!!

author: Jason
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2018
review_content: Let’s be honest. Life is not only easier with a cell phone, it’s just plain better. And even as I sit here in the year 2018, there are times when you don’t have an outlet readily available to keep your phone plugging along. That’s where these portable chargers come in so much handy.Heck, there are even times I’m sitting darn near next to an outlet and I use it to charge. Why? Because I have 4 kids running around and a charge cable running across the floor is like some sort of tripwire trap you’d see in a bad Vietnam movie.I’ve had several of these chargers over the years and Anker has been the best of them all. Since these things are just big batteries, you don’t want a cheap one that you have to worry about starting a fire every time you charge it. Anker knows what they are doing, so I have no worries there.I ended up getting this larger unit after dealing with a series of power outages from hurricanes and a bigger battery meant more charges for our phones. I think it’s a good idea for everyone to keep one stowed away for emergency purposes. Bad storm coming? Charge up the pack while you still have power.Anyways, if I haven’t convinced you yet, doubt I’m going to. Just don’t mooch off me when your phone dies from your outdated phone battery.
title: Anker

author: Tamara
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2018
review_content: October 2018 UPDATE: Anchor customer service reached out to me promptly and offered me a newer model. I've received that and so far it's working great. I will leave a review on that model after I've used it for a while. Their customer service is prompt and helpful. While my first charger broke, I now have one that works courtesy of Anker. Thank you to Anker customer service!I purchased this is November 2015. It served its purpose for the most part until I started upgrading my devices. My complaints are 1. It's pretty heavy considering that it won't charge certain devices link an iPhone 7 and a Galaxy S8. Both phones say it's not compatible and it's slow charging.  2. After almost 3 years of moderate use, it died! No outgoing power at all.  So if you expect a long-term battery, think again. I have other brands portable batteries that I've used for longer and they still work.Bottom line, it's fine overall, but due to the above mentioned issued, plus the fact that you can't plug in a USB Type-C without an adaptor is unfortunate because you'll need an adaptor to charge most up to date tech.
title: Anker Customer Service is prompt to fix issues!

author: Nikki
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2020
review_content: I don't know much about power banks so reading the number "20100mAh" meant nothing to me.From the reviews and the description of this power bank, you can already tell it would hold a lot of charge.But I did my own experiment just to see if this would be perfect for me.When I travel I like to take 4 things with me; my phone, tablet, switch, and wireless earbuds.This power bank can literally charge all four of those in ONE CHARGE. Mind blown.However, I still gave it 4 stars because it doesn't have lightning charge.
title: From a noobie to other noobies
verified: it really does hold a lot of charge

author: Monica O.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2016
review_content: BUY THIS PRODUCT.  YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT.Seriously though, this thing is one of my most valued possessions.  My iPhone 5S has awful battery life.  Tired of running from wall outlet to wall outlet, I did some research and ended up buying this product.  It has been absolutely life-changing (a description I would not use for many other products in the world...)  This product charges my 5S fully between 5 and 6 times.I bought this before going to Coachella so I could keep my phone and point-and-shoot charged throughout the weekend.  It lasted the entire weekend - and then some!  It also helped me reach level 24 on Pokemon GO, because that game drained my battery so hard.This is a high-quality product, but please do not buy it looking for a mini charger/light item.  It is heavy and relatively bulky.  Although it fits into my jacket pockets & purses, you will notice the extra weight of the item when carrying it around.  Therefore, if you're looking for a light charger around the size of your phone, you should find a different item.  If, instead, you are looking for a high-quality item which charges your phone RELIABLY for multiple days straight, please buy this item.Also, this pack takes two days to recharge when fully drained.  Make sure to plan ahead if you're going to use it on a camping trip or something like that.
title: Best purchase ever!

author: Did he just...?
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2019
review_content: Bought this as a Christmas present to myself last year. Great battery! Fast charging time for my Galaxy S8, great life, and relatively small. Inexplicably, the 'fast charge' stopped working in mid-January, right as the 30-day return period was up. I called Anker and they could not have done a better job. After I explained to them that, because of lack of a car, I couldn't easily make it out to ship it in any reasonable amount of time, they really came through. They worked with me to find a way to get me a replacement very quickly. It's now mid-March and working great. 5 stars for the battery. 5 1/2 stars for their customer service.
title: A better battery pack, I've never had.

author: Bobby Powell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2018
review_content: This battery is wonderful. My iPhone 6s was suffering the fast discharge blues.  I can charge this battery bank up overnight and use my phone for hours and hours and hours without recharging. This model is a little heavy for pocket/purse, so if you’re looking for portability, maybe consider a smaller model. This one suits my purposes just fine.  It’s a really well made product, as all Anker products are. And the packaging is fantastic.  Just get one!UPDATE. eleven months later, it won’t take a charge. Plugged it in yesterday with two lights.  Sixteen hours later, still only two lights. I like Anker products, but this isn’t good.  Now trying to deal with Amazon customer service because the replacement they sent is also defective.Update to the update. Anker Customer Service ROCKS. Not only did they send me a replacement, they sent me a really nice wall charger as a gift for my trouble.  Top notch Customer Service.
title: UPDATE. Had issues, and their Customer Service made it right!

author: Holly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2018
review_content: Used this on a recent trip to Rome. My husband and I both have Samsung Galaxy S7 phones, prone to early battery drain. I researched numerous USB charger hubs before we left trying to decide on the right one for this trip. I didn't want it to be too heavy, but the reviews on this one were good. It is heavy, heavier than we thought. We were both carrying our luggage for this trip, not checking a back so weight was a deciding factor in this purchase. However we decided to take it anyways. We charged it before we left for the trip. We were gone 8 days in total. I haven't charged it since we left. It was still 4 lights when we returned. I used it to fully charge both of our phones 2-3 times each while we were gone. Worked great.
title: Heavy but worth it

author: Avih Dreeder
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2020
review_content: This charger is powerful and fast. However is a bit heavy - I think close to a pound. I like to carry one of these with me but due to shoulder problems and the chunky size I won't be carrying this one in my purse. For me that's a deduction but it may not bother others. It is very convenient for home use if I'm away from a wall outlet. Please note, you have to remember to turn it on - it does not turn on automatically when you plug in your device, as some others do. I can't tell you how many times I've walked away after plugging one in, only to return to find...Thankfully once you turn it on it does charge quickly.
title: Very fast but heavy for me

author: Mary Kathleen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020
review_content: I absolutely love this charger.  So much power.  It powers numerous electronics with no problem.  My only complaint, and it isn’t anyone’s fault but my own,  is that you cannot bring this item on an airplane.  I had never thought to check that out before purchase.  I have a smaller one for air travel so will use that one.  This larger one would have been my preference but it is still great for at home use.
title: Perfect Power but not for Air travel

author: sdo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2020
review_content: I bought this apparently 2 years ago and today it stopped working completely. (I had plugged it in all night to charge and in the morning when I wanted to use it, it would not turn on, though the lights would try to blink occasionally)About a year ago or so one of the usb ports stopped working but I was okay with that. I just did not expect it to completely stop working. I enjoyed it because it had a lot of capacity.I am slightly disappointed since I thought it would last a bit longer since I have not used it very much over two years and only recently started to use it a lot. For full disclosure, I May have dropped it on solid ground once or twice which perhaps accelerated the aging process but of course I cannot know.There is probably an environmental cost to having an external battery (especially such a large one) so it would be nicer for the consumer and the environment if it lasted longer.
title: good while it lasts (like all things in life)

author: Amazonian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2019
review_content: I was actually amazed, after like a year of not needing this thing my power goes out at my house and my battery on my laptop was falling fast.I finally remembered where I put my power bank that I bought from anker years ago, and I thought, no way it still has charge after all this time... I plug it in and it's almost fully charged, 3 out of 4 lights are lit up so at least over 75% charge remained after over a year in my bag. Awesome stuff!Also, Anker support helped me a while ago replace some faulty cables I got from them, even months after I bought them, and everything I've gotten from them since has just been perfect, so I have a bit of brand loyalty bias going on.Honestly I'm glad there are companies that still actually care about putting out quality products and giving good customer service, instead of just shoveling as much low quality stuff as they can and then rebranding.
title: Charge lasts a long time sitting in my laptop bag for over a year

author: joanna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2020
review_content: This is hands down the best power bank I've ever owned. I did lots of research online because I wanted a power bank that was safe for my nitendo switch. Every single youtube channel and written articles highly suggest Anker.  I got this particular one because they suggested this precise model. I bought it for a camping trip my family was taking and my 7 year old nephew,6year old niece and 4 year old nephew were coming on the trip and they absolutely love pokemon so I figured I would bring my switch and let's go pikachu to play with the kids for a bit before bed time (they aren't really allowed to play video games but their mom is my sister and she trusts me, so playing pokemon on my switch is a treat. Not to mention it would entertain me on the long drive) we were staying in a Class C motor home with 9 people and where I slept had no plug in so I definitely was happy I brought my ankor power bank. It charges my switch fully with no issue, and had plenty of battery left (I charged my phone 3 times, charged my sisters laptop and my father's phone before it finally was on low battery) it absolutely charges fast and holds tons of battery. It doesn't gt hot, had several charging options, has clear indicator to let you know how much battery life it has left, it came with a charging cable and a nice little case to put it in. I totally love it. The one and only complaint (its not really a complaint) it definitely takes a long time to fully charge it up. It took several hours and at times I just leave it charging over night and still not fully charged in the morning (since it holds so much battery life,it only makes sense that it would take significant time to charge) i suggest making sure to plug it in the morning a day before you need it (if taking it on a trip) if its something you will use everyday, the battery last a long time so just make sure to plug it in when its dead way before you need to use it again. Lights on the ankor battery will turn completely off when it is fully charged. Its simple, works great, and decent price. I absolutely suggest this to anyone and especially to those who are looking for a portable battery for their Nintendo switch because we all know how Nintendo switches can brick from using any type of items on the switch that isn't licensed nintendo and having a portable battery that isn't within the correct voltage for the switch can brick it. If you have any concerns still about using it for a switch, I suggest looking up YouTube videos on it and I promise you that majority of the videos will suggest this power bank. Definitely buy this if you are wanting or needing a power bank for any electronics.
title: Best and safest power bank I've ever owned!

author: Bobbo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2019
review_content: To date I had really appreciated Anker and there products.  Until recently a rather expensive battery pack that I purchase failed just outside of warranty by no fault of my own.  I called and sent Anker a request for assistance and they were absolutely unwilling to assist.  They recommended that I purchase a new one, which I will not be doing.  Instead I will have to identify a more reputable company in this space to give my business to.  I am very upset with the customer service that they were able to provide.  Will not be buying any of there products moving forward.
title: Broke early and Anker was unwilling to assist

author: REBECCA SHAFFER
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2020
review_content: October 2020: I have purchased three of these charge packs (all this model).  They have all worked great for the first few months.  Strong charge.  Unfortunately, two of the three have already stopped recharging.  I have tried swapping cords and using different cables.  For the first few months they recharge quickly when plugged into the wall and then super charge ipads/cell phones.  After about six months (for both of them) when I try and charge, they won't charge.  One blue light just blinks the entire night and there is no juice in the unit the next day.  Very disappointed, the reviews are awesome and like I said they are fantastic chargers out of the box.  They just don't last long enough to justify the price.December 2020 Update:  Company replaced the unit and the new charger is working fine. Good experience with customer service to solve the issue.
title: Great charger but dies within months

author: Jacob Hamblin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2019
review_content: You know when you only have 1 car charging port, or just 2 but it doesn't give enough power to really charge your laptop or phone? Well this guy will have you covered for a long period of time, I tested it on my S10 which was at 50%, plugged it into the power bank, and it tells me roughly an hour and a half till 100%. Now that's quite a long time, so it's not a fast charging power bank, however it is a pretty large power bank, so it'll keep you charged through an entire day if you so need it. It is a slim design which makes travelling with it much easier, though there really isn't a great place to keep it on you other than a fanny pack, backpack or some kind of pack, if you had cargo pants, then your problem is solved. It does what it is designed to be, a power bank, to store a large amount of power for future use, in which case it does just that. Some of the other designs that Anker has can provide a faster charging capability, but it won't beat a wall port adaptive fast charger for my S10 which would charge my phone up from 50% in or around 55 minutes. Not too extremely off from an hour and 20 minutes on the power bank, but the other designs can provide a much better faster charging ability than this one. Take the comparisons below the product page as a reference to be able to pick one to your needs!
title: Great for travelling, not the best for speed charging.

author: K Holland
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020
review_content: I’ve had this power bank for three years now and it still works great! Not long after I got it, it stopped working altogether. I contacted Anker and they replaced it for me. The new one has been great since day one. I bought it to keep in my backpack when I was at school all day and my phone wasn’t holding a charge. Ironically, I use it more now that I’m home almost all the time. It’s easier to charge my phone on this than to have it tied to an outlet. I don’t know exactly how many full phone charges I can get out of it, but I would say at least five, maybe more. I use it all the time and only charge it once or twice a week.
title: Battery power that lasts!

author: Edward A. Del Castillo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2018
review_content: I bought one of these a while back and loved it so much I bought one for my wife.  It came with a port that was seated incorrectly so I emailed their support team.  Within 24 hours they had responded.  they wanted pictures of the issue and the serial number so they could track the device.  I sent the info and within 24 hours they responded.  They asked me to dispose of the problem item and that they were sending me another one right away.  A couple of days later the new battery came and it works great, like the first.These days customer support is so important, and Anker really nailed it.  This experience has made Anker my first choice for external batteries going forward.The battery itself is a great performer.  Please note that I have a strict regime when it comes to batteries like these.  I charge them to full and then do not charge them again until they are empty.  I travel a lot and have a wife and kids with electronic devices, so we use externals a great deal.  So far, the Anker batteries have done a great job of keeping my whole family empowered.
title: I bought one of these a while back and loved it so much I bought one for my wife

author: dizzyduzit
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2020
review_content: UPDATED:  ANKER REACHED OUT AFTER MY REVIEW AND SENT ME A NEW CHARGER.  Very responsive Cust Service. New charger works great!  Just felt like it’s important to post a review from someone that’s owned this charger for about 18 mos. ... so, it doesn’t work anymore. I probably used it about once a month, so likely charged and used as a charger on 18 different occasions.  It worked, but only at about 1/2 capacity for last 6 mos. So worked well as described for about a year. Then it started only charging to max 2 bars after over 24 hours on a charger. But those two bars would still charge 5-6 devices. So whatever... but now it just stays at one bar and can’t engage charging w any phone. So if $50 seems reasonable for 12 mos of as described usage, then go for it. That’s honestly seems fair. But you’d think they could do better
title: UPDATED:  New charger Works as described ...

author: Andrew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020
review_content: Absolutely love this product.  This will charge my phone multiple times over and the Ipad a few times over.  This coupled with the recommended case makes it a travel necessity.  With the case and the battery, I can compactly store 2-3 charging cables of different types and a wall plug.  If I'm on the road, and charge my phone/ipad, i'd estimate 3 days of power off of it.  Highly recommend.  I have one for both the wife and I.  Again, I cant reiterate the convenience for travel, its a compact kit that will handle all my charging needs and provide the opportunity for charging on the go!
title: Compact and incredibly capable!

author: Eric M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2017
review_content: After being without power, due to a flood, for three days I ordered this bad boy the moment my computer was back operational. I am admittedly somewhat addicted to my phone, and hated having to conserve every bit of charge as the only source of power I had was from a car charger. I wanted something capable of charging my wife's and my phone a couple of times in cast of another emergency. I decided on this model as it appeared to be beefy enough to accomplish this task, yet small enough and cheap enough to fit my other needs. Here are my initial findings..S7 EdgeCharged from ~10% to full in approx. 1.5 hoursWas able to charge my phone twice (from ~10%>100%)  with its initial charge of out box (2 of 4 power indicators)Took a good 10 hours to recharge this power core with using my Samsungs phone wall charger. (Please note, as described, this device only comes with USB to micro USB cable, which will charge MUCH slower if charged through USB)It comes with a fairly cool looking mesh bag and drawstring. I now carry this device with me daily.
title: Limited use, but loving it so far!

author: MEPchll
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2017
review_content: Is there anything this company doesn't do better than the rest? I have owned 2 different brands of this exact same item. Both of them are frustrating to use and don't always work. One arrived completely broken and the seller shipped me a new one which broke 6 weeks later. The second brand I tried I paid full price at Best Buy. It works on and off...It often will not charge even after its been plugged in all night. After some constant jiggering,it may decide to work. Then a friend of mine was using this brand and shared how great it worked. I hesitated at first, but then I decided to get one before a trip to the South of France where I wasn't sure I would always be able to recharge my phone during long drives, etc. WOW! This blows away the other brands.  It is super simple to use. Just plug it in to your phone and the blue indicator light lights up. Works every time. And it charges super fast. 5x faster than the other...I also love their USB cables with lighting connectors and the car-charger.
title: Best decision

author: Sky
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2016
review_content: I always carry around smartphone, tablet, Bluetooth devise for my work.When you on the field it is hard to get things charge, and without charging i can't do anything.I have tried few large capacity portable charger, and this one was the best i have ever used.I was always fan of Anker's IQ technology which support a fast charging for devise that supports it.The charging time for the portable charger takes long time do to it's high capacity 20000mAh battery, but it charges other devise plug into the battery really quick.Only downside was it only came with 1 short cable, but not enough to take a start away.Who does not have charging cables this days with all of smartphones and tables we purchase.Over all it is one great portable charger and i will recommend it to anyone looking for a portable charger.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, and I promised that my review is fair and honest.
title: One stop portable charging station for all of my devises.

author: Kenneth James
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2017
review_content: I love this power bank. Don't buy the cheaper powerbanks on amazon. I bought one a yr or so ago and it died in months. Bought one for a coworker and it too died in a few months. I decided to get this anker powerbank for a trip where I would be away from the outlet for long periods of time and it worked great. There is a new version though so unless you get this one at a really good price look for the new one. I only realized that there was a new one after I had purchased this one and a new one wouldn't get delivered in time if I cancelled this purchase. I guess its a testament to how good this thing works because I decided to keep it and just purchase the new one and have both. It works great, just doesn't fast charge my galaxy s8 plus but still charges pretty fast. I've used anker products since 2011 and they are ALWAYS REALLY GOOD QUALITY so I have no doubt that this one will last a long time.
title: Buy the newer version unless you get this one cheap, but awesome powerbank.

author: Michelle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2020
review_content: It's been almost 3 years since I bought this portable charger and still working great. I wanted to wait for the review because I had some friends that were having issues with different brands (not this one) and their chargers were diying in 3 or 4 months or after traveling to 1 place. The size is perfect for traveling, is not super light but is not super heavy either. I have used this many times in different countries and still working like brand new. I can charge my phone multiple times. I really recommend this portable charger.
title: Great & reliable charger. 3 yrs. w/me and still working.

author: Sherri Kai
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2018
review_content: Update 4/21/18This charged my Galaxy S9 4x and still had one light left!  I charged it at this point and it took about 12hrs to fully charge.  This charger has exceeded my expectations!I've only had this portable charger for a few days but so far I'm very pleased with it!  It arrived charged at 50% and took 5 hours to finish charging to 100%.I used it to charge my Samsung Galaxy S9 Plus today.  It took 90 mins for the phone to go from 15% to 100%.  I'm very happy with that charging time!  I used an Anker USB-C cord that I purchased separately.Please review the details on this charger as it is big and quite heavy!  It comes with a little mesh bag for to store it in but I purchased a separate carrying case.5 stars from me for now!!  Will update after a few weeks of use.
title: Great Portable Charger!

author: RoTe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2018
review_content: I bought this as a backup to my backup lol. I have 2 portable chargers in my bag that has about 5 full Samsung S7 charges altogether. However, I tend to forget to take them out and recharge them and only remember whenever my phone is at 5% and neither is charged. Now, this has enough charges that I can last at least a week without having to recharge it. The one downside is that it's quite heavy, so I don't bring it unless I don't have enough time to charge my other 2. I don't mind the heaviness, but I don't want to damage another bag again because of that. It's about the size as a Samsung S7 Edge but about twice the thickness. It's perfect for those who can't get to a wall plug like on trains, or classes or work. Even for people who have a lot of devices, like families who are going on a car trip but don't want to kill their car battery.
title: Definitely get if you have a lot of devices

author: Elaine Hosick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019
review_content: I was very impressed with this charger for the first month.  I traveled to England and although it was a little bulky, it charged my phone and tablet very quickly.  Shortly after returning from my trip, it quit working completely.  I was very disappointed in its short life span for the price paid.  I called the company and the representative was very nice, verified my purchase and said my charger would be replaced at no cost and to just throw the old one away.  That was over a month ago and I have yet to receive a replacement.  Needless to say I cannot recommend this charger.After posting this review I was contacted by Anker and they did send me a replacement.  It worked great again for about a month and then stopped working.  I called again and this time they want me to return it so they can do a quality check, which I thing is a great idea since this has happened with two devices.  I will update again after using my third device.
title: Cannot recommend this charger

author: Adam C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2016
review_content: I travel frequently for work and I find myself often needing to charge all of my devices in places where there is no access to wall outlets. When I travel I usually bring my phone, 2 tablets, an iPod Nano, a Kindle and PS Vita.Great capacity on this PowerCore. I've been able to use it to change all my devices, even my iPod Nano and Vita.As far as size of the unit, I own old version of the Anker powerbanks and few other units from other manufacturers (such as the AmazonBasics powerbank). This one is a great improvement. Lighter and better looking than other model I've used.The four status LEDs work great to show the status of battery charge left, although I would prefer one of the 5 LED circle indicators I've seen on other PowerCores. Two USB ports rated at 2.4 amp per port and total of 4.8 amp are great for charging t . I think that’s pretty accurate during my testing. The unit comes with a single USB-to-micro cable and is charged via micro USB input on the side. It appears to be pretty well built unit that is both durable and attractive.For recharging the unit itself, it can take somewhere from 8-10 hours. Best is to leave it plugged in overnight. You should also make sure the power source charging the PowerCore is at least 2 amps. Personally I use a Apple 12W 2.4 Amp brick charger.Anker customer service is excellent! They quickly responded to my questions and were very accommodating.List of devices I've tested with the PowerCore 20100:-iPhone 6s-iPhone 5-iPad Air 2-iPad Mini 2-iPod Nano 7th generation-Amazon Kindle Paperwhite-PlayStation VitaAll charged normally when connected to the PowerCore 20100. Overall, I'm extremely satisfied and highly recommend it.
title: Frequent Traveler Review

author: E. Byrd
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2017
review_content: First things first, its a lot of battery.  I took it and an Iphone6+ and a Go Pro and a Delorne into the mountains of New Mexico for 11 days and it kept them all charged for the full time.  I did keep the Iphone in airplane mode and low-power mode except on the very rare occasions when I would chk coverage to see if I had a signal.  The Delorne tracked our route the whole time and was used for txt messaging daily "I'm alive" updates to spouse.  Did not use the BT connection between the 2 devices.On the downside it isn't light by any stretch of the imagination and, and this is the major failure for me, it doesn't play nice with solar panels.  If a cloud passes over or anyone casts a shadow on the panel and causes the voltage to drop this battery will not resume charging once the shadow is removed.So in short, great battery but you'll need to dedicate a zero town day to recharging it once you drag it down unless you can find the rare cloudless day in open country to charge it from your panel.
title: Beast of a battery but don't plan on using a solar charger to top it up

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2020
review_content: Just what I hoped it would be. A bit heavy but not bad. I don't think you can get a product this powerful without a little weight to it. I easily got used to it. Very small price to pay for what you get. Lots of charges. On stand by lasts for days and days. I use it everywhere. Very convenient. Nice for trips or when you have lots of time on your hands and want to watch videos, movies, shows or listen to music. I spent a little extra to get way more power. It was worth it. Very durable case. Nice pouch and charging cord comes with it. I am careful with it because I want it to last years. I think it will.
title: I Love It !!!

author: David Edgar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
review_content: It is exactly what I wanted, battery lasts about two weeks if not used at all. If used, I’ve gotten about 7-8 full charges on an IPhone 8 before I need to recharge the power bank. Slight dilemma is the power bank needs a long time to refill estimated 10 hours give or take, which is understandable but an issue if in a pinch for time.Update 08/23/2020- both chargers are going bad already - it’s been 36 hours and only one light has been filled on both portable charges. These were awesome and I had friends buy them but now I’m not recommending them to anyone.
title: Started great , now not so much

author: SweetTriks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2016
review_content: Updated 10/17/2016: Anker customer service is awesome and unexpectedly responded to my negative review and offered a full replacement of my defective product. They promptly sent a replacement and wanted to guarantee I was satisfied with it. So far so good. It's only been 3 weeks since I started using the new device, as a result I updated the review from 1-star to 3-stars. After 1 year, I will update this review once again or sooner depending on the life of the product.Maybe I got a dud, but even when fully charged, it no longer charges our devices...Good while it lasted. I bought this portable charger in November of 2015. It worked great for nearly 8 months until it quit charging devices connected to it. The Anker would have a FULL charge but no longer discharge to charge our smartphones and tablets like it used to. I'm going on a trip next week and need a portable charger but I won't be choosing an Anker product. Their wall chargers are great but I also find that their charging cords don't last long either unless you buy the rope corded style.
title: Updated review: Anker replacement working as intended, so far so good.

author: C. Granger
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2019
review_content: The first one I received was a dud. Would not charge over 50% while on a 2A charger for over 24 hours. I emailed Anker support. They replied back a day later asking me to do troubleshooting steps, scanning receipt, etc. I did so just to determine their level of support, even though I am returning the item as defective to Amazon (UPS has yet to pick up my return, 4 days later). They have yet to reply in over 9 hours. These products are just Chinese-made battery packs, so you get what you pay for, and that includes support. The second one charged right up so I'm expecting to get decent usage from it.I'll update this review as needed.
title: First one was a dud

author: deadrock
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2018
review_content: I ordered this Anker portable charger while on a visit in Ohio.  I thought it would be useful for my return flight to Colorado to power my various devices. I paid extra to have the charger set delivered in one day to be sure I'd have enough time to charge the battery before my flight.  The package arrived the next day.  However, when I opened the package I discovered that although the battery was present in the box, the accessories box inside the main box was empty.  The accessories box was supposed to contain the fabric travel pouch and, more importantly, the micro USB charging cable.  Yikes!  I immediately emailed AnkerDirect via Amazon asking if they could ship out replacement cable and pouch ASAP, but did not really expect to hear anything definitive from them until the next morning.  I figured it was unlikely they would be able to get the replacements to me in time, so started looking around for a micro USB cable I could borrow that night to charge up the battery.  Success!  I found one for another device I that I was able to use to charge up the battery that night.  (It had arrived with only a 50% charge.)The next morning I received an email from Sharon at AnkerDirect.  She said she had arranged for a replacement to be shipped to Ohio. I replied to her about borrowing a cable and so I was no longer in a bind about getting the unit charged up and asked if she could ship the replacement to my home in Colorado instead  if the replacement shipment hadn't yet gone out.  She emailed back that it had already been shipped, but she would send a second replacement to Colorado.  Which she did.  Now I consider that pretty stellar customer service!  My only unhappiness was with the original shipment not being complete, but Anker bent over backwards to rectify the situation.As far as the charger itself, I used it on the plane and at the airport for my laptop and my tablet.  It worked fine.  I'm quite pleased with it.  Portable Charger Anker PowerCore 20100mAh - Ultra High Capacity Power Bank with 4.8A Output, External Battery Pack for iPhone, iPad & Samsung Galaxy & More ()
title: Good product, shipping mistake, great customer service

author: Aisha
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2019
review_content: -UPDATE-This is the 5th month since owning this maker power bank and it’s battery life does not last as before it dies so much quicker you can tell the difference so easily. For that being, I’ll rate it 2 stars down since it still takes forever to charge but does so much fasterBought this for my wife since she was going camping to Yosemite Park, next thing you know she gets lost for 3 days omg the wild rescue and search teams were looking for 3 days and thanks to this portable charger her phone had battery and rescue and search teams were able to locate her if it wasn’t for this portable charger who knows what would have happened. Thank you for the product wish I could rate it higher than 5 stars.
title: Update

author: Tyler Hensdale
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2017
review_content: The only external battery I've ever had, up until now, I found lying on the ground outside of a doctor's office. I never gave it a shot and threw it away. Anyways, directly before I bought these, I bought two, one from the ol ball n chainsy, and one from me. I had bought a wireless charger for my phone (which was the generic version, yet still costed $5 more than this outstanding piece of art) because I thought "hey, that's fancy"... but fancy shmancy. I'll let you in on a secret, wireless chargers, STILL HAVE A WIRE. So they should be called stupid round Chargers or Chargers that may seem cool but or just a huge waste of money. I returned this *poopy wired yet at the same time wireless charger*, and went on the hunt for something better, something worth hard earned money. This is, without a doubt the best charger I've ever owned in my life. May it be a wall charger, quick charge charger, a *poot noise*wireless charger*, or any other charger known to man. If you're looking for a great product, at an amazing price, with ridiculous power and hold time, then look no further. I'm actually looking into buying anew anker wall port when I get a bit of "me money", because as my wife stated, sparing a couple of nastier phrases, "there is absolutely, positively no way in hell you're putting that on our baby registry!!". But I digress, this is seriously the best purchase I've made for my phone since, well, since I bought the phone itself.  I absolutely love it and was flabbergasted when I clicked on a link that stated it was $80, but saw it was only $39.99. I was figuratively beside myself, started to do MAD research, and yet without a doubt, this was the battery for me. I'm now buying strictly anker products, have recommended the anker line of products to basically all of my friends, causing a few to make their own purchases. Thano you guys! Yall are amazing!
title: Look no further, i promise you will be unbelievably ecstatic

author: SomeareainMichigan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2017
review_content: After 17 months, the PowerCore  would not charge devices with a full charge.  I let the battery sit idle for a couple months.  Just before recycling the battery, I checked the charge, it showed three lights.  I tested and found  the charger did charge three other devices. Showing two lights,  I recharged the PowerCore back to full capacity, Once again, it would not  charge  any device.  The PowerCore was gently used intermittently during that time,and recharged perhaps a dozen times.  The PowerCore was an awesome accessory while it lasted!  But, I was hoping for a better longevity. I will try another brand next.UPDATE:  After posting the above I was contacted by the seller and sent a replacement. I compliment the seller for their desire to validate the issue, and help after the 18 month period.  I am humbled by their conviction to their trade, and their customers.  I can do nothing but rate the product/company as  5 stars.
title: Just a single caveat....

author: Chase L.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2017
review_content: This battery pack has worked flawlessly for me, No longer do I need to hang around any outlets during the day anymore!Im a power user when it comes to mobile devices and I drain the battery in my tablet and my Galaxy S8 in a matter of 4 hours tops, leaving me hugging outlets the rest of the day. This battery bank is small enough to fit in the side pocket of my backpack and allows me to dangle one cable out to my pocket for my phone and one inside the bag for my tablet. Making me fully mobile again, and I don't notice any considerably charging speed drop when I am charging both devices simultaneously. The carrying mesh mine came with works perfectly to store the cables and adapters I use with this while i'm not needing this in the morning. Keeping my cable clutter in my bag down (huge +)TLDR - Great size, great charging speed, good carrying case, would buy again!
title: Perfect addition to any techies bag? I think YES

author: EDJMED
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019
review_content: I purchased 2 of these over three years ago. I just purchased a Nintendo switch and went to research power banks and found that this exact power bank was approved by Nintendo. I was surprised since I have opened it for so long but it’s the same model number. I saw some reviews that people’s banks broke within a year but I have been using my two for a long time and have not had any problems. I often charge two iPads or a combo or cell phones (Samsung and Moto) at one time and it works great. It is heavy and does take a long time to charge but it last fours several days depending on use. I use either Anker cords of my original lightning/Samsung cords. Love them!
title: Owned 2 for more thank 3 years

author: lapis lazuli
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2017
review_content: This works fabulously. It charges up quickly, and easily charges multiple items without a rapid drain on power. I love this charger so much, that I have 2 of them. I use these to power multiple items at the same time. It does NOT, however, allow you to charge items and BE charged at the same time.* It is a bit heavy, but that's perfectly fine. It's a battery. It is sturdy, and has survived multiple drops.* I've had mine for several months, and they have kept working like a charm. This is an excellent item for users that have multiple items to charge. For me, I never had enough wall chargers to power up my items. These Ankers, however, fix that problem.* They power up items *fast*.Double ++The Anker PowerCore 20100 is worth the price. There are batteries that are less expensive, but don't perform nearly as well as this.All in all, this is a must-have for the user that has a need for portable power.
title: Excellent Battery Power

author: Rudy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2016
review_content: bought this battery so that no matter where i go, i always have a way to recharge my cell phone and other gadgets. i purchased this battery mainly based on the great reviews found on here. battery comes in a nice sturdy box. case has a great feel to it, feels very solid and put together well.i use it to charge my innokin itaste (e-cigarette) battery, apple iphone 5c, and i also used it to charge my garmin nuvi GPS unit.on the iphone, i can go from 22 percent to nearly 100 percent charge in about a hour and 20 minutes.not to shabby!when battery if fully drained it takes over night plus about 5 to 8 hours to charge. but once it's charged you can get several device charges out of it before you need to recharge. i charged phone 5 times, and e cig battery 3 times before it required charging. handy LED light indicator indicates current battery level.also comes with nice carry case and usb cord to plug into wall outlet to recharge the battery. get one of these today, especially if your on the go. you will be glad you did!update*** 10/20/19*** after 3 years and 4 months, battery has stopped working. but, to be totally fair this thing got ALOT OF USE. my daughter used it several times a day..sometimes for days at a time, i used it alot, and ive dropped it more times than i care to count. I believe the usb ports themselves failed, i push the button, the lights come on but when i attach the usb cord to charge my phone the battery cuts off, or doesn't charge. for 2019 this is probably the average product life. i will be buying a new one soon. hope this review is helpful.
title: A real powerhouse!

author: Abh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019
review_content: I absolutely loved this thing. It is bulky and heavy but it charged up fast, charged devices fast, can charge two of them, could recharge my cell phone multiple times but needing to recharge it. It was charged an ipad pretty quick.All of that does not matter now as one fine day i just stopped working. It was working fine one day and the next nothing. no activity, cannot charge it, no led lights nothing. Anker seems to be making cheap quality products these days. disappointed.
title: bad quality - broken in 8 months

author: Boff
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
review_content: This is a really excellent power bank. It charges reliably and holds that charge very reliably. The indicator lights are pretty accurate in displaying how much power is left (100%, 75%, 50%, 25%).The charger has some heft to it. It's not exactly light. But it has big batteries in it, so that's to be expected. The casing is hard plastic. There is no padding on the outside of the device and I suspect it would crack if dropped, given the charger's weight. If you take it to the woods, try to keep it cushioned.
title: Holds a Charge Quite Well - Not For Rough Environments, Though.

author: Ayoma Ritade
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
review_content: Might be just a lemon, but this battery bank needs over 2 days to charge when connected to a wall outlet. I just charged it overnight (a good 10 hours or so) and it didn't even fill a single charge barldot (out of FOUR). Either this battery bank can end up serving as an uninterruptible power supply for 3 families, or it has an issue.I use this battery to power my VR headset (~5 hours continuous playtime on beat saber, ~3 hours on ALYX) so I can't say for certain whether the charge capacity warrants such a large charge time.Works decently well for travelling. I don't travel much so by the time I do it's probably fully charged.
title: Takes way too long to fully charge.

author: Lothus
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2018
review_content: Biggest battery pack I've ever had. I know there are larger ones available, but this happens to be just about the right size to slip fully into a common reasonably deep jacket inner pocket. Holds a charge forever, and unless you're glued to your phone/tablet screen 24/7 should be more than capable of keeping your phone charged for at /least/ a couple of days. Of course, with this capacity it does take a long time to recharge... you need to factor that in if you're dealing with a long power outage.The only issue I've had with it is that I'd guess sometimes the PowerIQ charge type detection seems to frustrate my Samsung tablet, which then decides it's only a basic USB port. On those instances, I've had to plug it in, out again, then quickly back in and it gets accepted as the high-speed charger it is.
