This is likely just one side or the other not responding fast enough to whatever they're looking for on occasion. Hardly a dealbreaker in any case.
title: Biggest battery pack I've ever had. I know there ...

author: Alisha_Joy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2018
review_content: When I first purchased this battery in June I would’ve given it a ten star rating if possible but after only 3 months, it now takes 18+ hours for it to get to a full charge which when charging multiple devices on the go is so inconvenient. I used this battery during our Allstar cheer season last year (a friend owned one) and I was in love with how quick it charged and how long the charge lasted. My unit hasn’t given me the same performance as my friends unit. Still does the job, which is why I gave it 3 stars but definitely need one that charges a lot faster than 18-24 hours.UPDATE: I was sent a new battery and still the same issue. I used to LOVE this product but I now have received two with the same issue. Charge until it indicates it’s at full power only for me to attempt to charge a device and then battery instantly dies. So disappointed as I loved Anker products until this experience
title: UPDATE: I wanted to give it five stars so badly

author: Gadget Dad
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2018
review_content: Really great battery pack!  Look no further if you need a good, solid, dependable one with lots and lots of reserve.  While a bit on the heavy side (no way around that given the kind of power capacity/density this puppy has), this Anker power bank is a no frills rock star that delivers the goods!  I love products that have a simple/elegant design and that perform well.  If you are heading out into the wilderness camping/hiking and want something that will power all your devices for a long time, then this is it.  No need to worry about chargers at the airport or go hunting for an outlet when you travel.  Slim, sleek, nice little travel bag and a small cable comes with it.  You'll want a good stout USB charger to charge it though and it does take a while to fill back up once you run it down.  Highly recommended!  Oh, and Anker's customer support is first rate as well!
title: Plenty of power on the go

author: altdrsmoothop
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2016
review_content: I gave this four stars though really it's up there around 5.  It's only drawback is that it takes forever to charge to full.  However, if you've ever encountered fighting your cell phone for an extra 5% this thing will feel like a warm bath on a cold day.  I took this thing backpacking for three days in HI and had it hooked up to a solar panel when I wasn't using it.  My emergency GPS appears to have not worked the entire trip.  This thing was the only thing between me and an emergency on a hiking trail where the closest support would have been an emergency evac helicopter.  Or six mile hike from humanity.  I've actually taken to charging this instead of my actual phone and using it instead of a wall charger.  You can't beat this thing with a stick.  I definitely recommend it for anyone who needs juice on the run.
title: if you've ever encountered fighting your cell phone for an extra 5% this thing will feel like a warm bath on a cold day

author: Tim Hayes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2020
review_content: I travel a bit, I am an I.T. pro so I have an array of electronics, I was able to fully charge an iPad Pro 10" and still had a bit over half of this thing. Pretty sure I ran my phone from it for a good day or so GPS etc. charged the ol' headset and likely something else. I still had a quarter charge the third morning, in short I was attempting to push it and I did not take it all the way down before I got bored trying : ). I live in Indiana and have left it out in the truck more than one time so it has seen a range of temps and has continued to perform. Personally I felt it was worth the coin ...
title: It is Beefy

author: Harpreet Nagra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2019
review_content: I purchased this product for backpacking and there was an issue with charging as the battery will charge the phone for a min and then stop. I posted a review of the product here and I was not expecting anything. Then I received an email from Anker with an apology and offer to send me a replacement. I was so pleased. I provided them with my address and they shipped the replacement and didn’t even ask to return the other battery as to not cause me anymore inconvenience. Then they followed up to check how everything was working once I received the replacement!!! I am very happy with their customer service and I will probably only buy Anker batteries in the future.
title: Great Customer Service!!!

author: unitmonster
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2019
review_content: I bought this for a music festival.  I charged my iphone 7 2 full charges, charged a speaker, partially charged about 3 other iphones.  It does take close to 15 hours to get a full charge on the battery itself, but when you're recharging an iphone it charges, I would say, 2-4x faster than an outlet.  I basically now charge this thing and then charge my phone off of it until this thing dies.  It's awesome.  I have told everyone I know to get one.
title: This thing is awesome

author: JP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2019
review_content: I bought one of these power banks in December as a Christmas gift, and it worked fine for a while. It's pretty cool looking - very sleek. It does it's job as a power bank. My complaints are that it takes a long time to charge, and that for some reason, our JUUL vape USB charger blocks won't fit in the unit to charge (this is one of the primary things we use charging blocks for). I'm not sure why that is. Other USB items fit, though. It has always taken a very long time to charge, but it has good battery life once it charges. (Sometimes it seems like it's stuck on 1 solid light and 1 blinking light forever when charging. Leave it overnight and it'll be all set.) Oh, and also, it only has 2 USB ports - I wish it had more so it would charge more items.But the customer service is awesome! And that's worth celebrating. In April, the unit stopped working and wouldn't hold a charge. I contacted Anker to see if there were any options to replace it and they made it super easy and painless to return the old power bank and get a brand new one shipped to us. I'm pretty sure they gave us a pre-paid shipping label for the exchange so we just dropped it in the mail. The new one was here within 2 days or so. No questions asked, no issues with not having the box,  no worries about the time that'd passed. I believe they said they have an 18 month warranty window. I was very happy with the fact that they would do whatever was necessary to get us a new and functional charger. I'd do business with them again.
title: Great customer service on an exchange

author: Goodole
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2018
review_content: Charge time is 12 to 14 hours from a two LED status. I have been in touch with Anker about this and will change status when they decide what they are going to do. Communication with them is tough. They ask the same question over and over again but just change a few of the words around, but it's still the same question.Update: 03/14/2018,: Anker has been in touch with me and were extremely helpful. They are replacing the defective one and after I receive and test it and if it operates as quoted then I will rate at 5 stars, However, just because of their effort to assist me I'm changing the rating from 2 stars to 4.Update 03/20/2018, Anker has replaced both of my battery packs and after testing charge time with a Samsung 2.1 A charger the charge time was about 6.5 hours on both. I ran them both down to about 25% and the charge time was a little less about 5.5 hours. I'm a happy camper and thanks to Anker's service team, they are doing a wonderful job. Changed to five stars.
title: Test thoroughly before being satisfied.

author: John and Judi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2016
review_content: I have purchased a couple of battery backups. In addition, I did some research for a few months before making a purchase. This unit exceeded my needs and expectations!While there is some weight to it, it is certainly not the heaviest one I have seen, especially for the capacity.The battery arrived with Anker's usual high quality packaging. Boxed neatly, with instructions and the "Happy/Not Happy" page, which is a nice touch. I like when a company cares enough about customer service to include easy access to them for praise or concerns. I was impressed, upon opening the box, to find a mesh drawstring bag to hold the battery and cable. A very nice touch.The battery does take a while to charge. The first charge was 8 hours, though I expect a full charge will take closer to 10-12 hours.Out purchase coincided with a Cub Scout camping trip in Pennsylvania Dutch country. The trip lasted 4 days, with lots of picture taking, and spotty reception at best. This unit charged both iPhone 6s's three full times, and a partial charge for both on the last morning. At this point, it was low, but still had power remaining. I was very pleased by its performance!Overall, not only would I recommend this battery, I am considering another one, as we have multiple devices in my family and I have been so pleased!
title: Best battery for the money!

author: Tyler B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2018
review_content: I would give this a five star. It does in fact give your phone the projected amount of charges. (If you do the math from the watt hours for your device, the math is very successful.) The reason I give this a four (4) stars is due to the indicator inaccuracy. My last charge, the unit indicated two (2) dots of the four (4) dots. It dropped from two to one to zero within the last charge. (This was the first full charge to full deplete.) I hope it has a 'learning' controller to be more accurateNow, I knew that I should have been at the end of the last dot. I utilized this with my phone to watch Netflix. Due to the long flight, I wanted to ensure I had zero down time. I charge my phone between 20% to 95% and pulled the charger off, while Netflix was running. Within a 48 hour period, I was able to accomplish 8 hours of Netflix watching for a phone that typically can only handle an hour or two (airplane mode, may have saved some battery life). I also performed GPS mapping across for a two hour drive. Then I managed e-mail for a twelve hour day, then finished the night with another hour of Netflix, at which time, the unit decide to go from two (2) dots to zero (0) dots. (The first two (2) full charges, the unit kept four (4) dots lit as the charge level.) I still rank this more impressive and light weight and an additional plus for that additional amperage output for faster charges or higher end devices.
title: Light indication is not accurate, but this unit is still awesome!

author: lindsay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2018
review_content: I bought one of these in October 2017 and then another one as a gift in November 2017 because I was so impressed. The charge lasts forever and charges so quickly!! However, a few months ago (estimated 9 months after purchase) one of the ports stopped working, could not even plug the cord in so figured I must have somehow damaged it but still had a working port so honestly still worth the cost.  Just today though (1 year after purchase) a piece fell out of the second port so that doesnt work either :( I still gave 4 stars because honestly I loved it and it has been dropped a couple times so the fault could be my own just found it a bad sign that within a year it's now just a hunk of plastic. Doing some research now to try to decide if I want to try my chances and buy another one or try a different product.
title: Worked great but both ports broken after 12 months

author: Justin S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2019
review_content: Update 10/31: for the past couple of weeks I plug in with an anker brand lightening charger and apple and other chargers and it starts to charge when I plug my phone in and then it stops I have to keep checking in and pressing the Button again to get it to start charging then it stops. Super bummed because I’ve always heard great things about anker products. And it’s expensive to die a couple months later.Previous review when I first bought it:  Excellent!! Need it to charge my medical devices used while camping and also use sometimes at work it’s great! Holds a charge a long time. Anker products are really well made
title: Didn’t last

author: Matthew Cajigal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2017
review_content: I really like the capacity of this device, but looking back I would much rather of forked out the extra money for it's bigger brother:   Anker PowerCore 26800 Portable Charger, 26800mAh External Battery with Dual Input Port and Double-Speed Recharging, 3 USB Ports for iPhone, iPad, Samsung Galaxy, Android and other Smart Devices          .It has nothing to do with the capacity, form factor, weight, or number of USB ports. The main reason I would want the bigger brother is because of the charge time. I am on the go and external batteries are an essential. The think that irked me a bit was the amount of time it takes to charge this darn thing. Although the capacity plays a large part in the amount of time it takes to charge it takes a bit too long to charge from empty. A lot of the reviews say it takes anywhere between 10 to 20 hours. To me it should only take a good-night's sleep to charge any personal electronic device.Other than the charge time this Power Bank does everything I need it to do.
title: Another Awesome Anker Product - Charge time/technology could be improved

author: Chris Rogers
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
review_content: I think a lot of people are writing reviews right after they recieve it.  This product is great...in the beginning.  I have owned this for over a year now and it takes 3 days to charge the power pack when it used to take a day.  It doesn't hold a charge either, it will charge my galaxy s9plus only once and I used to be able to charge it 3 to 4 times.  I understand that batteries decline as they get used but this pack has charged devices maybe 30 times.  Cheap.
title: Short life span product.

author: D. Santos
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2018
review_content: When I first received my Anker charger, I loved it! It would charge quickly, and I could get 8 phone charges out of it, which was perfect for when I was traveling abroad and my bed wasn't near an outlet. I especially loved that it had the capacity to charge my tablet. I would carry this in my purse all the time and be able to charge my devices and my friend's. It wasn't until just after the 18 month warranty expired that it started to have problems. It now takes the whole night to charge an almost dead phone to 85%. I originally thought it was an issue with the cable, so I purchased an Anker cable as replacement, but unfortunately it still has the same problems with both ports. I also noticed last month that my dual port Anker car charger I bought around the same time also has problems, and one of the ports isn't working. The message I'm getting from the Anker products I've received is that they don't last much longer past the warranty, so just be aware if you're looking for products with longevity. The charger was great when it worked properly, but now it's a pretty lame brick.UPDATE 8/20/18: I reached out to Anker customer service about the problems I've been having with my Anker products and they were quick and kind enough to make an exception to replace my charger despite it being out of warranty. They really do stand behind their products, so I'll continue to support Anker in the future. I am still in the process of testing this new charger out and will update this review further after I've taken it on a few longer trips.UPDATE 2/17/2019: I took this charger for a long trip in October, and at the time I thought it worked fine. I noticed that towards the end of the trip the charging time got slower, and now it takes over 4 hours to get a full charge on my phone. Thinking it might be a cable issue, I purchased a new Anker cable. It had the same slow charging with the new cable, but I later discovered the new cable to also be faulty after testing out a couple other charging cables around the house. So still great battery pack, but maybe expect issues with Anker cables.
title: Anker customer service doesn't quit

author: T. Felder
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2015
review_content: This charger is quite a bit larger and heavier than I was expecting. When I first opened the box, I thought I might end up returning it because, though it is certainly portable, it isn't something I would ever throw in a bag to carry around with me. It is too heavy to put in a pocket or in a pocketbook or briefcase, I think (though again, you sure COULD).However (and this is an important "however"), this monster of a charger charged my iPhone 6 more than FOUR times before I needed to recharge it. That's awesome! I use it at home when my battery is low but I don't want to leave my phone plugged in to the computer. I can carry it from room to room with ease and the phone charges very quickly.Recharging this beast takes a long time, which is perhaps a small drawback (but not enough for me to take away any stars). I had mine plugged in for over 12 hours before it was fully recharged. (You'll know it's done because there are little lights that show you how much of a charge is left in the device.)To recap: I wouldn't use this as a daily back-up that I'd carry around with me. It's too large and heavy. However, it's PERFECT for use around the home or office when leaving your phone tethered to the wall or to a computer would be impractical or annoying.
title: Portable Charger Packs a Punch

author: Jamal E.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2019
review_content: I have ordered Anker products on occasion over the last couple of years and needed a new power bank for traveling due to my current one coming towards the end of its life and not keeping its charge. Plus, the multitude of devices I carry, especially when traveling with the entire family required something that could hold a lot of power to charge phones and tablets before needing to be charged itself.I received my PowerCore and carried it to the office the first two weeks to test drive it. I noticed that something was funky as my device would want to charge then not want to charge. I ordered a new Anker lightning cable because I figured it was an older cable I was using and that could be the issue, however, I had the same issues with the new cable plus it seemed that the PowerCore powerbank would stop charging the phone or iPad before it was fully charged. Finally, I noticed that I would have to press the charge indicator to get the PowerCore to start charging instead of simply plugging my source USB cable and plugging the device in and it start charging right away.I reached out to customer service to inquire about the peculiar issues I was having and they informed me that my device was indeed defected. They sent the prepaid label to send the old device in and promptly sent the new device which has been working as expected. I would continue to purchase devices from Anker for my device power needs.
title: First unit defective, customer service promptly corrected issue

author: Lawrence Matthew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2017
review_content: Update #2: Anker customer service wrote me and offered a full replacement of my dead battery.  They were great to deal with.  The new battery works just as well as my first did.  A couple things I'll do differently this time:  Unplug everything from it when not in use.  I used to keep one end plugged into the battery and the other hanging free from my phone when I needed to use my phone.  The other is I won't charge it unless it's dead. Given there's little risk because Anker will (probably) replace a dead one, I highly recommend it, but still need to dock a star.Update: It's dead.  After a couple months of perfect charging and discharging, I noticed that it started to lose its charge.  A few weeks later and it's now a glorified paperweight as it doesn't hold a charge at all.  I understand these are basically batteries which over time lose their ability to charge, but this is way too fast.Original review: Powerful little battery that holds a few full phone charges. Not too heavy and fits in my pants pocket while connected to the phone. Get a long enough charging cord and you'll forget you're carrying the battery.
title: Holds a few charges. Light enough to carry.

author: vt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
review_content: I received the Anker charger  about a week ago, it is well designed  and looks sturdy, but I noticed that while charging my iPhone  the charging abruptly stopped charging happened while charging my laptop.I trust Anker and have bought several items over the years their products and service are tops so I am puzzled by this, Does anyone’s as  have this type of an issue?*UptadeContacted  Anker, immediate assistance  they were terrific! Remedied my issue  without hesitation and apologized for my inconvenience !
title: Updating my initial review for Anker 2100

author: eric wright
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2017
review_content: Bought this product in January 2016 and took it out west that fall and the battery worked as advertised. It held a charge through the winter. The i drained the battery to make sure it would charge okay august 2017 but it wouldn't,when I called customer support they said there was nothing they could do since it was ONE MONTH out of the warranty.Bottom line if u looking for a battery that will last a year or so go ahead and buy it. As for me I won't buy another Anker product ever again !!
title: Bought this product in January 2016 and took it out ...

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2019
review_content: I recently got married in Greece and went to Italy.  I had bought this charger prior to our trip so we would always have charged cell phones.  I charged it up properly.  In order to use it, I connected it to my phone and hit the charge  button.  It started to charge my phone so I zipped it up in my backpack.  When I checked on it about an hour later, it had only charged my phone up 2% more than it was.  I  would have to continually hold the charge and push the charge button.  The charger would charge for about 5 minutes then turn itself off.  I tried this on my Iphone and my wife's Android Samsung phone.  We ended up using our regular charging cords with a European connector.  Don't waste your money on this product as it is useless.
title: Horrible Charge, Do Not Buy

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2018
review_content: Listen, I’m not going to try to get you to realize what you should of already figured out on your own, which is if you want a HighQuality SmartPhone Accessory that has anything to do with charging or powering up your SmartPhone, you look for the ANKER Name, brand and logo. Listen folks certain Folks are great at different Strokes. You want the best Automobile better think Germany, you want a HighEnd Technology gadget, gizmo or device you should think Japanese, or Apple, you wanna send a friend to the moon you better look at Buying an American made SpaceShuttle, if you want to power up, or charge a SmartPhone, YOU BETTER THINK ANKER CAUSE THEIR THE CREAM OF THE CROP IN THAT DEPARTMENT the rest are just fugazi trying to be ANKER when they ain’t ANKER YOU HEARD? Yeah this thing charges quickly and will charge your iPhoneXXX like 25 times on a single charge, So it’s worth the dough
title: ANKER IS THE CADILLAC OF SMARTPHONE ACCESSORIES

author: J. Hill
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2019
review_content: Had one blue status  light indicating 25% change when it arrived. Used overnight to charge it to 100%. Four blue lights and worked perfect on iPhone 6 and 6S.  No big deal but one can’t use an Apple iPhone lightning charge cord to change-up an iPhone directly the Anker. Anker uses a 22-inch USB-to-micro cable that comes with the PowerCore. All one needs is a 120v wall plug cube to accept the Anker USB plug.So another cord to misplace or damage, but wait.  Anker includes a nice nylon mess carry pouch for the PowerCore with room for its USB-micro-cable charge cord and a 3-ft USB to iPhone lighting cable.Imo if near water one should put it in the ziplock bag along with the iPhone.
title: Works as advertised

author: Incentive Buyer 48$
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2019
review_content: First charger I bought stopped charging after a few months of use. I contacted the company and they tried sending me a refurbished product. I obviously would not accept that so they sent me a new charger. It could not be charged, just like the original. Then the tech support said to do a "reset" by plugging the micro-USB cable into the charger and the end of the USB cable into the charger and wait 3-5 seconds. The charger began to charge again. Then a few weeks later it stopped charging again, just like the original. I have tried different USB cables and electrical plugs.  Someone once said that crazy is trying the same thing over and over again and expecting different results. It would be crazy for anyone to buy this product and expect different results from the company. RUN AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT AND COMPANY. SCREAMING!**UPDATE**Company sent me a new charger, which is supposedly better. It works. Takes a long time to charge but I guess that's what it takes, until new technology is implemented, to charge a hefty charger that will last a long time without needing recharged. 5 Stars for the customer service and the device that works.
title: Does not charge! Replacement item sent to me stopped charging just like original! AVOID!!!!!!!!!!!!!

author: Localee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2019
review_content: I got it yesterday for a trip today. It charges fast but this particular unit must be defective as it keeps shutting off while my phone is plugged in.  I have to monitor the phone and when it quits, I have to push the button again.  Pretty aggravating.  Ill be sending it back as soon as I get home.Addendum..... Ok.... got the replacement.  It, too only charges for a minute.  But talked to a friend who says he has a different brand and it won't stay on when he has just one device plugged in to it.  So,  I plugged my phone AND headset in and it stays on.  Weird.  Not sure how functional that's going to be but...... seems to work.
title: Doesn't stay on for charging unless 2 devices are connected

author: JDA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2017
review_content: Although these are listed as fast charging, they do not charge my Samsung Note 4 Edge at a high speed.  I have tried a few very well known USB cables from Amazon to test it (6ft and lower) in length.  I have tested the charging with an Anker AC (2 port) that actually gives fast charge, and compared it to this powerCore 20100, and this one is not fast.  It does however hold its charge so no issues there.However, the 4th "power availability" light, does not light up after about 2 months of usage.  Very disappointed in the quality of this power bank.***UPDATE***Anker has sent me a PowerCore 20000 to replace this defective unit (which as of 5/22/2017) has only the 1st light as operable even though it is fully charged, so no way of knowing how much I might have.  Fortunately it holds the power and does not discharge.  I hope the replacement is solid just as Anker products I've bought in the last couple of months (USB wall quick charging unit).
title: 4th "charge" light stopped working after -2 months use use, not fast charge.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2019
review_content: Interesting that nothing is stated on the description page about not being able to take this lithium battery charger on a passenger plane. It doesn't even state that it is lithium. Yet the box arrived with a large notice on it. Isn't the whole purpose of a power pack to charge devices when traveling?Further, It won't charge beyond one of four lights.This does NOT meet expectations!
title: Cannot take on a passenger plane & doesn't charge

author: mr. e
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2018
review_content: This has held up amazingly so far.  I think it's too heavy and long to carry in a pocket, but I throw this in a backpack and it stays there for weeks.  It feels like it has a sturdy and solid construction, and they include a padded carrying pouch.  I use it at least once a week, if I forget to charge my phone up at lunch and it's dying on my train ride home.  It charges my phone quick, and stores all the emergency power I need for weeks.  It comes in handy the most when travelling abroad.  Don't need to worry about fighting over outlets at the airport or hotel, or even pack a bulky international power adapter, with enough juice stored for my phone, GoPro, bluetooth headphones, and rechargeable 18650 batteries for my flashlight and vape.
title: Sturdy, quick charging and massive reserve, but heavy and long

author: Mz Lynn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2019
review_content: Initially gave 2 stars. Power charger takes forever to charge - 10-12 hrs - so no quick charge for the on the go person.  Too heavy for a ladies purse or pocket.  took an hour to charge my note 9 from 75% to 89%.  -  the only cable is USB to micro USB - so if you have an Apple product or a phone that doesn't take micro USB (like the Note 9 uses USB C) - you have to provide that in order to use the device. -  Plugged into a wall charger and the plug was almost too hot to unplug -  sure don't want to plug it into a USB connection on my laptop with that type of heat being generated.Update - Anker contacted me and we worked out a solution.  The 5 stars is for their customer service to help when things aren't right! -  Great Service and issues resolved.
title: Not what I expected - Updated

author: L Kay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2017
review_content: I have a long drive coming up soon and have an older LG G4 smartphone. While it still works fine for me, it doesn't have optimal battery life. I'm  taking a long solo drive and don't want to be without cell phone reception during my trip. So I've been looking at these for a while, and was happy to get this on Prime Day.I charged up the Anker PowerCore 20100 overnight. With a full charge, I was able to charge my phone 4 1/2 times from about 15% charge, which is better than most reviewers reported. Of course, I've had it only a short time, and am reviewing this only after the 4 12 charges. I also want to say that setup and use of the product is extremely simple. There are indicator lights which show you how much charge you have left, so no guesswork at all.If there are any issues with this at a later date, I will update my review.
title: Glad to have extra battery power...I really like it!!!

author: ecarradio1966
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020
review_content: I've had this portable charger since the middle of March 2020 (2+ months).  The battery capacity is relative to my LG V30's battery is enormous.  That's a plus.The physical size, although not small, isn't too large compared to my phone.  Despite being bigger than my phone, I am able to carry them in my pant's or short's cargo pocket.  The weight, however, is noticable.  It is beyond noticable compared to the phone.  The comparison to my LG phone is my go-by because that's its reason for purchase.  I purchased this Belkin model charger for the specific reason of charging my phone when it's battery was near no power.  I suppose that weight/mass is downfall part of high power capacity in batteries for now.  Understanding that this world is not a perfect world, I'm okay with this trade-off.The charging time does take long but again, like the weight, it is all part of the charger's high capacity.  I usually leave it charging overnight.This model will give me about four full charges to my nearly empty phone battery.  Unfortunately, this is where I give this product a lesser grade.  In my opinion, this model gets straight As in everything except performance.  I wasn't expecting this but I suspect that I was sold a flawed model.  At about the second or third charging cycle to my phone, I discovered that the charger would stop charging before completing the cycle.  To be fair, it's not too big a deal.  Simply unplugging the USB cable from the charger restarts charging.  Additionally, small problem or not, that shouldn't be happening.  I paid a good premium and as such, that glitch shouldn't be occurring.Over all, it's a good and very long lasting charger that uses a good-night's-rest time span to top off.
title: Great charger but...

author: Evan Peterson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2019
review_content: Have contacted this seller. I ordered the blue version of this and ordered this specifically to add a magnetic charger to my tech inventory. Was sad to see this show up in black and it is much larger than expected. Additionally this is not a magnetic charger capable device and am not sure why I ever thought it was after reviewing, possibly something else was said in the comments that swayed me to believe so.Update: I will give 5 stars as a proto type seeing as what I really am looking for in a backup charger I have yet to find. Ideally something less bulky is what I’d prefer with equal battery life offered it has held up over the test of time but essentially Apple needs to make phones with a better battery imho.
title: Bulky but effective

author: Alaz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
review_content: A high power capacity power bank with 2 usb ports. I ordered this power bank to be able to charge my camera, mic, light or phone on the go. Ended up using inside the bed, near kitchen everywhere. Because it stores so much power, I can charge my phone by my side no more sitting near the electricity plug. Downside may be its a little heavy and I dont like carrying it in a small womens purse. But when I use my backpack it doesnt feel heavy at all. I can charge my iphone 11 at least 6 times may be more. ( my friends also use it) Charge time is around 10 hours.
title: Power Generator! I can charge my phone 6-10 times fast!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2020
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.           Really great product. I have a secondhand iPhone 6 with terrible battery life. To avoid purchasing a new phone I use this charger, fairly frequently. If I’m out and about, I need a dependable charging method. This charger takes awhile to fully charge, but then it’s good for a week, if you utilize all three charging ports. Otherwise it lasts longer. The video show the two blue indicator lights, that will last a few more days. Fully charged, it’s four blue lights. I love this thing, you could use it at home too if you don’t want to be restricted by the outlet location.  Definitely worth money spent, which wasn’t bad at all!
title: So convenient!

author: MitchRider2014
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2017
review_content: This thing is the real deal and I'm glad I made this purchase.  Living down here in South Florida with the hurricane situations being what they've been of late I wanted to add to my collection of portable charging banks and now this one appears to be the best of the bunch so far which I had a feeling it would be because first of all as soon as you pick it up it has a heavier/more substantial feel to it plus you can tell by the packaging that this company Anker is serious about what they do. Also I fully tested it out this past week and after fully charging it up it gave me almost 4 (3.83 to be exact) COMPLETE charge ups on my Samsung Galaxy S5 after letting it drain all the way down to 0%.  I will definitely be keeping an eye on this brand Anker for this sort of thing going forward:)
title: Definitely A Keeper!

author: M Florentino
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2016
review_content: Excellent power source when you travel. Only problem is it takes a day to fully charge.I am updating my review and here's why.Seldom do I ever get follow up from a company serious about customer satisfaction but Anker totally changed that view forever! In fact ANKER is one of those rare companies that cares about its customer.After posting this review, Ophelia from Anker Customer  contacted me delivered the best customer service anyone can ask for. First, she took the time to reach out to me an explain how ANKER products work. I told her that I was ok knowing that power core I bought does not have the latest fast charging chip. But here's where ANKER deliver above and beyond....Ophelia offered to replace my battery with a new the fast charging chip. At first I thought why would you do that? She said that ANKER really cares about its customer and wants to its best to meet their expectation. So in summary, I got a new battery pack with the fast chip built in and let me tell you this thing is night and day in comparison to the new product.Anker understands that technology evolves over time and to convince its customer they are the leaders in their market using cutting edge technology and the best customer service follow up. I fell like a luxury car buyer with this kind of treatment. No maybe a guest at the Ritz Carlton. In any case, ANKER has really exceeded my expectations.ANKER you just made a loyal customer out of me and will share my great experience with friends and family -- thank you very much Ophelia!Ticket#8341000
title: Greate portable power but takes forever to charge. (UPDATED)

author: Mary Jane Sheppard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2019
review_content: EDITED AFTER ANKER REPLACED BOTH CHARGERS.  ORIGINAL REVIEW:  I have 2 and neither one works.  They both charged only once and then quit working.  Unfortunately this product is junk.  EDITED REVIEW.  After seeing this review Anker Customer Service contacted me, offering to replace both chargers. I accepted the offer and now have 2 new chargers, but since I don’t use them often I can only hope that they work as advertised.  The chargers are the right size, easy to use and handy so I hope they will work in the future.  I advise purchasing the unit before you need it to make sure it really works.
title: GOOD EXPERIENCE WITH CUSTOMER SERVICE

author: Adam R
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2017
review_content: I bought this to charge my Nintendo Switch, and it does so really well. I haven't had much opportunity to play and charge at the same time, but it charges around 30% an hour in sleep mode which is perfect for what I needed. From what others have said, I'd imagine that it charges very slowly when used during operation, but as long as it's keeping the battery level up, I don't need it to completely counter-act the drain of actually using the system.It's also come in handy during long car rides with my kids' Fire tablets, as it can charge two devices at once.The fact that it doesn't include a USB wall wart is a bit annoying, but I've been charging it off my computer every week or so, leaving it plug it throughout the day while working. The inclusion of a draw-string carrying case it nice, as I can throw it in my bag and not worry about surface scratches.
title: Solid, sturdy charger. Works great.

author: Brooklyn222
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2019
review_content: The powercore is not the lightest or smallest of chargers but it is effective and long lasting. And I love being able to charge two items at one time.  When I initially received the charger, it stopped charging my iphone 6s after just a few minutes. Very maddening. So I bought an Anker brand lightening cable assuming it might be a compatibility issue. That didn’t work. When I contacted Anker they recommended some trouble shooting - which also did not work. So they deemed the charger defective and replaced it with a new one. And it works perfectly.  I especially appreciate the responsive/responsible customer service.
title: Works great. Excellent customer service

author: Toni M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2020
review_content: I haven’t used it yet But I’ve had Anker products in the past for devices, but honestly, it’s a great brand! It is a hefty battery so if your wanting something small to fit in your pocket this isn’t it! But it’s a great size to fit in a bag though and great for traveling! It does take about 10-12 hours to fully charge it so be aware of that. I got mine half charged and it took over 6 hours to charge it. It’s a great product though I will buy again if I need to. Anker products are an awesome brand and they have great customer service
title: It’s awesome I don’t have any regrets in buying this battery bank!

author: J Whitmer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2017
review_content: I LOVE ALL ANKER PRODUCTS!  REAL QUALITY!  I haven't used the various items I have that long but hoping this power core lasts like other items I have been using. This was a little heavier than expected but to have the charging abilities it has dealing with the weight in purse will be fine for peace of mind. Cord included for usb (from Anker charger port or whatever source) to micro usb in unit. Obviously one uses whatever charger for phone or device as expected. I saw some reviews saying cord not included but that is absurd as several different connections per device demand. Anker products are such quality that I am happy to recommend them to others without hesitation. Just received this power core & hope to do review after using a year or so. Check our their guarantee & tech support provided.
title: Anker products are quality & recommend without hesitation.

author: zmsLV
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2019
review_content: I didn't use this for the first month or two after I bought it, but then I started traveling. At first the power bank seemed fine - but I started to notice that when I was trying to recharge it, the lights never went back up to 4 full lights. Again I did not use it for a month or so, but after I used it, the lights never charged up past 3 lights.I finally ran the battery on the power bank all the way down and I have left it plugged in and charging for more than 2 days. The blinking charging indicator lights are stuck at 1 single light. When I try to charge my phone from the bank, the power runs out after a few minutes.Maybe I got a lemon, but I would not recommend this model. I will have to throw it away and find something new.
title: Unable to Recharge Power Bank

author: Karen Jones
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2020
review_content: I needed to replace my old charger,was looking for more power and a unit that I could toss in my bag for trips to the park. This unit  does take hours to reach full capacity but does a good job on most  equipment.  What I do not like is the weight,it is a heavy unit . Too heavy for me to routinely take with me. I use it more at night to keep my iPad charged while I watch a video before sleep. Also the finish is very slick and has slipped from my hand several times and dinged my wood floor.
title: Heavy and slippery

author: AmZone
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2017
review_content: I am very happy with this power bank and this company.  Top quality.  I bought this along with the Anker 21W solar charger.  After purchase I noticed an earlier review where the reviewer noticed that when using on a partly cloudy day the power bank draw would reduce significantly when a cloud passed by but would not return to the full draw that was previously available when full sun returned.  A bit concerned, I reached out to the Anker customer service via email to see if they had resolved the problem.  They responded the next morning that yes it was indeed resolved and asked for my Amazon order number to make "double sure" the model was one of the new ones with the upgrade.  The tone of the email was refreshingly professional and helpful.  I could not be happier.  Super quality stuff AND responsive customer service.  By the way, I received the items today and it tested perfectly as promised.
title: Awesome company and a quality power bank.

author: The Real Tall
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2018
review_content: **Amendment** I ordered my first one as you will see below and it did not function properly. I am sure with any product there are a few one offs that for some reason or another don't hold up. However, once I reviewed my item I was promptly contacted by customer service with a sincere apology and offer to send me an expedited new portable charger at no cost to me. The replacement has been working wonderfully. The customer service was phenomenal and its refreshing to work with a company who stands behind their product. I would recommend this portable charger. I ordered this product based off of reviews even though it was more than I wanted to spend. After using it for very few months the I’m sad to report the power stick itself won’t charge to more than “one blue light”. I’m extremely disappointed and pretty bummed I spent as much money as I did on this.
title: Excellent Customer Service

author: Laura B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2016
review_content: I LOVE THIS. I wanted something compact yet with a punch that would last for days (I am very forgetful and tend to put off on charging such devices at night), but with this particular one, I don't have to think about it as much because1. It charges my iPhone at least 7-8 times. I have only seen this pack die once, and that was during a long trip out of town where I didn't rely on wall outlets to keep my phone charged. I was able to be out and about with family while charging my device.2. On that note, the charge time is QUICK! IT will fully charge my phone within an hour. I commute to work by bus and have had so many instances where I left work with my battery at 15% and by the time my 45-1 hour bus ride was over, my phone was fully if not at least 85% charged. It's such a relief and necessity for someone like me.3. There are 2 ports.4. The 4 LED lights to indicate charge are super useful and great to look at when you realize its been a couple days since the last charge and there are still 2-3 dots lits up ;)I would definitely recommend!
title: Perfect punch of power and longevity

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2020
review_content: I liked the fact that I could charge my iPhone almost 4 times from this charger without recharging the charger/battery.  However the longer I had it ( bought it 6-7 weeks  ago ) the less my phone would accept the charge.  I don’t know if it was because of cable issues or perhaps that it doesn’t support iPhones ( I kept getting messages on my iPhone that the device was not supported by my phone).  Yesterday I bought an Apple cable, and that has solved my charger problems for now.
title: Cable issues for iPhones with this charger

author: Mark A.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2018
review_content: Bought this a couple of months ago and it still has yet to give me any problems or a bad charge. Big enough for all the power-hungry devices in my life especially the work phone at my job site. As a security guard, I’m always on the move and the phone we share is a piece of s#%@ because its battery has been through too many cycles. I can charge my iPhone 8 and the work phone up from 10 or 20% until full and hold it there for a couple of hours until my shift ends at least 4 to 5 times a week and still have about 10 to 15% of the charge left after my work week is done. By the way, I can charge this battery pack up in about 10 hours from almost completely dead to 100% so it’s possible to have it ready even if I’m charging it up between shifts. You just need the right cable and wall plug. Like most tech companies, I’ve found that Anker’s own wall plugs and cables (yes even the 12-inch freebie) will get the job done faster whether it’s getting charged or doing the charging. It’s even more evident when using a generic or third party cable and an apple wall plug to charge it for example. When I used a generic cable that came with another device, the charge up took at least 14 hours and it wasn’t charged more than 75% at that point. The 3rd light was still blinking when I had to leave for my next shift. The only real drawback is the pack won’t shut off once the device is done charging especially with an iPhone if you’re prone to forgetting about it or just charging your phone while you sleep. Other than that it’s a great item to have in hand if your job kills your device(s) battery quickly.
title: Gets the Job Done

author: Howard R. Johnson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2018
review_content: I researched a ton of these chargers. I settled on this one because a friend of mine suggested I do so. He is one that researches everything before he buys. I have to say I am impressed with the power this thing has. I mainly use it to charge my GoPro and Nikon D3200 camera batteries. It will keep these batteries charged and usable like clockwork. Since most things can be charged now by USB this thing is sometimes a blessing to have. I know it will charge a phone. My next test will come later when I purchase a small DJI UAS and see how well it charges the batteries on it. One drawback is that it takes a long time to charge it, as it recharges from USB as well. I plan on using this on long distance hiking in the future, so I am testing on my normal activity at home to measure how it holds up.
title: This thing packs a punch.

author: Patrick Schaffer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2016
review_content: In the world of video games there is a concept where if a player, item or monster is too good at its job, it is deemed as ‘overpowered’. That concept pretty much sums up this backup battery up perfectly, it is almost too good.I mainly picked this up for travel. Something I can use to top off the charge on my devices while on the go. I’ve yet to do a full stress test on this battery, but I have been able to do a few weekend getaways without draining the battery even half way down.  The one down side to this device is that where it can hold a lot of power, it also takes a while to charge. So if you do plan on running it down, you also need to plan a while to recharge it.Build quality for the battery is solid, and the case/pouch that it comes with does offer some padding, but still something that you will need to pack into your luggage/pack not something you would clip to the outside.So far, I’m impressed not only with this product, but also Anker as a whole. Anker is a newer company only recently celebrating their 5th Anniversary, (founded in 2009) yet in terms of quality I would rank them up there with some of the ‘big dogs’ like Apple, Sony, LG or Samsung.
title: Overpowered...

author: Porter C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2018
review_content: I like this because it charges your phone easily and it can be used multiple times before it needs to be charged again, BUT it's pretty heavy. I didn't expect it to be so heavy and I still will take it with me in my small purses, but reluctantly. I would maybe go for a smaller version if you're hoping to take it out to restaurants and bars without weighing down your purse.Update #1: the company reached out after my review and apologized for my misunderstanding on the weight. They also sent me the smaller version of this which is working great (needs to be recharged more than the larger version). I recommend either charger depending on your needs.Update #2: The smaller version is dead and won't charge anymore. Really disappointed because I really liked it.
title: Works great, but a bit heavy

author: Invictus
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2020
review_content: I got this for a week long camping trip, to keep my phone alive for maps and pictures. I was able to charge my Galaxy S8 from 0-100 four full times and my boyfriend's iPhone 6 twice before this thing died.I loved this charger so much that when I lost mine, I bought a new one. I just recently found the old one so basically my phone will never die.I've had the one for almost a year, it spent about 5 months under a seat in my car, and was still about 70% charged and working perfectly when I found it.
title: So worth it, I bought it twice

author: James Murphy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2019
review_content: Great battery life.  Easily charges iPhone 4-5 times.  Just a little big for every day carry.  Mostly I use it for work trips or flying when I may not be able to plug in to a wall socket easily.  Next one will be a little smaller.EDIT:  Works great until it doesn't.  Had one that I used daily and then it no longer would take a charge.  Two lights would blink and not take a charge.  Very disappointed, I really liked this battery bank but its not built to last.
title: Works great

author: Steph
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019
review_content: I was really excited to get this because of its small size and large capacity, but it never worked. I tested it out on a few different devices, and it would charge each device for 30 seconds to a minute, and then disconnect for no reason. Thought maybe it was my cable, but it did the same thing with other cords. Amazon sent me a replacement and it did the same thing as the first one.Update 7/31:After returning my battery pack, anker customer service reached out to me and offered me a replacement at no cost. They sent me the powercore II, which offered the same amount of battery as the original powercore, but with updated casing and faster charging. The new model works great. I would definitely recommend getting that over the original powercore. Thanks Anker for helping me get a product that works!
title: Anker made it right

author: NWRobotics
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2018
review_content: First of all, this is a very nice product. It is very sleek and modern in design and feels really nice in your hand. I went a whole month before I had to recharge it. It can recharge my iPhone and other device many times, and I am very impressed with the quality. Charging the device takes several hours. There is one tiny issue, however... I don't know if this is a glitch or not, but occasionally, when I plug my charging cord in, it doesn't seem to recognize my device, and it won't charge it. I have to unplug it and plug it back in a few times for it to recognize it. Most times, however, it just recognizes it immediately. It is a slight nuisance, and I hope it doesn't get worse, but I still recommend buying this product because it is very nicely made and has a long-lasting battery.
title: Sleek and Modern design, but with one tiny issue.

author: Alygator
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2018
review_content: I have had this battery for almost a year. I love it. In my opinion, it stays charged longer than my brothers Mophie batteries. I use it often on trips and always make sure it's charged just in case. I had a slight problem where the battery wouldn't charge, but I called Anker and in less than 4 minutes, they have a replacement out to me. I am thankful and looking forward to using it again, because I LOVE mine :)Also, shoutout to Spencer with Anker who made the whole process easy. I'll definitely continue to buy Anker products.
title: A minor problem after a year, but Anker and Spencer came through

author: 🌴🌊🐚CaliGirl🐚🌊🌴
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2020
review_content: I absolutely love this charger. I have soooo many friends that love this charger too. It charges things (phone, tablets, watches, etc) in so little time. Plus the life of this battery charger lasts for a very long time. Even charging multiple devices.My son begged me to let him take it on his trip (going out of state to visit family), which meant I had no battery back up for myself. So, with no ease  did I even look for newer or better products with higher ratings, that's how confident and pleased I am with purchasing this device.♥️ I SERIOUSLY RECOMMEND IT 🥰 you won't be dissatisfied.
title: ♥️ YOU WON'T BE DISSATISFIED - You get what you pay for! 💯

author: Nick Salvador
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2017
review_content: Honestly, I have always loved the Anker brand. They sell a lot of quality products at a budget. I love their cables, and I definitely love this battery bank. When I'm out and about, and I need a quick charge, I'll use this. I don't know if anyone reads manuals anymore but the battery bank has "IQ" USB headers which changes the voltage/amperage depending on what device is being charged. I use this bank for everything. I use it for my iPhone, iPad, Nintendo Switch (yes,it works great!), JayBird earphones, etc. It carries a lot of juice which makes it useful so you don't have to constantly keep charging it after one use. Although, because it carries so much charge, it takes several hours to charge but it's worth the wait honestly. Also, it's has some heft to it and the exterior has a very nice texture to it and it also comes with a mesh bag so you can carry the bank around with its charger so if it's every bumped around or something, it won't get scratched keeping your battery bank looking brand new after several uses. I definitely recommend this battery bank, especially being it so freaking cheap and comes from a reputable company. I'd buy this again or even one of their higher models if I want more charge again.
title: Amazing bang for your buck battery bank!

author: Soma Chanda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2018
review_content: UPDATE: I contacted Anker about the issues I was having and they were very fast to respond to my concerns. They sent me two replacement units which work. However, all that being said, for those who say their chargers aren't charging, may I suggest using a higher output charger such as the iPad charger. My pack charges completely overnight with the iPad charger. I still have issues with the iPhone wall block but I believe it's because the output simply isn't high enough to charge it once it's completely dead or doesn't charge fully because the output can't match the capacity of the 20100. So now I have working blocks and their customer service is pretty good so it's still worth the buy.I bought this product three times. The first time it charged fully and worked great. Then I went home to my parents and it would only charge sometimes and even then to two lights. Then I came home to my apartment and it charged one time to all four lights and then the next time to two. The second unit charged fully at my apt and then barely is charging at my parents house. I’ve tested it on multiple outlets which doesn’t make any sense. I’ve tested all the outlets with a voltmeter and it’s fine. I’ve ordered a third one as a Father’s Day gift and I’m half inclined to send it back and buy him something different so he doesn’t have to go through this. How in the world does this product get so many great reviews? It’s not a good product at all.
title: Requires High Voltage Wall Block to Charge Fully

author: Makalila
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2020
review_content: I received this product back in March. The anker battery pack worked well in charging my phone until it ran out of battery. I charged it with the cord provided and now it will stop charging at every percent. Luckily I had my speaker with me so I could charge my phone otherwise I would have been screwed. When it worked it was great I got a lot of charges out of it for my Galaxy s10 but once I charged it, it went to crap. I'm very disappointed because I will need a battery pack in a few weeks for an event.*Edit *06/27/2020Was contacted today to diagnose the issue. Waiting on response to my new message will keep posted.**UPDATED ON 08/24/20**Sorry I have been really busy with work, school, etc. I barely have had time to relax and finish updating.*06/28/2020Was sent new battery.****Was delivered within the weekUsed it many time fully drained battery charged and everything seems to be working just fine now! Charges my s10 and s8 multiple times very good for Gofest or traveling, highly recommend!Again sorry for taking so long to update review!
title: Anker Portable Charger Stopped Working

author: BHI
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2020
review_content: The first power bank I received didn't fully charge after the first charge and use. The second power bank I received didn't charge correctly from the start. The third power bank I received charged great the first time and I am still using it on that charge. Despite the challenges to start with I have to say that Anker's customer support is amazing. Shelly was very helpful, quick to respond, and worked with me until my issues were resolved. I would buy from Anker again.
title: Great product and customer service.

author: Daisy70
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2019
review_content: It took me awhile to choose an Anker battery but after reading pages and pages of reviews, I settled on this one.So glad I did!  I’m not sure how long it takes to charge, but I charge it before bed anyway when I’m going to need it so charging time, whatever it is, is not of interest to me yet.I’ve taken this battery on vacation on a very long car trip and it was perfect for charging my iPhone X.  Charges it multiple times.  I don’t know how many times because I’ve never gotten below the 2nd bar.Works great with other portable devices, I also use it for my Nintendo 3ds game console.
title: Lots of battery power!

author: Shay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2016
review_content: I got my package very fast. It was nicely packed. I decided to test it ( believe it or not to write a 5 star review)I dont know if the power banks I received are defected some how or this is the case with all of them. So, I have a Samsung note 4 android phone. I charged my power-bank to its full capacity and I decided to charge my phone using this powerbank .The power-bank has 4 lights on when it s fully charged. My phone battery Mah is 3220 so I guess I need to be able to charge my phone for 6 times before the power-bank dies. But to my surprise I was able to charge my phone only 5 times ( from 0 to 100%) and as I started the 6th time the power-bank died.So, It has 16100 Mah power not 20100. At-least this one is like that.I got 2 of these powercore and overall I can say I am not satisfied with its quality. Maybe if they said it is 16100 mah it would be ok?Update: Few days after I posted my review, costumer service contacted me and they explained the reason behind why  was not getting 100% of what it was written on the power bank. So, first of all my phone was on all the time when I was charging it so as my phone gets charged it is also losing its power not to mention the powerbank loses some of its power due to heat. So what I was getting from the powerbank was totally reasonable. What I loved more was the way costumer service treated me. Even though I was not being reasonable they offered to replace my powerbank with the larger one in capacity while I did not have to pay the difference. So I am very happy now with what I have and I will test this power bank more and get back to you guys!
title: Updated Review: Great Costumer Service

author: AK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2015
review_content: The battery bank is simply amazing. Quality & craftsmanship if fantastic.  Better yet the design is well done amd engineered to perfection. It packs a mean punch in a small sized pack. Even comes with a quality cable to charge itself or your chosen device (s). Highly recommended. It is fast and charges my Samsung Galaxy  S5 quickly. Also both tablets. I can go all week without wall charging. I carry it as I travel for wirk and in my car. I like the fact that its 2amp input makes for a quucker recharge as most battery banks are half that at 1 amp input.Cable is good quality as well. Led indicator lights are nicely integrated to show you current battery level remaining. It's great as I have owned and own other brands of battery banks. This one by far is the best. One feature that is great is when the device being charged is complete it stops charging as it has the integrated IQ technology to nor overcharge. Price is right, product is fantastic, quality is superior. Thank you & hope this helps add piece of mind that this Anker product hits the ball out of the park. Great buy.
title: Superior Design, quality & excellent overall product.

author: Joseph Chung
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2017
review_content: This one is a DUD! AGAIN!I love Anker products and their customer service.  I have their cables, car chargers, usb chargers, extra batteries for my note 2, note 4 and G3.  Love them.  When ever I experienced trouble, their customer service came through like a champ!  I bought this PowerCore 2100 after having my Astro E5 confiscated at Shanghai airport (because they couldn't verify the battery's capacity).  Astro E5 was a beast, I was able to charge my phone more than 4 times per charge.  So when I bought the PowerCore 2100, I expected it to outperform the E5 handedly.Unfortunately, it never happened.The first unit that arrived, wouldn't charge.  It never got past the 2nd indicator light (there are 4).  Tried everything, different cable, charger, outlet.I called Anker and once again, their amazing customer service sent me another unit in 2 days!  They even told me to keep the first one but I don't need a paper weight to be that big and heavy. The second one charges fine.  So I thought I'd be happy with it.  Until I started using it.  It took me about 4 cycles of charging and usage to realize that this one is only able to charge my phone about twice before going dead.It probably needs to be conditioned, I thought.  However, after putting it through about 10 cycles of charging and using it, the result is the same.This HUGE brick is only able to charge my LG V20 twice before dying.  Unacceptable and disappointing.I should only give it one star but because of their awesome customer service, I gave it two stars.I won't ask them to replace this one.  I'll just look for another option.
title: I love Anker products and their customer service

author: Robert
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2018
review_content: I was having trouble with this battery charger after a few months. Basically it was malfunctioning and deemed unusable. I was frustrated so I contacted Anker customer support. I was met with excellent customer support and a company in Anker who believes in standing behind their products. I received a replacement in a few days and so far I’ve been happy with the replacement. Great job Anker.
title: Great Customer Service!

author: Dale B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2019
review_content: The battery pack is fairly lightweight and not overly large, and is easy to use. Our pack has not come to a full charge. I have left the pack plugged into a wall outlet for two days and the fourth blue light will still blink. The battery will charge our iPhone 6 and 6S, but does not give the stated number of charges. The most we have been able to get is four. If I were to purchase a battery pack again, it would not be this one, as it doesn’t deliver  the advertised features.
title: Does not deliver advertised features

author: margaret binns
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020
review_content: This just arrived so it may be too soon to write a review . I will be sure to update this if anything goes wrong . It took me a while to figure out what would be the best back up charger for us . Living in Florida we are used to power cuts that last for days and in the past we relied on the land line for a phone but over the years we are now down to just our iPhones .  I was worried when our phones had to be recharged by hooking them to our vehicles  . This will be a life saver as we are retirees with no relatives in Florida to check up on us . I  bought this one because it has the higher mAh which means more back up stored . The other thing I like is that it will charge two phones at the same time . I plugged it in overnight to fully charge it and so we will use it to charge the phones for the next few days and see how it goes .  The other reason I wanted this is for when we take that world cruise when corona virus gets sorted out .
title: I like the led lights that tells you how much juice is left

author: P Young
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2019
review_content: Update:  I ran into a problem with my PowerCore - the "middle port wasn't working all the time.  I was really worried about it because I had bought this for Christmas back in Oct. - I messaged customer service and they shipped out a new unit as soon as I gave them the order and serial #'s for this unit.  I am very happy with their service and highly recommend these units and the people who service them!I bought this for Christmas for myself.  I had another Anker battery back up and was happy with that.  This one has more power and I can allow other people to charge off of it and still have life left for me.  Love these!  You'll never be without a charge!
title: Happy to have this!  Their customer service is excellent too!

author: Lori H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2018
review_content: This thing is fantastic. It charged my phone a couple of times over, as well as other people's phones when on a trip. The battery lasts a couple of days/weeks/don't really know how long, so there's no need to worry that you won't be able to use them after a long time of not using it.Downside: this thing is quite bulky (doesn't fit into small bags, it's about 2-3 inches longer than an iPhone 6s), and a little heavy so it could get a little too much if you're walking and carrying it for a long time. Also, it takes a while to charge it up to full capacity when totally drained.Great for backpackers, long trips where you won't be able to reach an outlet anytime soon. If you're looking for a charger that'll keep you juiced up on the daily commute or something, you may want to consider a smaller size.
title: Awesome juice pack!

author: Jesse
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2015
review_content: Let me start out by saying that these things are awesome.  I spent a lot of money purchasing smaller less quality battery packs to find this out.  I have used this for about a month now and it works flawlessly.  One of the best parts about this Anker charger is that it adapts to the item you are charging.  What I mean by that is that I have a Samsung phone and any charger besides the factory charger takes hours to charge the phone.  The Anker battery charges my phone faster than the original wall charger.  The other great thing is that the battery charges my phone up to 8 times on a single charge.  It can charge phones,  tablets,  and any other small electronic device.  It's very sturdy made of a very hard plastic and comes with a nice pouch.  The pouch is ventilated so you can put a phone and the battery into it and charge it in the pouch and it doesn't heat up.  The USB cable that comes with it is also very well made and won't wear out like cheap usb cables.  Finally,  Anker's customer service is top notch.  One of the batteries was defective on arrival and I simply called them up and they overnighted a new one and sent me a packing label to send the old one back.  The item is about the size of a galaxy note 4 but about twice as thick.  I will definitely be buying more products from Anker in the future.
title: Best Battery I've ever used.

author: Jay V.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2018
review_content: I am a big fan towards anker products and been pretty happy for the most part. I want to love this product but i cant. The main reason why i bought this is because i was looking to get a 12v battery pack for my switch and on my recent trip (6hr flight), i needed to charge my switch. It didnt charge and all it did was heat up the unit. If your buying it for your phone or small electronics then this works well but for the switch. I wouldnt recommend it.*Update 09/24/18*I gave an extra star because of the great customer service of Anker. They sent me another unit that did charge the Nintendo Switch did charge on.
title: Its good but not for the Nintendo switch

author: Susan K.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2019
review_content: Took this on our 3.5 week trip, and we couldn't have lived without it! We used it for charging both phones and both tablets almost every day, and I can't believe how fast the PowerCore charged them, and how long it lasted before having to charge the PowerCore again. My only complaint is that it's a bit heavy for carrying around in your travel bag all day, but there is no way we could have lived without it. We got stuck in a thunder shower where every bit of us got soaked through - including the travel bag with charger inside, and it worked just fine after we got all dried out.
title: Indispensable!

author: f.b.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2020
review_content: Purchased this product in Nov 2015 at $28 on sale. It is quite heavy so not something you'd want to carry in a purse or pocket but if you need lots of juice for your devices on a photo-shoot or something of the likes then this is a good battery pack to have with you. I still use it today although I haven't used it incredibly often over the years. Remember the ideal range for the health of lithium batteries is between 40-80% so try to store your Li batteries in this range to increase longevity!
title: Heavy but effective

author: Saad A.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2018
review_content: I don't think I will keep anker as my first choice anymore!I purchased this power bank a year ago and never really used that heavily, yet, it failed when it reaches to the point of warranty expiration. It does not take charge anymore, whenever the battery is plugged in to the charger, it only blinks the first light (it's been on charge for 2 days and nothing happened).I think it'd fail long ago if I used that regularly. Now it feels bad that I have to throw away a good set of cells (probably) with blown charging circuit.On top of that i noticed, they jacked up the price as well!Verdict: They are all chinese, this brand is well finished on the outside and that's it. I recommend to look for other brands and read the reviews from the long term users.
title: Only good for a year (at least in my case).

author: Krista
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020
review_content: This charger is amazing! I took it with me on a trip to Patagonia to hike for 4 nights and charged my phone every night, and it still had some juice left over.It takes awhile to catch the full charge, but it lasts forever! It’s a bit on the heavier side, but I don’t really notice when I’m carrying it around with me.I like that it has two slots to charge with and the blue light indicator is very helpful!Probably the best charger I’ve owned so far! Would definitely purchase again.
title: Fantastic!

author: N.G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2018
review_content: Very surprised. Anger usually is bullet proof.  I have many anger brand products. This one is not working from day one. Took two days to fully charge. Tried many chargers including their own high output wall charger.  Then, the unit will not even maintain the battery of any phone if the phone is in use. If you turn the phone off it will charge the phone fully after about 6 or more hours. Of course this is ridiculous and something must be wrong with it. Tried different cords etc.  Not bashing the brand, but this particular product does not live up to any reasonable expectations.UPDATE.  Well someone at Anker saw my review and asked to replace the battery. They shipped me another without requesting return of the one I reviewed.  This new battery took a full charge in an hour and will completely charge an Ipad in the same time.  Obviously my first battery had a bad cell or something.  They are very proactive in making sure you have a good experience with their product.  Very happy with their service, and will continue to recommend the brand. Add a couple more stars.  More companies need service like this.
title: Updated review

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2020
review_content: I purchased this product in September of 2018. I didn't use it very much for the first year or so and have just started using it extensively for traveling several months ago. This was a really good product for while but I now realize that it may have zapped my Motorolla phone battery. My battery indicator would suddenly jump to 1% while charging when it started at 60%! And it would continue to go back and forth and sometimes just cause my phone to die abruptly while it is being charged. I thought it was a cable issue and kept switching USB cables thinking they were defective but I got several new cables that work fine with wall chargers. My warranty already expired but I will not be getting another Anker product. Very disappointing.
title: Started out well but stopped working after 2 years zapped my Motorolla phone battery

author: Major Havoc
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2020
