review_content: Come on Anker, your product descriptions are very confusing and I ended up purchasing exactly what I did not want.I have a Motorola e5 Plus that has TurboPower which is equal to Fast Charge 3, yet your item description  is so confusing with empty description which misleads everyone.So now I have an item which will take four hours or more to charge my phone or headset.Just because of this I probably will not recommend your products to friends and family much less on social media.
title: Just exactly what I did not want

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2019
review_content: First of all, I love Anker products. I've been buying them as gifts for friends and family for years, and I finally decided to upgrade to a larger battery for my 10 day trip to Philadelphia and New York. I find out while on my full day excursion in New York that it was glitchy and wasn't charging my phone as fast as my older anker battery pack did. It also CONSISTENTLY required me to press the button to activate the charging, (which when my other anker products didnt need that. I was disappointed and had to "salvage" my phone battery like a heathen instead of carelessly take pictures as I intended to fulfill my "tourist" expectations.Now I have this white brick in my desk that I dont use. Now, I bitterly use my old one and I'm reminded of every time of the trip when my phone didnt charge fast enough for my first excursion on the East Coast.UPDATE: Called customer service and within 3 minutes, I was speaking to one of Ankers representatives, Rochelle. Rochelle was so patient and helpful even on my time crunch (called on my lunch break). After explaining my issue with the device, she was able to get me on the track to return the power bank in exchange for a new one. THANK YOU ROCHELLE! Happy Anker customer here.
title: UPDATE: Still LOVE Anker.

author: Anny
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2019
review_content: It could be that I got a defective one, but mine doesn't fully charge at all, no matter how many different cords and outlets I've tried to use it on. It works great when I need it to charge, but it doesn't fully charge- it only makes it to the third dot, which is a huge inconvenience. I bought it to go on vacation but I have to keep it charging in order to use it multiple times and not worry about not having enough juice to charge my cell phone. Will be requesting a replacement and try that one out--hopefully i can update my review with more positive feedback.
title: Doesn't Fully Charge

author: Mark C. Mcelroy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020
review_content: I love Anker products (I have a smaller Astro E1 (6700mAh) charger from Anker and I love it.) so I expected to love this.Right out of the box I was surprised how big it is.  This is not pocket sized.The one I got did not work and I returned it.Anker sent a replacement of a different type for free for my trouble. I recommend Anker products and appreciate the responsiveness of the seller.4 stars for having to replace it.  This is the only example of a failure and I have 5 other Anker products.
title: Replaced for free

author: Concerned Consumer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2018
review_content: So I bought this battery pack for my trip to Japan and after buying it I read that there's a 100Wh restriction on lithium batteries. So I searched in the Q&A section "TSA" and some people said it's safe but this one bozo said it's 100.5 since it's 20100 instead of 20000mAh. So me being the pessimist requested for a return label to get another version that's 20000. Before I printed the Label I flipped the box and saw a customer support number. So I called and in a few minutes Adam answered and I told him my concern and he made me feel reassured that it's safe for CARRY ON NOT CHECKED BAGGAGE. He also told me the actual output wattage or whatever it's called. It's 72.36Wh. He then told me to call my airlines to double check with them if THEY have any restrictions on top of TSA and if they required any paperwork for me to email them and they'll send me whatever paperwork is required. Honestly, what defines a company is the people behind the logo. As a business man myself customer satisfaction is key and Adam at Anker really blew me away in his professionalism as well as reassurance. Thank you so much for everything. I hope you're reading this man, you're really good at what you do. Keep it up and thanks again.
title: Adam the Savior - TSA SAFE

author: April
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2019
review_content: I have one for a little over a year now. It takes a while to charge the power bank but it can be used to charge other devices numerous times. Great for traveling.I wanted to get a second power bank because the dash cam I have isn’t hard-wired but I still want it to run when the car is off. Hence, a power bank can power the dash cam even when the car is just parked or not being driven. Upon receiving the product, I fully charged it before use, however, it would not stay on or power the dash cam longer than a minute. Figured it was a defective product, I ordered a replacement. The same thing happened. It would not power the dash cam even though the power bank was completely charged.
title: Past two power banks were defective

author: C Breit
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2020
review_content: It was immediately clear as soon as I pulled this out of the box that this is a used item. It had scuffs and scratches all over it. Both USB ports were dusty. One of the ports was even dirty.
title: Used damaged item being sold as new

author: Wiltony
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2018
review_content: Edit: Anker reached out to me and offered to replace it after all -- thank you for backing up your product! Customer service rocks!-------------This battery is big and expensive, so it's a good idea to know the durability and reliability before investing so much money into one! I bought this one and a ravpower brand around the same time about 2-3 years ago. The ravpower is still working, this one is not, despite being used significantly less often.I contacted Anker with an out-of-warranty repair request and they kindly said, "thanks for letting us know it died, but there's nothing we can do. Throw it in the trash."As you can imagine, I'll be avoiding Anker products in the future due to poor reliability and I recommend you do the same.
title: DO NOT BUY: Will die within a few years! (Edit:Anker CS to the rescue)

author: Minna C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2018
review_content: This powerCore is slim enough for me to carry in my backpack while at work or at school. It charges my phone faster than a regular charger. It does take awhile for the battery bank to charge fully but again, that's probably normal with all larger capacity power banks. Make sure you get a higher amped wall charger to plug it into otherwise you'll be charging forever. The reason I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because it came with a case for the power bank and it keeps shedding this short black lint material all over the place and seems to be shedding into the usb port as well. They need to find a different material to make the casing.
title: Great purchase!

author: Riley Gardell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2019
review_content: UPDATE: After leaving the review below, Anker contacted me within a couple days offering to send me a free replacement. All I had to do was confirm my address and I had a new one within a week of my review. They’re great about their warranty but it’s not great that there was an issue in the first place. My previous review was 3 stars but their response bumped it up to 4.Disclosure: I did not use their Anker specific cable.The charge on the battery lasted me about a week of traveling (only used for day time charging, not overnight). It would charge for about 2% but then stop so I would have to press the power button again to get it going. While this eventually got the job done, I couldn't just plug in my phone and forget about it.
title: lot of battery but hard to get connected

author: Angela Windham
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2019
review_content: When I first started looking for a portable phone charger for a trip, I looked only at a certain brand I had bought before.  After perusing several brands on Amazon, I decided to give the Anker PowerCore 20100 a chance.  Having not even heard of this brand before, I was very hesitant, but I am so glad I gave it a shot!Pros:  This charger is very long lasting.  I charged it before I left on a week long trip and did not have to charge it once during the trip.  It has the capability of charging two electronic devices at once, but I did not use that feature to test it.It charges quickly.  I found it to charge more quickly than connecting my device to a wall or car charger.Cons:  If you are wanting it to carry around in your purse, it is larger than many devices (6-1/2 inches long) and is heavier than most I have used in the past.I have only had to charge it once, but the first time I charged it, it did take several hours to fully charge.  I will update this review when I charge it a second time.Conclusion:  This is a great, middle of the road priced electronic device charger.  Great value for the money.  I highly recommend this product.
title: Long lasting charging power

author: Junstar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2015
review_content: UPDATE: Still going strong [06-25-2018]I bought this battery in October of 2015 and it's still working. Still use it to charge my iPhone X and iPad Air 2.Recently, I just got a Nintendo Switch and was hoping this battery would work with it as well. So, I purchased this   Anker PowerLine+ USB C to USB 3.0 cable           and tried it out.Short answer: it works.Long answer: when the Switch is in sleep mode, it charges at a normal reasonable rate (still, not as fast as original charger of course), but while playing something intensive like Zelda: BotW, it charges very slowly. The Switch's battery doesn't discharge while plugged into the PowerCore, but it doesn't charge at the rate like when it's docked for example, which is understandably so.Eventually, I'd like to upgrade to a newer Power Delivery equipped external battery to support faster charging to the Switch. Until then, charging in sleep mode or charging slowly while playing will work for me.I'm just surprised this PowerCore is lasting this long. Only goes to show Anker's first class quality.Original Review: Edited to reduce cringe factor [10-12-2015]I originally bought the 16000 mAh version and loved it! I carried it everywhere and used it on everything.Then I saw this one... pretty much same size (it's a little longer) and 25% increase in capacity? I must have this.I gave the old one to my brother, and got this.I like the new matte finish. The older glossy finish was prone to too many fingerprints even though I never took it out of the mesh bag.They removed the built in LED light. Honestly, I've never used that light, so no big deal.
title: UPDATE: Still going strong almost 3 years later

author: Bryan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2019
review_content: *** Update October 2 2019***I would have to say that Anker's customer support really stepped up.  They expedited a replacement unit to me with no hassle.  The new unit has worked without issue for well over a month.This charger is without a doubt the worst piece of sh*t that I have ever bought on Amazon.  It made it through *one* two hour hike.  This was less than a month after I received it.  It no longer shows any lights.  It no longer charges up, or charges devices.  I tried the "loop" reset already.  Nothing.  Nada.  I'd return it but after becoming disgusted with its 1 week lifespan, I tossed it in my pack and blissfully forgot about it.  I only found it when preparing for hurricane Dorian.  Might as well throw it in the ocean.  At least a hermit crab might make use of the casing....
title: *** Update *** Great customer support.

author: Chelse
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2018
review_content: After about a month of having this product, one of the battery charging indicator lights stopped working. After about 10 months of having this product, the battery no longer charges past the first indicator light. Very disappointing! I heard great things about this product before buying. I’m hoping to hear back from the manufacturer and get this issue resolved! Otherwise I cannot recommend this to others.
title: Battery stopped charging

author: Sid
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018
review_content: I brought this product sometime around Jan, 2017 and it has been working really well since that time. This was one of the must to carry list whenever I  travel and very simply put it does its thing with 2A charging (which is very helpful since my iPhone X, iPhone 8 get charged really faster than usual Apple chargers). Seeing how this has been helpful for my day-to-day needs, I bought another one as a gift for my dad.Now very recently this product stopped working on me and I am not sure of the reason. The blue light does not turn on when I attempt to charge it. When I reached out to Anker Support, they had mentioned to me that I am out of the 18 month warranty since I bought this last Jan. I am not too happy with their response. I am going to see if my Dad's product that I just bought a few months back also would stop working after the 18 month warranty.I am going to be ordering the RavPower one soon to see how it works since they are giving a lifetime warranty.
title: Very good product but would not last longer after the 18 month warranty period is over!!!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2017
review_content: Great product. I bought a new Galaxy S7Edge and the battery is an integral part of the phone so I can't have a spare battery with me. This Power Core does the trick. I charged it, essentially overnight, and then took it with me on a 4 night trip. I only used the power core to charge my phone. In most cases the phone was at 30% power in the late evening and I turned the phone off and put it on charge. Average charge time was 1 to 1 3/4 hrs. The power core fully charged shows 4 lights. When I was finished with the 4 night trip the power core it was down to 2 lights....so there was more power to charge my phone for at least another night or 2. the power core is a little heavier than I thought it would be. It isn't something to carry around in your pocket.
title: Great power source for Galaxy S7 edge

author: Jessica
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020
review_content: I bought this product exactly 18 months ago. I didnt touch it for the first 8 months. I kept it stored in my office for hurricane purposes. First of all ots bulky and heavy. So my phone started dying at work so I brought it everyday for the past 10 months (roughly). Today it does not hold a charge. It randomly died with no warning. I havent contacted customer service because it's been just over 18 months since purchase (literally a few days)  I fear customer service wont do anything so why bother?
title: Not worth it for the price.

author: Blunderchief
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2018
review_content: I bought this power brick several months ago, and my impression has been very good of it. It charges my phone to full power about 4 or 5 times before it dies, feels durable as heck, and its slim form factor means it fits well in the bag I carry to work. The original unit did die recently, however. It would take and hold a charge, but it no longer charged any of my devices. I contacted Anker’s customer support, and I was immediately sent a new one, sight unseen. I sent them pictures of my current unit, along with the serial number and my amazon order receipt, and was promptly informed that they’d shipped a replacement for me. That is fantastic customer service.
title: Great customer support

author: Van Lambert
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2019
review_content: [Update] The customer service team for this product is wonderful! They immediately sent me a replacement charger and it works perfectly. They proactively contacted me to check up on me and see if I have received the replacement and also contacted me further to see if I had any further issues. You will not go wrong with this company. I love their service![Old]I am now on vacation in Asia where I finally need to use this. Item continuously stops charging after a few minutes, then I have to either replug or press the button on the power bank to activate charging again for a few minutes. Then rinse and repeat every few minutes.
title: The Best Customer Service

author: edub1223
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2018
review_content: This is the second one that I have purchased.  I left the last one in a tree stand in rural Georgia last deer season.  I had it for probably 2 years and it never degraded in power storage.  I love these things.  I do a lot of hunting and camping and am frequently without power for many days at a time.  This allows me to have reliable power for basically an entire week.  I also suffer from extreme battery anxiety, meaning I get anxious when my phone dips below 90%.  This is great to have to keep it fully charged.  One thing to note is that it does take a long time to fully charge but that's reasonable when you consider it will hold 7+ phone charges.  Another is that it is heavy but again, it is reasonable considering the amount of charges you can get from it.  I would highly recommend.
title: Great for the hunter/ camper

author: Nathan Adams
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2018
review_content: I got this back in 2015, and as someone that goes to a lot of Conventions, I needed something that would be able to recharge my Iphone as well as my Ipad, and this thing did all of that - not once during a 5 day convention did I run out of power. It was able to recharge my phone multiple times and ipad once before finally running out of juice by the end of the last day.  I know this review was a long time coming,  but I after using this thing for the past several years, I decided I just had to add my two cents. If I can find any negatives, it takes a long time to recharge once the device is dead (understandable due to it's high cap) and it's on the heavy side - so no pocket carry, but then again - understandable due to it's high cap. I am very happy with this device and look forward to many more years of service from it.
title: I am very happy with this device and look forward to many more ...

author: Hayley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2020
review_content: I've had it for a few weeks now and at first I thought I was imagining it but after a few tests I've found the charger only charges my phone 4 times. On top of that, the top of the bar, where the ports are, gets really, REALLY hot. I'm not sure if this is a cable issue or not but I feel fairly certain that it isn't. I don't have access to any power at work and I sit in my car, counting boats leaving port, for 8 to 10 hours most days. So I drain the battery quickly. I got this so I wouldn't have to keep using my car (I also drive at least 106 miles one way to work.). So I was hoping this would help but I may need to return this and try something else.I have a samsung galaxy s8 active.Ps. I was rather excited to find it was capable of charging my little ipod nano! That thing doesn't charge unless I plug it into my computer. Won't even work if I plug it into the wall.Overall, though, I'm really disappointed that it didn't work as well as it claimed. And I'm worried it may melt a bit...
title: Doesn't charge as advertised

author: NunyaBidness
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2017
review_content: I have had this charger since mid May and have used it within an inch of its life, lol! I used it on several plane rides, at airports, at home, at the beach, at the zoo.. I previously posted a 3 star review stating I had received only 3 months of use before it started acting strangely. After posting that review I was contacted multiple times by the seller who wanted nothing more than to solve the issue. I had tried multiple cords all which didn't seem to help so I assumed it was the battery, as did Anker who offered to replace it under the warranty. Once I returned home, after the three months, I purchased a new charger for my phone which immediately improved the charging rate and am now trying this same cord on the battery. It is very possible the cord that came with the charger is faulty (I KNOW my regular phone charger and back up chargers were all worn out) but it isn't a big deal as I can simply use my phone charger. Bottom line - Anker was right on top of the issue. They promised a new battery under warranty and responded promptly, and courteously, to my review and subsequent emails. I will ALWAYS give my business to a company that takes the time and makes the effort. IF it turns out the battery is the issue I will simply return it but the review stays as is.Note: It IS bulky and heavy. I personally do not care about its weight or size - it holds a lot of energy, charged my phone, and my sons, quickly and while we were using them throughout a day of travel. THAT is all I cared about. Others may need something that fits into a pocket or small bag. I'm sure Anker has something for you and I encourage you to give them a try.
title: Bought for vacation use

author: ashliegh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2018
review_content: Review update*******I was initially very disappointed as I statues below in my original post. I contacted Anker to talk about the guaranteed 18 month warranty and they were very happy to help. They got back to me right away, sent a new battery right away and have checked back frequently to make sure it's working and that we are satisfied. I would definitely recommend this product and company and would order from them again. I have their SD adapter and love that as well!Original review ******Have to say we are pretty dissatisfied with this. We bought in April or May for our trip to Hawaii, worked well for about a month or so and now it won't charge. It flashes like it charging and won't ever charge past one "light" but that doesn't even last long.$50 for something that worked for a month is very very disappointing. It says there's a 18 month seller warranty so I am going to try to contact seller to see about a refund or something.
title: Updated review *****

author: S. Garrett
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2018
review_content: Bought this for my son who has to keep his school IPAD charged up everyday. If you think a 12/ 13 year old can remember to do that ever day you are wrong. This battery once charged up can charge his phone and his ipad ever day while at school for a week. A great conveinient thing to have even though i am teaching my kid not to take responsibility for charging his ipad every day. there are just too many otheer things to wory about. This is just one more thing I don't have to nagg him about everynight. Really if I had to do that everyday I would keep this mega charger in my back back too. It's a life saver on long trip too. Get one, a big one it's well worth.
title: A life saver.

author: Jeffery P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2019
review_content: I use this to charge my iPhone and iPad while traveling. It's perfect for throwing in my bag to make sure I never run out of juice. Typically I can get 4-5 charges out of my iPhone XR and about 2 on my iPad Pro (2017).PROS- High Capacity.- Can charge two devices at the same time.- Well made.- Accurate indicator lights.- Charges devices fast.CONS- Takes awhile for the bank to charge, I know that's standard but it takes AWHILE.Overall, I am very happy with this power bank. I highly recommend!
title: More than enough to charge iPhone and iPad

author: Manju
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2018
review_content: The Anker 20100mAh portable charger has already proven its worth — being able to charge phone and tablet when on the road and not having to pause charging when car stops. Consistently will fully charge iPhone 6 3x and iPad 1x before having to recharge the Anker. Our experience is that it does take a while to fully recharge the Anker if it is fully depleted — about 30hours. We haven’t tried recharging the PowerCore on the Anker 15W PowerPort solar charger yet. We’ll probably not let the charger get fully depleted when having to rely on the solar charger… Overall, the PowerCore is a valued and reliable heavy-duty charger. We love it and highly recommend it! We gave all our extended family members Anker portable chargers last Christmas and they all love them too!
title: Reliable, long-lasting power source for your phones and tablets

author: Desiree Marie Wilkins
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2018
review_content: My husband and I purchased this portable battery charger originally to take to Disneyland, since we knew we would be using battery-draining apps all day. This product exceeded my expectations! We continued to use it frequently after our trip, and can get 4 full phone charges very quickly off a full battery. That being said, we experienced a quality issue when I went to remove the USB cable and a piece of the USB port came out of the battery and rendered it unusable. So I contacted customer service and they went ABOVE AND BEYOND to communicate with me insanely fast. They noted the issue and sent us a replacement almost immediately. They even checked back in with me a couple times to make sure that the replacement was working well, and assured me that the issue was out of the norm. I am very satisfied by their quick and easy solution to a problem that could've easily ruined our excitement over this wonderful product! We will be purchasing another one in the near future because my husband and I now fight over this charger, since I work from home (on my phone) and he works away from the home and needs the charger too! Thanks Anker!!
title: Excellent Customer Service

author: Penang1970
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2019
review_content: This device was used to keep 2 phones, an iPad, and a wifi hotspot up and running over a 3-week European trip. While there were only a couple times when I had to use the portable charger to bring one of our dead electronics back to life, I found it really useful to charge a couple phones at the end of the day when I had limited wall sockets. Typically, the charger only used a quarter to a half of its available power to ensure all our gear stayed charged when there weren't enough free sockets to plug in at the end of the day.
title: Ample power for several devices

author: Danielle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019
review_content: This charger is AMAZING!! It’s a bit bulky, but that’s a sacrifice I’m willing to make for the power and speed of this charger! It’s too big to fit in my pocket, so you’d need a bag/backpack (I used a hip pack to keep this charger/my wallet/etc. while traveling in New York). This charger works SO quickly. (When I started typing this post I was at 27%, I’m already at 40%!!)In New York, we’ve been using the GPS for walking directions which drains my iPhone battery very quickly. This charger took me from 25% to a full charge in less than an hour. So far I’ve charged my phone to full three times and another member of my party’s phone partially and the charger still has three blue lights (75% charge stored). I haven’t tried charging two phones at once yet but I like that I have the option!I’ve never once had to worry about being lost/stranded with a dead phone thanks to this charger! Definitely worth the money.
title: Worth it!! Great for travel!

author: McLeSk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020
review_content: This power bank by Anker is excellent. Compact power for charging.  Even better than expected from having one of their power banks for several years. The technology has improved. Now it’s powering the usb fan.  Haven’t had to recharge it in the month since purchased. And using it daily. I am very impressed and will be getting another, along with watching what Anker comes out with in the future!
title: Will get another

author: Wit Held By Request
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2016
review_content: High wind advisory tonight in the Bronx so I took out my Anker battery pack, used only twice to make sure it was topped off. I had last check about 30 days ago and it was fine, four blue leds. Uhoh the white led flashlight didn't come on and when I checked the charge it wasn't even one blue led.It is charging now but even after ten minutes the internal flashlight comes on only if the battery pack is plugged in to mains. I am wondering now if I can trust Anker battery packs for ANY emergency.Follow-up note:And help they did. Within hours of my complaint I was contacted by the  Anker Amazon support team and then by the AnkerDirect customer support team. After describing the problem and documenting the batch, the rep immediately dispatched (by 2-day air) a newer model unit as replacement.I have several Anker products bought over the last year and while this is the first time to have an issue, the company really had my back.Never have had a better customer service experience. Never.
title: Anker external battery failed on its own accord after a month in storage, but customer service was world-class.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020
review_content: This has power to keep your devices going.  And going.  And going.  That's what I wanted, and Anker delivered.Pros:- large capacity.  Once charged up, it is difficult to discharge this PowerCore 20100 power bank with multiple devices pulling power out for an entire cross-country flight.- Proven technology.  Uses older, reliable (larger) batteries.- Sturdy.  It's already been dropped several times, with no apparent cosmetic, structural, capacity ill effects to the unit.- Anker reputation for great customer service backing up great products.Cons:- power input rate is limited by microUSB standards (instead of newer/faster USB-C).- heavy (that's a relative term.  But I don't mind trading off the weight  to get the power availability),But -- to me -- the pros outweighed the cons.
title: An ultra-reliable rock.

author: Pops
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020
review_content: I have a couple of backup batteries, but this is the best one.  I use it quite often, especially when I travel.  Also great to have when I am out on a motorcycle ride and need to recharge my headset or phone.  Not sure exactly, but I think that I get about 6-8 charges on my Samsung S6 phone with this backup battery.  When I recharge this, I use a slow low amp charger, so it takes overnight to recharge.  I don't think it is good to use a fast charger on these batteries, but I may be wrong.
title: Nice backup

author: Tikna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2017
review_content: I bought this portable charger in 2015. It was my first portable charger and has been my only one since. I bought it, as at the time there was a deal to get it for $28, which was obviously a steal! Since that time, I have become a diehard Anker fanboy and will only get Anker battery packs and cables. It still charges my devices extremely fast and is very portable. I have even tried looking into get a new one from Anker but nothing seems to have the same portability form factor with newer features. This battery pack is amazing and a must for anyone looking to buy one. I would buy it again if I didn't already have one, and have recommended it to countless others. The capacity is excellent, and remains excellent after 2 years. The charging capabilities have never faded either. I've been truly amazed with this product. I charge it overnight maybe once a week and get tons of use throughout the week.The only thing that would replace this battery pack for me is one that can power a MacBook Pro and has multiple USBC ports with the same portability factor.
title: A must have

author: Julie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2020
review_content: I highly recommend this portable charger. Like 15/10.PROS:- Battery life is phenomenal. With the charger I got before this one (also from amazon), one charge (phone being on like 5%) would leave my charger on like 50%. This one, it’s still at 4 bars. I’m like “huh??????” But yeah, I get a good amount of charges before I have to charge the charger, lol.- The bag that it comes with, SO CONVENIENT. I have an iPhone so I keep a short cable, and also the cable it comes with (to charge the charger) in the bag.- IT’S SMALL, LIGHTWEIGHT, AND SOOOO PORTABLE.CONS: NOOOOOONE. I have had this charger for a good couple of months and I am so satisfied. :)
title: BUY IT, YOU WON’T REGRET IT.

author: Jason
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2019
review_content: Needed a charger that could handle some rough camping. 3 people used this charger over a weekend to charge our phones and also a small JBL Bluetooth Speaker. It still had enough juice at the end of the trip to keep the Speaker powered up. Worked great. It's a bit heavy but seems very durable and well built. Worth the Purchase!
title: Fully charge several phones before needing a charge itself

author: K. Greene
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2018
review_content: The charging port for this item was loose the first time that I tried to use it. When I put the charging chord into the unit there was wiggling and I had to move it around just to establish and maintain a charge, as observed by the blue lights flickering on and off when I did and did not have a connection of charge. I’ve read previous bad review, but read a ton of good reviews about customer service so I figured I’d give this a shot. Needless to say that I am highly disappointed with getting a defective product. I really needed this, as I am going out of the country for a couple of weeks and was relying on this unit to keep my iPad charged.
title: Charging port is loose and doesn’t maintain charge.

author: France Hayes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2020
review_content: Everything was working just great then I could not get the charger to indicate it was charging..I emailed them and received an answer back from someone named Luana very shortly...absolutely, totally professional! She indicated that they would want to take a look at it but once it was received by them she sent out a new replacement unit that works great! I'm talking days, not weeks or months..All I can say is that they absolutely stand behind their product with unusually great service.. something you tend not to see so much of in this day and age! For that alone I will recommend this Anker charger to anyone.. infact..I bought 2 more for my family members. Thanks Anker, Mike.
title: Great Service Help🙂!

author: T. Ip
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2018
review_content: I had the battery for just about 12 months, and in this 12 months the battery works great, performs very well. The battery is just solid, and never had any problem. We do not travel without it. It has charges multiple phones multiple times in a day.Then for whatever reason at about 12 month, the battery would not fully charge. There is 4 bars of light, and my battery never charged to the 4th bar. We tried different outlet, cables, and all sorts of tricks and still can not get it to charge fully. At this point, I was really disappointed, because I love this battery and I don't go any where far without it. I went back to Amazon and see if I need to get another one, and I am reading all the reviews. All the reviews had said how great the customer services is, so I guess I was going to contact them since my battery was still under warranty.OMG, they responded so quickly!!!! They sent me a new battery without any questions, and didn't ask me to send back mine. It didn't cost me (no shipping cost) anything to get a new battery after 12 months of use!!! The customer service agent stay in touch with me thru out the process!!!This is an great solid product, and the customer services is AMAZING!!! They totally stand behind their product. I absolutely love them, that I am going to give this battery to my friends and families as Xmas gift!!! Thank you!!!
title: Great and solid product with the best customer services!!!!

author: Luis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2015
review_content: I love this, I had the 13,000 mah version for a while but at work everyone kept asking to borrow it & by the time I saw it back it was below 50% and then I would drain the rest, So when I saw this was on sale I bought it instantly. I can honestly say this is Way better than the other, it's a little longer sure but the amount it can store makes that size difference Worth It. I have a Samsung Galaxy s6 edge plus & can fully charge it from dead to full about 5-6 times, by that time it's down to 1 light & needs to be charged. I charge it with anker's 3.5a adapter & it feels it takes about 6-7hrs to charge. Lately my samsung "fast" charger charges my phone so slow that I've been using this charger instead & it works much better! I would highly recommend this to anyone who takes long trips or doesn't have access to outlets at work, trust me You'll Love It.Not that it matters but a difference between this one & the 13k version, the glossy outer case is removed & replaced with a darker more rough texture. I didn't like it at first but it's good in the way it no longer attracts fingerprints & it reduces the chance of slipping off slanted areas.
title: Buy It, It's Worth It

author: NorthCoastChick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2020
review_content: Bought two, same time, same product. One will charge as seen, one will not. Tried changing cables, power squares, outlets, etc. just no. Beyond disappointed. Waste of money. Waiting to hear back from customer service regarding this junk.Update : Anker responded immediately and shipped a new power charger. New works as advertised. Customer service was awesome, happy customer for life. Highly recommend this charger.
title: Anker customer service rocks

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2017
review_content: UPDATE: Anker's customer care is above and beyond. I must have received a defective unit but Anker made sure that I was taken care of with a replacement. I appreciate this very much.I love Anker and I have a whole range of their products starting w the iconic lipstick power bank from many years ago. I also have the 10,000 mah power bank that I love as well as a bunch of lightning cables. However, with this latest purchase I was left unimpressed. Im not sure if this might be a defective unit but it only charged my iPhone 7 Plus about 2x on a full charge. For 20,000 mah I was expecting a lot more. I'll be returning the product. I used this during a camping trip on the 4th if July weekend and it left me with a dead phone for half a day. I was surprised to be disappointed as I have always found Anker to be a very reliable and well-built product.
title: Defective product BUT Anker customer care/after sales is the BEST in the business.

author: A Mom of 3
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
review_content: I bought this when we were going to be camping in the wilderness for several days and I wanted to be sure my phone didn't die. (No cell connection, but it's my camera!) It had plenty of power. Now I take it with me whenever I'm going to be away from a charger for more than a few hours, just in case something goes wrong and I run low. It's a relief to know that I won't run out of battery.It does take a long time to charge up - plan for a day or so.
title: Long-lasting, so far

author: Anonymous
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2016
review_content: Good packaging upon arrival. It was half fully charged. I purchased the Anker charging port so I can plug it into a wall instead of rely on my computer to charge this battery. Used it today to charge my Samsung Galaxy S6 from 10% to 100% -- this took about 3 hours for a full charge for my phone. Battery does not overheat, my phone did not overheat. I purchased this portable charger because I travel quite a bit for work and would need a reliable source of power when I'm stuck somewhere like the airport. I was unprepared, however, for the weight of this battery. It is heavy, but that is to be expected for something that gives 20K mAh. For me, I traded a bit of the portability (weight) for capacity and also of course, quality. This is my first Anker product. I highly recommend this portable battery (if you don't mind the weight) and the Anker brand in general.
title: Good packaging upon arrival

author: Debora W
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2018
review_content: Glad I sprung for the high capacity one, it'll get me through a long flight or a day of Pokemon Go with juice to spare. It does last as long as it promises to, but frankly I was surprised at just how LONG it takes to charge. "Of course it takes a while you silly person, it's the high capacity model" you might be thinking, but bear with me. It takes about as long to charge as it takes to use up. You really have to plan ahead when you intend to use it for the long haul uninterrupted, because if it's already empty you'll have to start charging it at least 24 hrs in advance.As for the material quality, it's plastic, what can I really say? I can't speak for its durability because I haven't dropped it yet.
title: Good so far.

author: Jeffrey K.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2020
review_content: Anker has an 18 month warranty on this charger, but does not honor it.  My charger failed after six months and I contacted them for support.  I went through their process, provided all of the requested documentation, they admitted there was a problem with the charger, and then failed to honor their warranty.  When the charger works it's fine, but don't count on Anker to stand behind their products or honor their warranty.Update:  After multiple emails, denials, and Anker trying to avoid responsibility I was eventually escalated to a higher level of customer support.  They finally sent me a new charger.  It was a frustrating experience, but they eventually did honor the warranty.
title: Anker does not honor their warranty

author: Atiya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2020
review_content: LOVE THIS BATTERY! It’s great it chargers quickly and holds  a charge for a long time when I’m not using it. I bought this manly to charge my phone (that had a terrible battery) while  traveling and now I use it all the time! It is a little heavy so just be warned, the case is a nice buff, but for me the fact that it completely charges my phone from 0%-100% 4-5 times is worth it plus it charges my tablets as well. It performed wonderfully abroad and domestically, even after a family member dropped, and I’ve had it for a year now so hopefully it keeps working *fingers crossed*
title: Love it!

author: Chris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020
review_content: At first blush this battery is an absolute brick of a power supply. I have on my short excursions camping with it kept my iPhone, my Nintendo Switch, my Kindle, my GoPro, and my bicycles lights and headlamp topped off. It takes ages to charge, but it takes ages to discharge. I use it to hold whatever power I can leech from the sun with my backpacking solar panel and it has never managed to top it off, this isn’t a fault of the solar panel, or the battery, it has just that much storage capacity. Time will tell if this massive capacity will hold up, but in the short time I’ve had it has not disappointed me. The ports are tight and the supplied cable is very stout. The construction is sturdy plastic, so it will probably survive being dropped once or twice. It does not appear to be sealed too hard against water ingress, I have no doubt you will have a bad time if it somehow gets submerged under water, so don’t use it while scuba diving to charge your phone, but it’s going to be fine if you splash it.
title: UNLIMITED POWER (power is not actually unlimited)

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2019
review_content: I bought the Anker PowerCore 20100 Portable Charger for my trip to Colorado. I used it the entire trip, I use it every single day now & carry it everywhere. I use it at home, in my car, in my purse when I’m out & even used it while hiking in Rocky Mountain National Park.I bought the bigger one because you can charge two phones at once. Plus it has a longer battery life than the smaller ones.For some reason my phone battery drains pretty fast so this portable charger is a life saver!It charges faster than my wall charger so I use this portable one especially when I don’t have a lot of time to charge my phone.If there is a downside it would be that it is big & heavy. Not heavy enough for me not to use it daily & carry it everywhere with me.It’s one of the best investments I’ve ever purchased. Worth every penny!I highly recommend this product!
title: One of the best investments I’ve ever purchased. Worth every penny!

author: Ruben
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2019
review_content: Tbh idk why I'm buying another. The first one I bought, broke within a month of buying it and idk how it did. I mostly left it in its box, and it doesn't help how my lazy ass didn't tell the company or write a review about it and now its most likely too late and is pointless to do. I asked friends which to buy and they recommended other brands yet I keep coming back for the less weight and the high capacity. I just got my second portable charger which is this device and so far its heavier than I thought, but i hope it will last longer. What I like so far is that there's 2 lights and a half when I pressed the button, out of the box which is good. I really need this one to last because I'm going on a trip soon which I need it for, and even though there's many other cheap ones that have much more capacity, it either doesn't have high\good reviews, it is very heavy, or both.Just like the saying, with cheap products come cheap quality. I'm kind of sad that I didn't notice that its a USB charger and not a USB-C because I bought cables to go with it but meh, I have other USB cables so I don't mind as much since I'm planing to buy a phone with a USB-C charging port and how everything is slowly switching to USB-C. I know its my fault that I didn't ask for a refund or new one when I could have, and now with my messed up brain think it was a long time ago or at least past the warranty so I doubt I can get a new one, and even though I do ask that if there is someone that reads this, is from Anker I hope something can be worked out or check if the warranty is still available or help me check, since idk how. I wont put too much mind on it since its mostly my fault though adn as I said before just hope this device will last at least a year. Also if you or any readers were wondering I bought a (Anker PowerCore 26800 Portable Charger, 26800mAh External Battery with Dual Input Port and Double-Speed Recharging, 3 USB Ports for iPhone, iPad, Samsung Galaxy, Android and Other Smart Devices) before. I might come back in a year or 6 months or if anything happens to change this or add on to it as I see others do.(Edit) OMG WOW I thought I wouldn't be coming back in a few months but Anker responded to my problem very quickly and got in touch with me. They told me that I could still get a retry/ new compatible charger if it was still in the 18 month warranty. They sent me a email asking for the serial number and shipping address for clarification and said that they would get me a new one and then check in 7 days to see if its up and running still. I'm both really happy and surprised on how Anker helps their customers, even though I know its for more to trust it and to buy more from it. And it worked, at least for me. I'm planning to buy more in the future from them, yet first clarify that I'm buying the right cables and tech since im not so smart in that compartment.
title: Second time purchase and second chance, maybe last if time will tell.

author: GeekFrog
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2019
review_content: I use this with a 21w Anker folding solar panel while backpacking, camping, etc and have never run out of power for my camera or phone.  My only complaint is that you can't charge the battery while the battery is in use. It's not a big deal since the panel can charge two devices simultaneously and I rarely need to charge more than one device at a time. The battery pack has floated down rivers with me(in a dry bag), spent all day in the hot sun, and generally been abused. It just keeps on working to my pleasure. It will also power a raspberry pi for longer than I have ever needed.
title: My Backpacking Battery

author: Jewel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2017
review_content: I decided to buy this charger due to the great reviews. I am happy to say that I was not disappointed. I was travelling to New York to do some touring and wanted to ensure that I'd have enough juice on my phone so as to take pics and vids. I had the charger shipped to a friend in New York and got it from her the very morning I was to start my tours. Fortunately the charger came precharged at about 50%. I was able to charge my phone twice and I even lent it to a friend to charge her phone. So I was very impressed.I'm just disappointed that it takes a very long time to fully charge the charger. But I found out that a 2 amp charger will improve things a bit!This charger is reasonably priced for the amount of charges you can get just from one full charge!
title: Best Charger!

author: Tina Barton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2020
review_content: The portable charger is great for backpacks that have cord access to it.  I bought the second one because I bought a business backpack just for my laptop and accessories.  I charged my phone twice so far and the charger is still showing 4 bars and it did charge quicker than other portable chargers I have.  I gave it 4 stars for traveling but that's only because it's pretty heavy.  I wouldn't walk around with it in my pocket or my purse.
title: This is My Second Purchase

author: Dave H. Shin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2019
review_content: I purchased this charger mainly to charge my iPhone 8 plus.  When I got it, I tried to charge my phone and was only able to get it to 80% before the charger stopped charging.  I changed lightning cables to see if that was the issue, but got the same result.  I called Anker and they got back to me quickly, saying they would send me a replacement.I got the second charger and the same thing happened.  I called back and was directed to plug the charging cable back into the USB-port in the charger to reset it.  This did not help and the charger still was unable to charge beyond ~80%.  I contacted Anker and got a response to the effect of "we hope this fixes your problem and your charger works again".After this, I became frustrated and attempted to contact Anker again.  I told them I would like my money back, since it seems like there was an inherent problem with the design of the charger.  I was told that the design was changed in December 2018 and that as a consequence, this flaw was seen in a handful of cases.  I was okay with their explanation, but still told them that I would not be comfortable with another replacement and would like my money back.  Instead, they told me because I was beyond the 30 day period where you can return it for a full refund, I would not be able to get the refund.Instead I was offered a newer model of the Powercore, the Powercore II.  At this point, I was very frustrated and had called and emailed Anker numerous times. I decided to stop trying to get my money back and just said I was okay with the new model.Based off of other reviews of this product, it seems to work fine for most people.  With that said, I would recommend to test it out on your phone or device.  If it does not fully charge it, get a refund right away (definitely before 30 days).EDIT:Anker has contacted me and offered me a full refund of my money.  I appreciate their efforts on maintaining good relations with their customers and am grateful for the refund.
title: Stopped charging my iPhone 8 plus after 70-80%

author: Edward R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2016
review_content: This is the best and last charger I'll ever have in my life. Fast charge simultaneously on both usb ports, 20k mah, lasts weeks before needing to recharge. Unlike most chargers where you have to constantlt recharge n ruin its lifespan of the charger, since u rarely have to charge, lifespan is lot longer as long as you dont keep recharging it frequently.For those who think it charges slow, consider getting better usb cords for ur micro usb or lightening cable.Best customer service ever. They stand behind their product and passionate about their quality. When I had to replace it one time bcz one of the ports was malfunctioning, no questions asked, they replaced it while covering the postage for me to ship back nalfunctioning piece. Anker is my go-to for any electronic accessories whether its chargers, cords, erc. Their micro-usb cords that they sell separately is lot sturdier than most cheap micro-usb cords. I recommend buying this charger with their cords. Ive made several friends buy this charger and all of them r in love with it. My friend who travels more than i do n pretty much benchmarks this product to its full usage has made this product a necessity. We dont use walls unless we have to charge this charger.
title: Best and last charger you'll ever buy in your life.

author: Kate O.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2017
review_content: Absolutely wonderful idea and product...this was a lifesaver on a recent trip where the voltages were so different than USA standards, and so it eliminated entirely trying to search and find electrical converters and plug adapters...it came 3/4 charged, and with the included USB-specific Anker cord, it recharges quickly, and can fully recharge the battery on a Samsung Galaxy Notebook about 3-4 times from depletion, and an I-Phone battery reportedly up to six times. Well worth the price for such convenience and peace of mind. It came with a soft mesh carrying case (more like a protector), but a hard case made specifically for storing and transporting this power bank is sold separately for about $12.99.
title: 'Banked-Power' On-Demand courtesy of Anker..."Are You Happy?"--Definitely...what's not to like?

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2016
review_content: Always heard good things about Anker portable battery packs from reputable sources online but never knew any friends or family who owned a product from them, it was always Belkin, Energizer, or other familiar brands. The only problem with that is not one of the other brand's portable battery packs would charge my phone faster then I could drain it with heavy to moderate use. Playing mobile games or multitasking was just out of the question if I wanted my phone to, at the very least, not continue depleting the battery from use. That is until I bought myself this Anker 20000mAh!! Powercore. This thing is just great, even heavy use of my phone didn't stop the charging power of this device, not only that I plugged in my dead bluetooth speaker and had it at full blast as well. If that doesn't paint a picture maybe this will. Samsung Galexy S4 with all connections open (Bluetooth, wifi, location services, 4g data and cell connection) full brightness, running music from the sd card, Pokemon Go (currently I think the most battery draining app I have), and various apps updating. My phone was outputting so much heat I had to hold it in front of my air conditioner with the back cover off. Also plugged into the powercore as stated before was a dead speaker that I was streaming the music from my phone to, AND IT WAS STILL CHARGING BOTH DEVICES as in battery percentages were climbing! Just awesome in my book, great job Anker for the capability, compactness, and overall design quality of this product for the price.
title: Probably the best portable battery pack for the price.

author: Jeff in Texas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2017
review_content: I travel a lot and I only fly international.  My trips are either 36 hours (door to door) to Asia or 25 hours to Eastern Europe.  I spend a lot of time using my Bluetooth headphones, cell phone and tablet.  Whether it is watching movies, playing games or listening to music & books I go through a lot of juice.This battery provides tons of reliable power.  I can recharge my phone, headphone & tablet multiple times and not make much of a dent in my reserve.  I even let friends recharge without any concerns about running out.Excellent & highly recommended - great size for what you get in return.
title: Hours of power!

author: Melina
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2018
review_content: Great product WHEN it works. ☹️ Super disappointed. Heard great things about Anchor portable chargers for travel but I have now purchased TWO and both have stoped working in LESS than a year. I plug them in the wall with appropriate cord and wall plug & let them fully charge (all 4 blue lights). BUT when I try to use with my actual phone (when I am out) it’ll turn on as soon as I insert the usb and stop working 2 min later with no luck of turning back on. Super annoyed and upset $100+ later and 2 non working portable chargers
title: Great WHEN it decides to work

author: shannon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2018
review_content: This is really awesome. It’s small & compact and works perfectly. Charges your phone faster than anything else. I took it on vacation with me to Europe and while you run out of battery power so fast (because of all the pics and videos being taken) this device charges the phone while you’re having lunch and you are at full power once again to hit up the sights without missing a single beat. It was a saving grace. I would definitely recommend this product and I would buy again. And you can charge two phones at once. Super fast!
title: It’s AWESOME! Never Vacation without it!

author: GVKW
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2017
review_content: Love love love these! I own a travel agency that specializes in trips to Cuba, and these are great for recharging devices while we're on the go (not all outlets there are 110v/American style). I have five of these 20k MaH juice boxes (as we call them), and they are dearly loved lifesavers. Super fast charging, and doesn't make my phone feel super hot. Love, too, that the cord that comes with it can recharge from a USB port to the micro input, or flip around and charge from the unit to my devices. I got a mutipack of lightning cables for the Apple-using folks, and everything fits in the included pouch. Excellent product. I highly recommend it.
title: Best portable charger I've ever had, so I bought spares!

author: Micki
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2018
review_content: I used this powerbank when I traveled to Japan and when I visited Bryce Canyon in Utah.  This charger carries enough power to charge my phone fully at least 3 times (from about 10% to 100%).  On one given day, we used this to charge two smartphones, a portable wifi, and a GoPro camera, and there was still enough juice left in it where we could use it the next day to fully charge one of our smartphones.  I highly recommend taking this with you anywhere where you are not guaranteed an outlet.  Only downside is that it does feel a bit heavy, so carrying it in your purse will hurt your shoulder over time.  It is best to put it in a backpack, or in any bag that won't rest on just one side of your body.
title: I highly recommend taking this with you anywhere where you are not ...

author: Natalia Eddy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2017
review_content: It definitely holds a lot of charge, but the battery that i received barely charges my phone! Worked really well for the first few months i had it, but now it charges so slow there's no point in using it all of my other anker products work exquisitely besides this one, very unfortunate.
title: Slow charge after a couple months

author: Mark Davis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2020
review_content: I first determined the need for a long-life charger a few years ago for a trip to Central America. The Anker was enormously beneficial then, and I've used it constantly since my return. My son made off with mine, so I purchased another one some time back. Clearly this is a wonderful product which can be of help anytime you are away from an electrical outlet and a charging block. When my most recent purchase failed to charge devices, I thought, oh well, I'll just need to purchase another one. But I emailed customer service, and they informed me that the warranty was in fact 18 months. My purchase? 17 months ago. So that begin an email back-and-forth with the wonderful Shelly, where she guided me through the return of my faulty Anker and the prompt shipping of a replacement. A good product is always a valuable find, but a company that stands behind its product and service the customer? That's solid gold.
title: Love the product, love the company

author: Wolffie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2019
review_content: So I scrolled back on my amazon orders to see when I bought this....late May 2019.  It’s now August 22, 2019, so it’s only lasted 3 months.  To start with, it was much heavier than I expected or wanted.  But being close to $50, I thought it would have super awesome charging capabilities. It was weird that I would have to switch ports upon plugging in my cell phone to get it to charge.  And it really didn’t do any better job than my $18 charger I had that lasted for over 2 years.  I could plug it in intermittently (between ports each time, mine you) for about two days before I would have to recharge it.  That is, until it died.  I tried using different outlets at my house but that was not the problem, so it has to be the charger itself.  I should have listened to similar reviews and not bought it. I’m really disappointed I wasted so much money on an average charger that only lasted 3 months. I’m going to go back on my amazon orders from 2+ years ago and find the $18 one and get one similar to that one instead.
title: Lasted only 3 months

author: Cynthia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2020
review_content: I'm always skeptical about purchasing electronic devices online but after this product being recommended to me by my sister, I made the plunge and bought one! Let me tell you, it's worth every penny!!! It takes a while to fully charge the portable charger, but once it is, it'll last you for a while (a few days). This was very important for me since my family likes to travel a lot and being able to charge our phones is essential. I ended up buying two more, ow my daughter, husband, and myself each have our own!
title: Best investment ever!!!

author: Syed Haris Pirzada
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019
review_content: This is simply the best charging block on the market. I bought it when Anker had one of their sales, so I got it for about 30% off and it is worth every penny.Here are some of the tests I've run on it when its fully charged:-most iPhone full charge 3x (still has some juice left left over)-Samsung S9+, full charge 3xI rarely fully charge my phones with the block. Here are some results from normal use:-iPhone ~20% - 90%, 6-7 charges-Samsung S9+  ~20% - 90%, 5-6 charges.I take this on trips, use it around the house. I have not used it yet to charge laptops, Macbook, tablets, or iPads but when I do I will update.I definitely recommend this product. Wait for when Anker does their sales and you can purchase it for a much better deal.
title: No complaints! This is the best charging block on the market!

author: davevalentine
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2019
review_content: After reading all the good reviews of this power bank I felt confident in ordering for keeping my old Pixel charged. It didn't disappoint. My wife and I are outside, away from a charging source, for several hours out of the day. We both could keep our phones connected and fully charged with no issues.Unfortunately, just past Amazon's return window, the power bank suddenly wouldn't take a charge. I too read about Anker's manufacturers warranty and outstanding customer service. It was all true. A simple email to Anker describing the issue and I had a replacement bank in my hands 3 days later.Not only is the product everything they say, their customer service is supurb. If you're considering a purchase, buy with confidence. These guys stand by their products
title: Outstanding customer service

author: Susie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2018
review_content: I purchased this product November 2017 it’s been great up until now. I recently charged it again this past week to use for this weekend for a car show but when I needed to use it, it didn’t work anymore. At first I thought it was my phone but then I had other people try it out with their USB cable and same thing. I really love this brand and it sucks that I have to leave this review as I recently bought their wireless charger for my iPhone and that one is great! Hopefully the company can do something about this since it has a “18 month warranty” per their description.
title: Product is great BUT only for 10 months

author: MH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
review_content: I’m writing a review on this item because I’m going to make another purchase for my 3rd one of the Anker PowerCore 20100mAh. The first I bought was in late 2018 the other spring of 2019. We have used them for domestic, international travel and for power outages. I have had it at full charge and was able to useit for up to 4/5 days without recharging it without any issues. I use it to charge my items while traveling when needed and have no access to a power outlet. The items we are charging with the Anker are our cell phones and iPads. They seem to work as they did when we first purchased them. I would recommend using them fully charged then depleting the charge and recharging fully before using. We have not had a issue with them for $50 we had gotten a great amount of use from them in a year and half. No regret in the purchase.
title: Great charge for days!

author: Charles Ellsworth
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2016
review_content: I bought two of these and unfortunately neither one would charge fully. One charged to 50%, the other to 75%.  I do a lot of hiking and needed something that would store a sufficient charge to replenish my phone's battery (i have topographic maps loaded on my phone).  My hopes were high after reading the glowing reviews.  The two i received do not make the cut.UPDATE: Jan 15, 2017  Thanks to the persistent and very helpful tech support at Anker i figured out what i was doing wrong!  The PowerCore needs to be charged with at least an iPad type charger, if you attempt to charge it with anything that has less charging capacity it will never reach full strength. Thanks again to the Anker tech support: NO problems with your product, just my ignorance.
title: Excellent tech support solved my problem!!

author: Dave c.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2019
review_content: I have had my share of batteries over time, by far this one has fit the bill for almost 3 years now...sadly I have to replace it now only because it was stolen! I listen to a lot of online music service at work in the wee hours of the morning...so plugging in to additional power is a must!! (via Bluetooth earbuds) I love this capacity as I am a little forgetful and I can space charging it for several days before its a must....but overall the best battery I have ever had...
title: The best battery I've had!

author: Bear
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2019
review_content: I bought this for traveling and after reviewing many different battery packs I’m glad I paid for this one. It will last DAYS of charging my phone (sometimes 2 phones!) and its very durable. I have accidently dropped it a few times and it has no dents or scratches! It turns off after 20-30seconds of nothing charging even with the cord hooked up to it. The only down fall is it cannot charge and charge your device at the same time but this is better for the overall life of the battery! It does take about 10hrs to fully charge but its worth it when it lasts days with a charge.
title: 10/10 recommend

author: Melvin Frisbey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2017
review_content: I got this before I deployed for a six-day exercise setting up a first-aid station for the eclipse, where I knew I'd be without shore power. From the excellent reviews I read, it sounded like the perfect backup. One of the first things I tried to charge was my old flip cell phone. I charged it all night twice and the cell phone never reached full charge. However, it charged my 3rd gen Kindle in record time. I'm thinking the problem may be with the battery in my cell phone, but no way of knowing for sure. I'm giving it the benefit of the doubt with five stars. The unit itself takes a long time to charge from a wall socket, longer than I expected--hours.
title: Great Backup for Small Devices

author: Lou Edano
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2019
review_content: UNLIMITED POOOOOOOWER!!!! (commence diabolical laughing)...okay maybe not unlimited, but a lot. Really.I received my package on a Friday afternoon right as I was heading out for a weekend camping trip. Of course the thing wasn't fully charged straight out of the box, but I took it with me thinking that even just a single phone charge would be better than a dead phone for the whole weekend. I took it, let it charge a bit for an hour using my car charger, and went on my way.Weekend camping trip charge tally?With only two of the four indicator lights on the PowerCore charger it managed:-3 charges from less than 20% to full on an iPhone 6S-2 charges from from less than 20% to full on an iPhone 7 Plus-1 partial charge from less than 20% to ~50% on an iPhone 8 Plus-1 charge of a Bose SoundLink MiniUnderstandably the numbers might seem inflated since the iPhone 6s has small battery capacity - but the fact is it managed to keep my phone and multiple others from dying on a weekend trip, especially cool considering the PowerCore was probably only about 50% charged! I do really like this product and feel like out of the other no-name portable power banks I've used before, Anker's product seems to be the real deal. I have no questions of whether the 20k mAh rating is legit. I have no qualms about the speed of the charging (it is definitely very speedy indeed). Anker backs their brand with the quality they put out and I am happy to be able to rely on their stuff.Cheers to Anker - now make some sort of mosquito-repelling device and I'm sure my next camping trip will be sponsored by your stuff!
title: Charges everything under the sun, doesn't catch fish for you...

author: Tracey V.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2018
review_content: I purchased this battery for our recent 9 day tour of France. We left our various hotels between 5:30 & 8:30 AM everyday and settled into our room around 9:30 PM (give or take an hour) each night.My daughter and I used our phones consistently for listening to music, watched movies, and played games on the bus rides; took a lot of pictures/video throughout the day; to help us with translation, and calls/text messages to family in the States (average 30 minutes in length).The battery did a great job recharging our phones even when two phones were plugged in at once. Because we were using our phones so much, It was common to recharge it 4-5x’s a day each. Out of 4 blue lights that indicate the charge level only once did it get to level 1 (hotel lost power & I couldn’t recharge it once); the rest of the time it stayed at a 3 or 4. It took two nights to get it fully charged again but even on level one it got us from 2:30 PM until I plugged it in at 9 PM.The battery is a little heavy and too big to carry in your pants pocket comfortably. However, it’s not so heavy that it could not be comfortably carried in a backpack or purse. I just stuck it in a hidden pocket in my backpack and when I needed to charge, I just pulled my lightening cord through a small opening.This battery was so much better than smaller batteries I used on a trip to NY, NY last year. My smaller batteries usually didn’t last the day and I had to limit my phone use. I would highly recommend this battery. I will never travel without it again. If wouldn’t hesitate to purchase it again.
title: Highly Recommed It.

author: Brittany Roper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
review_content: I bought this since I use my phone a lot for maps and GPS while I’m out hiking and backpacking. It has been a great battery and so far very dependable. I’ve used it on a few different big hikes/mountaineering trips and it has been so helpful for keeping my phone charged while I’m using the navigation. The battery was a bit bigger than I expected and it barely fits into the front of my pack’s pocket but it works and the charge lasts! I have used this charger for days on end without even having to charge it so that’s a big plus. A definite recommended purchase!
title: A good buy!

author: Mel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2020
review_content: I bought this because my luddite husband's vintage cellphone battery is a power sieve.  When he goes to deer camp where they have no electricity in the cabin, I worry about him and feel much better if he has the ability to phone home.  I purchased this as a way to settle my nerves whenever he is in the woods with no access to an outlet.  He plugs in the phone, wanders around until he can pick up a cell signal, then sends home a text to let me know he's okay.
title: Gift for Wilderness Hubby

author: Jennifer C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2019
review_content: ***UPDATE***So Anker reaches out to me and sent me a new power bank. Wonderful customer service. I will see if this one last longer. I’m wary due to the other reviews that say it only works for a few months. So far though, they’ve remedied the problem and I’ve upgraded from 1 star to 4. Will edit the review if the same thing happens again.I got about 8 months of use out of it before it stopped working. Won’t hold a charge anymore. I plug it in for days and only 2 of the lights light up. Worthless brick now.
title: Edited review after Anker Support

author: Jesse
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2016
review_content: Like many others buying power banks, I ordered this item to play with pokemon go.  The first thing you'll notice is it is very heavy! but at 20000 mAh that is not suprising at all.  It does come with a padded case which actually helps quite a bit if you keep it in your pocket.  It projects from rubbing against your leg and causing discomfort.  The supplied microUSB cable is very small so expect to use your own.  I charged it overnight with my fiance's moto-x pure fast charger and it was full by morning.  A second time i charged it using a cheap 3rd party cable overnight and it did not finish so be aware of the quality of cables when charging!  I am using this to charge my oneplus 3 and while playing pokemon this will actually increase my battery percentage.  Anker has yet to let me down with any of their products!  I highly suggest this for a high capacity power bank!
title: Keeps me catching pokemon all day!

author: Terence Anderson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2019
review_content: I like the product for someone who’s aways on there phone I don’t aways wanna plug it into a wall and wait hours I just wish I could charge two things at once and the little book says to charge it full like every 4 months but I fell that’s a little impossible I fell I have to charge it every other day or so just cause I like it being at 100% just a bar down stresses me out 🙄 but I love the product I use it daily plan on ordering more
title: Awesome product

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2017
review_content: I bought this powerful battery backup item for my hiking time on the trail.  There are some places where a cell phone or other electronic device works or doesn't, but you never want to be discharged with no batteries or backup.  An older one I carried was around 650mAh which is small by comparison, and maybe would charge an older flip phone once.I have been testing this and so far so good.  the capacity is over 2Ah, which is plenty for even the most power-hungry laptop or ipad.  For what I need, I'm looking for something that would recharge a phone (I have a Samsung S7 edge).  My starting conditions were a fully charged Anker Power Core 20100, and my cell phone.  I don't plan on having my cellphone on the entire trip, but under circumstances of having the phone on all day discharged the phone to around 60 to 70 percent (data services off).  I then recharge the hone at the end of the day -- the Anker takes about an hour or two to fully recharge the phone.  So far it will recharge my cell phone 7 or 8 times before the Anker itself needs recharging.I've noticed for more power hungry items like GPS handlhelds, ipads, etc., the Anker will recharge your device maybe once or twice.  But for the convenience of keeping a cell phone in good charge for over a week, I'd say it performs up to expectations.  For longer term recharging, I would recommend the Anker solar recharger (to recharge the Anker PowerCore) but that will be the subject of another review.
title: Performs up to expectations.

author: Warden64
