date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2016
review_content: I own the smaller 15000 mAH model, and I absolutely love it. I bought the 20000 for my mother as a gift, and she has been using it almost daily. Initially I always thought these were an absolute waste of money. Then when we lost our power for multiple days in a row, I realized this sort of portable battery can be a lifesaver. Now I even use it so I don't need an extension cord around the house! You can even charge them at work so you don't use your own power. ;) Sorry, I know it sounds cheesy. But really, some of the most useful instances I have had for my Anker battery are for camping trips, power outages, day trips, vacations, etc. I used mine when I was walking around New York City, where I could just have the battery in my back pocket and my phone in my normal pocket. It's so convenient, I really can't say enough good things about it.
title: Highly recommended for anyone on the go

author: S. Spencer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2017
review_content: I am very, very pleased at the performance of my  Anker PowerCore 20100. I have two kids who play club sports, and their tournaments calls for us to be gone all day.  The first time I used it, I was able to charge an iPhone 5s, 6 plus, 7 plus, and an iPad mini on one single charge without depleting all of the battery charger.  I am totally liberated and free from having to carry around cables and adapters and hoping I can find an available wall outlet. My husband car battery died, and my son reminded him to use the Anker to charge his dying phone while waiting for AAA.  This Anker is worth its weight in gold!  And the cost savings compared to the Morphie, you can't beat it!  I researched both devices.before purchasing the Anker.
title: very pleased at the performance of my Anker PowerCore 20100

author: king of anything
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2017
review_content: I wasn't expecting much from it but it turned out to be very powerful. It takes a long time for it to charge itself but it charges my devices lightning fast. I use this to charge my samsung s6 edge plus, iphone 6 plus, nikon b700, pivothead, go pro hero5, bose soundlink color. i love it just love it!UPDATE:(DEC 21, 2017) This thing is a BEAST! Not only can it charge our samsung note 8 and iphone x twice over it charges pretty quick! I ACCIDENTALLY DROPPED IT FROM THE LANDING OF OUR 2ND FLOOR APARTMENT IT's STILL VERY INTACT!
title: Very Powerful

author: Seung Gin Lee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2018
review_content: The Anker PowerCore 20100mAh Portable Charger has been awesome!  I use the charger at work, at home, and especially when I travel (I travel frequently).  I've been using this PowerCore for about 11months and about 2 months ago the LED lights that indicate how much charge it has left started to act funny.  When the powerCore is fully charged all LED's would light up but once I use it to charge my phone a couple times the outer LED lights go out and the middle two stay on.  With the two middle LED's on the powerCore worked fine but after another couple charges the lights would go out but still charge my phone.  Since I use it on a regular basis I called Ankers service department trying to figure out if this was a normal occurrence.Before I go on I would like to point out I bought this product because of all the positive reviews and also because most of the reviews raved on how great the customer support/ service department was.  Now to continue, On Ankers Website it was easy to find the Customer Support Phone number and once I called, it was easy to navigate which department I wanted to talk to.  I talked to Adam at Anker's customer support department, he was courteous and professional and was eager to help resolve my issue with the powerCore. (It is very hard to find good customer support these days)  After I explained to Adam about my issue with the product he found out that the batch of powerCore charger that I had purchased on amazon 11 months ago had a defects in them and was taken off amazon's shelf.  He told me due to my powerCore being part of that defective batch Anker would be sending me a brand new powerCore minus the defect and I was able to keep the current Charger.  I have to say that I am very impressed with Anker and their customer service.  I believe that Anker stands by their product and if any issues arise that is not fault of the purchaser they make it right.  They have me as a customer for life and I will also be telling all my friends about their product and their commitment to them.
title: The Anker PowerCore 20100mAh Portable Charger has been awesome! I use the charger at work

author: Merissa P
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2019
review_content: This device is excellent for recharging my dead or almost dead IPhone battery multiple times without becoming dead itself. Very useful for traveling and every day use, I also keep this in my purse just in case. I also bought a case for it to keep this and the charging cable in to help keep everything together. I loved this so much I bought one for my dad for Father’s Day as he travels on a regular basis and was having issues keeping his cell phone charged, he really enjoys it and uses it often.
title: Recharged dead phones multiple times, so handy!

author: QS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2019
review_content: Don't waste your money. I bought this charger for a family trip and I was going back and forth because of the price. I read the reviews but hoped I didn't end up with a defective one. I love the charging power, the 2 USB ports was useless as it only charged one thing at a time and stopped charged itself after 5 months. I have tried every charger in out house that fits and it will no longer charge. I'm even more disappointed than if it didn't work at all as it worked so well and fast then completely died out. I looked it up again to see if it was worth buying another I say no, $50 isn't worth it, save your money. I have a cheaper one doesn't charge fast but has lasted me at least 5 years.
title: Dies after several months

author: K JOHNSON
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020
review_content: This holds a charge for an exceptional amount of time! I keep it in my purse at all times cause I just never know when I'll need it. It came with a mesh storage pouch which is perfect for also keeping an extra charging cord neat and handy at all times. I have used it for both my Samsung Note and my Samsung Tablet and it could charge them both fully without barely putting a dent in the available stored charge. I can't imagine traveling without it. Useful for camping, boating, road trips, hiking, or anywhere and anytime your devices might be useful but a electric outlet is inaccessible or unavailable.
title: Great USB back up battery pack for electronic devices!

author: Keenan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
review_content: I love the performance of the product and everything about it, my only grievance is that it arrived damaged in the box with no packaging damage visible.  The outer plastic shell is cracked near the power button and the charge level indicator lights do not work.  It appears it was dropped prior to being shipped.  I leave it on the charger for a few days to make sure it is full then it will charge my Iphone roughly 4 1/2 times
title: lasts a long time when fully charged, but it came damaged

author: Shadpari
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020
review_content: ANKER is my new love for the last 4 years now  after Mophie was just horrible after less than a year of owning it. I now own multiple Ankers over the years because I use Small & Big ones for traveling & daily uses. And they make GREAT gifts for anyone! They work well for both Apple & Andriod, & they can do 3-4 full charges EACH PHONE! No kidding!!!! I highly recommend any Anker products & the higher the MAH, the more money you wanna invest so you can have more charges saved for life.
title: ANKER IS THE BEST POWERBANK BRAND, PERIOD!!!!

author: nathan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2018
review_content: Okay, I am glad I find this product because it is a greatest product I've really owned. So do the people who have taken the ones I've ordered one originally. It holds a powerful charge that you can use to charge your phone, tablet or ant other device several times over. I have a Samsung J7 and I can charge my phone up to 5 times before I have to recharge the powerbank. It's sturdy and very durable, I've dropped mine a few times and it still worked afterwards. It's not that heavy so you can put it in your pocket and forget it's there and you can charge two devices at once. If you but any charging device this one should be the one, otherwise your wasting your money.
title: Buy this first!!!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2018
review_content: Love this product.  If I could give it more than 5 stars I would have.  It takes a few hours to fully load/charge from empty, but once loaded it lasts and can recharge multiple devices for several times.  I have taken this on road trips and have charged iphones, ipads, apple watch, etc from it.  It has four blue lights to let you know how full it is.  Each light indicates a quarter. It charges your devices at a rapid speed so it is very powerful.  After several charges of iphone and ipad, mine was only down to half capacity.  When Hurricane Florence barreled through our area recently and caused power outages, we were able to charge our iPhones and iPads and could stay in contact with family and friends and the internet for weather updates.  It gave us great peace of mind to know that we had enough charging power for several days with this device.
title: A must have!

author: Steven R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020
review_content: Let me tell you guys something, this battery is amazing!This is actually my second one, cause I lost the first one.I would take this battery everywhere with me. It would last all day at the very least. The battery comes with a sleeve to put it in so you don’t have to worry too much about it getting banged around, it’s also built very well so not like you have to worry.When you get your hands on this battery it feels like a good quality product, the size is good, the material feels durable, it’s solid.You can not go wrong with this battery or even any of the baker products. They are the best!!!!
title: The only battery you’ll ever need

author: Tenebrous
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2016
review_content: This is a quality charger and it's fast - measurably faster than charging via a USB hub from my iMac (which is my main way of charging). You can recharge it quickly enough, so no problems there. It's drop-dead simple to use and it comes with a cool grippy pouch with a drawstring. It also seems to go forever, so I don't need to recharge it often. It even looks cool, in a flat black beveled shape. Minuses - it is relatively heavy and a little cumbersome. It fits your hand like an oversized candy bar, and you can feel the extra weight in your backpack. Now these are minor nits and I know that we've come a long way (baby) in terms of battery cell technology. Temperature doesn't faze it, and I appreciate the button on the side that triggers the display lights to show you how much juice is left. I also like that the display lights aren't always on, as that would drain the battery unnecessarily and emit light for no purpose. This is a powerful, well-designed, fast charger. All hail Anker.
title: Beast Charger

author: Tracy Tsai
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
review_content: I really like this portable charger! It's powerful, battery lasts a long time and size is perfect for my bag.It did stop functioning properly after a few months of usage (within warranty), so my husband suggested that I reach out to Anker's customer service about this. Initially, I was worried that it would be a long process but my husband told me Anker always has excellent product and customer service...so I tried! And Shelly, my support representative, was very responsive and helpful! She helped me troubleshoot and then it was concluded that the company will send me a new charger instead. It only took a few days for the charger to arrive (and I could track the package once it was shipped). I'm so impressed and happy about their service, I still bought another one of these after receiving the free replacement!
title: Awesome portable charger and superb customer service!!

author: Corey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2019
review_content: I have had this charger for a couple of years now and it is still going strong. Reading reviews I dont understand how people have had bad experiences with this charger. We have had 2 of them(husband lost his somewhere) It holds the charge even after you leave it sit for months not being used. No complaints here. Love this charger!I would recommend Anker chargers to anyone who asks me about portable chargers. In fact I let my mom borrow it for the weekend and she wants it now. I just purchased the larger one for myself and let her keep that one.
title: Best Portable Charger

author: Joshua hamby
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2016
review_content: Can I become an Anker spokesperson? No, really. I'm serious.If you don't own something from Anker, I don't understand you. Alright, that's a little harsh, but it makes my point. This company comes out of nowhere and starts making these "cheap electronics" that turn out not to be cheap at all.In price, sure, I consider it cheap. If you don't think $40 is cheap to be able to power your phone, tablet, Macbook (yep, I said it) and even one of those weird electronic cigarette things for a full day away from the socket, then you're actually the one who is cheap. But this charger, and every other thing I own from Anker, is far from cheap.I'm not kidding. Here's how I use my PowerCore 20100, pretty much daily:I pull it off charge in the morning and throw it in my backpack. During coffee, I charge my motorized panning head for time lapse photography. Then it powers my GoPro Hero5 Session while doing said time lapse for well over an hour. By that time, my phone needs topping up. After lunch during edits, my Macbook is usually running low, so I plug it in to this thing and charge up while editing. I'll usually give my phone another boost in the evenings and typically finish with one out of four "dots" left. I also charge my GoPro once more at some point during the day.What more could you ask for in a battery pack this small? Nothing. Nothing is your answer. Buy this, it's worth it.
title: pretty much daily

author: Chris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2018
review_content: I've got 3 of these now. They take a little while to charge from 0 or 25% back to 100%, I usually plug them in overnight. But luckily they do hold their charge for quite some time. I use these to charge mine and others' phones, portable speakers, and lights. One of them is designated to camp lights that I have (luminoodle and Revel Gear). Very high quality charger, and great price point for the amount of charges you can get out of them; I don't feel the need to spend more to get a bigger/overpriced charger because I am so satisfied with this model. Keep it up Anker.
title: Worth it!

author: Brian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2018
review_content: Love this product and bought 2 more smaller ones with 3.0 quick charging. Used on my Samsung Note8 and Note4 for when working IT jobs on the go. Only thing is it takes a while to charge to full capacity so i do that over night and by the morning comes around it's fully charge. I'd recommend this to a friend but i bought something new and better. Thanks Anker but there's something better now! https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B075R945ST/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1
title: Perfect battery on the go!

author: Ozzy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2016
review_content: Update: After almost two years the charger simply won't work. It'll hold a charge but a few months ago one USB port stopped working. But the other one was fine. Now that won't work either. For 20$ a year for two years it was worth it but sucks that it just stopped working correctly. Adjusting my review.Original Review: Fantastic for trips and commuting.  I have a long commute.  So I normally get to work and have to charge my phone.  I like to keep it topped off in case I suddenly have to go without an outlet for prolonged periods of time.  This wonderful little battery ensures my iPhone/iPad stays charged. Has worked flawlessly for a year.  While it's not small enough to go in a pocket it'll do the job in a big coat or a bag.
title: 100% Pure Smartphone juice

author: Iam  Dá Pyre
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2018
review_content: Originally made this purchase and received a faulty device and was very frustrated with my purchase, especially being that Anker prices are premium. Excellent customer service helped me get a working device and I am very satisfied. I have also purchased other Anker products including other powerbanks and wall adapters, all others were received in working condition, my first purchase just happened to be an unfornate bad apple that does not represent the standards of the company. I'd like to think Julia and the rest of the Anker customer support team for helping to obtain a high performance and high quality powerbanks which I had desired.
title: Edit: Customer Service was able to deliver quality

author: Barbara Oelschlegel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2019
review_content: This came highly recommended by a friend who walked the entire Appalachian Trail with it and it never failed.I had to take off one star because alas, it doesn’t come with an adapter, just a USB port. My white square iPhone adapter did not work at all with it to charge it and I spent another $11 buying a 5V/ 2 A adapter for it.
title: Does NOT come with the plug adapter. Fyi

author: Michelle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2017
review_content: Update 05/25/2020:I just purchased another one of these because I left it on the airplane. I am a flight attendant and this has been a Godsend! The customer service is absolutely wonderful! 2 days after I purchased a replacement for my lost battery pack, it went on sale for more than $10 off. I contacted Anker directly and asked if they would honor their sale price for me because it was only 2 days prior to when I purchased it. They responded the next day and issued a refund for the price difference! That is amazing. I will definitely be a returning customer!Great external battery! It charges my iPhone extremely fast. I can charge my iPhone about 5 or 6 times before having to recharge the Anker. I travel for work and it has saved me multiple times from a dead phone with no outlet around. I did some research and compared multiple brands before deciding on this one. Definitely the best bang for your buck! I highly recommend it.
title: Charges my iphone extremely fast 5 times before having to recharge the Anker!

author: Todd R. Stevens
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2019
review_content: Terrific. Meets and surpasses all expectations. About as long as your hand. LOTS OF POWER!  I work in small clubs  for 4 hour shows and I'm not always close to an outlet. This thing ensures my laptop never runs out . A nice and powerful backup to have on hand. Takes a long time to charge up fully ( about) 12 hours) but once it's fully charged your ready to go with this thing watching your back.
title: Terrific, powerful

author: Noor-Eldeen Moubayed
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2019
review_content: I was excited to use this battery when travelling, however I immediately ran into issues that were extremely disappointing.1) The battery no longer charges properly. I've hooked it up to be charged for a whole day and was only able to get it to charge to two lights (halfway).2) The battery USB ports no longer work. I've plugged multiple OEM lightning cables from Apple to charge multiple iPhones and neither work. I thought it was maybe a faulty charging cable, but I tried multiples and it's clearly the Anker battery that's not working.Really disappointed. I spent $60 and it didn't last more than two weeks.
title: Dead After 2 Weeks.

author: Clark
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2016
review_content: I like this product because it keeps my electronics powered when I travel. My fear was running out of power for my phone & my friend's phone while traveling by air for a 4.5 hour trip. It was perfect! It met airline requirements as a carry on item. It was not a security issue & I used it on the plane easily.  Although we never needed to use both ports at the same time, none of our devices lost power on our trip. After using it for at least 7 different charging times (sometimes the device was dead & other times just down 50%) there was still plenty of juice on the charger. There are 4 blue dots indicating amount of power & after a 4 day trip, there were still 2 dots remaining. It was more convenient to use than a car charger while traveling with friends. It was nice to be able to charge our phones while at dinner--no electric outlet needed! It came with a nice, thick, meshy travel bag & cord. It will be invaluable next time my power is out at home & my phone is dying. The product was exactly what I wanted.
title: Perfect for travel

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2018
review_content: Holds a charge when not used for months, will run the iphone or my zenfone from empty to a full charge over ten times. Does charge (input) slowly! Plan on hooking it up overnight to recharge. The included carry case and cord are also quality and have kept the charger looking like new for almost two years of being carried around a construction site. Has been charged and emptied over 50 times (which takes a while with this capacity) and doesn't seem to have lost any capacity or output charge speed.
title: Best deal on quality backup charger I have found yet.

author: Brad Aniya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020
review_content: 7 day backpack with 2 recharges in between.  Pack charges other Dev well.  However, it takes a bit to recharge (physics).  We ended up draining it after 7 days.  Recharge time was only an hour on my car 12 volt each time.  Never got back to 4 dots (On 1 hour recharge. ) Loved the dual output ports.For me, I’ll probably go with two (half capacity), keep one charging, and trade on resupply every 3 days).
title: Buy two (charge 1, use other, trade in between)

author: Yomar d
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2019
review_content: I love every single thing about this portable charger. From it’s nice slim and sleek profile , the color that it comes in Is such a nice shade of black to where the ports are oriented. Can take plenty drops and remain completely in tact and minimal scratches . Love the little carry bag it brings very nice accessories and also avoids it being scratched in your book bag or pockets. I only charge this once a week and it never fails me charges my phone amazingly quick and gives it a long lasting charge. Love that I can charge two devices at once and at the same speed !! Price was very fair for the quality and resource your getting out of this . Couldn’t be any cheaper. This does its job while looking great in my opinion
title: The BEST portable power bank , hands down !!

author: evmoore
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2015
review_content: Excellent product! Chargers my Tab S 10.5 32bg tablet from 40% to full in about an hour and it charges my galaxy S5 phone in less time than that. I love this device! I've charged my galaxy S5 3-4 times in the past 2 days and the power bank still registers at about 60-70% capacity.My only con so far is the fact that this charger is huge and it weighs as much as a full soda bottle. I probably should have read the reviews and looked at the product description a bit more closely before I purchased, but it was on sale, so I jumped on it. Regardless, I'm very happy with my purchase, but I'll pick up a smaller power bank for my trips to Orlando and around town, where I need something that's more pocket size. Regarding its size - It's definitely not something you can comfortably carry around with you while you're at Universal Studios or Disney World all day (I'm from FL). It's more suitable for people who travel on airplanes, sit at airports waiting for the connecting flight, or sit at work all day with no access to an outlet.
title: Not too bad at all

author: Extra Space
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
review_content: The Anker 20100 PowerCore is the first power bank I've ever purchased and all I can say is that I have no idea why I never grabbed one earlier. It is excellent for on the go charging of various electronics and lasts for quite a while on a single charge (which takes about 6-7 hours to reach full capacity). I use it to charge my handheld game consoles as there are plenty of moments where I have no power source nearby if I'm ever in need of a recharge.The somewhat small size of the power bank is also a plus, as it can easily be slipped into your pockets or a compartment in your bag. It also comes with a mesh carrying pouch, which does a pretty good job of keeping it in good shape.Overall, it is a solid choice for those searching a small, lightweight energy source for your devices.
title: An Absolutely Essential Item for Those Looking for More Power

author: Suedsue
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2019
review_content: Terrible product- Product charged up but every time I tried to use it to charge my phone it would just randomly turn off and stop charging my phone. I thought that it was the cord but it's the same no matter what cord I use. I thought maybe it was if I moved it but again- same issue if I kept it laying on a counter plugged in. It just randomly turns off and now the last time I took it with me as a back up it wouldn't even charge my phone at all- not even for a minute. Nothing. Unreliable from day 1 and now it's a paper weight. Big waste of money.
title: Big waste of money- unreliable from day 1

author: Jessica Benavides-Soriano
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2019
review_content: What a good portable charger! I was looking for one and my Boyfriend has this exact one and has had it for almost 2 years. I bought one and yes its heavy but i Dont mind the weight. The cover that comes with the charger ripped within a month of use. Ive dropped it a couple times and it still works fine! Just small dents in the corners that you berly can tell. Will purchase more anker items in the future!
title: Great Charger!

author: Austin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2019
review_content: Perfect powerbank in every way, except for one fatal flaw:It charges my devices for mere minutes before it shuts off, and I’ll have to reconnect the charger or press the button to restart it. I have tried several different cables (including an Amazon lightning cable) and two different devices (iPhone, Senso earphones).In other words, it is impossible to charge overnight and infuriating during the day. I might as well get a hand crank electricity generator, as that would probably require less attention than the Anker Powercore.
title: Stops charging within minutes

author: Elisa R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2019
review_content: Great portable charger! It is a little bulky in size but it makes up in charge ability. Approx 8 inches by 2 inches. It is great to throw in beach bag or carry on for flying. Battery lasts long .  I haven’t charged anything other than an I phone so I can not comment on ability yo charge other electronics . I am going to order a few more for Xmas gifts!
title: Better than others!

author: Linda W
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2019
review_content: I haven't had a chance to use this yet, so I can't really rate it yet. When I do, I'll come back and edit this review. It did get here late, which is probably due to UPS and not Anker. I will be using this later this week as we are going on a trip on a bus, so figure I will probably use it then. Two things I didn't like, was the lack of instructions, and the weight of the item. It's pretty heavy, but that is probably unavoidable too.
title: Late arrival

author: Online_Shopper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2018
review_content: I love this thing. I have had other chargers but none worked as well as this one. I just took it to Europe, kept it in my purse all the time, and used it to re-charge my Android phone almost every day. Since I have no sense of direction I rely on Google Maps to display walking routes and tell me which stop to get off the bus. I found I could discretely and easily hitch this charger to my phone without having to take the charger or the phone out of my purse. What amazed me was how it quickly it would re-charge my nearly-dead phone. It re-charged much faster than plugging the phone into an outlet. And the charger itself never needed re-charging during the two weeks I was traveling.One downside:  it is heavy (over 1 lb) to carry around in a purse, but the aggravation of the extra weight was less bothersome to me than being lost with no phone connection.
title: Reliable, quick charger

author: Aaron A
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2019
review_content: When I first got this power bank I LOVED it so much the first couple months. I’ve had it for a year and it stopped holding its charge. I’ll charge it and take it with me somewhere and it’ll die halfway through charging my phone. I was really disappointed. I thought I finally found a power bank worth the money but sadly I was wrong.Update:Anker has amazing customer service. I reached out to them about my issue and then sent me a new portable charger in less than a week. They were helpful and friendly. I really appreciated how fast they handled the problem.
title: Amazing  Customer Service

author: RDW
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
review_content: I use this all the time to charge my IPad and phone, often at the same time.  It does a great job, and I love it!  I always keep it charged in case of power outages and it holds a charge very long.  Highly recommend!  You will need a separate charging cable for the newer iPads as this doesn’t have the connection for the newer models.  Very pleased with this product, and purchased a second one for my husband.
title: Great charger

author: cary w.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2019
review_content: Love this.  I can recharge my phone over and over.  I especially like that it automatically turns off when done charging so I don't over charge the battery in my phone. Likewise, the recharger itself turns off when it's charged which is good since I usually plug it in and leave it to recharge over night. (It takes awhile to go from dead to fully charged)  I like the little bag it comes in.  My only complaint is that slide clamp on the bag that tightens the draw string broke after only a couple uses so now it doesn't stay in the little bag when I drop it in my back pack.  Otherwise,  great product
title: Great recharger

author: Caleb
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2018
review_content: July 31:This things battery life is insane, I’ve charged mine and several co workers phones from half way or less to full multiple times and this things still full. Design seems sturdy and durable, doesn’t heat up noticeably, USB ports arnt loose or anything.August 17 Update: Battery lasted 17 days with consistent use during my travels. Still love this thing! A little upset after ordering my second one from this seller for my girlfriend seeing that one came with a carrying bag and mine did not, not sure if it was just never put In my box or what. Still worth 5 stars to me
title: Awesome product - insane battery life

author: Jon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2020
review_content: This portable battery charger is great if you are a traveler. This battery is very sleek and can easy fit in your pocket. I do a lot of traveling and can charge my phone for days on a single charge. I have had this charger for nearly a year and it still holds a charge like it did on day one. The charger comes with a mesh like bag that is great for not only keeping the charger protected but can hold charging cables.
title: Small design with a lot of charging power.

author: J. Chin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020
review_content: Addendum to original post; Anker immediately responded to my review, got relevant info about the unit that had stopped functioning correctly, and sent out an updated replacement for free. I would absolutely recommend buying from this company again despite the hiccup with the original unit...... Old review:Initially after my Oct 2019 purchase, it worked extremely well to recharge my iPhone several times before needing it’s own recharging. Took the battery on a few trips, no issues. However With no gradual decline at all, as of January 2020 the battery won’t charge my phone fully even once before needing a recharge. Surely this is meant to last longer than less than three months?
title: Faulty unit replaced immediately by Anker

author: meathead1986
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2016
review_content: This little thing (although not that small) is wonderful.Purchased to replace an older battery pack that would no longer charge and had a great life.Product came very well packaged as most do through amazon and 3/4 charged already. The led indicator on this is pretty acurate as far as i can tell and this thing charges a standard phone around 4 times before the meter even begins to drop and even does it remarkably faster than my previous one.If durability is ur thing this is pretty stout goven what it is and its monsteous size for most. Being in the military everything i use in my work environment tends to get pretty abused and this is really no exception.I would definetly reccomebd this thing for anyone that isnt around a charger for a couple days and is quite the power hog .
title: Great pack and bang for the buck!!!

author: Lesley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2019
review_content: Bought this specifically to use on a family vacation to Disney World. My phone drains quick when I take a lot of pictures/videos that backup to the cloud and this saved us.  Love that you can charge 2 phones at once.  We consistently get about 5 charges out of it. This one is a bit heavy and not pocket size but it fits in my purse or backpack. I also need to plan ahead to charge it up overnight as it is not quick to charge but it is worth it to me to have the peace of mind of having power for my phone when I need it.
title: Great backup power

author: Lacy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2020
review_content: This is a great portable charger. It is longer than a dollar bill but slimmer than one. It takes a few hours to charge but can charge a phone or other electronics several times over. It is small enough to fit in a book bag or purse and not take up too much room. It's very easy to use and has 4 lights on it to let you know the battery level. I bought this to use at the beach and camping. I definitely recommend this product!
title: I think it's perfect for my needs!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019
review_content: I originally bought this product for playing Pokemon GO! back in 2016 when everyone was going crazy about the game - me included! after pretty much 3 years I have used the charger uncountable times - more than 10 trips abroad, different weather/ temperatures, has felt on the floor at least 7 times that I can remember with no protection whatsoever and this little device has more lives than a cat!! I used it again for Community Day on 07/22/19 with 2 phones connected for at least 4 hours during the heat wave we are going through in NYC and it gave me 2 full charges and only went down to 50% - I know is not the same experience for everybody and products sometimes can fail, but for me this device deserves the glory - I bought around 2 years ago a second one as a birthday gift for a married couple of friends of mine and they also use it on a daily basis with no issues, they loved it so much that asked me to buy a smaller version for their son - which I did!
title: Product worth writing a review for!

author: Kathleen M. De Cruz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2019
review_content: I bought this charger in Feb 2019, after doing my homework, and was initially very pleased. I loved how fast it charged all of my devices,  and I was telling all my friends about it. But in July 2019, 5 months later, it won't charge pass two green lights, and I am having difficulty with the charging cord when I try to put it in tp the charger port.
title: Initially a great charger

author: Andrew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2016
review_content: Opened product up, one thing I notice right off bat, was weight of charger.. i was like damn this is a solid product.. solidly built.. good materiel, didnt feel cheap.  Density of battery cells must be good! Cause u all know when u get those cheap batteries from knockoffs.. they are light /feather weight u can say.I charged battery up, and have yet to use it.. but I already know i'm going to get good results. I Bought this cause my buddy has lower model version 16600 Anker.. he was charging his IPAD and Phone at same time.. and I was amazed how fast and results where when we were in VEGAS, never used Wall charger or plugged Anker Charger into wall.  I was impressed!Follow up 02-19-16: My phone was completely dead, charged it on Anker, and took about hour  to fully charge my battery
title: Very impressive battery!

author: SHARKY
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2016
review_content: I don't know what all the positive reviews are for, mine doesn't charge ,it's been charging for 10,12 hrs. and then only one light blinks, also I'm past the 30 days by 2 days,  I will call anker and see what  customer service is like ,  I will update later . I have also noticed a lot of people are having this problem ,and they bought it this year ! UPDATE; Anker  responded right away, very good customer service,  I was using an extension cord that was not proper to use with this device charging this device , my bad,  now it is charging just fine ,  I have also tested it by charging my iPad, iPhone ,iPod and still all lights are lit , and all  Devices  Are fully charged:) sorry for the one star,updated to 5 stars.
title: STOPPED CHARGING!!! UPDATED : (my falt)

author: Saundra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020
review_content: I purchased this charger for my 10 year old granddaughter. It would not charge when we received it. I already owned two of these so I knew there was a problem. I contacted Anker, and I spoke with Malcolm. He was so nice and understanding. He reassured me that a replacement would be sent out. Well, the replacement came, and my granddaughter is so happy. She gets to charge both her phone and iPad at the same time. I’m happy because she can stop borrowing mine. Thank you sooo much Malcolm and Anker!!!!!!!
title: Thank you Malcolm and Anker!!!!!

author: Alex D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2019
review_content: This is a good battery pack. It holds a charge and can charge multiple devices. Only down side is one of the ports ending up getting pushed into the body and doesn’t work any more. Honestly can’t figure out how it happened, but I have kids, so one of them most likely did it and is a dirty lier about it. Anyway I purchased same brand as a replacement so I can’t be that upset about it.
title: I don’t know, but...

author: wjw
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2019
review_content: First I would like to say I have been a long time user of Anker products.I have always loved their chargers and power cords. I never have had any issues with their products until now.This charging block stopped taking a charge recently after purchasing it in May.It seems to have a bad connection to where the USB micro-b port is located.Up until now I loved this product.It worked flawlessly and charged very fast even with two devices. It's built very solid and has the capacity to charge many times.I am disappointed it stopped working so soon.I will reach out to Anker and hope they can resolve this issue.
title: Loved this charger until it died.

author: R. A. Geiger
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2017
review_content: I bought two of these as my Samsung Note 5 was losing charge immediately. This is a high quality device and I believe would be very functional at recharging your device but is very heavy and kind of large to just carry around with you. I will probably gift these to friends/family because I don't see carrying them around with me but I do think they are a good idea and AT&T store indicated that they are a good option.Update - 1/23/17 - I was contacted directly from the Seller wanting to make my experience better. I am very impressed with them and their concern to satisfy their customers.  I highly recommend buying from them and will look at other items they have that I may want or "need" - ok I don't need anything. But I love all things tech so will keep my eye out on their other products.
title: Great Customer service!

author: 100grit
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2016
review_content: I have a large power hungry 12.2 inch tablet, and I was excited for the substantial battery capacity...other sizes don't cut it with this tablet. My routine it relaxing at a coffee shop with the battery juicing my tablet keeping the battery in my pocket. After the 3rd use it, whilst in my pocket it heated up so quickly and so hot that I tore it out like a hot potato, placed it on the table, and stared at it angrily over the investment that just went bad. It just stared back like an apathetic Note 7. At least it didn't explode; for this I count my lucky stars....speaking of stars Anker earns 1 as it did work a whole 3 times. Now what do I do, can't even throw it away...maybe I'll hunt for a lithium battery recycling facility and waste more of my time. So sad, I used to like Anker...but all their USB cables would get loose to quickly, their Premium Bluetooth Speaker died after 6 months, and this is the second battery to fail. I guess I just wanted to like them.
title: Battery gets HOT: too good to be true.

author: DAAT ONE GUY
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2017
review_content: This is honestly a great battery. The bets i have ever owned. BUt I bet you already can figure how great it is because of how well it's reviewed. They are all right. Great build. Massive charge capacity. Speedy Charging. It excels at what it's supposed to do.But...I think my LED indicators are malfunctioning. The second from the left LED burned out, and I can't tell if It no longer accurately indicates the charge correctly, or if it really is still at 75%+ charge despite using it relatively often. Regardless, that doesn't bring it down much, just something to take into mind if you want it to be "perfect". This little malfunction doesn't matter all that much to me.
title: Nearly Perfect.

author: mikhail
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2017
review_content: I orsdered the portable charger.. and now after 1month use the charger will not fully charge .
title: Bad

author: Charlie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2017
review_content: I bought this for a trip to Europe and it worked great!. I originally purchased it because I wanted to be able to charge my iPad on the long flight but we ended up using it for all our charging needs, namely our two iPhones. We planned to buy an outlet adapter and use the Apple iPhone chargers to charge the phones but since all the TV's had USB plugs we were able to just charge the PowerCore overnight plugged into the TV and then just top off the phones as needed during the day. One caveat is that we needed to leave the TV turned on in order to keep the USB powered but we just turned the volume down and draped my jacket over the TV to block any light. For just the iPhones it's overkill (the larger size) since charging the two iPhones barely put a dent in the charge. If you needed to go a couple of days between charging the PowerCore i.e. camping etc, then the larger size might still be nice too have.
title: ... this for a trip to Europe and it worked great!. I originally purchased it because I wanted ...

author: Avidreader
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2018
review_content: I have been using this Power Bank since March and have noticed that it won't recharge as fast as it used to. I had it plugged on overnight, last night and it's only blinking one light this morning. Not sure what happened but since Anker seems to be the leader in the product line, perhaps they can explain and fix these issues.UPDATE: Anker has sent me a replacement Power Bank and I will try it for a few months to make sure it is still working. Have to commend their efforts at rectifying the situation and ensuring that I had the best experience :)Increasing stars for Customer Service
title: I have been using this Power Bank since March and ...

author: Brian King
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019
review_content: The battery was working well until one day recently when I plugged it in to charge it, and instead of charging the battery, it was completely drained. I have not been able to charge it since. I had probably used it to top off my iPhone about three times.[Update 11/11/2019] I reached out to Anker via email and someone responded to me within 24 hours. They provided a couple of diagnostic suggestions and after no luck immediately agreed to replace the battery. That is on the way. I found Anker support very responsive and prompt throughout our exchange, which I very much appreciated. Bumping my rating and I will review again after I receive the replacement battery and will adjust my rating again at that time.  5 for support though.[Update 12/13/2019] I quickly received the replacement battery (a while ago). Have not had much need to use it lately, but no problems so far, and again, customer support was very helpful.
title: Stopped working after barely one month of very light usage

author: Zachariah J.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2018
review_content: Anker 20100mAh Portable Charger PowerCore 20100 - Ultra High CapacityI bought this item in Dec 2017. Product was working very well till beginning of Oct 2018 and then i noticed that the charger was not charging to full capacity.Since this item has 18 month warranty, i reached out to Anker support team and they rushed me a replacement charger and charging cable.Before discarding the supposedly defective battery, i charged it again with the cable that got shipped with the replacement.  To my surprise, the old battery got charged to the full capacity.So, it turns out that the charging cable is the culprit and not the charger.  I got in touch with the Anker support team and updated them about the findings.  They let me keep both the old and the replacement chargers.I am very satisfied with the Anker customer service, and truly appreciate their commitment in standing behind their product!I gladly recommend this Anker portable charger to any one having a need for one.
title: Great Product, Great Customer service- recommend to any one!

author: Ari Miller
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2016
review_content: I bought this when it went on sale around the time Pokemon Go was released. After getting a few extra cables, I was able to keep two phones fully charged while we hunted Pokemon. It works best when your battery is fully charged, in order to keep it from going down, instead of necessarily charging up a dead phone. It will still charge your dead phone, just not very fast.Comes with a nice drawstring bag for storage The four lights keep track of the battery charge and are easy to see. There is a button on the side for turning it on and off. Now that I've gotten used to having the extended battery life, I've found it quite helpful even without running very draining apps like PoGo. I'm disabled and have started using the bus, and this provides extra security so I know I always have a method of contacting help if I need to.
title: Good for Long Bus Trips

author: Josiah X
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2018
review_content: I bought this to recharge my iPad and Moto X3 cell phone.  I don’t have experience with other chargers so I can’t make a comparison. One of the primary reasons I bought this was to charge on the go. I use public transportation and the size and weight prevents me from taking it outside.  I use it to charge when I’m using my device. I’m not unhappy with my purchase, it’s just not worth five stars imo.
title: Great for charging, not so much on the go

author: Melissa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2019
review_content: I have probably had this product for a year and a half at least.  I LOVE it.  It holds it's charge really well.  The capacity is more than I could ever need.  It will charge two devices at once.  It's well made and durable.  Works as well now as the day I received it.  I've used it on long road trips, camping/hiking trips, while out to dinner when my visiting friend lost her charger.  It comes in handy and never disappoints.  If I ever need another, I will definitely buy from Anker.  I've recommended their products to several people since this purchase, and they are all happy customers.
title: Excellent Product

author: Freddy M. Echaves
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2020
review_content: Used this on a backpacking trip to recharge my headphones and phone. Was able to charge my phone once and both of my companions phones twice. I was even able to charge my wireless ear buds and had some power left. It takes a long time to recharge but that is only a minor inconvenience.would buy another if I needed one.
title: Great charger pack with a lot of power

author: Jim Ackert
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2017
review_content: I got this battery to power my Garmin Nuvi GPS while riding a motorcycle. It worked great powering the GPS for 10 hours and still had a third of a charge left. I'd give it 5 stars except the unit will not charge using standard USB chargers. I tried the charger for my iPhone, the charger for my Nexus tablet, and several others, but, even after two days on the chargers, it wasn't charging at all. I ended up buying the Anker 2-Port 24W USB Wall Charger PowerPort 2, and then the battery charged to full in 7 hours. Kind of disappointed I had to pay $10 for a charging unit. I think Anker should supply a charger that works with the battery.
title: Would give it 5 stars except....

author: Sstag
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2020
review_content: This thing is epic.  It can charge (your battery % will go up, no joke) your Quest while you play no problem.  If your Quest and this charger are fully charged you can play all day!  But wait, there’s more!  I purchased a cell phone arm band and secured the battery pack to the back of the headset and it provided an amazing counter balance.  It’s still not perfectly comfortable but I went from 10 minute sessions to 30 minute sessions before my face got sore.  This is a must have accessory for an Oculus Quest!  Side note, I use the 3’ Anker cord, purchased separately, to connect the device to my Oculus for charging
title: Bought this for my Oculus Quest.  You should too

author: kar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2019
review_content: I LOVE this charger!!! It worked well when I was traveling and on long plane flights. Most importantly, as a resident of northern California, this charger was a necessity when the local power company shut our power off for almost a week!! Without this my phone would have become useless in less than a full day. This enabled me to remain in contact with friends, family and the power company through the entire week. (Landline telephones were disabled by the power outage as well!)
title: I LOVE this charger!

author: Tj
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2016
review_content: Can't reach an outlet? Hotel room only has one outlet clear across the room? Use this. This can charge an iPad to full from empty or a phone several times. I treat it like a mobile outlet. The only downside I found is it takes a very long time to charge back up once it is run down, so don't think you can just plug it in an hour before you leave. It took almost 10 hours the first time when it arrived completely dead. I also tried an experiment and stood it on its end and tried to charge it like that to allow more airflow, and DO NOT DO THAT. It sat like that over about 16 hours and did not charge at all. I lied it down and it was charged up in about 2 hours (it was just needing a top off before a trip). The spongy case is great and breaths well. I use it to keep short charging cables in along with the power bank.
title: A big slim power bank.

author: map112233
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2017
review_content: I'm one happy camper. I can't say enough good about this thing, and I certainly could say nothing bad so far. I use a 5-port Anker charger to charge it to full power. Takes about 7 hours it seems. Once it's full, it charges my Samsung Galaxy 5 about four times along with my Samsung Prime core phone (like a small smart phone) about 5 times total, so about 9 charges total. Then it gets down to around 25% or less full and I recharge it. I got it because I'm recently retired, and want to start doing road trips. I didn't think ahead, because I'm still going to need an AC outlet to to plug in my Anker 5 port phone charger to charge this Anker portable charger. I was kind of hoping to camp---no motels--and that means buying an AC inverter for my vehicle. I'm not even prepared to go that route. I'm mechanically inept and electronically less.  :-)
title: Excellent product

author: Good guy!
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2018
review_content: I hesitated a bit to get this device. But after reading the reviews and knowing Anker's products are generally good, I went ahead with the purchase and do not regret getting it. It is very useful when you travel and have to charge multiple devices. Our family has 3 iPhones and all of us use it a lot - photos, watching videos, listening to music, chatting, talking on phone. And obviously, the battery gets drained quickly. But this is where the power bank comes to rescue when you are on the road and need to charge multiple devices at the same time. Highly recommended!
title: Very useful powerbank

author: JDAIrish
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2019
review_content: Ordered this for the kids as a Christmas present.  One of the two has since gone dead on us. That's 7 months of life...pretty sad!  I realize electronic things have a certain shelf life but as expensive as these chargers are, they should last way longer than 7 months.  I would not recommend this brand of charger to anyone!  Plenty of other reliable brands to choose from.  Very disappointed customer!
title: I would give zero stars if I could!

author: Len8509
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020
review_content: Received my Anker charger today, it had chips at the edges of one side I put it to charge and it didn't charge at all also did not come with charging cableSo I reordered a new power bank, blue one this time it came in today. It looks new not like it has been used I plugged it in and the lights lit up and showed its charge and it also came with charging cord
title: Not sure if I received one or a broken one

author: Blips
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2020
review_content: This thing is amazing. I carry it everywhere and for weeks it’s charged my phone and others multiple times and it STILL isn’t dead. The battery power is amazing and I cannot believe I ever bought a cheap version of this that barely charged my phone. This thing is completely worth it and has saved me nearly every beach day when I play the music and my phone dies quickly!!
title: WISH I BOUGHT IT SOONER

author: 𝓚𝓪𝓵𝓮
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2019
review_content: No more shall I worry about dying. ☠️Half drained, this battery pack can still charge your phone AND and iPad from 0 to 100% with a little bit still left over! Of all battery packs I’ve had, this is the only one that has performed beyond what I expected. If you travel a lot, this is an essential pack. The only downsides to this power wower core is that there isn’t a built in wall adaptor, like Pocket Juice, and the surface does scratch easily (but they are not noticeable and it doesn’t really matter).Also, this thing is heavy! You can really tell it packs in a lot of juice because of its weight.
title: You'll Never Be Caught Dead 🔋

author: TMB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2017
review_content: I use this several days a week to charge my bluetooth earbud and my iPhone 6. It charges them at the same time and I have yet to drain the battery and I have not charged my phone to 100%, but only because I usually put it on to give it a boost if it falls below 30% and I take it off before I leave work - so it's usually back to 90% within an hour or two (Not really sure on timing because ... work.). Before I got the Anker PowerCore, I had a little power boost stick thing that gave me 10-15% boost. It was fine to keep my phone from dying if I was out on a run and a few streets away. With the PowerCore, it doesn't matter than I don't have an accessible outlet at work - I can keep my phone charged all day and keep my bluetooth earbud going.
title: Excellent choice for portable power

author: J. Stack
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2016
review_content: I bought this in preparation for a trip to Disney World. I already owned   Anker PowerCore 13000 Portable Charger - Compact 13000mAh 2-Port Ultra Portable Phone Charger Power Bank with PowerIQ and VoltageBoost Technology for iPhone, iPad, Samsung Galaxy (Black)          . The 13000 was perfect to date, but we were going to have three adults and three children. We had 6 tablets and 4 smartphones between us. I figured we would need more than the 13000 could provide - especially for watching movies on the plane and the kids playing Pokemon Go in the parks. The 20100 did not disappoint. We frequently passed it between people to keep things charged up. We went all day in the park keeping all of the devices charged and never used more than ~50% of the pack's charge.
title: Another Winner from Anker

author: Wilson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2017
review_content: Update: someone from Anker did reach out to me right away and was able to give me advice about the power bank.  I appreciate their high level of customer service and look forward to more of their products in the future.Id like to talk to someone about this.  It doesnt take that long to charge compared to my previous 20,000 mah battery of a different brand and drains about twice as fast if not more than my previous one also.  One day i charged it at more than 75% and never fully charged.  Usually it takes a day for me to drain it about 25 percent but on another day it somehow used up 75% battery and died during my usual one day use.  I was expecting better performance than this compared to my previous battery.  I wonder if this one may be defective.
title: Updated: like to talk to someone about this

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2020
review_content: I purchased in January 2020 and it stopped working in March.  although the battery is fully charged, the battery itself doesnt provide charge to other items.  very disappointed.  The pandemic hit and tried calling the company directly since amazon could no longer return it and replace it but the company not answered the phone.  I sent an email and now waiting on them to respond.  hope they can replace it or fix it.
title: not a good battery

author: Par
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2019
review_content: I would have given this charger 5 stars as it is a strong charger that held a charge the whole time I was on vacation charging my phone and iPad in the plane. I did not have to recharge it until I got home 8 days later. But I went to use it recently for anther trip one of the ports quit working and the charger itself is not charging up. I feel this should have lasted much longer for the money. Disappointed.😣
title: Longevity is poor for product.

author: David Draper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019
review_content: We have two iPhones in our household - an SE and an 8 Plus. I returned the first 20100 power bank I ordered because it would stop charging at 92 to 95%. My second one (replacement) charges our phones to 96% and stops. A couple of times after unplugging and replugging and repeatedly pushing the side button I got my SE up to 100! On the first unit I tried discharging completely and charging fully, tried several apple brand cables and two Anker brand cables, and then ordered a brand new Apple brand ($20) cable. Same result every time. I'm not going to go to extreme measures trying to get this one to work. It's going back.
title: My iPhones will not fully charge.

author: Dave & Sabrina
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2020
review_content: This thing is a beast. Charged my phone about 12 times over 4 days before it ran out of power. Only down side it is that it takes about 12 hours to charge. With great power comes longer charging. Highly recommend.
title: This thing is a beast. Strong buy recommend.

author: Allen Preveaux
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
review_content: Will charge my iPhone to 100% (from under 20%) 4 times before dying.  It takes many hours to recharge this thing completely, but it's worth the wait.  My phones charge just as easily on this as on my wall outlet.  And it has 2 USB outlets. There is added weight that comes with this great charging performance, but the dimensions make it easy to fit into jeans pockets or a typical pocketbook/purse shape.  Doesn't heat up when recharging or charging phones.
title: Great product, highly recommended

author: No need for my name
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2018
review_content: I have no idea why all these reviews seem to praise Anker customer service. In fact I'm surprised anyone has ever needed to contact their customer service. Anything battery related or charger related I go nowhere other than Anker. I am in the process of ordering another of these chargers right now after having my old one for well over a year through drops and using it every single day at work to keep my phone charged for music all day, sometimes not even needing to recharge it for 3 days. To be honest if it wasn't for an unexpected and unfortunate forklift accident (I ran it over and it didn't explode or have the batteries leak everywhere) I would still be using my old one since it showed 0 signs of slowing down or giving up. Thank you anker for your well made products
title: The only brand for charging needs.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2019
review_content: Used for 2-3 months and flat out stopped working.  Worked great before that for a week long trip then used it twice a week.  Very disappointing for the price.  It will charge when plugged in and shows a full battery, but then when I plug it into my phone I get nothing.  Changed cords multiple times and still nothing.  Like I said, money that I could have spent elsewhere because I now find myself needing another one for a trip and back to square one.
title: Stopped Working

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2019
review_content: Very disappointed.  I got my fist one at January 2019.  Tried to charge the new battery over night.  The light for the power only show 80% charge.  Even I left it charge over 2 days.  On the top of it, I try to charge to my IPhone.  It will stop to charge to my phone after 15 mins.  And my phone only get 80% of of power.  I will need to keep pushing the power switch on in order to keep my phone fully charge.So I return the first one and ordered another new one from Amazon last week.  However, it happen again...new battery can’t fully charge after 2 days of charge.  I  haven’t try to charge to my phone yet.  Will keep you posted after I try that.  And the 2nd battery still can’t be fully charge.  So I did return both of the batteries at the end of last week.
title: 2nd Battery still can’t fully charge

author: Pen Name
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2020
review_content: WOW WOW WOW! I've had a portable charger for the past 6-7 years and gave it to my son. I purchased this one for myself and it has been awesome. It charges my phone fully and its still fully charged. I charged it last two weeks ago and its still fully charged. The battery life is great and you can charge your devices multiple times without having to recharge your charger. It also charges pretty fast.
title: Excellent charger buy it

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2016
review_content: Edit February 2019: Well, it has been at least three years since I bought this charger, but it finally broke. I don't use it that often (only when I go on extended trips) so I've only charged it maybe 20 times. At first, one of the USB ports stopped working. Now, the unit lights up while charging, but does not light up when I press the button or when I plug in my phone. Even though it lasted a few years, I'm quite disappointed (especially because the price has doubled in that time frame). I've heard that the warranty is good, but you only get 18 months. These are just some things to consider about the cost of this product.It's a little heavy but the 20000 mAh can't be beat!  As other reviewers mentioned, it does take a significant amount of time to charge (mine takes almost a day so it does take some planning ahead of time) but I could confidently charge my phone and tablet for an entire weekend away with the amount of power that this battery has.  It's a reasonable price and looks sleek.  Overall I'm very happy with my purchase
title: Worked until it didn't (plan ahead)

author: The Remedy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019
review_content: Wouldn’t charge no matter what cord I tried using. Made it a whole 2 days. Surprising because I thought Anker was a good brand. I’m sure the ones that aren’t defective are great but mine unfortunately was a dud. Giving buyers heads up they might experience the same. Sent it back and got a different brand.
title: Got a dud.

author: CB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2020
review_content: I ordered this after a recent snow storm left us with no power for 7 days. Our phones were our only connection to PG&E and the repairs going on. We ran our generator sporadically to run a space heater and charge our phones plus one very small charger I had but between 4 people it was tough. This ought to be something everyone keeps on hand for emergencies
title: Fantastic little charger

author: mjo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2019
review_content: I got this for a camping trip, which was cut short, but it charged my phone and medical device 3 times and only went from 4 lights to 3 over two days. Recently took it on a trip and it repeatedly charged my phone, kindle and medical device and again didn't get below 3 lights. A bit heavy, you wouldn't want to haul it in a purse all day but was fine in my tote bag. Great for my older phone that won't make it all the way through a day.
title: Haven't killed it yet

author: Anna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2020
review_content: I’ve purchased 2 of these. My teenage sons love them. My oldest has had his for years and uses it for long track and cross country meets. It’s a life saver when your out alll day with no outlets nearby.Amazing customer service. When there was an issue with my younger sons new battery Anker replaced it quickly with no hassle.
title: Great battery, great customer service

author: mkat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2019
review_content: Update roughly a week after my initial review.  Device is now working like it should.  Charges fast and not turning off by itself every two minutes.It turns off while charging every two to three minutes, whether I’m using the device or have stepped away. I’m getting about 2% charge on my iPhone before I have to push the power button to turn on the battery again. Seems like a pretty serious shortcoming for a battery this expensive. Really disappointing.
title: Update:  No longer pushing the button every two minutes

author: Claycon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2018
review_content: Anker does it again! This one is a life saver. I have iPhone 7+ and I get 4-6 charges from this depending on use. I find myself using it even if I have access to a power outlet because it's more convenient to be plugged into a moveable object than a wall or power strip. There are bigger batteries & smaller ones but this is the one that fit my budget & I am very happy with it. For best results use it with Anker Powerline+ charging cable.**Note: the mesh bag it comes with adds a nice layer of protection, but may shed fibers unless you turn it inside out & wash before use.
title: Great product. Solid

author: Jack Rhodes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2017
review_content: This thing packs a massive battery which I can get roughly 6 full charges out of for my iPhone 7 PLUS. I never have to worry about my battery getting low or finding and outlet, I just keep this in my bag, and then I  also won't have to worry about recharging for a while also. I can also share it with a friend if someone else needs a charge. It's a little long, but not enough to be an inconvenience. It is also a little heavy, but it's not to bad in relation to the relatively slim form factor, and it is especially not bad for the capacity-size trade off. I plugged it in overnight when it was dead, and it was fully charged by the morning, so no complaints on that part. It also has an alright charging speed, no fast charging but not super slow either. Both my phone and bank did get a little warm while charging, but not to my concern. I picked up and Amazon basics 3 in cord I believe and keep it with the bank in the wonderful included carrying case and I am set for whenever. I really love this bank - it has a great design, good weight, and fantastic capacity, so I will never have to worry.
title: Huge capacity, great size

author: Michael E.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2020
review_content: This battery pack worked great on a recent road trip. It charged our phones quite rapidly and so on. We gave it, its initial charge using a 2 amp charger and it was fully charged at around, 7 hours. It is quite compact, solid and simple to use. We bought the red one so as to lessen the likelihood of losing it while traveling. If you travel, you need one of these.
title: Good Form Factor from a Reputable Company

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
review_content: Order the charger on oct 1 2018 than in Jan 2019 charger didn’t work contact anker customer service they send me a replacement after we did the trouble shoot over emailThan in March 2019 the replacement didn’t charge again so I contact anker again they told me to send back the charger to get the replacement !As of now charger is good been using anker the pass 4 years every charger able headset has been good !!
title: Great customer service

author: Michael S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2019
review_content: I got caught once without a spare battery and no place to charge. Did some research and found this. Portable Charger Anker PowerCore 20100mAh. Other reviews stated heavier compared to other batteries. It does have some bulk but it's in my pocket, not in my hand so I didn't mind. I can change iPhone Max multiple (5+) times on single change.  It does take a while to charge up, and I don't think device charging is as rapid as base changer, but when it's in your pocket when your on the move, does that really matter as much???...but it is a tad pricey... tradeoffs...
title: Good portable charger. (Real review)

author: BlackMetalKnight
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2017
review_content: I bought this charger back in February of 2016. It worked almost flawlessly for 12 months, and now it is essentially a paperweight. It will no longer charge above 3 lights, even when left plugged into a 2.1 amp charger for 48 hours. The charger is unable to charge my Kindle Fire completely. I'll plug my Fire into the charger, come back an hour later and the charger is dead and the Fire only has a 80% charge. I get the same result when trying to charge my LG G4 phone. Since day one, the charger would not power any "dumb" USB powered devices, like a fan or light, or charge my USB charged flashlight. However, my cheapo $5 big lot chargers have no issues with any of those devices.  I expected a better quality in an Anker product.Update - I contacted Anker as the charger is still under their 18 month warranty, with the primary complaint being that the charger will not fully charge and fully discharges before charging either my Kindle Fire or LG G4 phone completely. Their response was to FULLY CHARGE THE ANKER CHARGER and then see how many times it will recharge my LG G4!!! SERIOUSLY?! My complaint is that it will not FULLY charge and they request that I FULLY charge it!Update 2 - After a short exchange of emails, Anker is sending me a new charger, without any of the normal RMA hassles you usually see with most electronic companies. My replacement will be here in a couple days. The company that produces the Cadillac of chargers has Cadillac customer service as well. FIVE stars for standing behind their product!
title: Expensive paperweight after only 12 months

author: M. D. McGarity
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2019
review_content: UPDATE: the company contacted me several times and gave me several options to check the charging of this product. In the end they replaced it without really having to. Their customer service is the best!! Would definitely use them again!I love the actual charger but it takes forever to recharge once it loses all power.  I can plug it in in the morning and it will take ALL day to build up to a full charge.  I'm not sure if they all do that or my is defective.
title: Slow Charging

author: Skarsgardgurl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2017
review_content: I purchased this for school. There never seems to be a free outlet for me to charge my devices when I am on campus. This has been a great addition to my backpack. I use it almost everyday either during my bus commute to and from campus or while I am in class to charge my iPad Pro or phone. I was nervous that the charge in the battery pack would be depleted quickly while charging my iPad but so far I can get at least two full charges out of it and still have a little left for my phone. Very fast charging even when you have both of the USB ports plugged in. I would highly suggest this item. It even comes with a mesh protective case to protect it from scrapes and heavy books you might carry!
title: Huge capacity charging device that can handle an iPad Pro!

author: countrygirl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2019
review_content: I bought this battery bank for an international trip where I had limited ability to charge my phone for several days at a time. I averaged 4 and half full phone charges before the power bank needed recharged. It did exactly what I expected, as other reviews had also stated similar charging averages.With two USB ports, it allowed me to charge a friend's phone at the same time as my phone. I never noticed a decrease in how quickly my phone charged when I charged another item at the same time. The main thing to note there is that the "4 and half charges" is for charging one device at a time. Charging two items at the same time seemed to use up the battery much quicker, which decreased the output a noticeable amount.The only negative I would say about this is that it's a little heavy to carry around for long periods of time. But even so, I was really thankful to have it. I would definitely recommend this battery bank!
title: Great product!

author: Some Chick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2018
review_content: This charger REALLY holds a charge. I bought it for a long international trip to use instead of the tiny one I'd picked up at Target or somewhere. I ended up using the smaller one on a daily basis simply because this one is more like a big laptop battery and quite heavy. I'm glad I bought it because it'll come in handy when I travel places with dodgy or no electricity. I've been using it around the house to recharge when I want to carry something with me from room to room or even to my car. I haven't had to recharge this for several weeks now. It seems well made. Good purchase.
title: It holds a charge very well, a bit heavy. Well-made.

author: Product Review
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2018
review_content: I've only had this charger for a few weeks after coming off another Anker charger with much smaller capacity that I have been enjoying over the last 5 years.
