This 20100mAh charger is a little larger and a little heavier than my last one, but I love the capacity.  It charges my ipad pro and my iphone and has plenty of battery power to spare.  If you're like me and travel a fair amount and find your self for extended periods in airports and don't want to be shackled to an electric outlet or you want to charge a device in a business meeting, restaurant or on a plane, you'll love this charger.
title: Must have for road warriors

author: BrittoNYC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2019
review_content: I bought this charger 4 years ago, and it still performs as well as it did from its early days. It fully holds it charge, even if I don't use it for several days. I also believe it charges my devices faster than simply plugging it into the wall, so I even use it at home. It's amazing for travel. I cannot say enough about it. It's well worth every penny.
title: Performance, Endurance, Longevity

author: Antonio M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2016
review_content: This battery is from Anker, a company I consider to be reliable. This product met my expectations for what they make. Unlike a battery I bought from Best Buy, this one held its charge well, and had a nice look. The included cable charged it quickly, and was very easy to use, as it is a common MicroUSB. My favorite parts of the battery were the charge indicator and the capacity. I recently used this on an international trip, and it kept my phone charged wherever I went. I recommend this to most people, but if you don't have the space, get a PowerCore Mini.Edit: I recently "lost" this battery in my car for over 6 months. When I picked it up after finding it, it still had nearly full charge! This is a testament to the product's reliability, and is incredible for the price.
title: Charged Up!

author: Tanya Scala
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2019
review_content: Trying to use now in the airport and it won’t keep charging! I have tocontinually press the button every few min tokeep it charging!! I will have tocontact them but right now I’m tired and stuck in an airport at 2:30am.UPDATE:Apparently it was the cord because I got a new one and it’s been working just fine! It charges insanely fast. Also, after my review the emailed me and said they’re sending another at no charge... so good customer service too!!
title: works

author: Ed.Ge
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2019
review_content: First off the build is nice. It has a hard plastic case with four small light on the top that let you know how much power it has. On the left side is a power button. On the top are two USB A IQ ports and one USB B micro port. The PowerCore is a lot bigger and heavier than I expected, I don't see too many people fitting this in their skinny jeans. It charged my phone pretty quick but I haven't had it long so I can't comment much more on overall product usage. It's very convenient when you don't want to be tethered to a wall and need to charge things.
title: Charges fast, solid build, not tiny.

author: Sarah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020
review_content: This worked like perfection for just under two years. It still charges up beautifully but as soon as I hook it up to my phone to charge, it stops charging, almost immediately. I took great care of it, it looks brand new but I’m tired of things just dying like that. It should still work beautifully.
title: Disappointing lifespan

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2018
review_content: It worked perfectly until this morning it wont turn on I’ve had it only for a few months i always took care of it never dropped it never did anything to it and today it wont turn on it wont charge it wont do anything I’m asking for a replacement i loved my charger i used it all the time for all types of things please contact me as soon as possibly for anyone to ready this
title: Trying to contact seller for replacement

author: Ken Lagman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020
review_content: Y’all. This is hands down the best investment I’ve made this year. If you are anything like me and literally use your phone for personal and professional use 24/7 a day. Then this is the product for you. The powerbank takes a bit to charge up to its full capacity but is well worth the wait. Ive charged my phone 4 times with this product in 2 days and it still has 4 bars of battery life left in the powerbank. In terms of charging, it takes 30 minutes for my iphone 11 to charge up to 50% from 1% and 40-50 minutes to charge to 96%.
title: Totes worth the investment.

author: Nick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2019
review_content: This thing is awesome I was able to charge 3 phones from 20% battery life to 95% or more and still had plenty of power to charge more the only negative thing I would say is the battery pack is slightly heavy but to me that says quality and obviously would need to be heavy to hold so much juice in it to charge your products highly recommend this product if you travel a lot and are constantly looking for a outlet to charge your wireless devices
title: Has a lot of charging power very good product

author: Jen Ford
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2018
review_content: I bought this for a trip, charged it up, and with no window to test, headed out. It worked great! I charged my phone, friends' phones, and my iPad and never went below 2 lights (though I did recharge it mid-vacation). It was so great to never have to worry about my older phone running out of gas as it was vital to nearly every step of my vacation. The recharge power this one provides balances out its weight, and it is lighter than most iPads so didn't feel like it was weighing me down. The charger fit in a side-pocket of my purse and I could run the recharge wire from charger to phone while I ran all over sight-seeing without having to make a production out of it. Highly recommended.
title: Great for Vacations

author: Amir M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2018
review_content: UPDATE: Anker reached out to me and offered to replace the product under their warranty, and to send the new one sitting 3-5 days! Amazing how fast they replied, and resolved the problem I was experiencing. This company's service, paired with their amazing product is unbelievable! I take my anker to school with me everyday, it's powered my devices when I needed them the most.This item worked amazingly for a while, but now it only charges Up To 1 or sometimes 2 bars. I used it for aobout 8 months before this happened. Will try to get in touch with support and update review afterwards
title: Great charger.

author: Michael Howard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2016
review_content: Had this for less than 2 months and it stopped takeing a charge. It has not been dropped or misused it just stopped.It was upsettung because my wife was looking forward to useing it during delivery.Even though this product looks like quality like the cheaper ones it has a high fail rate...
title: 1.5 months and it failed

author: Matthew Green
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2017
review_content: This battery pack was the first one I have ever gotten from Anker. Before this brand I would always try more uncommonly known brands that just didn't work the way that they were advertised too. When I buy products from Anker, I know that I can trust the advertising and that I am going to get a good quality product. I have yet to ever have an issue with an Anker brand product. This portable charger features two usb ports, with a micro usb port to charge the device. This portable charger is a great quality and is able to withstand being dropped multiple times and still work fine. You will not find that to be the same with other companies. I give this product a huge thumbs up and I look forward to future products from Anker.
title: Great Device

author: Erica Brown
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2020
review_content: A year ago I would have rated this product with 5-stars because it was great in the beginning. Now,  it’s very slow charging and takes forever to charge my phone. This product is too expensive to stop working efficiently in less than a year. (just writing review) Not to mention this is the second charger, I had to send first one back within a month because 2nd port wasn’t working. This portable charger need a 3-year warranty.
title: Great IF you ONLY need it for 7 or 8 months

author: REG
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2018
review_content: We bought 2 Anker PowerCore chargers right before Harvey hit last August. They were awesome and helped us get through each day when we needed to take tons of pictures of all of our flooded items. Both stopped charging up when they were low. I contacted Anker and they immediately sent me 2 new charging cords to try. The cords worked perfectly! Anker was in contact with me throughout the whole transaction making sure that I was aware of what steps were being taken. It's wonderful to know that there is a company out there that stands behind their products, taking care of business and offering superb customer service. Thank you Anker!
title: Superb Customer Service!

author: Lucia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2018
review_content: Edit: A year later and it no longer works. Very disappointed.I was originally very unhappy with this product after writing a negative review, I was contacted by one of their customer service Representatives. I was having issues with the fast charging port in this battery pack and was extremely dissatisfied. However , after being contacted by the company they sent me what I needed and I am a very happy customer. This company strives to make their customers happy. Please purchase this battery pack as you will not be disappointed.
title: A year later and no longer works

author: Francisca Nwoke
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2019
review_content: I bought this charger due to the fact that I would be doing a lot of air travel.  I wanted the ability to charge my devices on the go.  I was told by a friend who purchased at BestBuy that this charger would give up to 4 full charges. After trying multiple times and leaving the charger charging for several hours (up to 5-6 hrs), I have yet to be able to bring the charger up to full charge.  The charger dies after one charge of my device.  For the price this charger was not worth it. I wish I could return it. I currently am trying to charge this charger to full charge and its been charging for 3 hrs and has yet to reach 2 bars.  Hoping this is a defective model and not representative of the overall quality from this seller.
title: Defective device, highly disaappointed.

author: Rebecca Bolander
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2019
review_content: I bought one of their chargers about 16+ months or so ago, bc Anker chargers are the best. I already have a few different anker devices. Then, I started having issues with one of the 2 ports/plug ins. One worked, the other mostly didn’t. I contacted them thru Amazon & immediately they responded, saying there was an 18 month warranty & they’d send me a new one, after I tried a couple of things (like other cords, etc) to make sure the issue was with the actual charger. I did that, still had problems, so they shipped another device to me right away. It got here early this week, & so far the new one works great! The person I spoke with was very kind & patient (sometimes it took me a long time to respond to her questions), and her response was always almost immediate. If you need portable charger, this is the place to go.
title: Best company

author: Michael D. Lee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2016
review_content: I originally bought this item and it worked great as advertised but docked a star because it was super heavy.  To my surprise, Anker contacted me via email and sent me a smaller version of this charger free of charge.This type of customer service is unheard of to me with internet shopping.  They didn't ask me to change my review or to do anything, but were just concerned that I wasn't completely satisfied with one of their products.This company has earned my business now if I ever need anything electronic, cable etc.  I have never had a company that interested in my satisfaction with any of their products.I will be buying Anker products in the future.
title: Anker actually cares if you are satisfied with their product.

author: Antonio E. Cara
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2018
review_content: Update my review from one star to four:They offer great customer support outreach, and the charger began working again using a different cord/outlet. That said, it doesn't seem to like certain power sources. Hard to tell what will work and what isn't working when the only feedback is a blinking blue dot.As for the performance of the product itself, it's great. It can charge an iPhone 7 plus in less than a couple hours. Perfect for people who game heavily on the go and have [X] to USB adapters or people who just really, really love using their mobile devices (Pokémon go at Disneyland perhaps?).
title: A bit finicky but great!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2020
review_content: Been an absolute great tool on deployment. I have it on my carry on for flights at all times for the long wait times and hopping between barracks and different voltage set ups in barracks. I charged my phone and my WiFi puck off of it from no battery to full battery twice before needing to recharge the power bank. It does get very warm though.
title: Great Portable Charger

author: Matt Sears
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2019
review_content: I've left this in the hot sun while camping, left it in the car many times in freezing and hot temperatures, and it still works great! I once charged it up and then forgot about it. Came back ~1 year later, plugged it in and it still had a full charge! I've been consistently impressed with Anker's quality from several of their products. I now have 3 of these and would buy again if needed.
title: This thing is a beast!

author: Tiny Naylor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2018
review_content: This battery has been amazing. We have taken it on two week internal trips, of course we were in airplane mode most of the time and only ran out of battery on the flight home. Yes it is heavy and bulky for everyday use but for travel, road trips, camping, etc, it is the best and most reliable. One more thing to note, it does take about 12 to 18 hours to fully charge so use your highest voltage usb charger to reduce charging time!
title: Must have for any extended trip!

author: bas0921
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2019
review_content: So heavy.  Takes forever to re-charge  Not worth it. Wanted to return it but had passed the return date. Don’t write many one star reviews but this is a piece of junk heading for the landfillUpon leaving a negative review, I heard from the seller who replaced the item with a newer version. It still takes at least 10 hours to charge and is still heavy. But I did appreciate the communication with the seller which is why this review went from a 1 to a 4...
title: Heavy. Bulky. SUPER SLOW to recharge -UPDATE-Excellent Seller support

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2018
review_content: I got my Ankur charger for the purposes of travel. I have used my cousin's before and read great reviews about how this charger could charge multiple devices at once and how it had more than one USB ports. I was pretty sure it would be a great product; however, when it arrived, I was quickly let down.I'm not sure if it is supposed to include the charging chord that actually charges the charger itself, but the product did not come with one. I tried contacting the seller about this issue but I recieved no response. I brushed it off and decided to use one of my chords instead. No big deal.I took this charger with me while traveling to Tokyo. It worked for most of my trip but failed after a week of using it. My Ankur charger will not charge anything anymore. For some reason, my Japan trip wiped out all the power it had to charge and wiped my confidence in this charger. I was sad.After reading some reviews, I guess I'm not the only one that has had this same problem. I hope whoever buys this product, takes it into consideration.Edited Post: The great customer service team at Anker reached out to me regarding my review. They so kindly offered to send a replacement charger along with the chord this time and I was very pleased with their concern and service. I got to use it this past Saturday at a concert and it worked great! My phone charged very fast. Thank you so much! Happy customer here!
title: Stopped charging after my Tokyo Trip

author: DJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2017
review_content: I was looking for a portable battery pack to charge phones and pads during trips and backpacking. This unit so far is every thing that I was looking for. It takes about 10 hours to fully charge it with the Anker 2-port 24W USB wall charger (purchased separately) So far it has recharged a 12" Ipad pro twice on one charge and a I-phone 6 about 5 times. Both from around 20% charge on the units. It is a little heavy but you really can not get away from that if you want this kind of power storage.
title: Great power storage for travel

author: Zachary S. Bedell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2018
review_content: Very solid power output under load.  Verified with a USB power analyzer and charging performance, even with a solid 2 amp draw, this delivers 5.0 to 5.1 volts reliably with relatively little heat.Charging time of the PowerCore itself is very good.  Just make sure you use a full four wire USB cord.  The "charging only" cords that come with a lot of cheap stuff will only charge this at about 200mA.  Any decent USB cord with a good USB power supply behind it will charge the PowerCore at a solid 2 amps.  The included cable works fine.
title: No voltage drop at 2 amps

author: kmg
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2018
review_content: I really enjoy my battery pack. I usually charge it up at work and it lasts all week recharging my fitbit, phone and airpods. I  end up using the battery pack to charge items even when I have a wall charger, because it charges SO FAST! I take this with me when I travel because you never know when you are going to run out of battery and wont have access to a wall outlet. It comes with a little dust bag and i put all my cords in there so I always have what I need. I am thinking of getting a smaller one to fit better in my purse. I will FOR SURE get Anker over any other brand. Their customer service is BEYOND AMAZING! My first battery stopped charging. All I had to do was go on their website and enter a few items of information. They replied via email and a few emails later and they were sending me a replacement. Always go with Anker - it's worth the investment!
title: Great product and even better customer service!

author: Olivia T Chin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
review_content: I bought this after hearing from a coworker that it would charge her phone 4x before it's battery dying. I can happily report that it has amazing battery life and can charge my phone several times over before having to be charged itself. My only gripe is that it is a little heavy, I love bringing this out with me in my backpack but it's a little heavy to bring in a purse.
title: Very glad I purchased!

author: HP_Steffey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2015
review_content: My wife and I just returned from a 15-day European Marvel vacation that had us traveling through 7 different countries.  We bought an Anker PowerCore 20100 to help keep our iPhone 6 Plus, Samsung Galaxy S4, Nikon Coolpix camera, and iPad fully charged over the course of the trip and it worked exceptionally well.  It does take up to 10 hours to recharge, but was powerful enough to recharge our phones several times between the power pack recharges.  Another great feature of the Anker PowerCore is it charges phones and tablets just as quickly as a plug outlet.One of the main reasons I purchased this product is confidence in the Anker brand.  In the past, I purchased a few Anchor external hard drive docking stations and they were well designed and have worked flawlessly.
title: Great Portable Charger To Keep Your Phones, Tablets, and Cameras Fully Charged When Your Out and About

author: Kent E Oldfield
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2020
review_content: Overall this charger is great for those who are looking for a long-lasting powerful portable charger. It charges your devices very quickly. While I can't say enough about how great Anker products are, I do personally regret getting this specific charger for really only one reason. I did not realize how big, bulky, and heavy it was. I did thorough research prior to selecting this product and read numerous reviews stating it was the perfect size. When I made the purchase, I had all intentions of getting a device that was long lasting and slim that I could fit in my pocket when I'm traveling to and from work. This however is not that case and I purchasing a slimmer charger from Anker.
title: Powerful & long lasting - but bulky/heavy

author: Scott Bartholomew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2016
review_content: After having received 2 defective units,  Anker customer service sent me a third charger for free.  After a month of rigorous testing,  this third unit works perfectly! The capacity is massive at 20.1 ah and the unit definitely charges all of my usb devices far more quickly than my 2.4 amp wall charger. The micro controlled Anker portable charger is superior to any charger I have ever used of its type. I am very picky about my technology and can honestly say this charger lives up to my expectations. It charges in about 10-12 hours off of a 2.4 amp wall charger via micro usb cable. The micro usb cable included with the Anker portable charger is of good quality and I seldom use any other usb cord for charging my phone.  Anker customer service is impeccable and truly takes pride in their work.  They prioritize customer satisfaction over all else and the stand behind their products firmly.  As far as I am concerned,  Anker is the last word in charger technology.  I will be purchasing a 2.4 amp wall charger to replace my current one very soon.
title: A master work!  Fantastic technology and customer service!

author: Rachel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2018
review_content: Absolutely love this portable charger!!!! Ahh! I’ve ordered this about 6 times... I got one for myself then one for each of my immediate family members as well as a few cousins! The battery will charge all my devices super fast and multiple times! I can carry it around and use it for several days before charging it! When I do charge it, I will usually leave it on the charger as soon as I get home for the day and then it’s ready again by the time I leave in the morning fully charged! The ONLY slightly annoying thing is that it’s kinda heavy.. so I always know when I have it 😂 This is perfect for frequent travelers as you won’t be fighting over outlets at the airport and you can charge multiple devices at one time. This was the first product I ever bought from Anker and it has been AMAZING! Since they’ve raised the price I’ve been hesitant to buy more.. but this was the perfect gift for my moody teenage brother who is really plugged into his phone all day! (Btw, this picture is after almost a year of use! Still going strong!)
title: I’ve bought this at least 6 times!! 😍😍😍

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2017
review_content: Upon receiving this, I immediately went to work testing it, exclusively charging my iPhone 6 and my wife's iPhone 7 from it for about 5 days. (Each time I tested it, I made sure to use the phone minimally or not at all while it was charging so I could get an accurate representation of its capability.) Here are the results. I tried to time how long it took, but I didn't tether myself to a clock all day so the charging times are estimates.1st charge: 27% to 100% in 1:18, with 4/4 lights left at the end2nd charge: 1% to 100% in 1:40, with 4/4 lights left3rd charge: 24 to 100% in 1:20, with 4/4 lights left (seriously!)4th charge: 16% to 100% in 1:32, with 3/4 lights left5th charge: 21% to 100%, with 3/4 lights left (I stopped caring about how long it took to charge, but you can assume here)6th charge: 40% to 100%, with 2/4 lights left7th charge, 15% to 43%, with STILL 2/4 lights left, after which I was sufficiently happy with my test and recharged the AnkerThis does what it says it does: charges your phone a lot. At $40 (which I paid for a Goal Zero charger 2 years ago that barely charges my phone once), I'm more than pleased. Who cares if this is a little heavy and takes a while to recharge? Get this.
title: after which I was sufficiently happy with my test and recharged the Anker This does ...

author: Chris Reidt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2018
review_content: I would have given this product one star if it had not been for the impeccable customer service I received.  The first one I received was on one charger for 48 hours and the first light would only blink; changed chargers and let it go for another 24 hours.  Still just the first light blinking.  E-mailed Anker and they were all over it.  Told them the issue, sent the picture they asked for and had a working replacement within a few days.  Plugged in the replacement, first light already solid and the device was fully charged over night.  Works well and just how it is supposed to.  it is a bit big but it needs to be for the power it holds/distributes.  I would completely recommend the product and the company!
title: Exceptional Customer Service and Replacement Product Works Perfectly

author: JD_Justice
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2019
review_content: A little on the heavy side but definitely is worth it, can repeatedly recharge my phone and devices and this power bank barely loses its charge.  Has saved my from a dead phone on every trip I take and I never leave for a trip without it now.  Great product, wish it were a little lighter but it is still manageable and portable.
title: Excellent Battery Backup

author: Henry S. Birdseye III
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2019
review_content: This external battery is an absolute beast. It'll recharge your phone many times over. HOWEVER, if you use third party iPhone charge cables, it'll only charge the phone for a minute or two before you have to press the charge button again. What's even more infuriating: even Anker iPhone cables don't work with this battery. Why would you make a battery and then not support your own cables? It's a frustrating, baffling feature, and I recommend considering another battery altogether if your crappy first-party Apple cables have frayed until they had to be thrown out and you rely on third-party cables.UPDATE: if you complain about how the battery is bad they will send you a working battery that accepts all phone cables but only after you post a negative Amazon review. 4 stars. Overall a fantastic external battery.
title: If it’s broken they’ll send you a working one after you write a negative review

author: Jusada
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2019
review_content: Omg. Atlas, a portable charger I can rely on. I have purchased so many power paks and have had different issues from, they not charging quick enough to not charging at all or that my power will not last when charged using them.. This one on the other hand charges quickly and my power last on my office. It's has a little weight to it but I guess that comes with its performance. I love it and highly recommend it. It fits in small pocket book too
title: It's powerful

author: Jordan M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2020
review_content: This battery charger is amazing for traveling, festivals, van life and everyday life. It holds 5 full charges and the better life has not diminished over the year I’ve been using this product. Two USB plugs so you can charge multiple devices at once and can charge the battery itself with any micro usb charger (the charger is included). The item is a bit bulky and takes a while to charge but that is to be expected with the amount of charge this holds! Would highly recommend.
title: Great Product for Travel, Festivals, living in Van, everyday

author: Jim Handshy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2018
review_content: This is the second one I bought of this style because the other one did break. It was a zmas gift for a young teen at the time and who knows what he did with it for it to fail. But he/I did like it enough to buy another. They hold a lot and charge a galaxy s7/s8 quickly.It's big though.. Remember if you want/need a big supply of stored energy then this is great. But I think it's too big for a pocket, a bag for a day out at the beach is perfect. Great quality and materials.
title: A lot of storage

author: JRock
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020
review_content: I've had this charger for a little over 1 year.It normally is plugged in and is used at home.So, it's in no way "abused". Recently I've been having problems recharging (the battery itself). The female to male cable connections are loose and just not working properly, I have to wiggle and manipulate to get a "constant" connection. Also, when the unit was new it would easily charge my phone and have lots of reserve left. This is no longer the case, after charging my phone (from around 70%) I find that the battery os almost depleted itself.Not happy, I thought this unit was good to go. Now it's basically fit only to be recycled.
title: Pretty much useless after 1 year

author: Happyguy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2019
review_content: I purchased this for charging my Galaxy phone, headlamp and mini flashlight. I use it when doing 2 to 3 day backpacking excursions. Luckily this did not happen when I was out the trail.Customer service was fantastic. I called and they put a new one in the mail and gave me instruction on how to return the defective one.I hope this was not a sign that I will have the same problems in the future.
title: The unit would not charge/. Customer service was awesome.

author: Cosk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2017
review_content: After 2.5 months of weekly use the USB cable broke and one of the four lights of the charge indicator failed.  Anker does not have a website for warranty replacement of Amazon purchases, so you have to do it over email.  It took them a week to respond to my email, but in the end they replaced the battery pack.  Taking 2 stars off of my original 5-star rating.-------------------------------------------------My original review:I bought this battery to extend my Pokemon Go trips with Galaxy S7.  I used it on three 4-5 hour walks so far, without recharging the battery between these walks; the battery went from full capacity to about half capacity.Its capacity is too large for PoGo - 10,000 mAh would have been enough.  It appears that the game uses about 1,000 mAh per hour.  Nevertheless 5 stars for the device.Pros:- It fits in a guy's back pocket.  About an inch sticks out, but it still feels secure.  Belt is recommended - the battery is heavy enough to pull down sweatpants.- It fits well in a water bottle pocket on the side of a backpack.- The USB cable that comes with the battery is long enough to reach from the back pocket or from the backpack to the phone in your hand.  The cable works for Android devices and for charging the battery, iPhone cable is not included.- Remaining charge indicator is simple, but sufficient.Cons:- Does not come with a power adapter.- Does not do "fast charge" on Galaxy S7.- The bag that comes with the battery feels slippery and I could not find a use for it.
title: Good battery, too large for Pokemon Go

author: Amer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2015
review_content: Update: I was contacted recently by an anker representative and was informed that I had bought the wrong item. Anker sells another device that supports Qualcomm Quick Charge 2.0 which is the charging speed for the Moto X. For most androids with faster charging capabilities, that one is faster, however this one I believe hits speed cap for Apple product users.The other product for QC2.0 devices: http://www.amazon.com/dp/B016HNALOI/The so called "Smart IQ charging" feature isn't very smart at all. I'm using a moto x Pure edition, which is one of the most, if not THE fastest charging phone in the world. However, every time I plug my phone in, I get a max 1.2 amps out of the advertised max of 2.4 amp per port. This is unacceptable. I tried my older charger, one thats off brand and generic, and it gets nearly 2.0 amps. What makes it even more sad is that my older one is 2 years old! I can't completely hate it though, it does look pretty nice, and I have to admit it holds a charge pretty well (+1 star).
title: UPDATE: This isn't for QC devices

author: Superwoman AJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020
review_content: This worked for a very brief period of time. I was disappointed because I bought it to take with me when I travel, and before I went on my next trip, it stopped working.
title: Broke ...

author: Shela
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2018
review_content: I’ve had this AMAZING Anker Portable Charger for almost 3 years now and I still have nothing negative to say about it! I take it with me everywhere I go and I never have to worry about a low-battery phone. I bought a Qualcomm Anker Single PowerPort along with an Anker PowerLine Lightning Cable and whenever the charger becomes low, I just plug it in with the PowerLine and PowerPort overnight and it’s fully charged in the morning. A fully charged charger gives around 8 full charges for my iPhone 8 and it always charges fast too. For almost 3 years, I’ve never had one issue with my Anker charger and if it were to ever kaput on my one day, I’d buy another Anker charger in an instant. The material that was used to make the charger is clearly extremely durable and very high quality. I’ve dropped the charger a multiple times and it’s never hiccuped. The casing material is so durable that it barely gets any damage from the drops, even with the travel pouch on. The charger is not light but also not heavy—It’s at a good weight for a quality charger. I would hands-down say that this is the best portable charger anyone can buy. The price doesn’t break the bank and the amount of MAh you get for the price is unbeatable. My brother recently bought one like this for his Switch and it’s good to see that the quality Anker puts out has not faultered. I’d no doubt recommend this to anyone and would buy another charger from Anker in a heartbeat.
title: Nearly 3 years and it’s still like new!!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2020
review_content: For this product, I was provided with:1. The portable charger2. A USB Cord3. A Black Slim Bag to hold the portable chargerA struggle that I had with this product was difficulty charging it. The reason why I am writing this is due to the USB Cord didn’t have an adapter to plug into the wall.  I found out that the only way to charge it fast is if it is connected to a laptop or computer.  For me, it took about 4-5 hours to completely charge.I want to inform you that it takes a long time to charge the portable charger using the outlet.  DO NOT CHARGE IT USING A SIMPLE APPLE ADAPTER CHARGER FOR AN IPHONE!!!Other than that I am okay with the charger.  I feel that this product help me by saving electricity.  The portable charger has last me for 2-3 days now.
title: Charging the powercore

author: Ehsan Syed
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2018
review_content: I never leave reviews for products but I'm so happy with this I felt compelled.For daily use, this currently serves as my phone charger. Mainly since 1) it's portable so I can charge and carry around the house without having to worry about cable length; and 2) this thing charges my phone faster than any other wall charger or device. Honestly I'm frequently surprised when I come back after 15min of connecting my phone and seeing how much it charged. I've never timed how long it takes, but I've seen it get from 15% to 70% in about half an hour (iPhone 8). With thi daily usage pattern, I have gone up to 6 days without charging the power bank itself.Naturally, it takes a while to charge the whole thing. Again, I've never timed this, but I've left a fully drained unit charging the from night before (~11pm) and came back from work the next day (~7pm) and it hadn't been fully charged.I think the size to mAH ratio on this thing is superb. I'll probably purchase another one for work and give these as presents to my family this year.
title: Amazing

author: Tammy Boggs
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2019
review_content: I've tried to use this product three times, and for me when I can't get a product to work after 3 times, i'm done with it.  I bought this brand because of all the great ratings it got, unfortunately for how much I spent on it, I wasn't so lucky.  I will not be buying this brand again, not worth wondering when you get it if it will work or not.  Also, I thought I would be getting a smaller product, it's long and heavy!  Hope yours works for you.
title: Horrible product

author: Desmond Mason
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2017
review_content: Works like a charm. The build quality is really nice which I have come to expect and love from Anger. I got this a few days ago and decided to charge it fully and see what it can do with that massive capacity. It successfully charged up my iPhone 7 Plus from almost 0% to 100% 6 times and there was still a little bit of juice left. I picked this up to replace an old Polaroid mini power bank I bought several years back in the mall and it has been quite an amazing upgrade already. Being able to start and stop and check the battery of the device from the button is a really simple yet welcomed touch. The casing has just the right amount of grip to where it is pleasurable to hold on the go if you choose to hold it for whatever reason. Overall very satisfied with my purchase.
title: Tons of juice

author: Samantha Louis-Jacques
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2019
review_content: By far the best charger I have ever purchased. My husband has the larger one and just recently had to replace it after 5 years. I had this size one for 4 years and just replaced it. Anker is much better than the chargers that are 3-4 times the price of this one. The carrying case is great for people who travel frequently. I just throw all my other cords in the mesh case and know anytime i travel to grab that and it will have all the chargers I need. We've purchased many of these and the other sizes as gifts for people and every time they love them.
title: Stop looking for another charger and just purchase this one!

author: G. Hays
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2019
review_content: Bought this for my wife for a small Christmas gift and she loved it but now it will not charge all the way and seems to be charging slower as well. She was pretty disappointed because she loved it for the first 3 months and became dependent on it for her charging needs.Anker Contacted me and offered to send another device free of charge. The new device works perfectly, I really apperacite the amazing Customer service 5 stars now. Will definitely buy from this company again.
title: Bought 4 months ago and won't charge all the way now.

author: Cindy P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2019
review_content: I bought this to take on vacation. I knew I would be doing a lot of sightseeing and was afraid my battery would die with all the pictures I would be taking. This charger is amazing! I have an S7 and have only had to charge my phone twice in one day with it and still had half the power left. Therefore, I know I could charge my phone up to at least four times in one day. It is a little heavy to carry in my purse but so worth it.
title: Love it!

author: Kelly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2019
review_content: This device worked well for a few months and I was pleased and would’ve happily given it a 5-star review.  But now it will not charge.  The light blinks like it’s charging but after days of trying to charge, it has no power at all. Very disappointed as this issue began while I was on vacation and really needed it to work.UPDATE - After looking into it, I realized this item came with an 18 month warranty.  I easily contacted Anker and spoke to a real life person rather quickly.  Once I provided her with my Amazon order number, she sent me a label for the broken charger and I had a replacement within a few days.  Anker Customer Support is TOP NOTCH!!  Since this was such an incredible experience, I've now ordered 2 more Anker products.  I mean, you can't lose with them!  Thank you for really standing behind your products, Anker!  I'm one happy customer!
title: Anker Power-Core portable charger

author: Stewart McGill
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2018
review_content: Updated Review After Contacting AnkerDirect Customer Support:I contacted AnkerDirect regarding the issue my son was having with his charger and they responded immediately. They were genuinely concerned about making things right and getting my son back up and running as soon as possible. They made the entire process easy and sent him a replacement immediately. A person doesn't see customer support like this very often these days. AnkerDirect truly lived up to:  "the customer comes first". Given the great customer support and bolstering my confidence that they have my back I decided to purchase another unit for my wife's birthday and revised my rating to 5-STARS.My Initial Review after owning for ~ 13 Months:Initially, the charger worked great for my son (college freshman), but he quickly noticed when the mini-usb was plugged in a person had to make sure the mini-usb position was just right for it to charge. He went on like this through his first semester and the better part of the 2nd. He recently went to charge it and found it lights up, but nothing happens - Dead! Very disappointing!
title: Mini-USB Connector Issues

author: L. Sheryl Adams
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019
review_content: I bought this 17 months ago. Love it!!  It’s powerful enough to charge an iPad and iPhone several times. I’ve taken it on many trips, as well as my other Anker charger (can never have too many). Recently, I noticed that it wasn’t charging. I did some research and found out that that there’s an 18 month warranty. I contacted Anker Direct, the Seller. They replaced my unit with a refurbished one within days. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!
title: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!

author: Stefan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2020
review_content: Seems like a good product however it gets incredibly hot after charging only for a few minutes. After roughly 15 minutes of charging it when it was on 2 out of 4 it began to get very hot. I dont recommend charging this device while not attending to it. Also it takes very long to charge. A bit of a fire hazard I've purchased an anker product in the past it was a dashcam. I left it in a hot car for a week and it broke so not sure what to expect with an anker charger. If it lasts a year then props to anker but I have my doubts.
title: It's good but.. its anker.. so fingers crossed.

author: Jillian Goodwin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2019
review_content: This is my 6th  Anker purchase. This item charges rapidly and will charge my iPhone XS a few times. I am very happy with this item. Especially since it recharges quickly. It is a little bit heavy when traveling but since I use it while traveling overseas to Haiti where electricity is a premium this is only a minor inconvenience and anker properly lists the weight of its items. I have the smaller anker charger and love it. I am very pleased with this item and would purchase again.
title: Fast charging and reliable!!

author: Martin L. Del Prince
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2016
review_content: It does not seem to be a fast charger. My Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge reports that it is charging below it ability when using the charger. It is a big battery with plenty of capacity, nut I find it is not a fast charger and takes all day or night t charge my phone where my Samsung fast charger can charge my completely depleted phone in 1 1/2 to 2 hours.****UPDATE****Anker saw my review and contacted me. The sent me a portable charger that will work with my Galaxy S6 free of charge! So % stars for the company! However, The product description still states it will charge the S6. While it is technically true, it will not FAAST charge the S6. I am increasing my rating from 2 stars to 3.
title: Not a fast charger

author: blackhawksguy_11
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2019
review_content: This thing is a GOD SEND.Normally, like most people, I charge my phone to 100% before I go to work. My phone tends to die at the most inconvenient of times, which gets annoying. But this thing comes in clutch! Give it a few hours or so to charge (the longer the better) and just plug your phone in and you’re good to go for a while. It’s reliable, durable, easy to travel with, and holds its charge well. I’d recommend it for anyone.
title: Exactly what I needed!

author: David W
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2017
review_content: Update (June 14, 2017):Not long after I had posted this review describing a defective charging port on the device, a customer support representative reached out to me. They sent me a brand new power bank and a prepaid shipping label to return the defective one. Overall, the return process was quick and painless!As for the power bank itself, it has been about a month since I've received the new one, and so far it has been working perfectly! I just got back from a short roadtrip out of town with a large group of friends. With this many people, wall outlets were scarce, so I brought this power bank with me. I was able to charge my phone from ~20% to 100% charge overnight for all 4 nights! Absolutely worth it.Original review:The charge capacity is fantastic, and traveling with it makes me feel extremely secure that I won't be found dead with a dead phone. The biggest problem I've experienced is that one of the USB charging ports seems to be defective (specifically, the port in the middle). Sometimes it'll charge, but oftentimes it won't. The other port is perfectly fine, and typically I only use it to charge one thing (my phone) anyway, so I'm not too heavily impacted by it. Still, should the day ever arise that I need to charge a second phone simultaneously (say, my girlfriend's), then I'm in trouble.
title: [UPDATED] Defective charging port?

author: Kevin G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2017
review_content: I really like this portable battery. I've been looking for the perfect portable battery for the past few years and just haven't made the jump because I haven't found what I wanted. I wanted real power that would survive multiple charges. I also liked the idea of charger multiple devices at the same time, while being small enough to fit in a purse or backpack. Those were the biggest selling point for me purchasing the POwerCore 20100. Definitely recommend this. I've  I also like their smaller one and probably get that one to charge my phone in my pocket. I haven't ran the battery though it's entire charge cycle, but so far I've charged my phone from 10% to 100% 3 times with only one bar out of four. If you want something smaller, Anker sells a smaller option. I'll probably get it as well to charge on the go in my pocket.
title: Great portable battery and a great price!

author: Rhys Harrison
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2018
review_content: The best I can give the product is that it looks nice.I’ve waited about five months to write this review just in case perhaps it wasn’t charging properly, but it seems I may have gotten a dysfunctional one because otherwise it has excellent reviews. If yours isn’t behaving out of the box, return it.There are four charge indicator lights on the product and only one works on this one. Additionally, with each full charge, it will only recharge my iPhone 6S+ about a time and a half. Not what I paid for. Disappointing.
title: Small charge, indicator lights broken

author: HOWIE O
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2018
review_content: To big and to heavy but the power source lasts a long time.  When the manufacturer read my review they contacted me and offered to send me a smaller unit that more met my needs.  The smaller PowerCore of course weighed less but still has more than enough power for 2 or mor e recharges of my devices.  They product is very good and now just what I wanted.  THE CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS OUTSTANDING. They wanted to make sure I was happy with their product and did everything they could to make sure I was satisfied.  I WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND ANY OF THEIR PRODUCTS.
title: Long lasting power source

author: Martin Murat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2015
review_content: The reviews are great. After receiving the product, I like it very much. The only problem is, this battery will not recharge. I've had it on a 2.4amp charger for 2 straight days and it won't charge at all. Now I am waiting for a response from their customer service people on how to exchange it. What I found troubling was the number of people on their web forum with the same problem. And recently as well. Maybe they sent out a bad batch or something. I sure hope I can get a working one before my vacation.Ok. I have determined that the problem was the short USB cord that came with his unit. AND I am still wait into hear from customer service.Update: Anker just emailed and is sending me a new cord asap. Love the battery, charges well and recharges as advertised. Can't argue with quick customer service.
title: All good except a bad cord.

author: Twitch.tv/ParoXitiC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2018
review_content: I live stream at twitch.tv/ParoXitiC and I use these to charge my phone as I stream. I stream live fishing often from a kayak. On a recent trip I dropped my LG V30 phone and this charger in the water, my phone still works fine and the charger worked for a few more weeks perfectly before it began to rust inside I suppose. All and all this product does what it is supposed to do I can live stream for an extra 8 hours or so if I wanted. Considering this product is not waterproof and I dropped it into the water and it still continued to work for 3 weeks I give it props.
title: Pretty durable product

author: Cristian D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2018
review_content: I use the anker battery pack daily. I am on the move most of the day and i use the battery pack as my main source to recharge my phone. A full charged battery pack will last you the whole day under heavy use. It has been working well and up to the standards of anker battery packs. I have had no issues with charging or recharging my battery pack. It charges my phone to 100% in 30-45min. And i can do 4-5 full charges from 10% on a full battery pack charge. It has kept this quality forbover a year now. I am beyond grateful to anker and their support team. I had an issue with a battery pack that was malfunctioning and thier customer support is the best in this market. They were able to fix my problem swiftly. The customer service has been excellent. Looking forward to purchasing more products from this company.
title: Best battery pack on market

author: Adriana Giraldo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2019
review_content: I'm a college student and I commute. I run through my phone and ipad battery very quick while I'm working and don't always have an outlet to charge so a portable battery is essential. I used to have the small ones but I always got through their battery before my phone was even full (don't even think about charging an ipad.) I was given this battery as a gift and it is amazing!!!! I never run out of charge while I'm working or trying to get somewhere and maps is draining my percentage. I carry it with me everyday everywhere. :D
title: keeps ipad and phone CHARGED

author: Jacqui Penera
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2017
review_content: After doing a lot of research on the different chargers I was thinking of buying, I went with this one because I liked that I could recharge my iPhone many times before the charger died out.  It's so nice to have a charger that I don't have to worry about charging every single day just to get one or two charges out of it.  You can do one full charge of your phone one time and it'll still have over 75% left in it!  It might be a slightly heavy for a charger, but that's probably the trade off for holding a lot of power.  Now I can go everywhere and know that I don't have to worry about my phone dying on me anymore.  You also get a mesh bag with your charger so that it doesn't get beat up in your bag.  Overall, it's an amazing product.
title: I love how much power this thing stores!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2018
review_content: Perfect size for your purse. I have had mine for a few months and love it! I take it everywhere. I'm constantly traveling and on the go. This charges my phone in less than an hour.Also they have great customer service! Mine wasnt holding a charge after awhile, so I sent them an email. I got a response in a day with a couple things to try and they still sent me a new one. Great guys, I was not expecting it to be that fast. Usually when I hear warranties, i dread the long process of trying to take actually use them. These guys genuinely stand by their products and want their customers to appreciate them. Great product, great customer service..., just get one!!!!
title: Great Customer Service and Great Product

author: Stormy Daniels
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
review_content: Got this bad boy on sale for 30 bucks and its great. I use it for long treks on my motorcycle. This thing'll charge my phone 5 times over without a charge, I say that but ive never actually drained the entire thing. Its tough and has a neat little pocket thing it comes with. Only weights maybe 1 lbs but in an extreme scenario if you chucked it at someone id hurt and i bet you could still charge your phone afterwards. It was a great investment, no ragrets ;)
title: Lotta juice

author: Martybacardi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2019
review_content: Traveled the world for 6+ months w/ this battery.  Used it daily and it never failed me.  My only advice is when you want to charge this battery to use an Anker super wall charger as opposed to just the normal plug in squares.  The basic phone squares will NOT charge this battery fast enough.  If the battery is totally dead it could take a good 2-3 days to charge the battery full.  When charging with the Aker wall charger it will still take 5-6 hours, but as long as you plug it in over night you'll wake up to a fully charged battery and be good to go.  I have the iphone 6+ and my phone could be totally dead and there's enough juice in this battery which allowed me to recharge my phone 4 full times before I needed to recharge it.  I'd give this product more than 5 stars if I could as this battery saved me hide countless times while traveling.
title: This thing saved my A$$ more times than I could count...

author: Mags
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2020
review_content: I bought this cause I bought the new iPhone se so I knew I was gonna have battery life drama. This thing is great! It charges so fast! I’ve bring it to work everyday 5 days a week and has so far lasted the whole week. Charging my phone and air pods. I recommend and yes I would buy again and as a gift
title: Amazing power

author: Mary Fantazia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2019
review_content: I am so disappointed with this product. I was really banking on these working throughout my deployment to the Middle East. I bought two and both have the same problem. They don’t charge past the first power line no matter how long you leave them on the charger. They stopped charging within a month of use. Tried switching out charging cords with no difference. Now I’m stuck on deployment trying to bum battery pack charges off other people with no way to get a replacement. Thanks for nothing Anker. Do not buy these. Waste of money.
title: Battery packs do not charge

author: Tiffany Rivera
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2018
review_content: This thing is awesome! I bought it in Oct. 2016 and it still works great! Charges my phone fast and many times. Also very durable, which is a necessity cause I drop my stuff like crazy. Me no gentle. Got my roommate to get one too, and she loves it just as much. Love it! Only 2 problems with it: it takes forever to charge the actual power bank, and it's pretty heavy. I leave it charge over night and sometimes it isn't fully charged by the time I wake up. I also take it with me to work or when I go Pokemon hunting and it weighs down my bag/pocket. I would still recommend this to others and repurchase the same exact one if mine went caput. Love Anker in general. Got several different things from this company and love them all. Great quality products for great prices.
title: Almost 2 years in and it's still going strong! Love it!!!

author: Abby123
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2019
review_content: This battery is so heavy and a bit bulky. We used it when traveling to Africa. It kept both of our phones (and our Go Pros) charged when we did not have access to electricity. Battery life is long but it takes 10+ hours to charge so you have to plan ahead. beware if you are going to be carrying  it around all day that it is bulky and will weigh your bag down. Was really helpful though, we could charge all 4 devices and still have battery before it died.
title: HEAVY material but good quality

author: James P. Davis, Jr.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2020
review_content: Unless you also want to buy a super charger avoid this product.  Takes 22 hours for a full charge with a standard adapter and the cord provided.  Emailed company and they said their website clearly said this.  The amazon description did not say anything about need for a special charger.Company did provide a super charger after this previous review.  This battery pack works great and charges fast with the super charger.
title: deceptive description on Amazon listing

author: Feras Jaber
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2018
review_content: Believe I received a defective product. Bought this 2 days ago (06-16-2018) with plans of taking it with me on an overseas trip tomorrow (6-19-2018). It will not charge past the first LED light and I have had it on the charger for over 35 hours now. I am reading that ANKER has great customer support, but sadly my plane leaves tomorrow and ill be gone for 5 weeks. So i do not have time to return or exchange this one.Edit.I contacted Anker Customer service after i came back from my trip and they first helped me troubleshoot my power bank to see if i can find out what the problem was. (could not find the issue) After doing  that they took my address and sent me another power bank which worked great. They saved me the trouble of having to send back the broken one! I just threw the defective one away and they sent me a new and functioning one. Charges phone fast, holds a lot of power, sleek design, and Great customer service.
title: PowerBank WILL NOT FULLY CHARGE (resolved)

author: Hana Tran
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2019
review_content: I love it. It saves my days. I use it every day. My iPhone battery runs out around 2pm every day. I feel like I carry "an oxygen tank" for my iPhone. It was small, and light to carry in my small handbag. The battery lasts very long. The fully charged battery can last for about 4, 5 days.I used to use a stick battery, first it could fully charge one phone 100%. After 5, 6 month it could charge about 50%, after a year, it could charge only 10%, and finally dead.I gave one to my brother, he loves it. I think everyone who has iPhone needs this battery. It is excellent and the best.I will buy as gifts for my daughter in law and nephew.
title: Excellent -The  best portable battery in the market

author: Raven L
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2019
review_content: This is a review written two years following the original purchase. I can say that I’ve used this brick for every trip I’ve taken in the past 2 years (I travel every month with a few longer trips sprinkled in) and it has saved my life on numerous occasions. The battery life is fantastic and has remained so. It has changed my phone 6 times though a trip and is a godsend on trips with friends. As long as you plan ahead and charge it the night before it is perfect to take on the go. It has gone easily on planes, trains, buses and can basically charge everything except my computer. It was a fantastic purchase and I would highly recommend it especially for frequent travelers who are tired of darting around airports to find an open outlet!
title: Strong reliable battery pack perfect for travel

author: VH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2015
review_content: It is somewhat bulky IMHO. Perfectly ok to carry in a backpack but in a pocket (jacket or pant or shirt) probably/may be not. Hence, I gave 3 *s Otherwise, nice to have.After this review, I received a new Astro E1 free of charge. So far it is working GREAT and I am VERY HAPPY with the weight - it is very light and easy to carry in the pocket and very portable and mobile as compared to other bulky unit I bought which I must carry in the briefcase and use at home/office. I am going to give Anker ***** for taking care of me. They went out of their way and sent me a new unit free of charge. FANTASTIC customer service and they REALLY listen to their customer ---- that is very very important to me. I will most certainly HIGHLY recommend their products to all my friends and family. GREAT JOB......Anker.
title: It is somewhat bulky IMHO. Perfectly ok to carry in a backpack but in a pocket (jacket or pant or shirt) probably/may be not.

author: emily
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2018
review_content: Second update: Customer Service reached out to me and fixed everything! Their worker was very kind and helpful and replaced the broken charger so I now have two working ones and couldn't be happier! These things are a little heavy, but perfect for vacations, camping, Pokemon Go, theme park trips, and emergency situations. They really hold a lot of juice and charge my Samsung S7 several times. Highly recommended!Update: bought a second charger since I loved my first one so much. The second one I bought takes more than 24 hours to fully charge itself. The first one fully charges overnight, so definitely defective in some way.Best Portable charger I've ever owned. A bit bulky/heavy but has a lot of charge and does everything its supposed to. Gets us through theme parks with heavy phone usage, and great to throw in the bag just in case- so we never get stuck without GPS.
title: Lots of Power!

author: jenna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2019
review_content: this portable charger is a lifesaver! i go to a lot of concerts and would always bring a smaller portable charger, but it would never last that long and my phone would be on a low battery percentage before the concerts even started. after getting this portable charger, i never have to worry about my phone dying again! for a lot of my concerts, i'm waiting in line for 8-10 hours so i can get a good spot and this charger has lasted me way past that. it's usually only down to two bars by the time the concert is over! it also has two charger ports which is super convenient to share with friends! it's also fairly lightweight for it's size and power.
title: a must-have for all concert addicts

author: ParrottReader
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2020
review_content: The Anker PowerCore is a great product.  It does exactly what it is suppose to do.  I have no complaints on the product itself.  I give it only 4 stars because it arrived beautifully packaged but when opened it was filthy.  Some sort of sticky substance was on it and it was covered in what I think was fine sand.  Had to throw the bag, which came with it, away.  Thought about sending it back but I didn't have time to wait for a replacement, so cleaned it up and kept it.  No problems since.
title: Great product BUT.....

author: noah bloom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2017
review_content: This charger works really fast it can charge my iPhone 7+ about 6 times on a full charge and it charges it super fast. This charger has the ability to detect if the cord your using is slowing down your charging and if the cord is slowing it down the charger will push out more power to compensate. It takes a little while to charge but that's to be expected for such a high capacity charger. It's got some weight to it but again that's to be expected for the battery size. The charger also comes with a charging cord and a nice sleeve to carry and protect it with. Overall I'd buy this again and I'm 100% satisfied with my purchase.
title: ... times on a full charge and it charges it super fast. This charger has the ability to detect ...

author: CloArcega
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2016
review_content: Awesome portable battery!  I love the Anker products! I've used all their power supplies & cables, good quality, even better performance.  Purchased two of these as presents to family members and they love the fact they can charge their phones & tablets to full charge at least 3 or 4 times!  I recommend to decide on the PowerCore size depending on your usage.  Heavy users should look into 20000 mAh or higher.  Remember the larger PowerCore you get, the larger the battery will be.  So choose wisely if you require something small & convenient. Get their Anker 6 port 60W changer to help speed the process of charging your devices or portable batteries faster instead through computer usb port. It will open up plug space in your home!
title: Awesome Products!

author: L. Schrock
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2016
review_content: I have two Satechi batteries that I use to power a Nuvi GPS on cruises, but these are getting old and are fairly expensive to replace.  Thought I would try the Anker model, which is rated at twice the capacity of the ones I have and half the price.  So far it works very well and is just slightly larger than my old batteries.  The original battery would power the Nuvi for about 14 hours.  The Anker battery is still going strong after 48 hours, with 50% capacity left. No accessories included, except a nice mesh bag and a charging cord, but I really didn't need any more device adapters so this was fine with me.  You will want to use a fairly hefty power source to charge in a reasonable time.
title: Excellent battery pack

author: Nate
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2019
review_content: Let me start by saying, I LOVE Anker products and use many of them. So I bought this charger for my Pixel 3 XL. I was taking a vacation and would be using my phone for pictures ALOT. Doing this drains it's battery very fast. I bought this battery specifically for the 2 ports and even bought new Anker cables to supplement it.It took a charge fine and the LED lights are nice. But that's where the positives end. This battery refuses to actually charge anything. When you plug it in, it lights up and everything like you would expect, then a few seconds later, everything stops. You have to keep hitting the button on the side to keep it charging.  Or only is this inconvenient, it totally defeats the purpose of a standby battery if I have to babysit it the whole time. I've contacted Anker support about the issue but have yet to hear back, going on 2 days now.
title: PASS THIS UP!!! SAVE YOUR MONEY!!!

author: Tahirah F.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2018
review_content: Update!!!The company replaced my defective device! This is good customer service and I’m changing my rating to 5 stars.I bought this charger after several recommendations from friends and Amazon reviews in November of 2017. It’s now July 2018 and it doesn’t charge any of my devices. I haven’t even used the device more than maybe 7 or 8 times (mostly due to having access to chargers most of the time). I’m extremely disappointed in a product that came so highly recommended.
title: Battery pack was replaced aftee being defective.

author: Hira Hasnain
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2018
review_content: Great quality. 8 days honeymoon trip. Charged this in advance, and took it with us. Really ended up needing it as we travelled by car, we drove between France, Switzerland and Italy and this Power Bank helped us throughout the trip. We didn't use it constantly, and only began using it on day 2, so technically, it lasted us 7 days.Fair warning, it is kind of heavy, so be prepared for that, if you are planning on traveling with it in your purse. Other than that, super stoked with our purchase!
title: Wow!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020
review_content: Took this with us on our trip to Hawaii recently and it was great.  Used to charge phones and apple watch every night.  Lasts multiple days without having to recharge.  Has a spot for two cords which is nice so you can charge two items at once.  It does take a little while to recharge the unit, but plan to just do that overnight and you are ready to go again.  Only 4 led lights indicate the battery level so it could be improved with an lcd showing the percent like some others on the market have.
title: Very good portable charger

author: Ryan Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2019
review_content: Nearly perfect but the only thing is, its very easy to scratch the casing material. All i did was leave it in the backpack with some clothes and it had a ton of scratches from the plastic zippers on my pants...doesnt really bother me too muh but i reccomend puting this in some sort of protective cover or something unless you want it to look like Freddy Kruger just got done with it.
title: Terrific

author: Larry S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2018
review_content: This thing is awesome. I can charge my Samsung Galaxy S7 at least four and probably five times on one charge. It charges the phone very quickly, almost as fast as a wall plug. It does take some time to get it charged but that hasn't been a problem. The only thing to consider is the weight. It isn't the lightest thing but it probably wouldn't have the power it does if it wasn't built so sturdy. I'm sure someday that will change. I love everything I have gotten from Anker so far and will try to buy their products as needed in the future. I don't work for them or get anything from them but so far they have really good, well-built, quality products.
title: Loads of power. Love it.

author: Richard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
review_content: This unit works very well. I get about 4 full charges in an iPhone 7Plus.  My original order was partially defective and would charge about half capacity.  Customer service was in the spot and I had a replacement immediately.  Probably every so often there’s a bad cell in the unit.  Fits in the pocket, not terribly heavy, and decent capacity for the size.  Comes with a great padded mesh case and nice charging cable.  A good buy for spring storm power outlet and if you’re gaming your phone to death in a pandemic.
title: Good value, solid construction, handy product, and excellent support if needed.

author: Karen B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2020
review_content: Living in Florida so needed an option for charging devices in case of power outages. This was a great price and chargers what I need. Hope to never have to rely on this but great price and versatility. Would recommend for anyone needing for Android or iPad charging.
title: works on my multiple devices

author: Jeff pritchard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2019
review_content: This thing is mighty, I bought it for the Nintendo switch as well as tablets and cell phones while traveling abroad and extended times in the outdoors. This is a great accessory and I was truly surprised by the power it can store. Definitely worth a purchase for anyone who uses a good amount of tech and isn’t always near an outlet (or at outlet adapter overseas)
title: Great for travel or heavy tech users

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
review_content: This is my second unit of the same model. Unfortunately, this one was defective. I really liked the first unit, so I bought a second one. 3 weeks after I got the unit, I connected my phone and it started to charge normally. 30 min later, I checked the phone and the battery was lower than when I set it to charge. I switched cables and still got the same problem. I connected my other phone and same issue. The charger starts working and all suddenly stops. It did not work with my iPhone, neither with S10. I contacted their support and was asked to ship them the unit. I should have send it back to Amazon while I could.Another issue was homicide g the battery charge. I had the battery bank fully loaded; however, given the issues to charge, I put it away for one week while waiting a response from Anker, I turned the battery on and it was half way, when originally I left it full. Quality issues!
title: It stops working 10 minutes after charging begins

author: Zack
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2018
review_content: dear anker,my portable battery was working really well, charges my phone 0% to 100% in about an hour. but over the week (got it Monday 7/9/18), i noticed that my charger has been getting slower and slower. at first i assumed it was the cable so i went out and bought a new micro USB cable and still, it charged my phone 0% to 50% in 2 hours. so i tried many different cables ranging from expensive to cheap and they all came out the same. but still i wasn't assuming it was the charger itself, i decided to try my moms phone to see if it could work, her phone went from 45%-100% in 1 3/4 hours. at this point I'm sure its the battery that is causing my problem. but i do know that anker makes great portable batteries so don't use this as a reason not to get this, I'm just the unlucky percent of people to get a faulty model.[update] anker is sending me a new model! anker has amazing costumer support. i will keep this updated because i am going to keep trouble shooting to see what the problem is. i'm assuming its the ports and not the battery because i decided to let it charge for the night to see what would happen and it went from 0% to 100% in a couple of hours. so now i assume its the ports. i will keep posted if i find the exact problem.sincerely, zack
title: amazing battery and customer support, i just got a faulty model.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2017
review_content: I travel often and with the limited amount of power outlets on planes (and most of the time they don't work even if they are there) I don't know how I ever survived without this thing. I bought it for a two week trip to Germany but I use it constantly. I will last for a while and charges quickly but not so bulky that I cant have it in my back pocket with the cord running to my phone in a side pocket. Have had it for about 5 months now and have not had a single issue to speak of. I have actually bought quite a few Anker products since and there is no comparison for the high quality you get at a reasonable price vs the junk you get for going cheap.
title: I travel often and with the limited amount of power ...

author: Masada556
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2020
review_content: Worked great at first. Charged my S10e super fast, faster than plugging the phone into an outlet. Now the 4th charging light never stops flashing, no matter how long you charge it, and the battery is no longer holding a good charge, or able to charge my cell phone as well as it used to. Very disappointed with the longevity of this battery.
title: Worked fantastic at first, now not so much :(

author: Doctor W
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2016
review_content: My son had this on his Wish List, so I bought it for him as a gift. He was raving about how wonderful this portable charger was, claiming he could charge his Samsung S6 seven times without regarding the unit. Given how often my phone drains out and the inability to put a spare battery into the S6, I broke down and bought one for my self.My son was right. This charger can repeatedly charge my phone without draining the charger. It charges quickly and fully. I have been so impressed with this charger, that I am recommending it family and friends. It comes with a carrying case and charging cord, so it is convenient to transport and use. It is sufficiently compact to fit in my purse (although it does add a little weight to the bag). I would definitely buy this again
title: Worth every penny

author: Lam V Doan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2019
