review_content: This product can charge 8 iphones before dying.  The great thing is that it can charge 2 devices simultaneously.  There is a battery indicator represented by 4 blue dot lights which indicates the current battery life.  The charging is a fast charge too!Before not to splash water on this product because it will no longer function which was what happened to me :(  This is the second time buying this product, it means I like it alot!
title: Great battery life

author: Greg S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2015
review_content: This portable charger is quite convenient for people on the go. When I travel for races, I have a lot of small devices that need to be charged. Sometimes, the power plug is just too far away. With this, I don't have to worry, because I can charge with confidence without having to be near a power plug.I can charge my iPhone several times with this Anker battery before it needs to be recharged. It can also charge up smaller devices, like wireless headphones, Fitbits, or Garmin watches, quickly and efficiently. When I'm in remote locations, I bring this along so I can charge essential gear in case my car breaks down or I'm stranded somewhere.The only possible drawback I can think of is that the battery is a bit heavy. However, that's to be expected with batteries.
title: The price is right, the quality is awesome, and I couldn't be happier!

author: Dange M. Bertoldo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2016
review_content: Bought this for camping trips to charge my bluetooth speaker(also from anker) and ive used it more than ive expected.  this kept my note 4 and  bluetooth speaker fully charged for a whole 3 day weekend out camping  and I was playing music almost every hour there was daylight and reading on kindle at night,  so it got a workout,  heck ill even admit i took this out to go pokemon huntingtheres not much to say about it, its exactly what i wanted in a power bank,  large capacity,  easy charging (use the cord it comes with to both charge the power bank from a charger and then flip 180degrees around and charge your devices from the bank.)  its simple just charge throw in its cool little padded bag and go.  little blue leds will let you know how full it is.I only wish it came with a charger,  a nice 2.4amp charger would have really rounded the order out but at its price I cant really argue.
title: does what i needed it for and more.

author: Justin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2018
review_content: I use this power bank as a back up to run my tp cast wireless adapter for the HTC Vive I get 4 1/2 to 5 hours of use from it which is perfect. It doesn't get hot or warm to the touch even with the continuous power draw which is nice. It takes about 8-10 hours to charge I'm using the charger that came with one of my smart phones that has adaptive charging I just plug it in before bed and take it off before I leave for work this works out for me.
title: A back up power bank for HTC Vive tp cast wireless adapter.

author: Albert
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2017
review_content: So I have had this battery pack for a few days now. I have exhausted my Galaxy S7 edge  3 times now  down to 5%. I have used the charger to recharge the phone all three times and still have 2 bars of power showing on the pack. It recharges my phone just as fast as Ac power. I have not charged two items at the same time but, from what I am seeing with this charger I do not think it will be a problem.In 5 minutes It will charge +6% I am very satisfied with this charger, well worth the price. I have dropped this once and was fearful that I may have broken it. Not an issue at all. If you need a portable power charger this is the one for you.
title: Simply the best recharger I have ever owned.

author: Adam Spiegel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2019
review_content: I've had this battery pack for a little over 2 years now (25 months in service), and it's gotten to a point where the capacity is seemingly there, but the current isn't. It cannot keep up to the drain of devices in use, and just slows down their drain. If I keep screen off, or the device powered down, then it can recharge them. It's been very durable, surviving in either my back pocket or my belt pouch with nothing more than scratches. The USB-A ports don't hold the male connections too well, but they do work.I guess 2 years is sufficient use for the purchase price.
title: It's lived a hard life, but slowing down.

author: Brendon Slattery
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020
review_content: This product has a strong out current, however charge in and charge out options are very outdated. The USB mini charging was still only at 1/4 from an overnight charge (at least 10 hours). The USB A charge out, while it delivers strong, it is still lacking in compatibility with USB C products.This product would suite those that need a solid power bank for older type devices and don't need to upgrade for a few years. If you have or consider USB C devices that require constant travel charging, consider this may not be for you as the power out options are limited and the power in is very slow and outdated.
title: Cheap but obsolete

author: Isaac K
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2019
review_content: Update:I am changing my review from a 1 Star to a 4 star because this battery bank is actually solid. It charges fast and holds a lot of charges. The bad part of this bank is that it kills the usb cord quick. You’ll have to change your coords every now and then for the charging to be effective. I would still look for something better and more promising but nothing is perfect right? 🤷🏻‍♂️I just got the item TODAY but it doesn’t even work, and it was even delivered a day later than it was supposed to be delivered! DO NOT GET THIS ITEM!!
title: Ehhhh

author: blacklablover
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2018
review_content: I purchased this product June 2016 to use for traveling.  Whenever I purchase a product I do a lot of research and read reviews on Amazon.  This was highly rated and will say I have enjoyed the product.  I can plug in I- phone and Apple IPad at same time and both will quickly charge.  However, I am on a road trip and currently using product and I can not get it to charge.  Changed adapters still not charging.  I called Anker and found out about 18 month warranty.  I have owned it for 20 months, just missed the warranty by 2 months.  I am definitely concerned because it's not used on a daily basis and expected the product to last longer than 20 months.  Called amazon they referred me to Anker.  Called Anker customer service found out product is made in China.  They offered 20% discount on purchase of replacement charger.  I asked if this is  the same percentage whether I had owned product of 20 months or for 60 months,  in other words do they pro Tate discount based on number of year it has been owned?  I was told they do not pro rate.  Asked to speak with a supervisor.  I got a return phone call within 30 minutes very impressed spoke with Matt discussed my concerns.  I did have an additional concerned that when I went on to Amazon I saw that they were offering a 10% discount code so I questioned 20% discount from Anker, asking if this was now only an additional 10% from Anker?  Matt did confirm that the 20% was on top of the 10% that was being offered on Amazon. Matt did ask me to hold and then he did come back on the phone line and provide good news indicating that they would replace mine under warranty.  I didn't expect this and appreciate the effort that the company made to keep me as a customer.  I also discussed extended warranty, because I would purchase this, but they do not offer this
title: This was highly rated and will say I have enjoyed the product

author: leigh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2018
review_content: This thing is amazing! I saw it recommended in a Travel Group I'm with. My cell phone loses charge pretty quickly, especially when using it continually as a camera. I didn't want to be caught on my european vacation with a dead camera and purchased this with little expectation, to be honest.It blew me away! I could charge my cell phone from almost dead to fully charged, very quickly, and at least four times if not more before the battery even began to deplete. I would recommend this to everyone
title: Excellent purchase choice!

author: Sprklindiamond
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2020
review_content: Can't say enough good things about this Anker charger. I used to travel for work every week and this thing was a life saver. It was reliable and had a monstrous battery capacity. I never had to worry about running low on device battery and I could charge two things at once. It is amazing how small these are for the power it holds.
title: Lota of power in a small device!

author: Kevin McCarley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2019
review_content: Amazing, had over a year now, still just like new. Use it all the time. I travel a lot and do long hiking, camping, and bike trips. I take it everywhere. I.can fully charge my phone from 5% to 100% 2 to 3 times. I have a Galaxy S9. Charges quicker than my car charges my phone. The string on the cloth bag broke after a couple weeks but other than that, the battery is exceptional.
title: High Quality

author: Dan J
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2016
review_content: This thing is a life saver!! OK, not literally, but has been so useful in so many situations. It truly does have enough power to power you phone from 0-100% at least a solid 4-5 times, likely more, haven't pushed it that far. If you're in an airport and can't find a plug, just pull this out of your backpack.  At a hotel and not near a plug, same.  It charges at about the same speed as a high output wall charger, and the fact that you get so many charges out of it means you can use it over the course of an average vacation/business trip/event, and don't have to worry about recharging until you get home.  This is not something you put in your pocket or wallet, although it works well with a winter coat, so just be aware. But when it comes to being on the go, in the car, on a plane, this thins is MONEY!
title: Key Device to Have For Travel

author: Betsy V.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2018
review_content: Bought this back in May, to replace a VERY old charger.  I read many articles about the best charger for an android phone, and this was on all the lists.  Usually in the top 2.  That was good enough for me to take the plunge.  Sooo glad I did.  FANTASTIC charger.  I can get 4 full charges out of my phone at only 10% left, before needing to charge the charger.  Took it camping for 5 days, and it still had 2/4 lights left after I got home.  Bonus, it charges faster than my phones original charger.  I can literally get it fully charged in less than an hour, with only 25% left on my phone.  Super speedy.  The only negative is its weight.  Definitely heavier than my old charger. But it still gets 5 stars despite its heft.
title: I read many articles about the best charger for an android phone

author: Sheryle Bazan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2018
review_content: I purchased my Anker portable charger on September 30, 2016. Yes 2016!!! It worked flawlessly for over a year. Near the beginning of 2018 the charger’s USB ports stopped working. The charger would hold a charge, but wouldn’t charge any of my electronics.I set the charger aside, basically writing it off. For the price I was happy that it lasted as long as it did. I was without a charger for a couple of months and decided to buy a new one (April 2018). This is when I saw that Anker had an 18 month warranty. Technically I was just days outside expiration date of the warranty. I decided to take a chance anyways.I emailed Anker and gave my info and when I purchased it. Even though I was outside the 18 month warranty ANKER DECIDED TO SEND ME A REPLACEMENT!!!! Talk about customer service! I was already very happy with purchase. I can’t begin to tell you how pleased I am with Anker and their customer service! They have earned my business for life! Thank you Anker
title: Anker has earned a customer for life!

author: Recklessandbrave
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2017
review_content: I love this power pack! I used my friend's while we were camping and I knew I had to have one for going back to school. When fully charged, it will last unused for a week or more. When I use it, I can charge an almost dead phone 3-4 times. I also love that it has indicator lights to know how charged the pack is.My only complaint is that it did not come with a power block to charge it. It came with a cord (which is super short and I think meant for my phone more than charging the pack). I looked at the product description after it arrived and it didn't mention this.I want to give it 5 stars but the charger is a flaw.Get this item though. It's awesome!!!!
title: Great product but...

author: beachhawk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2016
review_content: This unit comes with the charger, a USB cable to charge the unit, and a nylon, drawstring bag.  The unit appears to be well engineered and well constructed.  It feels sturdy and substantial in your hand.  My only complaint at this point is the inadequate documentation that accompanies the unit. Having never had a portable charging unit before, I did not know what to expect. For example, I was very concerned when the unit did not fully charge for several hours, but then  I read the Q&A section and discovered that it takes 8-10 hours to fully charge.  The fact that Amazon lists more than two hundred questions and even more answers about this product indicates that the documentation is grossly inadequate, shocking in a product so well engineered.
title: Great Product-Poor Documentation

author: Jungah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2018
review_content: Update:Anker has reached out and fulfilled their warranty. But they're doing 1 better by sending me the upgrade: PowerCore II 20000. Waiting for it to be delivered, but I've already gotten a shipping confirmation, as well as a lovely email. I don't even have to return this one! I LOVE ANKEROdd... when I first got it, it charged my Samsung 7s Edge flawlessly on quick charge. Had two of my friends both charge 1 Samsung 8, and an iPhone 8 at the same time. They went from about 15% to 100% in about 1-1/2 hours. I recharged, and was trying to charge my phone and it won't quick charge anymore. I know the Anker charger is not Qualcomm compatible, but their own IQ fast charging technology usually works (I've had 3 car chargers that I've gifted and 1 of my own, that still quick charge all electronics). I'll give it one more try before I return it.... weird tho...I've only used it about a week on 3 charges.
title: Not as expected... worked perfectly on 1st charge. 1 week later, it won't fast charge my Samsung s7 Edge

author: Al Ross
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2018
review_content: My iPad is probably five years old at least, and it’s gotten to where it’ll drain the battery in 2 or 3hours .. admittedly I always have the WiFi on and screen pretty bright, so my battery conservation techniques aren’t great.  Looking at battery replacement s it looks like it’d cost about as much for a new internal battery, then the hassle of installing it?  Apple says they will do it for $100.  This is a pretty reasonable alternative.  It’s a little heavier than I expected but it’ll definitely bring the iPad back to full charge in a short time even while I’m using it.
title: A lot cheaper than a battery replacement.

author: Mark H. Rosengarten
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2019
review_content: I can charge my iPhone Xs Max for days on this thing.  I can charge my camera's battery.  I can charge my DJI Osmo Pocket's battery.  I can charge my iPad.  And have plenty of power left over for more.  The ultimate travel power pack in a very portable form factor.  The power indicator lights are very useful.  Very glad I bought it after my previous portable battery pack stopped charging.
title: Wow.  Power when and where you need it.

author: Brittney S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2016
review_content: I bought this so I could use my phone while on vacation without having to use it conservatively to save battery. I fully charged this the day I got it. While at Disney World I used my phone which is an iPhone 6S PLUS.. until it was at 10% and then plugged it into this charger. I left it in my bag charging for about 30/45min and it was already charged up to 70%. I only had to charge it once that day. Other then the weight of this product I haven't found anything else wrong with it. Super easy to use. I love that you can charge multiple devices which makes this a perfect thing to have in any emergency kit. Any road trip/vacation/camping trip I go on this will be in my bag for sure!
title: A must have for any occasion! 🙌🏻🔋

author: J. Howard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2019
review_content: Plugged it into the iphone wall outlet to USB brick for the initial, out of the box charge.  The current draw on this thing must be insane, because within a half hour the brick was extremely hot. I unplugged it as soon as I realized the charge light was off and it was getting hot. Can't charge the phone off it anymore, much less this power bank. No charging indicator at all on either.  The brick is cooked. I can move the charge cable to a straight up USB port on a UPS or something and it will still charge, but I won't risk plugging it into a computer USB port and killing that too. Be very careful what you plug this thing into. Fair warning.
title: Call me disappointed.

author: retiredhiker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2018
review_content: I purchased this charger primarily to take backpacking as it can be days between being able to directly charge up my iPhone X or iPad. I've not used it extensively yet, but I'm pleased with how quickly the unit charges when plugged in, how quickly my devices are recharged and how many charges I get from the unit. The customer service is great, several emails from them just to make sure I'm happy with the purchase - I am!!! Only downside is that it's a bit on the heavy side but I'll take the extra weight for being able to recharge!
title: Great charger!

author: Marlene M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020
review_content: I love the convenience this portable charger gives me.  Initially purchased for a trip to the bottom of the Grand Canyon but after I returned I use it whenever I’m outside or traveling.  The battery life is excellent and it recharged my phone quickly. When I had cause to use Anker’s customer service department, they exceeded my expectations.
title: A Must Have for anyone who travels

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2017
review_content: I bought this one for my wife as a gift.  It's not a small unit, but this thing has the horsepower to recharge your phone/tablet/iPod extremely fast, and will keep you going all day long.  I recently had a road trip, where we recharged my phone, my wife's phone (both of us have Samsung Galaxy--S4 and S5), and still had enough juice to let my daughter play on her 8" tablet all day long.  Plugged it in overnight at the hotel and it was fully-charged in about 8 hours.The auto-sense is a nice feature, because it doesn't over-charge my phone.  Battery indicator has 4 small LEDs to show how much power is remaining; they're small, and kinda hard to see in the mesh case, but they're bright and easy to read outside the case.  I love this brand!!!  I will stick with Ankers as long as they keep making them so great!!!Tip:  If you get this, there's a really nice hard case by Caseling that you can store your USB cords and recharger/ cord.  I recommend that, which costs about $13.
title: Good price for a quality product

author: Erwene Chiu
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2019
review_content: My anker was not even used heavily but today, it doesn’t charge anymore.  I’ve been trying to charge it for 2 days. It doesn’t charge. I thought buying anker a reputable brand would allow me to use this for many years.**UPDATE:  Jane in Customer Service reached out to me to replace my defective item.  I received the item less than a week.  I am proud to say that their Customer Service is next to none.  I am a very happy customer and even happier for choosing the right company who back up their products.
title: Doesn’t charge anymore

author: Nancy in Arizona
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
review_content: I have a smaller Anker charger and like it but this one lasts way longer and charges so quickly, too. It was great the night I got stranded in an airport and because of this great charger, I didn’t have to worry about finding somewhere to charge my phone!
title: GREAT, FAST CHARGER  Anker is the best!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020
review_content: Doesn’t charge past 80% sometimes. I have to maneuver it so it’ll charge. Same with the anker dual port plug in I bought with it. Takes longer to charge than the EasyAcc 20000 and doesn’t last as long. I only bought this cause my EasyAcc was stolen and I wanted to try something different. I’ll be going back to the EasyAcc or another brand.
title: Meh.

author: Gilbert Ho
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2019
review_content: Product unfortunately it failed, for unforeseen reason, the battery packed received a full charge, started to charge my iPhone 8+ my personal and iPhone 7 my work phone. it reached 85% and shut off, stopped charging. Some how managed to use up the charges to completely drain the battery pack, plugged in to house outlet to recharge it to 100% full again, test it again, the same thing, it stopped, shut off in the process of charging. ( see pictures, 4 blue lights=full charge. the time show 10;47am plugged in to start charge, with in 10 -15 seconds it shut off still 10:47am, all blue lights are off ),  Contact the seller ; Anker provide a great support to help test it out and determined it was defected, rushed me a new replacement, new battery pack.
title: 5 stars are for Great Customer support and service

author: ANN M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2019
review_content: I've beat the crap out of this thing as a bike messenger in NYC I've dropped it ar high speed at least 20 times and it's been run over by a truck, and even got rained on and stickk works great. The EasyAcc powerbank are excellent too. I actually like them better because they have a light built in, the 10,000 mah one is aweosme because it's the same side as your phone so you can hold them together in one hand nicely, this Anker one doesn't do that well. Still a durable powerbank though.
title: Very durable!

author: Ronald K.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2019
review_content: The Powercore was partially charged showing two of four indicator lights when I received it.  I charged two cell phones from 50% and one tablet from 45% before one of the lights started blinking.  I think its charging capability will be excellent when fully charged.  A big reason I chose this charger is that Anker's customer service, from previous experience, is beyond compare.
title: Anker customer service will not leave you drained!

author: Kelly Bezz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2017
review_content: This Anker external battery/charger is great. It comes with the charger, a carrying pouch and the USB charging cord. It takes a while to fully charge (4 blue dots) but once full it can charge my iPhone many times without recharging. I hooked it up to my Anker USB charger and it works great  This, like all Anker products has an 18 month warranty. This charger is much bigger in capacity and size than my slim Anker charger but it is  still wonderful. What's not to like? I highly recommend.
title: Big Anker charger

author: R. Shaw
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2020
review_content: We own four of these- one for each of us. They are fantastic! Fully charged, they last for a whole weekend hiking trip. They are heavy and take a long time to recharge but we use them each night to recharge phones and run small fans in our tent and they are perfect!!
title: Camping must have!

author: Kdperry7
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
review_content: If there is one thing I have learned is that every company is not as good as Anker - I buy tons of their products as gifts but this one was for me - I’ve been buying these backup type batteries from Anker going on 3 years now and the one time I ever had an issue they fixed it right away. I love that this is blue because I know this one is mine 😃❤️Thank you Anker for making a great product!!!
title: Anker is the best!!

author: Sasha Fernandez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020
review_content: Bought this in 2017 and used it many times for dirtbagging, car camping, backpacking etc. Finally bit the dust when both charging ports broke in the winter of 2019/2020. Definitely not quite the durability I was expecting, but I loved this battery pack while it lasted and would probably buy it again. Take care to keep it clean and stored well (the bag it comes with is not enough) and be very gentle plugging cords into it and yours may last longer than mine.
title: Pretty great for $35

author: Sonia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2018
review_content: Ideal piece of equipment.  I used the double-USB port charger to keep my Garmin 1000 and my Galaxy 6 at 100% charge for 18 consecutive hours while riding 200+ miles on my bicycle with several stops, from Seattle to Oregon.  I had the phone on full brightness, both devices synced via bluetooth, the Garmin on full brightness on map mode, and I had the phone doing the beacon thing to send my location to my wife.  It wasn't heavy, but it's a bit long, so make sure you have a top tube bag that is long enough.  After I was done with the ride, I used it to charge both my front light and my rear blinker, and I barely even touched the Anker's limit.
title: Kept a Garmin 1000 and Galaxy S6 at 100% for 18 hours with both on mapping mode, 4g/satellite, bluetooth, full brightness

author: Laura C Nash
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2016
review_content: This product worked successfully for ONLY 2 months. That is an UNACCEPTABLE timeframe for a product with this much capacity and hype!From the start, this product took FOREVER (2+ days) to achieve a full charge. At first I didn't think this was a big deal, considering the product advertised that it could charge an iPod/Bike Light/Wireless headset up to 10 times.However, after 2 months and registering a full charge on the portable charger, it still would not charge my personal devices. I continued to ensure that the Anker portable charger was fully charged (which it was) but nevertheless, it would not charge any of my devices including but not limited to my iPhone 6 or  iPod. I purchased this device specifically due to the high charging capacity since i own the iPhone 6s and that battery can't withhold a charge to save it'd life (maybe 3 hours max).I would not purchase this product again!
title: This product worked successfully for ONLY 2 months. That ...

author: Sarah R
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2019
review_content: This is the best battery we've ever used. We travel so much and this has been a huge relief to have knowing it has enough charge for 2 phones for the whole day, using a ton of data. It's a bit big, but we have a purse or bag when we travel with it or fits in a men's pants back pocket. You won't regret getting this battery. You might even ask, "when was the last time we charged it?"
title: The best for the money

author: Guyzie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2016
review_content: ***SEE UPDATE BELOW***I recently purchased two Anker PowerCore 20100 battery packs and although they do charge my devices, both battery packs arrived with defective functionality. When plugging my devices into the USB slot, they do NOT automatically start charging as it is claimed to do. Aside from the battery's capacity, having the auto-charging function was important for me when carrying the battery pack daily in my backpack as a means to charge my phone during my commutes. Instead of it charging automatically, I need to plug the phone in and then hit the side button to activate charging. Not a big deal, but i do have to dig around in my backpack to do so. The second problem is that when my iPhone 5 is fully charged, it does not know to shut off and the lights stay on and continue providing a current. I figured this would provide trickle charging, but after two nights on a fully charged battery pack, the battery meter shows a drop to 1 to 2 dots out of 4 on the battery meter. I called Anker, and they said this was unusual and offered to replace them or offered a 50% refund and voiding the warranty. I thought that was fair. If I got one that functioned as it should, I would not hesitate to give this 5 stars. I would also gladly purchase again from Anker. :)***UPDATE: Feb 23, 2016***I have since received exceptional customer service and follow up from Ida at Anker in getting me out a replacement for one of my two 20100mah PowerCore Anker chargers. I've been testing the new unit I received and it is working as it should. I have since upgrade my revied from 3 stars to 5 stars!! Would do business with Anker again no question!!
title: UPDATE: Automatic Charging Function Did Not Work...but still good!

author: DC shopper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2019
review_content: I purchased 2 of these in July 2016, they has been on multiple trips going overseas for vacation with family and friends. Also on multiple cruises where they have been very useful, while not on board the ship, to charge several phones, cameras and notebooks. Daughter uses one almost daily, while attending college full time, to charge notepad and phone, for the past 2 years (she swaps them every few days to recharge one, so both are being used).  These have had a lot of abuse (grandchildren, nieces, nephews and some "not so" sober adults) in all kinds of weather including sand at the beach and still work as good as the day I purchased them. Very Highly suggest purchasing this product!
title: Great product, still working as good as the day I purchased (now 2.6 years later)

author: atgio
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2019
review_content: Anker makes very good products from past experience. For some reason this charger has stopped charging my iPhone 7 consistently. Sometimes it will charge up to 90% and then stop charging.  Sometimes it won’t charge at all.  I plug it into my iPad Pro and it works. Not really sure what’s going on. Have only had it for just over two months. Not happy with this device.
title: Defective charger??

author: SpringsGardner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2017
review_content: A few months ago I purchased one of these, and it did ship a defective unit with a bad LED. And I called customer service, (I am quite sure I called the wrong department. Oops!) they happily sent me a new one, and even paid for the return shipping of the old one! (P.S. their customer service is amazing!) And the replacement unit has worked dependably to this day. (P.S. apparently the cells in the power bank are worth more than they are selling these things, and withthe high quality components, and excellent customer service, these powerbanks are a steal!) (Do be warned Anker is a Chinese company.)
title: Excellent value!

author: Lorgen Avila
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2019
review_content: Update: I received a new power bank and this works great. After fully charging it, it has last days of endless charges for my phone, tablets, even my pump! Great for traveling when you’re out and about and don’t have an outlet to charge your phone.I was excited to receive this power bank, as I needed it for some upcoming travels. I fully charged the power bank, and decided to test it before traveling. The power bank kept shutting off after several minutes. I had to keep pressing the power button in order to keep charging my electronics. Not sure if the one I got was a lemon, but I can’t use this power bank during my upcoming trips. Will be returning or exchanging.
title: Out of Power

author: Forrest
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2016
review_content: Everything is working good so far. Capacity is good i charged s7 twice, s7 edge, and my vape couple times and i still have 2 lights.Now the bad:1. Its heavy but not a problem for me2. I bought this cuz of 2.4A im comparing it with 3 different cheap powerbanks ($13- $18 price) all 3 of them rated at 2A output. Charging time is the SAME maybe the anker is 1-2mins faster if that. I feel like the marketing is kind of misleading. Thats the reason i gave this product 3 starsConclusion: DONT BUY this powerbank for 2.4A output, thinking it will charge faster than 2A output. Other than that i recommend this powerbank
title: Misleading. 2.4A is the same with 2A

author: Peaches
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2018
review_content: I purchased this item for a very long trip to Asia.  Many months later this charger has become a part of my portable office.  Traveling through airports and finding a place to plug-in is no longer a problem.  And what about those outlets on the plane where you have to be a contortionist to find the outlet holes...with this battery, problem solved again. If you are a serious traveler, you would not want to be without this.  It looks pretty hefty but it’s not as heavy as you might think.
title: Lifesaver!

author: Jean B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2018
review_content: My charger stopped worker a month before it had been a full year that I had it. I contacted the seller "Anker" through Amazon and they were excellent. They first suggested ways for me to try to get my orginal charger to work. When it still didn't work I informed the seller then they immediately rectified the problem by sending me a new charger. Good customer service and good portable charger very convenient. I would definitely purchase from this seller again and I would recommend it as well because of the quality of their product and their customer service.
title: Good Portable charger and excellent customer service

author: FullPlanet
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2019
review_content: So, yes, it charged our phones, BUT, only if I kept pushing the on button. I would plugs the phones in, the charging noise would go off, and 5 munites later I would check the phones and they both would have stopped charging. I would press the on button, they would charge for a few minutes, and the charge would stop. Over and over and over again.
title: Had to keep pushing the on button to get it to charge iPhone 6s and iPhone5

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2020
review_content: I purchased it for my light box which I use in my sewing class.  Very convenient as I don't have to worry about a power source.  Very pleased with purchase and also pleased with size...transport easily and doesn't take up alot of room on the sewing table.
title: portable charger

author: K&C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2017
review_content: I bought this for my wife in December of 2015. she was going to use it to charge her phone and GoPro while she hiked the Appalachian during the 2016 hiking season (she started late February 2016). within 2 weeks of the start of her hike she developed knee problems and had to come home. we packed all her hiking gear away including this Anker at that time. here it is August of 2017 and we started going through here hiking stuff again and pulled out the Anker and low in behold, it still has a full charge, 18 months later!  yeah! it works really well and holds it's charge. buy it!
title: Holds it charge!

author: Deniro
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2018
review_content: Had this for 2 years already. This thing really holds a charge. Dropped it on the ground multiple times and not a scratch on it. My only complaint was that the supplied cord broke quickly.Get yourself a brexlink armored usb cord for cheap and enjoy days of phone or laptop usage.Takes a couple hours to charge up from low power. But just plug it in when you go to bed every night and you'll have power all day, every day.
title: Worth it's weight in gold

author: Dave
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2016
review_content: Given the capacity of this charger, I was surprised at how fast it charges. This is a huge life saver when I'm travelling or am out and about playing pokemon go :D This might be a little overkill if you don't have a bag to throw it in, but its not that big of a deal. While it can be a bit cumbersome to put it in your pant pocket and always carry it around, it fits in my coat pocket rather nicely. Its basically the size of another cell phone. It feels really well made and came with a little carrying pouch to protect it from getting scratched. It also came with a regular USB (type A) to micro USB cable. If you are looking for a spare battery with a pretty large capacity, I would recommend getting this!
title: Power for all my devices

author: Oscar Ajo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2015
review_content: Upside: Charges my Samsung Galaxy S4 5 or 6 times, and charges it FAST.Upside: Charges my ancient iPad 2 1 or 2 times, depending on how low I let it get before I put it on the battery.Downside: Takes 5-10 hours to charge the battery itself (hey it's a BIG capacity battery) so plan ahead.Downside: Size - this thing isn't going into your pocket; it's the size of a big tv remote. Perfect for your carry-on bag though.Overall - I travel a lot, and this thing is perfect for long airline flights, or anytime you won't be around a power plug for a while.  I keep it in my backpack.  So nice to be able to wander around while my phone charges for the fifth or sixth time on a long trip, and not have to search out a power outlet and be tethered to it.  Especially nice at airport terminals where they haven't figured out yet that everybody has devices and there should be a plug by every seat!
title: Perfect for your carry-on bag though

author: StevieK49
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2016
review_content: I have used the portable charger several times and so far I am happy with it. After I received it I fully charged it and then started plugging in my devices to charge. I charged my iPhone 6 a couple of times from just over 20% charge left on it as well as my iPad one and a half times before the charger needed to be recharged. Now if it lasts at least up to the 18 months then this product deserves a 5 star rating. I bought this charger to replace a Justin (brand) charger I purchased at Kohls. It was a 10000mAh unit I believe. When I got it I fully charged it as well before using it. At full charge it showed 99% charged. I guess the manufacturer was to cheap to add another digit to the display. It did not fully charge my iPhone or iPad. At most it charged it only to the 90-92% level. And when the unit showed 65% charge left on it, it would not charge anything anymore it had to be recharged. The Anker unit has 4 led's to indicate its charge level and when it is fully charged it turns off automatically to avoid overcharging whereas the Justin charge didn't. And when it needs to be recharged one led is on and it blinks. This unit fully recharges my devices unlike the Justin.
title: Works as advertised so far.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2016
review_content: A little heavy and bulky to carry for every day power ups, but throw it in a travel bag and you'll wonder how you ever survived without one! I laugh now at folks who are scurrying about in airports looking for a plug. If they're really nice, I'll let them use my spare USB port to charge their device.The carry bag it comes with is nice and holds the mini cords I bought to use with iPhone   Anker PowerLine 1ft Apple MFi Certified Short Lightning to USB Cable Sturdy Charging Cord for iPhone 5/5s/5c 6/6s Plus, iPad mini/Air/Pro iPod touch(Space Gray)           or microUSB   Anker PowerLine Micro USB (1ft) - The World's Fastest, Most Durable Charging Cable, with Kevlar Fiber and 10000+ Bend Lifespan for Samsung, Nexus, LG, Motorola, Android Smartphones and More (Black)
title: The best for traveling!

author: Mathew Thomas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2019
review_content: The battery comes with a comfortable and neat little pouch that you can keep in your pocket and have little worry about the battery getting scratched or dirty.It works as intended, charges in under a night of sleep and can charge my phone and others multiple times (7 or more really.) times a week and still have some juice left. It can fully charge my shield tablet 3 times before needing to be charged.It's everything I wanted in a battery and it has a warranty too. <3Mines still working great since the day I bought it.
title: Hefty brick of power

author: Plexus Princess
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2017
review_content: Purchased to replace my first portable charger (6000 mAh) from 2012. It was a good charger to start with, but took too long to recharge, for me at least. This Anker is AMAZING compared to that one, and DEFINITELY worth a try...YOU WON'T BE SORRY📱The only slight hesitation I had before I purchased was the fact this item DOES NOT have charge passthrough. IT CANNOT CHARGE THE DEVICE(S) WHILE CHARGING, SO DON'T EXPECT IT PEOPLE!!! (Feature I loved about my previous...IT DID!)Very nice to have with you in the car, at work, on trips/vacations/outings, family get-togethers (if you don't mind getting/answering questions because I have gotten quite a few enthusiastic ones👍🏻), trips to the store or your kids' school for whatever reason...& COUNTLESS OTHER USES!!!Basically, it's a lifesaver when you can't be right by a USB port to charge your mobile device. When you return to home, work, car or computer, just charge this Anker and you'll be ready for your next rounds😃 I don't use it daily, but when the pack does drain on me, all it takes is overnight to 100%!One of my favorite purchases of 2016, and you won't be sorry when you purchase it today!!Take care and much thanks to Anker!
title: Amazing backup juice! WON'T DISAPPOINT📱

author: siren
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2018
review_content: My job has a lot of "hurry up and wait" to it. Sometimes for hours at a time, outside, with no access to a charger. I'm constantly using my phone to keep up with tasks, and this charger has been a lifesaver. It is heavy, and it doesn't fit easily into a pocket or a small purse, but I'd rather carry a bigger purse than have a less reliable charger.While my phone doesn't tell me it's fast charging, I do notice a distinct increase in the speed of charging between this and smaller portable units.I'd owned it for about 6 months when it died after a particularly hot 5 days of constant charging. It would take a charge, but it wouldn't send one out anymore. I contacted Anker about for the warranty, and they replaced it right away. Hoping the new one lasts longer than the first because this charger is practically perfect when it's working.
title: For long days and constant power needs, heavy but worth it

author: Gene Arrow
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2019
review_content: Overall the battery design, size, and capacity are good. The problem this battery doesn't last long, even if you use it or not. It purchased one less than two years ago,  it stopped working, and I got a replacement. The replacement battery also stopped working. So within less than two years, two battery stopped working, and I barely used them.
title: doesn't last long

author: Amazon7Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2018
review_content: Update: Anker was quick to respond and easy to work with. Stellar product support. I received a replacement within a week. I wish all companies were this prompt and professional.Original review: I've had this charger for less than 3 years. It has probably been used a dozen times. It has not been dropped or damaged. It no longer holds charges. ANKER usually has solid product support. I will reach out to Anker and will update this review if needed.
title: Update: power horse, power support

author: Amy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2018
review_content: This is such a great battery pack! I bought this in August 4, 2017 and received it a week or so after I FULLY charged it ONCE and I used it to charge up my iPhone and my Bluetooth headphones and it’s only on 3 bars battery. I love how it automatically shut itself off when the device is fully charged and it only takes about an hour (if your playing with your phone when it’s charging from dying). Still pretty good. I’m thinking of getting another for my friend’s birthday because they love it so much as well
title: Best $40 spent!!!

author: carl TALAUE
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2018
review_content: I didnt even get to use this item! i was really looking forward to using this on a trip. and as I received it had 2 bars of charge and I charged it fully. After being fully charged it seemed to drain itself within 2 hours and now no longer charges at all even after being connected overnight. I tried different outlets and different cables to charge the device and nothing. Started the return process immediately!UPDATE! I must say this 5 stars is for their service. they messaged me after my original post and went beyond to help me resolve. They sent me replacements and we resolved everything. They were very patient with me as well. honestly, I have always loved their product and was bummed that the original one i bought was a bust but the final replacement that was sent is working great!
title: I have always loved their product and was bummed that the original one ...

author: Dominique Njemanze
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2019
review_content: We bought this charger for our vacation. It held the charge very well. But when we would plug in a phone it would charge it for like 5 mins the. Stop so we had to keep pressing the button every 5 minutes to keep charging our phones. The charger it self was charged all the way so I really don’t understand why it kept doing it. I wouldn’t recommend this product as it should be able to charge things without having to keep pressing a button every 5 minutes. Because the battery life should be able to charge a laptop.
title: Powers off every 5 minutes

author: James
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2016
review_content: Great capacity and fast charge time. Sometimes I find myself charging my phone and devices on this portable charger instead of the designated outlet charger because I would rather have the faster charge time! It is on the larger side so I wouldn't recommend buying it if you intend on putting it in your pocket. If you are looking for a portable charger and don't mind it being bigger on the compact size then this is the one for you. But it is portable and fits great tucked away in a bag or backpack etc. Note: Wait for all 4 blue lights to be on to indicate the charger is full charged
title: I thought my charger was stuck at 3 blue lights but it actually needed to charge longer than I expected.
verified: Fast charge time, great capacity. Works as intended!

author: Alan Zulch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2019
review_content: My PowerCore 20100 has been around the world a few times, saving the day from northern Kenya to remote Cambodia where no line power was available. Finally, it no longer charged, and when I got home I contacted Anker customer service. Remarkably, they instantly responded with concern that the power bank failed, and wanted their technicians to analyze it to learn from the problem. They included clear instructions for returning the device and assured me that the moment it shipped they would send a new replacement, which they did. I'm now back in business.
title: Excellent product, top notch customer service

author: Diego Schelling
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2019
review_content: I highly recommend this product to anyone who is away from their home and needs to charge their phone. You can take it with you on a plane, train, car ride, school, work, you name it! It takes a long time to charge all the way up to 100% but that’s obviously for a good reason. This portable charger charges my phone super fast. I recommend (if you’re using iPhone) to turn in low battery mode to charge it even faster.It doesn’t just charge your phone. It also charges your laptop, Nintendo switch, or literally anything else you can think of that’s compatible with USB.
title: Amazing product

author: R. Chapman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2019
review_content: I just received this unit and I will be testing it extensively before I take off to South America for several months. The weight is suprisingly heavy and that was a bit disappointing as backpack weight is very important when traveling for 4 months. If the unit continues to work and has no problems, but if I experience any issue in the next few weeks, I will update and possibly send back for a lighter unit.
title: Heavy, but big capacity

author: Emily DeLeon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2016
review_content: This Anker 20,000mAh PowerCore portable charger saved my life while traveling abroad! Using Google Maps to navigate (rather than being a tourist and whipping out a paper map) and taking lots of photos and videos to cherish the moments well into my old age really drained my iPhone battery! I had to charge up my iPhone at least twice each day while out and about exploring the city. I was so thrilled that my package arrived in time for my trip, otherwise I probably would have spent a lot of time at coffee shops trying to charge up my iPhone or had my battery die on me leaving me to be completely lost in a country where not many people speak my language or not being able to take photos or videos to send home to friends and family! I've had many many many portable travel chargers in my lifetime, all of which massively failed me in charging up my devices and other peoples' devices up multiple times throughout the day. This charger comes with a handy carrying case where I can store the included micro USB to charge it. However, it doesn't come with a wall charger or any lightning cables to charge your iPhone/iPad. But then again, not many travel chargers don't either so this wasn't a big deal to me. This Anker PowerCore portable charger was very affordable compared to the travel chargers I purchased in the past, so I definitely have to say this charger is well worth the money! I can't recommend it enough!
title: I can't recommend it enough

author: John Paul Douglass
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2017
review_content: I purchased my first PowerCore 20100 in October of 2015.  The product worked wonderfully for several months and then just stopped working 13 months later without showing any signs of failure.  I had used the backup heavily throughout that period and was very impressed with is functionality.  Thankfully Anker has an 18-month warranty.  I contacted them and they shipped out a replacement.  Now it's 7-months later and the replacement they sent is having the exact same issue.  2 months out of warranty from my original purchase...  My belief is that the battery has a minimum voltage that if drained below, will no longer accept a charge.  If this is the case then it is poor engineering and a higher cutoff limit should be set.  Such a shame as it as an otherwise wonderfully performing product.
title: Stops accepting charges if it doesn't get charged immediately after being drained.

author: mmr859
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2019
review_content: It won’t charge anything unless you continuously hit the power button on the side. I bought it last month to use this weekend at a convention. Now it's outside the return window. I’m mad because it cost me $50 for something that doesn’t work.
title: DO NOT BUY

author: Gary
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2019
review_content: I have had Anker products in the past and they have worked great.  I purchased this one as my prior large capacity charging block was given to my son.  This one worked well for a few weeks then would not fully charge.  I contacted the company and they had me try a few things to see if I was doing something wrong, or if my cord was faulty.  After quickly determining that there was an issue with the charger they sent me a pre-paid label to send it back.  As soon as I dropped it in the mail they received notice that it had been sent and they immediately shipped the new one to me.  This one is working great.  I am very happy with the way that Anker responded to my issues and will continue to be a loyal customer.  Things happen, but when a company responds like Anker did, that's the real measure of a company that values their customers.  Thanks!
title: Excellent product. Excellent post-sale customer service

author: Jinuine Reviews
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2016
review_content: Anker has done it again.I have been using Anker products for several years and I am confident that Anker has one of the best customer services. I have had a couple of times (2-3) where the items that I have purchased were missing parts or stopped working. However, the Anker team was always quick to resolve the problem. For this particular product, the charging cable was missing, but they were kind enough to send it not once but two times (the first time the item was not properly delivered to my address, so they sent a brand new charging cable).Anker PowerCore 20100: 9/10 (I feel like my phone drains the charger pretty fast, considering that this product is supposed to charge the iphone 6 "7.3" times. I haven't actually measured, but it feels like it is draining fast.) For iphone users, you probably need to use your iphone charging cable. It does not come with a separate cable to charge your iphone. The cable looks like it would charge the samsung phones? not sureCustomer Service: 10/10.
title: I have been using Anker products for several years and I am confident that Anker has one of the best customer services

author: monique
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2019
review_content: I've owned this charger for 2.5 years and take it with me everywhere. Super convenient when traveling as it can charge my phone 6x so I never have to worry about my phone dying while I'm sightseeing, using Google Maps, taking 100s of photos, live tweeting conventions etc.Holds a charge for months without needing to plug in and small enough to take in a fanny pack or deep pockets.My only complaint is when it dies, it takes almost a whole day to fully charge
title: 2.5 years old and still going strong

author: Panchito Rodriguez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2018
review_content: I was really looking forward to this. I know Anker offer quality products at unbeatable prices. Upon receiving my packages I was stunned. The presentation is phenomenal. Felt like I was unboxing an Apple product.The power bank itself feels durable and it’s actually quite small. I was expecting a much bigger and bulkier design but this model is very well designed. Fits snug on the side of my backpack with extra space leftover over for some lightning cables, pens, etc.Overall I really liked the product design. Sadly, this power bank charges super slow, to the point where I just began using a wall charger instead of this.Pros-price-quality-designCons-charges super slow-getshot (not sure if that’s normal)Update 11/17/2018: I gotta give it to Anker their customer service is by far the most supportive and caring customer service i've ever dealt with. They acknowledged my review, offered me a replacement and BAM just like that, I was taken care of. The replacement they sent me charged my iphone super quick and its not faulty!! Thank you for your help!!
title: High expectations, big surprise.

author: Alex Linebrink
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2015
review_content: This thing is awesome. I use it to recharge a lot of things on the go, but here's the big one: my drone/quadcopter batteries!I have a few different mini quadcopter drones that I love going out to fly with, but my flight time is usually limited to ~ 7 minutes per battery. Even with a couple spares, that just isn't a lot of time. The Anker PowerCore 20100 helps me extend that time. I just plug in my USB battery charger to the PowerCore, and by the time I've used up my two spares, the first one is done recharging.It works as advertised, and even supports rapid charging. Two quick tips though:1) While this device puts out enough power for rapid charging, some chargers can't support it. Make sure to get a charger/cable that will!2) It has two ports! Use them both simultaneously for max charging efficiency.
title: Fast charging, huge capacity. Great for recharging your drone batteries (or anything else) on the go!

author: Consumer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2019
review_content: By charging the power bank and then charging iPads, it seems that the capacity is under 20k.  BUT compared to my other power banks (such as All-Power):1.  This Anker is better constructed.2.  Is auto-activated.  When a device to be charged is connected, the unit starts charging without having to press a button (such as one has to do with All-Power)Recommended.
title: Manufacturer probably rated the capacity too high, but this power bank is worth buying

author: Alma
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2017
review_content: It has been over a year since I bought this portable battery pack. I have bought several Anker products over the years, and I have to say they make quality stuff. There hasn't been any battery deterioration or issues with the battery.- DESIGN: this battery is on the heftier side, but it makes sense considering the capacity of the battery. it is sleek and functional, and easy to carry with you. The mesh carrying case it comes with helps to cushion it from other things carried with it (other objects in a bag or backpack, pocket, etc).- BATTERY: I bought this battery during a black Friday sale, so the price for the amount of battery was a great deal. I wanted a large capacity battery that could charge my Galaxy Note Pro 12.2 tablet completely (tablet has a 9,500 mAh) and the Anker powerCore delivered. It is able to charge my tablet and my phone completely with some juice left, or charge my tablet twice, or my phone at least 5 times fully. I am able to charge my devices quickly and while I am using them.- DURABILITY: I have dropped this thing so many times and from various heights, that I am surprised it hasn't dented or stopped working all together. now I am not say be reckless with it, I am just saying that it will most likely withstand some accidental drops and bumps.- CHARGE TIME: depending on what type and speed the charger you are using to charge the PowerCore with, the average charge time is  between 10-14 hours. If using a slow charger, it could take over 20 hours. I usually let it charge overnight while I sleep, and it it good to go in the morning.- FINAL THOUGHTS: It is an excellent product, I highly recommend this portable battery. I can't tell you how many times I have lent it out to my friends and family so they could charge their devices. It comes in handy on long trips and is generally a good thing to carry around. I have used it as a flashlight by attaching a USB powered LED light, powered a USB fan, and many other USB powered things. The uses are innumerable.
title: Over a year, and still going strong

author: Jilly Stras
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2019
review_content: I have many battery pack chargers, and this one beats them all! It beats them by a long shot too! After charging it completely it charges my tablet, phone, and vaporizing pen, without needing another charge. It's awesome! You'll definitely love this as much as I have.If you've tried others, I highly recommend giving this a go. You'll see that it out performs any that you've had previously.
title: Best Charger Ever! Get It!!

author: Shawn Gipe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2019
review_content: Originally wrote a positive review about this product, which was purchased in June 2019.  However, the charger will no longer charge other devices.  The portable charger shows  fully charged, but will not charge other devices.  I’ve tried charging multiple devices with multiple cords but it will not charge other devices.  Very frustrating as I don't use the charger that often and has never been dropped or damaged in any way.  DON’T purchase unless you plan to replace it within a year.
title: Don’t Buy Anker Power Core 20100

author: lombardi4vr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2020
review_content: We have purchased another charger similar to this, so we thought we'd pick up one for my daughter headed to college. When it arrive, we started charging it, but after 4 hours, it was still at two lights and not completely charged. We returned the item. Disappointed.
title: Did not charge, disappointed.

author: Corey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2017
review_content: I constantly get compliments on this thing. It charges incredibly fast, and fits in my pocket. I pulled it out at Disneyland and the people I was with were so impressed, they bought one on amazon while we were standing in line!It gives me about 3 or 4 charges on my S7 galaxy. I recommend buying 2 and charging these rather than your phone at night and trading off the chargers while the other is at home charging. I've had it for about 5 months now and it's just as good as it has always been.
title: Everyone is ALWAYS so jealous of this

author: BrentH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2015
review_content: Charged the unit immediately when received and then waited for both of our cell phones to run down. We have a Note 3 and a Galaxy S5, both of which where discharged to below 20%. The charger had both of them back to 100% in 80 minutes...amazing! I will confirm one thing, when reading the instructions/user guide it says they advise purchasing the Anker PowerPort USB charger and I understand why after attempting to charge this with my phone charger (the OEM Samsung). While the phone charger did the job, the charger got so hot I could not touch it and feared I had done damage. I immediately ordered the PowerPort 4, used the charger a few more times, and then recharged it with the new charger with no issues and it charged faster.
title: Very happy, but buy the PowerPort also!

author: Sushant
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2020
review_content: This is my update on this charger. I was provided a new charger by the seller and tried and tested the battery charger for over 10 days and it was satisfactory. Probably the previous charger was among one of the defective pieces. All satisfied.-------------------------------------------------------------------We wanted a good capacity charger for our camping trip to charge our phones and iPads. Up to 2 charges of my iphone all was working fine and then suddenly it went down from 3 light indicating around 10-12k mah to zero light. We had a hard time charging our devices rest of the trip.
title: UPDATED REVIEW: The product works nicely now

author: Zach Spaulding
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2017
review_content: Update:. Since my first review, the company send me a brand new one due to the faulty one sent to me.  I still love the product, just hope it does not happen again.  Great customer service!!!!I've had this charger for roughly 6 months.  Up until last week i wouldve given it 10 stars.  Charged my phone all the way faster than the wall charger.  As of right now,  it has a full charge but will not charge my phone a quarter of the time as fast as it used to.Recommended this product to all my friends and more than 4 have purchased it becuase of mine.  Sadely i hope this does not happen to them.
title: Fantastic at first....

author: lylou
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019
review_content: Stops charging devices almost every time and when it does it charges super slowly. Have to keep hitting the button to make it charge and it’s virtually brand new. Not happy and was unable to use effectively on my trip, running out of battery :(Will have to purchase a different one for my next trip. It is also very heavy, so consider that when purchasing.
title: Didn’t work

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020
review_content: I enjoy anker products. The brand is usually a quick identifier of quality in my world. This product unfortunately has changed that. When it charges, it does it well. But, it will only charge for 1 or 2 minutes and then turns itself off. Powering down automatically would be a great feature if it only did it once charging was complete, not still at 34% when only 1 or (if lucky)2% charge gained. I have used this on a variety of items( galaxy s10+, galaxy buds, valve index controllers, ps4 controllers) and it does this no matter what is plugged into it.
title: Won't charge for more than a brief moment.

author: Blake W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2018
review_content: Over the last several years I have felt severely limited while using my phone on back country excursions. I love the apps for the outdoors but found that using them burned up my battery way too fast, often within one day. I used with little success and many headaches a solar charging system that was crippled by the weather. I needed more battery! I read many reviews and took the plunge. I fully charged the Anker PowerCore 20100 and charged my Galaxy S6 five times with it! I can now use my phone to it's full potential during 3 - 5 day excursions! From location and trail marking to video and photography of scenery and wildlife I can know where I am at and capture forever the moments I love!
title: Great Battery Life!

author: david zuber
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: I bought this device to recharge my phone for Pokemon Go!I was tired of feeling inadequate in chasing Pokemon, I hated when my phone died and I had to go home.My friends recommended Anker power cores.specifically the 2.4/portanother friend was lookig for a smaller version and went to a local brick and mortar store whose name starts with Targe  and was dissapointed with the lack of information available on their selections.I immediately sent her to Amazon and Anker so she could find a power core to fit her needs.Mine is a bit large for casual carrying around, but it has a satisfying heft, like I could fend off attackers with it.It charged my iphone6 while I had Pokemon Go running! (and the game is a battery drain)You will need a cable (typically supplied with your phone) to charge your phone and with the spare port you can help your team mate stay in the game longer too!my only suggestion is if you are both going to tether off a single power cord, buy an optional longer cable.but guys,  if its a special lady you want to keep close, use the standard short cable, she will stick by you and your Anker.!Happy Hunting!
title: I hated when my phone died and I had to go home.

author: juan carlos barajas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2018
review_content: Bought this to take with me when I went to Mexico. Overall worked good and charged my iPhone 7 Plus pretty fast and didn’t take long to recharge. Only downside is Iv only used it a handful of times and now one of the terminals doesn’t work and the other is starting to go out I bought this October 2017 so it should still fall under there 18 month warranty. But not sure how to go about getting replacement10/3/18 update  contacted customer support and they responded next day in regards to my problem had me test a few different things out and try seeing if there was something causing the problem. After some trouble shooting and emails they finally offered to send me a replacement unit. It was very easy and hassle free. Great customer service that went above and beyond
title: Works good when it works

author: Miah8000
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2018
review_content: We bought this to take as a backup for wall chargers in Europe. One of our wall adapters didn’t work properly and we ended up using this to charge the phones for a few days and then charged it off the jack that worked. The battery indicator is key and very useful and while a little heavy and long, it performed perfectly and fit anywhere we needed to put it while we travelled. I carry it in my commuting backpack in a small pocket inside and it fits well.
title: Charged two phones for several days when the wall chargers wouldn’t work

author: Monsieur Brutal Honesty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2018
review_content: Really reliable. It does take quite a while to get to 4 bars/dots for a completely fully charged battery. On average I'd say roughly 6-8 hrs. But once fully charged, you can pretty much use this 1 or 2 days on heavy use (phone only). I've also dropped this a few times accidentally. While cosmetically it is a little dented/brushed, functionality is excellent. Great build. I will have to buy larger capacities in the near future and hope I don't scratch those.
title: Power up!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2018
review_content: Bought a new backpack for vacation to Europe. Backpack included a charger. So I Purchased this battery for backpack backup. The battery isn’t heavy. Does include a storage bag for battery and charging chord. I kept in bag. I used every day during my trip. Not once did the battery come close to needing to be charged. Didn’t charge as quickly as I thought it would. Maybe my expectations where unrealistic. I charged overnight so I had full battery backup. Did give peace of mind knowing had this backup battery.
title: Comfort knowing have backup Battery

author: steven
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020
review_content: Superb power brick!! This thing has been all over the world with me and it's still going strong. I can get about 4 to 5 full charges out of this for my iPhone X. I would not for one instant hesitate to buy this thing again. Well worth the money. Would definitely recommend.
title: Best charger ever!!

author: Edward Nemec
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2017
review_content: The Anker PowerCore 20100 is almost overkill when it comes to a battery charger. I use this battery pack to run my GoPros at tennis tournaments and it can keep my the cameras operating for 24 hours. I have even charged my iPhone 6s Plus and iPad Air after using the battery packs with my GoPro cameras. I highly recommend this battery pack if you need something with substantial power usage and need a reliable battery pack that can charge devices for a long substantial time. On a side note, I had these battery packs exposed to outside heat and sunlight and have not noticed any degradation in their performance or reliability.
title: I highly recommend this battery pack if you need something with substantial ...

author: Omer D. Williams
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2017
review_content: When It came it was showing a 2 light charge in it so since then & before I charged it I have charged my phone 2 X's and some Sony ear buds 1 time at which point the battery was only showing 1 light. Anyway, I have since charged it up all the way but have not used it to charge anything yet. I will say however that it is a little bigger and heavier than I thought it was gonna be. Clearly this thing is going to hold a lot of charging for just my phone, (iphone 7) and Sony earbuds, but then its purpose is for just that while on motorcycle trips, (Heritage Softail, no cigarette lighter).
title: Maybe more than I needed.

author: Joy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2018
review_content: I ordered the Anker power bank just in time! Hurricane Florence set her eye on my area in NC.. with mandatory evacuations in place, I knew that I'd have use of my cell phone even if I didn't have a means of charging my cell the "conventional way" My son purchased the Anker a while ago and advised us to get one as well. So happy I heeded his advice!  This power bank is awesome...its nice looking, and doesn't take up room in your suitcase or larger purse!
title: Be prepared!

author: Steven p
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2018
review_content: I bought this product about 8 months back and never noticed one charging port didn't work. I contacted Anker about it and it was under warranty so they sent me a new one no questions asked! They even let me keep the old one. That's great customer service and the new one works great! I've had some of their products before and still use them, but this just made me realize I won't ever buy anything besides an Anker.
title: Only buying Anker from now on!

author: Jane
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2019
review_content: I ordered the charger to take on a trip the I was taking. When it came the charging cord did not work. I was abole to charge it with a cord that I borrowed from someone and it stayed charged all weekend with out another charge. I was very pleased. I received a message that Anker wanted me to verify my address. I did and the nest day I had a new cord. Now that it fast. I really appreciate it. I love the charger, just what I needed. Thank you Anker.
title: Great Support

author: Big Expectations
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2019
review_content: Bought this a few years ago to use as a charger for my iPhone. It's heavier than a few other chargers I own, but it packs a punch and lasts a good long time. I play a lot of Pokemon Go and I usually use it in the car because it is heavier than the others. But when I need a dependable, quick charge I go right for it. Durable and charges overnight. Recommend  for heavy phone users!
title: Old Reliable...

author: Mr&MrsFleming
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2018
review_content: This battery lasts an incredibly long time.  It's slightly heavy but that's a problem well worth the benefits you get. I will sometimes keep this in my pocket since it's so thin and slim, making it easy to charge my phone on the go or keep it charged if I'm using an app on my phone that murders my battery.They also have fantastic customer service.  My first battery was broken so I emailed them about it and they got it resolved within 3 days.
title: definitely recommend!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2020
review_content: I purchased this portable battery back in February and unfortunately for some reason it stopped working some time this past August. I got in contact with Kurina a representative from Anker customer service. She was so helpful and she was able to get me a replacement. The shipping of my new device literally took 24hrs to arrive. Very happy with their customer service. Thank you Kurina!
title: Great customer service!

author: Premal Dinesh Patel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020
review_content: Please beware, this battery caused a small fire within our JBL speaker.  There was way too much heat when connected and the battery melted and speaker had a small fire inside.  This happened the first time I used this battery with this speaker.
title: Thermal event with battery connected to JBL Speaker

author: Amy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2020
review_content: I bought this battery pack for travel (specifically camping).  While it is a little big and heavy, it charges very quickly (I have a Samsung Note 8) and I can get multiple charges from it. I believe it does take a while to recharge the pack (not sure on the exact time), I usually charge the pack while I'm sleeping.Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase.
title: Quick charge

author: Livingdeadgirl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2019
review_content: This charges my iPhone 8 about 7 times which is great being away from electricity for long periods of time. I love the little cover it comes with and that it can charge 2 devices at once. It charges my phone almost as fast as an outlet but it does take awhile to charge itself. The blue dots that I dictate battery life are a great feature.
title: Good durable portable charger

author: zamnoi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2017
review_content: Purchased the Anker 20100mAh in August of 2016.  I have used it every day for almost 13 months.  The battery charged my iphone and laptop several times on a single charge and I usually ended up recharging it once a week.  And although bulky and a little on the heavy side, I highly recommend the battery for its dependability and high charge capacity.  Unfortunately, this product is discontinued.This review is relevant because Anker’s customer service is outstanding.  Recently one of the two usb ports on the portable charger stopped working.  After some trouble shooting I contacted Ankerdirect via Amazon.  They responded promptly and gave me a full refund, no questions asked.  After using it for a year, Anker did not hesitate to honor their warranty.  It was a pleasure to speak with them and they resolved the issue within hours.
