Because of this, I bought another Anker high capacity portable charger to replace the old one.Anker will continue to get my business, because of the quality of their products and the excellent customer service.I have not recieved anything from Anker to write this review.
title: I highly recommend the battery for its dependability and high charge capacity

author: Abdullatif
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2017
review_content: it worked for almost a year, then it just stopped chargingEdit:as soon as I wrote this review, Anker contacted me to know the exact issue with the product and immediately they offer me a replacement free of charge and shipping sent and delivered in less than 5 days (although my battery was out of warranty). The immediate response and the amazing customer care from this great company is the main reason I keep using their brilliant products.The replacement is working very good, thanks to Anker!!
title: Three Stars

author: J
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2017
review_content: This was the first portable charger I purchased from Anker and now I'm hooked on their products. This charger is about as long and wide as two credit cards aligned lengthwise (although maybe 1/2 inch thick). It's a bit too heavy to carry with me on day hikes (buy Ankers 10,000mAh for day trips it's awesome and compact) but would be perfect for a camping trip or any extended electronic use (think long plane ride with multiple devices). it even came with a nice little pouch to protect the battery. Great product, sturdy build to survive minor drops and tumbles
title: Solid charger, will last a long time

author: Alexandra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2018
review_content: Anker has yet to disappoint me in anything I've purchased from them. I love this portable charger, it rapid charges every device I connect to it while paired with my Anker Powerline cables. It holds enough power to charge my iPhone 7+ several times, or multiple devices at once a few times as well depending on how big their battery capacities are. I charge it with my Anker 24W charger and it reaches a full charge within about 5.5 hours. Most definitely recommend for anyone who doesn't want to be tethered to a wall outlet. Also perfect for any outdoor/camping use.
title: Another fantastic Anker product.

author: Amaya21004
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2019
review_content: This thing was a life saver on our trip to Iceland. I bought two wall adapters and after just one day into our trip one of them quit working so we couldn’t charge everything we wanted to overnight while we were sleeping. Had I not had this, I’d have missed out on taking lots of pics because my phone and camera would’ve been dead before the end of the day as we were pretty much out and about the entire time except to sleep.
title: Lifesaver!

author: Roobee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2019
review_content: I kept having difficulty finding a way to charge this power bank, so I used my computer usb, only to have it produce a power surge.it would have been nice if this product came with an actual charger. Aside from that, it's been amazing for charging my phone!
title: Charger please

author: C. Gillespie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020
review_content: I've waited to write a review on this until we tested them heavily.  They are amazing!  They are heavier than most that I had previously found, but I believe those were not the capacity of this one.  It charges our phones, speakers and Ipads lightening quick.  You won't be disappointed!
title: Amazing!

author: Boudreaux
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2017
review_content: Edit 3/2/2017Anker followed up on this review and ran through some troubleshooting steps that unfortunately didn't work, but they sent me a replacement unit right away. Great customer service.******************************************************This charger was awesome. I mainly got it for when I travel for work. I had it fully charged for my last trip and used it on my way out of town. On my way back it was dead. I didn't think it was a big deal at first because I thought I might have used it more than actually did and ran it out of juice. I got it home and it wouldn't charge again. It lasted a little over a year. RIP PowerCore 20100.
title: Was great until it didn't work anymore.

author: masood r. rana
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2020
review_content: It's a shame that I bought this before usb-c became more widespread. The micro-usb input is the only bad thing about this product. You should buy their version that comes with a usb-c input instead of this.But other than that, this product is great. The physical weight is alright. The capacity is amazing. Note that it takes a LONG time to charge.
title: *Amazing* capacity. The micro-usb input is a shame though.

author: Marlie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2018
review_content: I've bought it for my own usage and have had it less than 3 months and the USB cord that came with this portable charger stopped working & charging. Will not be buying this product in the future.**UPDATE**Their customer service was phenomenal! After I had posted my review I was contacted and mailed a replacement USB cord free of charge! Their outstanding customer service will keep me as a loyal customer!!!
title: Cord stopped charging

author: O' Boy!
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2020
review_content: I bought this a few weeks ago and it had no problems at first. It took about 10 hrs to first charge as expected. It worked twice on my iPhone and then it only charges it for a few minutes and then stops. I’ll unplug and plug in again and it only charges a couple of more minutes and then stops. This is my first Anker product so I’m not impressed.
title: Risky investment

author: Court Lee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2019
review_content: I bought this charger for a trip out to Colorado. Depending on the airport, plugs can be hard to come by. I tested my Anker 2 weeks before the trip and this thing is so handy! I fully charged it before leaving and didn't run out of battery until coming back from the week trip. I normally only used to charge for my phone and tablet but I also let my friend use it so the battery has not done me wrong yet. Highly recommend for on the go.
title: Handy and Does the Job

author: I’m not a moron & I tell the truth
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2020
review_content: Quits taking a charge after a few weeks. This was my third one. Anker products are all bad. I’ve had charging cords, headphones, external battery packs and a few of these. All BAD. Put your money towards something else I’m telling ya I’ve tried all this stuff. Bad products and they used to have good customer service but now they don’t even have that. Go with another manufacturer.
title: Don’t buy Anker products

author: JG
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020
review_content: I have 4 Anker Portable Chargers and they all worked very well.  This one, however, had some charging problems from the start.  Sometimes it wouldn't charge at all, sometimes it would take 2-3 days!  After awhile, I wasn't able to charge at all..  Since none of the other chargers I've ever got from them had any issues, I chocked this up to a fluke bad unit. I contacted Anker and they sent me a new unit.  To me, that's good customer service!  Mistakes happen, bad units happen, what counts is that Anker cared about their product enough to send me a new one.  5 stars!
title: I had a defective unit, but Anker went above and beyond to resolve it

author: Taz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2017
review_content: To be fare I've only had this for about a week. I can say in that short time I've charged my iPhone 7 twice and my vape a couple times. Doesn't seem to have drained this thing at all. All 4 blue lights showing fully charged. Until feels and looks solid. Arrived well packaged amd half charged. Yes it's a little big, but all that reserve power makes the size a non factor. Easily slides into back pocket. I would reccomend this as a must have for anyone with charging needs.
title: Must have, don't hesitate

author: Kim22
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2017
review_content: I have to edit my original review that stated it quit working in 2 weeks.  The charger works very well & I'm very happy with my purchase even though I'm not sure I get a full charge but, the company saw my review & have gone beyond what I expected in making sure I am happy with their product & make it right.  I never expected that at all, but am very grateful.  I do wish it would come with it's own complete wall charger or better instructions on what kind of charger to use when charging the unit because not all will work.
title: Change in my original review for the better

author: hq
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
review_content: Tons of charging power in this thing and awesome that it can charge two devices by USB at once. Only downside is the size/weight, which is not that great for traveling, but a good backup power source otherwise! Anker products are always durable and reliable, with a reasonable price point, and this one lives up to the legend!
title: Lots of juice!

author: KMc
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2017
review_content: Just a reminder to note that this weighs a couple pounds. It is not a little carry around in your purse kind of thing...unless your purse is big and your shoulder strongJan 12 update: I have to say I am pleased with AnkerDirect's customer service. They have politely contacted me several times and even  offered a lighter replacement. I had  already returned this item for a refund so have respectfully declined their offer. Anyway, I should have better noted the weight information provided before I bought it...thus my reminder review to all the fine people shopping for one of these
title: Anker/anchor

author: Will Sicard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
review_content: Bought this since my iPhone 5s has an awful battery and since I've used my friends before. I was super happy when it came in although when i used it it would only charge for about two minutes. Sent them an email, they told me to send photos of the order form and of battery ID number. I did and they sent me a new one without even making me send back the old one. The battery life is so good that i can use it for a solid 3 days without having to recharge it. I charge it over night and it is completely charged in the morning. I somewhat wish that I bought the smaller one just because it is smaller and weighs less. I completely over estimated how much power this battery can store.
title: Amazing Customer Service

author: RussianAura
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2016
review_content: 11/08/2016I've been using the replacement for about a week now and have had no issues. Customer Support is very helpful and have stayed in contact with me, based on this new device I will give the Anker 5 stars.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------28/07/2016Anker responded to me very quickly be email and after explaining my issue it turns out I have a faulty model and they have send me a newer device free of charge. Will update when I get a chance to review it. Changed my review from one star to three because of their customer service, very friendly people.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------1starI've had this device for half a year now and while it originally it worked great with my note 4 (utilizing fast charging) after I upgraded to the note 5 it's almost as if the fast charging stopped working. It reads that it takes 5 hours to charge the battery, when in reality it doesn't even charge. If i'm not using the phone it just prevents the battery from dropping, if I am using it then it just slows down the drain. I'm hoping that I can get in contact with Anker and see what they can do about it.
title: ... a year now and while it originally it worked great with my note 4 (utilizing fast charging) after I ...

author: Melody Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2019
review_content: Bought 3 of these for our family. I travel for work and I'm able to recharge my phone a couple of times during the day. IT will also charge much faster than the USB port in the car. It will actually charge faster than I'm draining the phone battery with GPS, phone calls, etc. I would highly recommend this to anyone who travels or is not near charging ports regularly. Holds a charge for a long time and will charge phone multiple times before needing to be recharged itself.
title: LOVE this item!!

author: Antonio M. Magalhaes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2019
review_content: I've had the Anker PowerCore 20100 for only a month but if already feels like an excellent product. I've done some tests and a fully charged Anker PowerCore 20100 is able to charge my iPhone 5S between 7 and 8 times w/o recharging it.You have to use your Lightning cable for your iPhone (or whatever smartphone you have) but I find this is actually a plus. This is because you can then use it with just about any gadget you own that may need power in the field. For instance, I do night photography and astrophotography and the Anker PowerCore 20100 can provide power to my equatorial mount, lens heater, etc., all in a compact, ruggedly built format.Highly recommended.
title: Excellent, versatile product

author: Joey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020
review_content: I purchased in November 2019. I have used a few times since then and experienced no problems and actually worked really well. Now in June 2020, the battery takes a very long time to fully charge and only 1 Port on the battery works. This is a bummer because I used both ports when traveling.
title: Long Lasting Battery

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2018
review_content: It works great. Lasts many hours when being used. Lasts days when not in use but at the ready when you need it. Only drawback is it takes a long time to charge which is fine because now I bought another one if I'm impatient and will charge my phone(s) or iPad mini. It's somewhat durable after having used over a year.Dropped it a couple a times. Once on a cement road and it got scratched but still worked fine. I'm very careful to have it in the case at all times so that helped. I already recommended it to my friends and they're happy with it too.
title: Small but lasts all day. Great for a weekend.

author: Edgar Julian Remedios
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2020
review_content: When my battery charger failed and would not charge after more than 9 months, I contacted Anker and they immediately sent me a replacement. They did not have to as it was out of so called warranty but they still did. This is the good thing about Anker they are willing to support the customer. Great company with great customer support. What more can you ask for.  The lady at hi helped me from Anker was Shelly and I am indebted to her for the ease with which she supported my requests.
title: Great Customer Support

author: Monica TH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2019
review_content: I don’t get why this isn’t charging my phone correctly? Is there a trick to it? Have tried with several power cords and had the same result each time.I know Anker is a good brand and I got one before that works really well. What gives?Also is there a reason there is no way to return it??
title: Did I get a lemon??

author: Hannah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2019
review_content: Had an issue with my first battery pack not charging with my cables though the cables worked with my other wall chargers, contacted Anker's customer service and they sent a replacement battery within two days! The new battery pack works with my cables and they didn't make me mess with sending in the old one, amazing customer service! It's worth paying more for a company that cares about their customers satisfaction and stands by their products.
title: Happy customer

author: KK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2016
review_content: Fantastic Battery.  I'm a big fan of Anker products - everything I've bought from them as a manufacturer has been fantastic and does exactly what I expect.  This is no exception.  I use a Samsung Galaxy S6 as my primary phone and found that when I travel I usually end up killing the battery on it.  This has helped me out immensely.  Sitting in the airport with no open power sockets?  This charges my phone up in little over an hour from 10-15% battery life remaining.  All while I'm using the phone.  I charge this up at night, so I'm not sure how long it takes to recharge.  All in all, a great product, and it fully charges up my phone like 3-4 times before it needs a recharge itself.
title: Great powerbank!

author: Chuck Higgins
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2019
review_content: i'm amazed how fast it charges my iPad mini for an iPhone XS max.  The charging speed is at least four times what the normal speed is.  not too heavy just the right shape it seems a little expensive but you get what you pay for I've had it for about a month so far.  planning a trip overseas and didn't want to purchase a battery pack case for my phone.
title: Impressive, and airport approved supposedly

author: Joshua Metzger
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2017
review_content: This charger has plenty of charging capacity.  It's able to charge my Samsung Galaxy Tab S multiple times from 0% before it needs a charge itself.  To charge a device, you use the small cord it comes with by plugging in the standard size USB end into the charger and the micro USB end into the device.  To charge the power pack, you turn the cord around and plug the micro end into the power pack and the regular USB end into the adapter, which is NOT included - I took off one star for this.  I can easily use my tablet adapter, but that means I can't charge both the power pack and the tablet at the same time (unless I daisy chain them together, which I haven't tried, so I'm not sure if that will work - if it does work, it will draw in a LOT of power, perhaps making the adapter overheat.)It does have two ports for charging two devices at the same time, but it comes with only one cord.  But you can use your device's cord.Overall I am very pleased with this device and the capacity.  I would not buy anything smaller unless I needed extreme portability for some reason.
title: Great charger but does not come with an adapter.

author: RDP9201
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2018
review_content: This is the second one we've bought.  I have a smaller one.  Great quality and performance.  Great for traveling or long days out if you have one of those phones whose battery dies all the time.  This one is a bit heavier bigger than the one I have, but provides more charges.  (mine is the 10100 one and provides about 3 charges).  I highly recommend both.  I've been very satisfied with any Anker products I've purchased.
title: Highly recommend

author: Kumaraisin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2019
review_content: Bought for a trip to europe, worked great. Could charge two phones at the same time and good for at least 5-8 full charges. But not even two years later of light use it take like 24 hours just to fully charge the battery and it will only charge my phone like maybe 2.5 times before it dies.
title: Great at first, looses power less than 2 years later.

author: bbg05
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2019
review_content: After having to deal with 3 (so far) power company, weather-related outages, I am on my phone more than usual and was unprepared for more than a 24 hr outage. Purchasing the Anker power bank is what I need to ensure there is undisturbed communication for our school's parents to contact admin during these outages.  I can now breathe more easily when camping - no need to monitor my use!!
title: It's a 5* Review!

author: Kenny
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2016
review_content: I bought this after my   Portable Charger RAVPower 16750mAh Most Powerful External Battery Pack Power Bank with iSmart Technology (4.5A Output, Dual USB, Apple 30pin and Lightning Cable Not Included) - White           died out. This charge has been nothing short of amazing! My phone usually dies out around mid-day from playing music while browsing or the occasional gaming (with PokemonGO released, more so now). I can charge my Anker one time and be able to recharge my phone multiple times for 2 weeks (from a half full phone). I could never do that on my RAVPower. If I could, I would give this product additional stars!
title: This charge has been nothing short of amazing! My phone usually dies out around mid-day from ...

author: Charlie W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2017
review_content: I heard about this power pack through recommendations from others online and thought I would give it a try since I needed one badly for Coachella Music Festival in SoCal. Heat outside reached about 104 degrees, so it was stored in my pocket or inside a backpack. Never had any issues of overheating, even when in the direct sight of sunlight. Be smart if in that scenario how long you leave it exposed to such extreme heat and you'll be fine. For 3 days, I didn't need to charge the pack up and was able to charge my Galaxy S7 phone (4x) and old iPhone 6 (2x). When I started charging them, the battery was always between 10-20%, so I can't vouch for true 0-100% battery charge count.Just keep in mind, there are two ports for charging via USB, one is going to charge slower than the other. Not sure if the 4.8V output is split between the two output ports or through one particular one, but either way, they both still charge well. I've taken this pack through TSA with no problem and have flown to Dubai with a layover in Germany; never had issues with their security-screening teams.The pack comes with a cushioned mesh drawstring bag to store it in. Does a solid job to protect the power pack from minor drops, scratches, bumps, or chips.
title: A proven battery pack that gets the job done

author: L. Hanson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
review_content: It worked pretty well for a couple of months.  It was always slow to charge (usually at least overnight for full charge) but now doesn't charge at all.  Alas, it failed after the 30-day "deadline" so I am stuck with a dud.
title: DEAD in less than 3 months

author: Customer007
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2019
review_content: Take a while to charge, however, that’s expected considering the size. The charger, despite taking long to charge, still charges faster than other portable chargers I’ve bought. Battery lasts A WHILE. In case that was emphasized enough, it’s last A VERY LONG TIME. I’ll charge the portable charger and won’t have to worry about charging it again for another 2-3 weeks. Given, I don’t rely on my portable charger. If you phone fast charges, the portable charger is capable of fast charging your phone and you can get a lot of charges out of it before you have to recharge it.
title: Great portable charger. Price matches quality

author: eluvittar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2017
review_content: Anker makes best in the market product. High Quality and works as advertised. I have become a big fan of anker over the time.  It might not be the cheapest, but definitely the best in quality. This battery pack , packs a punch. i used this quite a bit during my backpack travel in Europe and would charge my fast charge samsung phone really well and quick, without heating up the phone or so. definitely not small in size, but i could keep it connected and in my jeans front pocket comfortably. 20,000 mAh - don't expect it to be small :) Get the 6300mAh if you want small candy size. I got that one too :)
title: Worth every penny! Solid build and works great

author: Shawn Bauerschmidt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2020
review_content: This product works well. It charges quickly. There was one issue where we needed to get a new charger due to a part that broke. We contacted customer service via email and got a quick response. Within a day or so, a new unit was sent out. The customer service representative at Anker kept in constant contact with us and followed up to ensure that we received the new unit. I was impressed with this. This speaks volumes as far as good customer service. The new unit works well and would recommend it.
title: Great customer service

author: BC1997
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2015
review_content: Little on the heavy side I would guess it's about two pounds. I have a Samsung S6 and its about an inch longer than my phone so that should give u some idea of how long it is. It's also about twice as thick as my phone to. My one con to this battery is it takes quite a while to fully charge. It took about 10 hrs to completely charge the battery. The good is that it will charge my phone about 4 times before needing to be charged. I bought this on sale for $28 so for the price not a bad deal. It would have come in very handy on vacation this past summer being in airport and sightseeing. I carry the battery in my front or back pocket  letting it charge my phone while I continue to use it.
title: Not bad for the price I got it on sale.

author: Rohit
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2020
review_content: It was wonderful power bank which i had and charging was also pretty fast.  I was using this from last 2 years and had no issues. All of a sudden, it has stopped charging. Mostly i have used this at home. This was very light and really liked the product. I just wished it would have lasted longer. Now i have to figure out whether to buy the same product or go for another one.
title: Stopped Working!!

author: DV
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2019
review_content: This is our second one of these purchased from Amazon as we wanted one for each of us. Can recharge an iPad quickly and is a lifesaver. Liked the option of bright blue to match the extra cords we got so “we” don’t “accidentally” take the others to work and the Bermuda Triangle of lightning cords.  I can buy him the battery, but I can’t make sure he keeps it charged....
title: Works perfectly

author: Todd Hall
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2016
review_content: I really like the item so far, it has been working great while charging devices & from my rough calculations it should be able to support a 5w led light bulb for more than 16 hours off a full charge.  I use the Anker 24W Dual USB Wall Charger (PowerPort 2) to charge the PowerCore (20,000 mAH).  When the device is nearly depleted, I plug it in & walked away.  Today I started charging at 9am, at 4pm it has only reached 2 of 4 lights and the third blinking signaling the rate of charge.  In 7 hours time, this device should have only an hour left to recharge.  I feel as if I have a bad battery but will update with the final hours taken to reach a full charge.
title: Good powerhouse, slow rate of charge

author: Jeffrey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2017
review_content: I am a Soldier deployed to Afghanistan and the trip here took several days.  I took this charger with me and used it to fully charge my Galaxy Tab S2 twice and my Galaxy S7 three times.  I am amazed at the amount of power this thing has.  It was relatively fast charging, my only issue was my own confusion.  I thought it was compatible with my phones fast charge tech, but I was mistaken.  This was an issue with my lack of research and not the product.  All in all, a great product; plenty of power and sufficient recharge speed to keep you going while using your devices.  I'm new to Anker but I'm a becoming a full-on customer.
title: I am amazed at the amount of power this thing has

author: Gene
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2018
review_content: Defected item. After 12 hours of charging only two of the LEDs are solid and the third blinking. Tried different outlets. Fails to charge iPhone.This is an issue other customers have had before.Edit:Received a message from them very swiftly. They offered to send a replacement, which arrived just as quick. The first one is bricked and completely will not work while the one sent after as a replacement works great. Holds a good charge and keeps my phone alive and well when I'm not able to get to another power source.While this is great, initial quality checks are important. Regardless, I understand that a few can slip through and it's great that they offer replacement.
title: Quality checks?

author: GP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020
review_content: I’ve had this Anker Powercore charger for over a year now And it still charges my phones and tablets without any hesitation. I’m glad that invested in this portable charger as it has helped me out during times of great need. I’ve used this charger during business trips, vacations, and camping.
title: Best charger

author: Jae Lee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2017
review_content: 1st order - use up the battery, after that when I was charged, never get pass 2 lights.  Return and got the 2nd one.2nd - after 3 wks of using it, charging was great. After the 3wk wk, my iPhone won't charge. I would left it in for more then 5 hrs charging my iPhone and it was still be around 30% charge up. whats the reason why I can't return it, it's only been 30 days today.
title: Bad chargers.

author: Connor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2018
review_content: My first portable charger. I got this guy on Prime day and it is amazing. I have taken it on numerous trips and it rarely seems to run empty. I decided I needed two so I tried   Portable Charger RAVPower 26800 Battery Packs 26800mAh Total 5.5A Output 3-Port Power Bank (2A Input, iSmart 2.0 USB Power Pack) Portable Battery Charger for Smart Devices (White)           to compare. While having the third port is nice, I think   Anker PowerCore 26800 Portable Charger, 26800mAh External Battery with Dual Input Port and Double-Speed Recharging, 3 USB Ports for iPhone, iPad, Samsung Galaxy, Android and other Smart Devices           wins due to having a better form factor. I highly recommend both but you have to decide on an extra port vs overall size. All in all one of these is required nowadays.
title: Everyone needs one of these!

author: Ernest Lee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2015
review_content: I've had this battery pack for several months now, and I absolutely love it. I've owned several battery packs in the last few years and this is by far my favorite one for keeping in my bag. I usually carry a smaller Anker ~5000mah battery pack in my pocket as a backup, but I use this one to accomodate it. The pack is a little on the larger side, but that's totally okay with me, since any time I have to use one this large, I'd be carrying it in a backpack anyway.The change from gloss to matte is also a huge plus for me as well. I love the fact that it's less scratch resistant and it looks very discrete. I like a lot of my gadgets to be black and subtle, and this fits the bill very nicely. The shape is consistent with most of their previous packs and doesn't have those sharp edges and corners like a lot of other ones I've seen from other companies in the past.Operation of the pack is very simple. Four small blue LED lights indicate that it is on, and how much charge is left. Being that the pack is so large in capacity, I think I've only ever run it down to near empty just once. The PowerIQ techonology also makes things a breeze. You just plug it in and forget about it while it does it's thing. The 4.8A output is also a huge plus. It charges your phone rather quickly when you need that extra bit of battery on the go and can't bring it with you later on.
title: Great pack with huge capacity and simple design

author: Josiah Eubank
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2018
review_content: Saw the overwhelming reviews and I have to agree.  Holds many charges.Only downside is that the phone doesn't recognize it as fast charging, but the charging speed is considerably higher than normal.  Most other products can only maintain my current charge while I am using the phone but this one charges while I use the phone.
title: Best purchase - not supported fast charge though

author: Tracy R. Reed
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2019
review_content: It lasted 3.5 years before it quit charging me devices. It says it is fully charged but when I plug in my phone the phone doesn't say charging anymore. I think the output circuit has failed. Not too bad I guess for 3.5 years.One possible complaint is that the label on the back is black ink on black plastic. Impossible to read.
title: Lasted 3.5 years before failure

author: Ryan Ciesla
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2019
review_content: I've had this charger for nearly a year now. At full charge, this bank charges my Pixel 2 XL 4 times before needing to recharge. It's an absolute beast. It charges my wireless SteelSeries gaming headset in about 40 minutes while I'm using them without losing one of it's four battery lights. Highly recommend this for the price. I don't think I'll need a battery bank again for some time.
title: A Bit Bulky, But Worth It

author: palabras
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020
review_content: I have purchased Anker lightning charger cables for years as they are better than Apples genuine cables. Decided to upgrade my back up power pack with this and it does not disappoint. Charged my iPad and phone very quickly. Holds charge well and has lots of capacity. Very impressed.
title: Very impressive!

author: bullrider
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2020
review_content: I was looking for a charger that was fast and could be used for multiple charges. This charger met the need in size, cost and use. Unfortunately it stopped recharging a few weeks after purchase. I tried all of the solutions I found online (ie changing cords, power plugs) but couldn’t get it to charge. I contacted Anker customer service and within a few days I had a brand new charger!! Customer service is TOP NOTCH!! I’ll definitely be buying Anker in the future!
title: Great charger! Great Customer Service!

author: P Lunaria
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2017
review_content: I'm sure this works for some people, but mine legit stopped charging or maybe even holding charge after one full cycle.
title: Stopped working way sooner than expected

author: Nick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2019
review_content: This is a great product excellent for traveling slightly heavy but worth the weight ! I had an issue after 10 months with the charging capability. Kaya in customer service was exceptional.Response was very quick and the replacement was issued. Email follow-ups were timely and professional. Slight issues can happen especially with electronics but the real test is when you need service. So hats off to Anker for delivering amazing customer service.
title: The best in customer service

author: auntcindy002
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2020
review_content: I initially tried to charge this with my iPhone charger.  Only 2 of the 4 power level lights came on even after charging for 24 hours.  I reached out to the seller.  They promptly responded and advised me to try it with an iPad charger which is more powerful.  I did and after 24 hours for the initial charge all 4 power level lights are on and I was able to charge my phone.  Very helpful customer service!
title: Great customer service

author: Mae. M. Ferrell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2020
review_content: Based on Amazons Choice I went with this portable charger Portable Charger Anker PowerCore 20100mAh - Ultra High Capacity Power Bank with 4.8A Output and Power its horrible DO NOT BUY I would give it 0 stars if it was an option It took approximately 3-4 days to fully charge smh  Im an advid traveler so I always need my phone to be charged after frequent use and I cant have a charger taking 3-4 days to charge its also really heavy for a portable charger cant just throw it in your pocket or bag without noticing weight TOTAL DISAPPOINTMENT
title: Took about 3-4 days to charge this portable charger

author: Melly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2019
review_content: This portable charger saved me so much. Overtime, the battery doesn’t last as long as it used to, but honestly, still can hold a charge for a couple days with multiple full charges. It is a tad long of a product but it’s always fit in any of my bags or zippered jacket pockets.
title: Long lasting product! Very satisfied

author: Peter Krivejko
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2017
review_content: Love this and use it almost daily.  I have to keep my wife from stealing it.  So I need to buy her one.  On our trip to Disney...I would place this in our small carry packs and charged both of our phones at the same time.  This is very convenient.  I get at least 6 charges of my phone(LG G5 3500mAH).  Usually a little more.  Charge times are just about as fast as my "fast charge"  which is about 30-40 minutes for a full charging.  I had a friend with an Anker..and I knew he loved his.  So glad I followed his lead...Will definitely buy again.
title: Get this...it is a no-brainer...

author: MOONSASH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2020
review_content: I got two of these for my wife and I because my son got one and he loves his. Ours arrived but they're plain – button on the side, plain black plastic, plain 4 lights. My son's has this nice texture with lights going around the main button in the center of the charger. Ours works just the same, but as as designer, I liked the other design a lot better.
title: Works great, BLAH design

author: Patty Lou
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020
review_content: My iPhone is getting older, so I often need a charge later in day when I am out in the car or out on my porch.  This is stronger and faster than a car charger. The more I use it, the faster the charge. Got it for power outages , but use it daily for its speed and portability.
title: Good charger for daily and power outage use

author: ExhaustedMom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2020
review_content: We had several devices that needed to be charged on our last camping trip and this little power bank did a pretty good job charging without running out of power. The carrying bag holds the cable and device with some room to spare. Great buy!
title: Perfect for charging phones while camping

author: Anon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020
review_content: Lost its ability to charge just over a year after purchasing (maybe 1 yr 2 months?). I bought it specifically to last longer than the cheap chargers.  I wouldn't be that surprised, but we are talking around 30 phone charges total. That shouldn't be enough to kill a charger like this.  The charge level on the lights also is nowhere near reality.  This is the only "quality" charger I've purchased and it's no better than the garbage freebies I've used before.
title: Shorter shelf life than you think

author: Sunnie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2016
review_content: It works great. I've used it to charge my phone, bluetooth speakers, and tablet. It lasts all day and i do multiple charges. I usually use it heavily. When i use it just for my phone it will last me 2-3 days. Again i probably use it more than most people. Im constantly gaming, going on pokemon catching and gyming runs, and much more. So i need to constantly recharge. Especially when there isnt an outlet available. The only down side to this product is that it can take 13-24 hours to charge. I dont know the exact amount of time. i lose track it takes so long. Keep in mind though theres a lot of charge in this sleek model. It will fit in a mans jean pocket, in a purse, or a hoodie pocket. Doesnt take a lot of space. Very happy with my purchase.
title: Thumbs up!

author: A. R. Barry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2019
review_content: The charger would not charge my iPhone higher than 86%. I tried several times. I recharged the charger several times and it didn't help. Yesterday I had my phone plugged in for several hours and it would only go to 45%. Also, sometimes one USB port worked and the other did not. I'm returning this product.
title: Would not charge my iPhone!

author: Six7roses
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2019
review_content: I purchased this product in 2016 (it’s now 2019) and admittedly I travel a lot. However recently, after a long flight, one of the USB charger ports stopped working and the battery started feeling hot during charges. I tried to recharge the battery but the battery became so hot I was worried it might spark a fire left unattended. After 5 hours of attempting to recharge the battery it appears it is no longer holding any charge. So the pack lasted me about 3 years with moderate use before becoming unusable. Not sure if this would influence others but felt it was helpful to share.
title: Careful after repeated air travel...

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2019
review_content: Easy to use, ergonomic battery pack. Charges my Moto G smartphone by ~1.8A current ( apparently this is limitation of phone charging circuitry, not limitation of the power bank output).Comes with a case that prevents the battery from occasional damage.I'm using 2.1 A wall charger and Anker USB cable to charge the bank. Initially, it took about 10h to fully charge the pack , that is pretty close to the time needed to reach max capacity of 20100mA.About 2 months later, all four lights go on after about 5-6 hours of charging, and number of phone charge cycles went down from 7 to 4..5. When 4 or 3 lights indicators are on, everything looks ok, but when it comes to 1 or 2 lights, it discharges very quickly. It is not possible to fully charge used XT1063 phone when only 1 LED is on.Will be looking for battery pack from another manufacturer next time.
title: Battery degraded after two month of use

author: Ryan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
review_content: I’ve had my original one for over five years! I love it so much I bought another one. If you’re on the go or travel a lot this is a great product. This company has several portable chargers to choose from. Great stuff!
title: I’VE HAD MINE FOR 5 YEARS

author: Texas Rose
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2019
review_content: Anker Chargers are usually highly recommended, but this one, the 20100mAh, could be better.  I bought it so there will be an alternative in the event there's a storm caused black-out.  It has four blue "power available" indicator lights, but after I charged iPhone X and iPad Pro 10.5, it was down to one.  It takes several hours to recharge (I suppose that's why there's a charger for it too).  So this means that in a storm, I can count on only one full charge for each of those two devices.  It's also heavy to me so I won't be traveling with it. Check weight and capacity before buying; so will I, because I still think it's a good brand.
title: Ok generally, but disappointed in number of full charges

author: cinthia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2019
review_content: It took forever to charge when I first got it. I’m talking like 24hrs. But after that I would charge my phone a good 3 times and still had plenty of juice and would only take me a few hours to recharge it. I could also charge multiple phones At the same time and it wouldn’t take forever to get it at 100%. Only downside is that it’s quite heavy but who cares lol
title: I would recommend it

author: Dchafin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2016
review_content: I really like this little battery pack, the overall portability and capacity of this device is awesome. You can practiacally fit it anywhere from a cargo pocket to a clutch purse. This thing has a lot of power for it size and with the Anker brand you know it's quality products. I use this with the quality Anker braided cable and my wife never leaves home without it. I would recommend this to anyone who has a on the go lifestyle. This should be in your roadside kit in case of emergency.The only suggestion I have is that it could have a LED light in case of emergencies however, the product is superb as is.
title: Anker battery pack

author: JODI
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020
review_content: I am writing this review nearly a year after buying this charger because mine stopped working for some reason and I contacted Anker about the issue and they promptly replaced it!Their customer service replied to my initial email within 24 hours and less than a week later, I received a replacement.I have purchased nearly a dozen Anker products and this is the first time I had any issue.It's hard to find companies who stand behind their products to this degree. Anker is simply the best!
title: ANKER STANDS BEHIND THEIR PRODUCTS!

author: Yash Gujarati
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2018
review_content: I bought the Anker PowerCore 20100 in December and had been using it ever since on daily basis. Being a college student, owning a powerbank is essential. My field of study also requires me to travel a lot, thus making my a powerbank more useful. However, last week, my PowerCore failed to work/charge, this happened 9 months after my purchase. I decided to contact Anker regarding the matter and they asked me to perform few simple tests, like trying a new cable or changing my charging source. After 3 email exchanges with Shae (Anker representative) I was sent a new powerbank at my door step. Thanks Shae, you were very nice and quick with responses. I have been using the power bank with my Google Pixel 1 in past and now with my Google pixel 2, though this model does not have a USB C port, thus I shelled out a little extra and bought the original Anker USB C cable to go along with my powerbank. I'm very happy with my powerbank and the "Legendary" Anker customer service.
title: Worlds best customer service even after 9 month of purchase

author: Alex Richardson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020
review_content: I really like this portable battery.  It provides a really good power output to my phone and can charge it fully within about an hour and a half.  My first one died but Anker luckily sent me a replacement and my new one has been good for 2 years so far.  Will probably come back as their warranties are hard to beat.
title: Nice but my first one died on me

author: Michael T. Milanich
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2016
review_content: My Galaxy S6 was always dying on me when I needed it to take photos at the end of a night, and I needed an answer to my power issues.  A friend had the same (or a similar) model and I remember him singing its praises, so I finally got myself one.I needed it this weekend while staying in a hotel with some friends and not always having access to the plugs while they were charging their devices -- and it performed beautifully.  A quick charge brought me right back up to 100% and I was able to shoot photos and video all weekend.I also need it when using Facebook Live on my phone and broadcasting NPSL soccer matches while being the play-by-play announcer for AFC Cleveland's away games.  I can usually shoot the fist half with a full battery, but I need a continuous charge after halftime, and this charger does the trick.
title: High energy for a high demand

author: Robert Fite
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2017
review_content: I originally purchased this to use with my iPad at my fantasy football drafts. I do three over 2 days and wanted to make sure I'd have enough power to last through them. I checked out quite a few on Amazon and must were not powerful enough to charge an iPad but this one can do it a couple of times.  It's a bit on the heavy side but it charged my iPad a couple of times before needing to be recharged. You definitely wouldn't want to pack it around in your pocket but if you are traveling it would be great.
title: Heavy but gets the job done for iPad users.

author: Joey Anwar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2020
review_content: Anker’s customer service is excellent. Outside of the warranty program they replaced my non-working charger. The only problem is the replacement stopped holding a charge after about a month. I don’t think anker is a bad product I just think that some times you can get lemon products.  Guess I was just unfortunate.Below you will find my original review.Original review: I bought this, used it, loved it, and then it just stopped holding a charge. Very unfortunate as it was excellent while it lasted.
title: Great for a while, but then it just died. Amazing customer service though

author: B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2019
review_content: I originally bought this for camping at Coachella and it delivered juice the ENTIRE WEEKEND! I didn’t have to recharge it at all. Now this bad boy comes with me everywhere. You can full charge 2 phones at once which is awesome. You can pretty much charge anything with a usb connection. It takes a long time to charge the actual battery pack though, besides that it’s phenomenal! Buy it!
title: Perfect for all occasions

author: Constance
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020
review_content: Good charging bank. Nice and sleek, not too bulky like some others. Charges my iPhone really fast. Does pretty much everything as described. Wish it had USB C charging instead of Micro USB. Otherwise, just about perfect
title: As described, very satisfied

author: Anthony Anderson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2020
review_content: I just received my new battery today ,thank you so much I enjoy doing business with you . I'm very happy with my new battery . I look forward to doing business you in the near future. I will definitely recommend your business to my friends .Once again thank you .
title: The new battery arrived today .

author: cr8tiv1
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2018
review_content: First off, my PowerCore 20100 is a go-to battery backup. Second, everyone always looks for a deal. But most of the time a good deal comes with some flaws - as in quality with product and customer service.I've never had an issue before with an Anker product, but nothing is perfect and that's ok. An indicator light went out on my PowerCore, therefore not able to determine how much juice is actually left. I know it seems petty, but knowing the exact amount of battery life when working remotely really helps.That's where great customer service comes into play. I sent a simple email with pictures explaining the issue. Not too long after I received a response with instructions to reset the battery. Well, it didn't work but Anker said they are going to send a replacement and that I don't have to return the original.In no way was I looking for a handout or free device, but when a company/brand goes that little extra mile its very easy to be a loyal customer!
title: Go to charger and brand

author: Sam
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2019
review_content: I use this battery as a USB power pack for my two DVRs in my car.  I connect the USB cables to this battery and it lets me leave the two DVRs (Front and Back Windshields) running even while my car is off.  I did this because I wanted to make sure my car was not damaged or vandalized (passers-by or valet people etc).  This battery powers the cameras for more than 2 days straight.
title: Amazing capacity

author: Brandon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2018
review_content: I have purchased several cheaper portable batteries over the years, but I bought this Anker one on the recommendation of a friend. It takes a few hours to charge, but it can recharge my phone entirely many times over. When I don't use it, it retains its charges for several months. It is heavy and well made. Do yourself a favor and spent the extra few bucks to get an Anker battery instead of an inferior one.
title: Best portable battery I own

author: Ronjon808
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2019
review_content: Best external battery I own. I have used this power bank to charge my S9, Galaxy Tab, Bose head phones, wife's Note 9, wife's Studio beats and it still had lots of juice left. I've had this power bank for years and it still holds the charge like I just got it.
title: Great product

author: Vader D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2017
review_content: One of the best purchases I've ever made! I'm so glad I settled on purchasing the 20100mAh! I get many charges on my phone from this bank! I wished it would charge faster, but I have no other complaints, otherwise. I even accidentally dropped it and it seems everything to still be in working order! I don't hear any components floating around in there, which is surprising, considering my last one. Anker is usually the brand I seek, since I've purchased much from them over the years.
title: Best. Purchase. EVER!

author: Reginald M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2017
review_content: As usual, Anker has produced a great product.  I charge this portable battery charger via AC outlet overnight and then it typically provides enough juice to charge my Samsung Note 5 at least 5 full cycles.  The battery charger is well built with about as slim a design as physically possible an still allowing for a high output. I bought a 3 foot long charging cable and this allows for quick charging without taking up too much space. I would definitely buy again, especially with Anker's outstanding warranty.
title: Excellent Portable Battery Charger.

author: ns55
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2020
review_content: we've used this power box not very often in the time we've owned it since we own 3.  my husband noticed today that the one port is no longer working. a replacement would be nice but looks like i'm out of time which stinks. didn't even last a year.
title: worked great until...

author: stephanie smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2019
review_content: Edit: Ankers customer service reach out to me and sent a new charger. So far it’s working as well as our first purchase. Thank you for your awesome response and service.I purchased this brand before but a different model, and we love that one. So I ordered this one so we should have two. I wish I had kept the box so I could return this one. It does not charge my phone for more than a minute. Then I have to keep pressing the button on the side to start charging again. Another minute and it shuts off again. I don’t have time for that. I’ll be sure not to throw the box out without trying it first next time.
title: Does not continuously charge my phone

author: Unique Snowflake
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2018
review_content: This charger has been great for us.  Can charge two iphone 7's quickly.  What's better, though, is Anker's customer service and return policy.  After a year, I had two of the LEDs go out on this, and they shipped me a free replacement.  I would buy Anker products JUST for this benefit, but I have like 10 cables, chargers, etc. and this is the only product of theirs to malfunction in any way.  So, solid products, even more solid company.
title: This charger has been great for us

author: Tiger Fan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2016
review_content: I love external chargers. I have one by another company and it has been a huge help with keeping our I-products running.I bought this one as a Deal of the Day to give to my 8 yr old to charge his 3DS. It arrived today and it's much larger than I anticipated. It's the length and the weight.The pic of it with the iPhone makes it look like it's the same size. It's actually longer. Of course, I just saw the pic & great reviews.Anyway, I think it's going to be too cumbersome for him. That's a bummer because it seems like a GREAT unit!!!
title: So, I need to look at specs & not just the pictures.

author: Melissinha73
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020
review_content: Not an expert in chargers but I got this charger for a trip a year ago and it’s still working perfectly. The best part of it is that it charges quickly, quicker than plugging it into the wall. I’ve found that charging of my iPad is painfully slow but this charger charges it significantly faster. It also holds a charge even when not in use. It’s a bit heavy but it’s a good trade-off because it gets the job done and can charge two devices at once and can fully charge an iPhone multiple times or an iPad at least once. Glad I have it, worth every penny.
title: Powerful charging

author: HEATHER LYNN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2018
review_content: Great product! Worked perfectly and charged my own phone and my friends simultaneously while at our industry convention and still had several charges left it in. Easy to use, comes with a carrying case and convenient double sided cord for charging the unit in the usb and then swapping to plug in your phone. Came in handy when we lost power too! Charged all of our devices up and still had more power to spare. Definitely would recommend this one!
title: Works great! Portable power for when you need it most!

author: Curlyanne12
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2018
review_content: Full disclosure, I had an Amazon Basics power bank that was recalled. I LOVED my power bank. It traveled around the US and around the world with me. It saved me a bunch of times. This unit replaced my old one. It is every bit as good as my old power bank. The user reviews helped me find this replacement product. Thanks! Highly recommended.
title: Power on the go

author: Suzykat77
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2019
review_content: Was so excited that I finally purchased a PowerCore...and it initially exceeded my expectations. Charge lasted and was strong, able to get 4-5 great  phone charges on a Galaxy S7 for about a month. Looked forward to having this in the event of power outages during storm season, and felt reassured having an Anker product as backup. Have been impressed with Anker cords and speakers, guess I was counting on the same quality......fast forward to less than four months, it won't hold a charge.50 bucks for a paperweight.C'mon Anker--you can do better!!
title: Disappointed Anker Fan

author: Adam L
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2018
review_content: Charged all the way up once. It charged my phone a few times then the portable charger would not charge again. Very disappointed. Would not recommend.*****Update on review*******After reviewing this product I was contacted by customer support and they asked me some questions about my device. I told them about my phone type and what was happening and they sent out a new unit. It was hassle free and customer support technician Shae was very friendly and followed up in a timely manner.Mistakes happen, bad products are shipped, but great customer service is something that is rare.Thank you Anker!
title: Faulty product (UPDATED REVIEW)

author: Christine
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2019
review_content: I have to say that anker is one of the best companies to back their products ! I received a new one and it’s black but that has nothing to do with it working it is outstanding last days and the company after I couldn’t return it through amazon made sure I was happy an that it is working an it is
title: Company backs product even after Amazon’s limit is up best company I have seen ever

author: Dr R.E. Cheeks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2018
review_content: This item arrived on time but was dead on arrival. It has not been able to hold a charge irrespective of the time connected to a power outlet, and it only has one flashing green light whilst connected. I have never been able to charge any device with this item, neither SG phone nor Ipad. This is disappointing because I bought it as a gift for my son since I was so pleased with the one I had previously purchased in 2016.Very disappointed.
title: This is disappointing because I bought it as a gift for my son since I was so pleased with the one I had previously purchased in 2016

author: Y. Cabrera
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2017
review_content: Followed the good reviews here. But my unit stopped working just after 1 week. I received a defective unit but since I bought this product while I was on vacation in the US. I am unable to get a replacement - so it's hard to recommend this product. QA I think is taking a slip.
title: Defective and wasn't working within 1 week.

author: Alex
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2020
review_content: Have been using this charger everyday for about 7 months. Works extremely well. Went on a 4 day camping trip and had multiple people doing full phone charges off it, and it still had power by time I got home. Very pleased.
title: Lot of horsepower

author: Jamie Pohlman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2019
review_content: This is an absolutely beautiful piece of technology. The longevity of the battery is perfect for my academic schedule, as I’m not always near an outlet whereby to charge my phone. I’ve used it for two solid weeks without recharging the pack, including being abroad in a foreign country for charging my iPhone SE, getting upward of ten charges before the pack requires a recharge. I would certainly recommend to any travelers or students out there, especially those with older phone models. It will serve you well.
title: Excellent Tool for the Busy Life

author: Peter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2018
review_content: I got this unit and it did not fast charge my V10. I was disappointed but its one power packed unit for sure. I did not try it on a friends S6 or newer so I can't say. Anker did reach out and replace it with a similar unit that did fast charge so I'm a thrilled customer and will continue to purchase Anker Products. This is my 3rd Anker product, the other 2 are chargers , a auto charger and a home 6 USB charger with fast charge and love their products.
title: Avoid buying this!

author: tarheel-64
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2019
review_content: I purchased as a replacement for a previous Anker that died under warranty while I wait for replacement.  Now this one doesn't work properly.It charges an iPhone for a  few minutes, then the button has to be hit for it to charge again... for a few minutes.  This is true for multiple cables and multiple iPhones.A friend also has an Anker and uses a Huawei phone.  We traded battery packs.  His phone charges fine on mine and I charged fine on his older Anker with the same iphone and cables that did not work properly with the newer one.As I need a WORKING battery pack within the next few days, I'll be purchasing one from a different manufacturer today.
title: Apple Users Beware

author: David
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2017
review_content: The battery backup does a wonderful job. I use it to charge up both Samsung and Apple phones and it doesn’t have an issue.I find it particularly find it useful when navigating cities by foot and the GPS will kill a phone’s battery in no time but with the power core it will go for days before I need to recharge or when I am at a family member or friend’s house and running low on power.I would have gave it 5 stars but the USB cable that came with it bent on the micro side and was not charging anymore. I replaced it with a better cable and everything since has been good.
title: A great battery backup for phones and tablets

author: Shawn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020
review_content: I have owned this item for close to 2 1/2 years and it was amazing at first. Although now around 2 years it is no longer able to quick charge and what take 1 1/2 hrs takes around 6 now. Every once in a while it will quick charge for a minute or two then quits. Still good while it lasted though.
title: Great For A Time

author: Spend too much
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2017
review_content: Does NOT come with a charging cord/wall plug cord to charge the powerbank!
title: No charging cord for the powerbank

author: Josh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2015
review_content: (I ordered the 20,0000 mAh version)I ordered this battery a few days ago and I am very impressed. It shipped quickly and the box it arrived in was very premium-looking. It was one of those cool laminated cardboard kinds where you fold out some flaps to get to the product rather than struggling with plastic and tape. The contents were a small and pretty simple manual, a short micro USB cable, and the battery itself. The battery is a sleek matte black in a sturdy seeming plastic case. It's a bit heavy, but that's what you're gonna get with a battery of this size. It has 4 LED indicators telling you the charge and it arrived at 75%. This battery itself is great! It lasts several days and charges several devices very quickly. I have an LG G3 and it was charged in record time!I would like to issue one warning however. You know how when you have a cheap charging cable, and after some time it only charges when you jiggle your phone just right? Well, the cable that came with it was like that right out of the box! Of course I just grabbed another one and used it, but I was disappointed to see that shoddy quality in an Anker product.I would have given it 5 stars had it not been for the cable, but other than that. It is a great product.
title: A great battery, but a not so great cable...

author: Raftin90
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
review_content: I have used so many type of backup battery. Since I work a lot or travel and I like to have my phone charged at all time. I use this one for when I am work it last me 4-5 day charging my phone and my coworker. I have the pro max iPhone. So if you have that phone you know the battery is big and I can fully charger my phone 3 times and my iPad twice.
title: Battery that can last

author: HCO
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2017
review_content: Bought this for a trip I was going to in Alaska where I would be without power for days. Worked perfectly. Got home and it started to only charge to 2 bars! I started the return process but ended up cancelling it because I realized it was being charged by a similar black cord that belonged to one of my other electronics, not the original it came with! Plugged the right one in and it charged to full capacity quick! phew! So immake sure you only use the cord it comes with and it should work great.
title: Fabulous!

author: Biff
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2019
review_content: I love this charger. My first one died on me and I contacted customer support and Kaya was amazing. She did some trouble shooting with me which did not work, so she sent me another charger since it was still under the 18 month warranty. Kaya was super responsive and helpful. She answered all my questions, I clhding which wall charger would be the best to charge my external charger. I would totally recommend all Anker products. I have multiple wall chargers, cords, and this external charger from them and they all work great.
title: Awesome product!

author: B. O'Laughlin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2016
review_content: Besides needing a good USB block to ensure optimal recharge time for the power bank itself, I fell in love with this almost instantly. Originally, I had purchased it for Pokemon GO, but then realized how much more useful it was as I do not have to worry about going out at night to bars or clubs and having my phone die in case of an emergency, which has happened before. Furthermore, having the two USB plug-ins allow my mom and sister to charge their phones as well and I can go about 2-3 days, playing Pokemon GO all day plus several other tabs open on my iPhone 5S such as Spotify and social media, and forget charging the bank for a few days before it dies. However, a word of caution would be to always plug it into the wall specifically EVERY night to keep it well charged and although it is barely the size of my iPhone 5S, it is a tad heavy for keeping in your pockets; besides those and being careful not to drop it or get it wet, it was well worth the price and has allowed me to keep my phone around 100% charge while showing a charge rate of about 1~3% per minute depending on my settings and usage. I'd definitely recommend it as I already have done so and I would say the description is fairly accurate when it says it can charge an iPhone 5S/6S at least 7x~7.5x before needing to recharge the bank. If anyone else is hesitant or has questions, I can assure as a satisfied customer as I have been using mine nonstop for the past month and no problems yet despite the beating it has taken with me.
title: Where has this been all of my life?

author: Sash
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2018
review_content: The battery was marked “refurbished” but it was used and didn’t perform as new as they indicated. They offered me a full refund for a positive review. This is honest. I did get the refund and kept the battery. I am satisfied with this outcome but I still need to buy a new battery that will meet my requirements. I hope whatever struggles they’re having at Icell they get it worked out. It’s just better for everyone to be accurate in describing merchandise. To be fair they made it right in the end.
title: Read recent reviews

author: joseph
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2018
review_content: Purchased this product April 2017 and immediately loved it. If you never used a lighting charger then your missing out. The product worked great for the entire time until this past week. I contacted customer service and they gave me some instructions on how to troubleshoot it and how to request a replacement under the 18 month warranty. I contacting them back with my purchase info and they immediately sent me a replacement. I not only love the charger but the Customer service was outstanding!!!
title: AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

author: Maria D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2018
review_content: This Anker power bank is amazing, the battery life seems to be endless, I charged my iPhone 5S (which need constant charging due to its bad battery life) to 100% around 5 times a day for an entire week before I needed to charge the power bank again. It charges my phone very quickly and is not as bulky as I would expect it to be for such a high capacity.In addition, the Anker customer service is fast, efficient and professional. One of the accessories that came with the power bank (the pouch to store it) broke, so I contacted their customer service to see if I could get a replacement. Their support was very effective and they sent me a free replacement within a few days of my first email! The only down side of this power bank is that it takes long to fully recharge, but a few hours of plugging it to the wall will get you through an entire day of charging multiple devices! Overall a great product and amazing customer support, I would highly recommend getting this product.
title: Great product, extensive battery life and amazing customer service!

author: Ben
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2017
review_content: Works well, I've been using it for nearly two years now and the only issue I've run into was the included charging cord getting ruined, along with a Samsung cord getting ruined. Those were my partially my fault however, as I would put the power bank into my backpack without unplugging the cord from it, which would cause it to snap the cords because of the weight of the power bank. Replacing the cord isn't too bad, but I would recommend not leaving your cords plugged in while carrying it around inside of a bag. The power bank however is still in great condition and can charge my phone many times before needing to recharge.Overall, a great buy and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a portable charging method.
title: Great product

author: Natalie P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2018
review_content: I purchased this in March of 2016, for portable charging for my phone.  It worked great, though about a year into using it, one of the ports stopped working consistently.  The other port worked fine through about October/November of 2017, right at the end of the warranty (it's how they get you!).  I was still using the PowerCore, but less frequently, since even while plugged in and "charging" my phone did not take a charge from it. I tried different cords and wall outlets to charge the PowerCore, and different cords to charge my phone with the PowerCore, and none worked, though my phone charged fine with these cords using a wall charger. I finally decided to give up on the first one working as well as it had in the past, and purchased a second one today. Aside from the inconsistent port and the PowerCore no longer giving a charge after 19-20 months, the PowerCore worked really well when it did (and I know a few other people who purchased this battery and it's still running great).  Crossing my fingers for the same quality of product - but hoping it might last a little longer than just past the warranty this time.
title: It worked great, though about a year into using it

author: Dennis Gallashaw Jr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2019
review_content: I bought one years ago and that one still works fine. So I decided to purchase another one for my wife  a few months ago and it wouldn’t charge any of my Apple products. Customer service replaced it and the new still doesn’t work. Unfortunately I may have missed the return deadline so I’m stuck with a paperweight.
title: Do not purchase

author: MK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2016
review_content: THANK YOU. there were some bad storms the other night in Richmond, VA, where my Mom is and my older brother is visiting.. they lost their power as many others did. I've purchased Anker chargers before, and they have never disappointed. i ordered this product last night when i received a couple texts from my family saying that they would turn off their phones soon to save power.. i was going to do overnight shipping anyways, but it was FREE, and the product arrived this morning, and i just received word from my Mom that it arrived with 50% power and is currently charging both of their phones. 50% should be more than enough to top off their phones a few times over.. Quality product. and, again.. THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Very appreciative. - Mark
title: awesome

author: René
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2019
review_content: About the product:It takes a while to load, say a couple of hours, despite them the duration is good, charge a cell phone a couple of times, it is quite portable and does not heat up at all, on the highly recommended product.About the package:In the description it says that the package includes a bag, battery, cable and manuals. I only received the battery, alone without any bag or anything, I wrote to support and when they sent it back only the bag came, without cable or manuals or anything.
title: The product is good, unfortunately I had problems with the integrity of the package.

author: Tami Kuntz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2018
review_content: I bought this product  to take on my first long distance hike to keep my tracking device charged. The 2nd day on the trail, I got stuck in an all day rain storm. The Anker, along with everything else in my pack, was damp. All power was drained and I ended up with no way to charge my tracking device except a dollar isle charging block. Thankfully, that one held its charge so I could get enough battery power in my tracker in case of emergency, but not enough to let family know I was safe. I am very disappointed in this product and I don’t know how to get it replaced.It’s a shame that a cheap charger that was in the same bag as this expensive one continued to work while the one most was dead.I am updating my original review. Originally I had given this item one star due to the issues we had with it not working. Upon my return from my through hike, there was a brand new Anker waiting for me. While this did not solve my problem on my hike, the customer service was fantastic and therefore I have increased this to three stars
title: Did not work when I needed it most and don’t know how to resolve the issue.

author: Richard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2015
review_content: This thing rocks!!I have used this very often, I am an Ingress player and I am out and about for hours with no worries about my phone dieing! I have used it for two days straight and it had more than 25% charge left! Fits in an inside jacket pocket and id lighter than I thought it would be, Lot's of folks mentioned the weight, I think it is fine.
