It is a bit slippery, make sure you have a good grip on it when changing out cords!!All in all, I am extremely happy with my purchase. Anker products seem to always be good quality and not overpriced. I will continue to be their customer, as long as they keep up this good work!!
title: I think it is fine. It is a bit slippery

author: Mike
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2020
review_content: Bought one older model in 2016 that still charges an iPad from empty while my kid is using it.  Also a second which I think is this model in feb 2019 that has been works even better. Just about to buy my third right now. I’ve bought 2 other brands similar capacity in that time that both stopped working. Only Anker from now on.
title: Will only buy Anker from now on.

author: Jared Wenzel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2017
review_content: Works great as a portable charger for my Galaxy S7 and iPod touch.  Perfect capacity for when I'm not home for the weekend when I'm power using it for GPS.  One of the output ports has broken twice in the 18 month warranty but Anker was very proactive at fixing it for me both times.  My current brick has been working perfectly for over a year with 0 issues.  If it does fail I will not hesitate to buy a newer model.
title: Great Buy!!

author: Elizabeth Wilson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2016
review_content: I LOVE this item!  I do a lot of longer distance bicycling and some bike touring.  I keep this in my handlebar bag so I can listen to music, keep a couple of gps and bicycle route programs going and still be able to use the camera and text/call and never run my smartphone battery down.  It also recharges my bike lights.It is so easy too.  If you already have the piece that fits into the wall socket the one cord handles the rest, both charge whatever your charging as well as the item itself.  You just flip the cord around.  When I looked at the directions before using it they showed a charger being needed to be you don't need that at all so think simple.
title: The Best!

author: J. Sullivan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2018
review_content: It's what I thought it would be, only maybe a little bigger. About the size of a 3 cigar case. I've found it holds about 4 full charges worth for my s7 and/or iPhone 6. It charges fairly fast with proper cables , and has no problem charging two devices at once.Seems fairly well built , looks nice enough.Will update if anything changes, but right now I see it as a good product that does what I expected it to do.
title: Pretty good

author: G. Millikan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2016
review_content: PROS: I've bought three of these for friends or family.  I plug it in to my iPhone 6 for a 2 night business trip and don't run out of battery. Period. No hunting for outlets in airport or behind beds in hotels.  Durable.  Not too heavy.CONS: Hard to tell when the battery is fully charged.  Dumb flashlight feature turns on sometimes and hard to figure out how to turn if off.  I'm sure these last 2 things are supposed to be easy to figure out but when traveling it's all goes sideways - they're not horrible, so still giving it 5 stars because it does exactly what you'd expect.Suggest always keeping the USB charging cord and the charger combined together in the included black mesh carry case.
title: Works great

author: BRouse
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2019
review_content: This is by far the best out there. Being on the road for my job and using my work tools this charger is a life saver and money maker. I’m able to recharge my tablets and phones 2-3 times fully before having to recharge the battery pack. Recharge time is fast. If you travel and use your electronics for work to make you money look no further than this great charger. If you are worried about price at first don’t be. It will pay for its self in no time.
title: Best portable charger on the market!!

author: Giorgina Frumpington
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020
review_content: I've had this device for about 9 months and used it about 10 times.  When it was brand new it worked really well.  Charged quickly.  Now it doesn't charge anything.  Kind of annoying.
title: No longer charges

author: Yogesh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2017
review_content: We are still using it virtually every day, you can charge you phone almost 5-6 time with fully charged pack. We take it whenever we go out, and also you can use it when you are at home. You don't have to sit next to wall if you want to use your phone when you are home. Don't need longer charger cables. Parents with babies can benefit from it as you don't have to leave your charger hanging from the wall and you can place your phone out of reach of your babies while charging your phone.a must have for everyone
title: We are still using it virtually every day, you ...

author: Rltms
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019
review_content: I own numerous anker products. I bought this as a gift for my little sister after her 1st one broke from extensive/prolong usage. All things were good until one day it suddenly stopped charging. Figured it was a dud battery and messaged customer service for a replacement. They replaced! Things happen, first time I have had an issue with their products!!Within a few days, we got a brand new one! The customer service at anker is speedy, reliable, and accommodating. The rep. Shellie did an excellent job at taking care of us and making sure all of our needs/requests/questions were answered!!Love the products and customer service- will without a doubt continue purchasing anker products
title: Great Customer Service

author: QueenB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2017
review_content: I travel long distances for work daily and needed a portable charger for my multiple devices.  I truly never leave home without this device.  The charge lasts for a long time and I can recharge two devices at the same time with ease.After a year of near daily usage I noticed that the charge was not holding as it previously did so I contacted Anker customer service.  Customer service was professional and courteous and sent me a replacement right away.Five star product and five star service.
title: Never leave home without it!

author: May Tran
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
review_content: I bought this for my traveling, and it was working wonderful for my two trips oversea.  Unfortunately, it died completely last month.  When I tried to charge my phones with this unit, nothing showed up.  Dead!!!
title: After two trips, the thing is dead.

author: Reviewer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2018
review_content: The Anker 20100mAh Portable Charger is an exceptional product if your needs meet the battery's specifications. If you are someone that just wants a very portable charger to save your phone from dying in a pinch, this heavy duty product is not for you. However, this battery is ideal for someone that needs all their devices charged in one battery life, or someone who is in a place without electricity for extended periods of time. Due to energy lost to heat, and inefficiencies in the charging cord, you can expect to get around 20% of the 20100mAh listed by Anker. Overall, a great portable battery that makes up in mAh where it falls short in size and weight.
title: Perfect battery for someone who needs lots of charge per battery.

author: Willie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2016
review_content: Of all the products of purchased on Amazon, this one has to be the one I use the most. This battery pack will charge my phone about 6 times before I have to recharge it. I love Anker for making such a great quality product like this, as well as their phone batteries. I bring it anywhere I know I won't have access to a charger, such as my camping trips and other outdoor excursions. The price is extremely reasonable for the amount of power this thing holds. I've even purchased a couple as gifts, and everyone who I've given one to loves it! Thanks for a great quality product at a very reasonable price!
title: The last portable charger you'll ever have to buy!

author: kenneth line
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2020
review_content: I can charge my cheap Samsung phone from walmart 4 times using this portable charger. Even though it's a little on the long side, it is still slender and works great. I would hands down recommend this product to any one.
title: Most buy!!!

author: Nathaniel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2019
review_content: I use this to keep my phone (Pixel XL) charged while bike camping. I use my phone way more then normal when doing so (location services are Always On, constantly listening to music. Browsing Facebook at stops. Posting images and video when coverage is good) but this Bank keeps me going for 3 days of such constant use before I need to re-charge. I'm sure people who use their devices less extravagantly can get more days, but I am very pleased.
title: I love this Power bank.

author: Shelby Hallford
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
review_content: this definitely led me to belief it would charge my phone quickly. Unfortunately it took 4 hours to get my phone to a full charge, without using it. While using it moved, but I only got up about 5% in 30 minutes. Good thing is this battery pack really is capable of multiple full charges, and the indicator lights on it to tell you how charged it is are great. I just wanted it to be faster because thats what it advertised and I paid for it bc of that
title: compact, slow charger

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2019
review_content: To be honest I rarely write reviews. This had to be said. I have purchased and used a dozen power bank chargers in my life. All have lasted well over a year or so. This broke without even being moved around or handled much at all. It lasted 2 months flat and now will not charge and there is a rattling sound inside the product. I was all about Anker. I will never buy from them again and will make sure family and friends do not as well! Anker if you're reading this send me a replacement and I will change review ASAP.
title: Broke within 2 months

author: Kathy Ellmaker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2018
review_content: I purchased this to use with my dash cam. I own an electric car and am unable to use the car port for risk of damaging the car batteries. I am able to run a full week without having to recharge the power bank for my dash cam. I tend to forget to unplug the dash cam and it will usually record overnight a few times. :) I am very happy with the performance and the longevity for the purpose I use it for. For the price you can't go wrong.
title: Long battery life for Dash Cams

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2017
review_content: I did not have any experience with battery back ups prior to this purchase. I bought this product for a trip to the Netherlands.First of all I took this through multiple airports in my carry on bag without issue. Also, I carried this device in the same carry on sling bag throughout my travels.I used the device to charge phones and cameras. I was pretty happy that I could plug my device into the charger, put the whole into a compartment of my bag and continue on my way.Couldn't be happier with this product. Although I haven't used any others this one worked well. Also I only did two phone charges and a camera charge between recharging the device, so I never did actually drain the device. I recharged the device every evening.
title: Great Product

author: Nancy L. Otto
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2018
review_content: Even though this charger is fast and can accommodate 2 phones, I returned it.  The description clearly states that the charger is as heavy as a can of soup and goes to great length to explain why.  However, when it arrived, I realized it is simply too heavy to carry in a pocket without weighing me down.If the weight isn't an issue, I would highly recommend this product.  I received an email from the company and was pleased at the interest.
title: Fast and Charges Two Phones...but heavy

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2020
review_content: The cable isn’t meant for using with Apple.Take an Apple cable before you leave home!You need 2 cables: one for recharging ( comes with the charger).One to connect with Apple devices.
title: Change de câble for IPad/iPhone

author: Chan Saechao
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2020
review_content: I bought this portable charger and I charged it until all lights turned iff.  I let it sit for a week since I didn’t use it but it charged my iphone for 5 mins before it stopped working.  When i plugged the battery back in, it showed that 4 lights on already with the last light blinking. Basically my battery charger did not work.
title: Did not work.

author: Wendy Tellez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2019
review_content: Love this product. God, has it saved my life so many times! I even have used it at airports to help other people when stranded. When I travel for work most islands I visit are very old school where the outlet is completely away from your bed. Unless I travel with an extension chord, I’m defeated. This is so essential for when I travel. Especially when I’m on a airplane that has no outlets. So happy with this!
title: Buy it !!!!

author: Sarah C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2020
review_content: Takes days to charge the unit! It’s been on the charger for three days and still isn’t fully charged. Light is blinking but seems like nothing is happening. I hope someone contacts me to figure this out as I’m not seeing an option for customer support on this item.
title: Unit doesn’t charge up.

author: J McK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2016
review_content: There are lots of portable chargers out there and this is one of the best.  After extensively reading reviews, I went with this model because of its physical size, battery storage and two ports.  It's easy to charge a phone while holding both in the same hand and easy to charge two devices at the same time.I keep this charged and in my emergency bag.  It's ready to go whether there is a storm in our area at home; a personal emergency to take me away from home or just travel.  It comes with a micro usb/usb cable and in can be stored in the small cloth (breathable) bag that includes a plastic toggle spring stop to secure the cord and keep the bag closed.
title: Power for traveling and emergencies.

author: Ken King
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2017
review_content: I have traveled far with this battery back up and used it many times.  Have charged so many pieces of equipment and especially my cell phone. This allows multiple charges of phones and tablets. Took this with me to the 2016 Paralympics. As a photographer it is very important to have your communication devices charged as there are long days of shooting and going from location to location. Have many Anker products and will continue to purchase more as needed.
title: Great High Capacity Battery Backup

author: Peggy Brunyansky
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2019
review_content: I bought several of these for two of my grandsons for Christmas last year. They are still talking about how much they like them and another grandchild has asked for one too. Do you know how picky older teens and young 20’s are? Score! They are impressed with Grandma!
title: A great purchase

author: Erick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2017
review_content: Anker, as always, has very quality products. This battery is no exception. I bought this battery for a camping trip to yellowstone and it was able to charge both my iPhone and smart watch multiple times through out the trip. Although the trip may have only been four days, my phone was constantly used  to take pictures. After the trip, the battery still had approximately 25% charge left. This product is a MUST buy if you are playing to go to visit secluded locations and would like to stay powered up.
title: Great Battery

author: alex
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2018
review_content: Not even 10 months old. Dropped once and it stopped charging.
title: Not worth the money

author: Naomi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2019
review_content: I have been waiting to purchase an external battery for forever, as I travel often and am constantly in desperate need of a charge. This charger works great. It takes about a half day to fully charge, but once it is you can be confident that it will last you. I always get 4-5 charges and best of all it charges my phone QUICKLY, faster than when I just plug it in to the wall. The pack is a bit heavy but it's sleek and I just drop it into my purse or backpack. I also love that it has two plugs, since someone always wants to borrow it! The carrying case makes it easy to slip an iPhone 7 into, so I often will just carry the phone and the charger in the case. Easy and great!
title: Works fast and great

author: eric welborn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2015
review_content: I purchased this to take with me on a week long site seeing trip in New York city knowing full well my iPhone 6 would be dead by lunch.  Sure enough with all the photos I made and by using the GPS to plot my walking path between attractions my battery was down to 20% by 11:30 a.m.  I pulled out the Anker charger and I was AMAZED how quickly my battery was back up to 90%!!!  My wife and I both were able to charge our phones twice in the same day while the Anker only fell to half power!  We recharged it fully each night and this thing out performed our expectations.  I had previously been using a Brunton pocket charger that maybe would charge my phone once only up to 75% before it was out of juice.  I will be purchasing these for my sons for Christmas.  You will not be disappointed!
title: I pulled out the Anker charger and I was AMAZED how quickly my battery was back up to 90%

author: Erica Hebert
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2016
review_content: I LOVE Anker products and as a company. How often do you find a company that truly cares?I ordered this battery charger to use when I went on vacation. The thing was awesome. I charged my iPhone and my girlfriend's Galaxy with no issues. It charged the phones fast too. You'll get a few charges out of the pack (how many depends on the device you are charging). This battery pack packs some punch and it's pretty light weight and fit in my camera bag no problem. I would suggest buying this if your looking for good quality and a nice company to deal with.  Just FYI Anker sent me a follow up email to make sure everything was working well and that I was happy with the product.
title: Love Anker products

author: booly_booly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2018
review_content: I paired this with an Anker three panel fold out solar array. It works fine and charges quickly, IF you angle the panels correctly in full sun.  Do not leave the battery in full sunlight, just set it in the shadow of the solar array.But with those points in mind, this battery works really well to quickly charge two usb devices at once. It can regulate juice gong in, to charge the unit and discerns what is being charged and regulates flow accordingly.
title: Charges devices faster than the wall outlet

author: Chris JL
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2017
review_content: I was excited to use this on my recent vacation but quickly found out this was a dud.  After what has been a very tough year, I treated myself to a getaway where I hoped to sit out on the beach, drink Pina Coladas and just read/watch videos.  I managed to get a half a charge out of the unit only for it to stop working.  When I got back to my room I could see that it wouldn't charge again.  I got it at a great deal but not worth it if it will not work.  Disappointed as Anker usually has great products.UPDATE 1/16/18:  I reached out to Anker and received a brand new replacement for this battery that works flawlessly.  I must have originally received a bad unit.  Anker was very helpful and understanding of the situation.  ALSO,  it turns out they had been reaching out to me several times to make things right but because of the settings I set on Amazon, they weren’t able to reach me.  So warning, have your settings to allow vendors to message you directly.  Could help expedite any issues you have!
title: Great Product!  Would definitely buy again!

author: I like pandas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020
review_content: This thing has some serious charging capacity! It charged my friend’s tablet from 0 to 100%, and then my iPhone 7 from 0 to 100%, and is still showing 3/4 full. The bright blue color is also helpful for finding it inside your bag. I won’t travel without this.
title: Excellent portable charger

author: Salvatore Alfieri
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2016
review_content: I will keep this short,  as the other reviews covered the majority of specs and information.  Had the unit for several months and will absolutely charge several devices completely until it needs to be charged again.  Seems to rapidly charge devices as well.Only two minor issues:  The unit is somewhat large considering it's made to be portable, however considering the amount of devices that be charged, that's a fair compromise.  The last issue is how long the devices needs to charge in order to be 100% full.  It may take all day to finally charge the device,  and it may seem like it's not charging at all,  but it definitely will be at 100% after a while.Overall, excellent product and would buy again if need be.
title: Excellent portable charger!

author: Mindcontrol
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2017
review_content: It is big. Look at the dimensions before buying. With the 20100mAh capacity this would be good for a family or when you need to charge multiple devices over a long period without having access to a wall charger. Otherwise, I like the convenience of having something much more portable. I still gave it 5 stars because Anker's products are simply the best. When I used it, it did what it was supposed to do. Just be informed prior to making this purchase.
title: One draw back

author: Robert J.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2016
review_content: I received the Anker 20100 PowerCore portable charger to review.  It is AWESOME!  Full speed charging of my electronic devices and I can charge two simultaneously.  Packaging was simple and neat, a place for everything and everything in it's place.  Unpacked the Powercore and charging cable, plugged it in to my Anker Power Port 2 and immediately, the LED status lights showed that the PowerCore was half charged already.  Charging was completed and then tested by plugging my iPad and iPhone into it.  Charging the two devices appeared to be full speed equivalent to a wall charger...and there was power left in the PowerCore for more!  I love this thing!  I am using it when I travel and NEVER worry about my phone or iPad running out of power.  Realize that with such a large power reserve, it does take some time to fully charge the PowerCore.  I am, once again, impressed with Anker's build quality, care in packaging, and attention to detail.  This is an AWESOME product, and I happily recommend it.Thanks Anker!
title: Anker PowerCore 20100...It's AWESOME!

author: WaltP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2015
review_content: This is the 4th external battery I bought and I was truly amazed of how small this product was when compared to other 20000mAh batteries. I guess using high quality cylinder batteries helped to reduce its size. The design is also highly ergonomic. Very comfortable to hold in hand.Bought it as a donation to a tibetan place where electricity is a problem together with Anker solar chargers, however during plane ride in China it got taken away from the checked in luggage from whatever their regulation was.So just a friendly reminder, do not put it in your checked in luggage if you are going for airplane rides.
title: Powerful, ergonomic, slim, and a friendly reminder

author: Grenik
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2015
review_content: Took a chance with this since it was on sale and I have been very happy with the product.  It was larger and heavier than I expected and feels like a small laptop battery instead of a portable charger.  Despite this, I find myself carrying it often in the car or my backpack and have used it several times.Since it has such a large power reserve and I can charge multiple devices at the same time, I do not mind the larger form factor and weight.  I know when I am carrying it that I will not run out of power during that day and it is very comforting.Packaging was nice and I appreciate it having a carrying case.
title: Good device with a lot of power

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2018
review_content: My anker block stopped working, is there warranty on it ? The lights seems to stay on but no charge out of the ports. I tried different cables and no output. Wish I would have kept the little paper work with it, can remember if it had factory warranty. Pretty good charger but it stopped working. :/****updateI was contacted by their customer service team the following day after writing this review. Their team was very pleasant to deal with and quick with their responses. Within a day or two, they've already sent out a replacement for the faulty PowerCore 20100 I purchased. Definitely buying their products again. It took me a while to find my review to update but I finally got to done! Thank you Anker for the fantastic experience, great customer service!Quick,Fast & Easy.The replacement was shipped and replaced free of charge! And a follow up email came along with it just to make sure everything was well with the product! 5stars!
title: Pretty good charger but it stopped working

author: Shannon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2018
review_content: I can’t live without this now that I have one! Perfect for a day at the theme park, or at the pool, or even just out running errands when I don’t have time to charge my phone in the car. It recharges my phone so fast and multiple times before having to be charged itself. I wish it were covered in a no slip material - but that’s only if I’m being picky. It’s a MUST HAVE FIR DISNEYLAND so you can take all the pics and instastories without losing battery life!!!!
title: MUST HAVE FOR DISNEYLAND

author: andy conklin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2018
review_content: It is a great product. I took it to Ireland and it was nice having extra power when I needed it. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the cable they provide with it was garbage. It would not charge unless I held it in place. I had the same issue with another Ankor product so it is just cheap cables. It didn't charge for the first part of my vacation which was a let down. I bought a new cable and it works like a charm. They should give a decent quality cable to match the great quality of the product itself.
title: Great backup! Lasts a very long time and is safe for air travel.

author: Mcie2
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2019
review_content: Worked  great for 11 months then abruptly would not charge at all. All lights are blue but as soon as I attach my device it turns off.Also rather heavy if carrying around with you.
title: Worked great until it didn’t

author: Chris W
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2018
review_content: After using many other chargers that were disappointing, I purchased this one based on the reviews.  Best Purchase I Have Made!!  My wife and I take this camping with us.  It charges both our phones almost two full time.  That would be three plus charges for one phone.  I have started taking it with us almost everywhere, just in case. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!
title: Best High Capacity Charger I Have Owned!

author: turtlemocha29
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2019
review_content: UPDATE:I sent the message below to Anker. They asked me to try a different cord just to make sure it wasn’t a faulty connection. I did, but it was still. It working. I let them know and they sent out a new charger the same day!!! The new one works perfectly. Anker customer service is awesome! No back and forth bs, just wanting to get me a working product. So happy to have my amazing charger working again!Anker, I LOVE this battery but is recently stopped charging. I’ve plugged the battery in overnight and the 1st dot is still blinking. I recommend to friends family and coworkers because of how long it lasts and how many times I can charge multiple devices. Please help!!! Thanks Julie
title: UPDATE: Love this charger!!

author: Mark
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2019
review_content: Not sure if I just got a bad one but I charged it to use on our vacation and it would come on the start charging my iPhone and then it would stop. I had to keep hitting the button on the side to turn it back on but it would keep going off. Must be defective 🤷🏻‍♀️ But I couldn’t get it to work and my coworker has one and loves hers. I need to get information on where to return it to get a new one?!?
title: Need a New one! Mine doesn’t work

author: John B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2019
review_content: Bought this for a vacation. Am very pleased that it worked as advertised. Sturdy, easy to use. Never ran out of power on any device. Plenty of recharges. Yes it is large and if you are looking for a tiny daily backup for only your phone, then maybe this is not for you. But for multiple recharges or multiple devices, then this item cannot be beat.
title: Excellent in every way

author: Todd Twohey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2018
review_content: Update: Anker noticed my review and corrected the issue. They sent me a new power bank with a 10V wall charger. So what I learned is that my original power bank could have just been one of the defective ones or it's not compatible with my iPhone 5V wall charger. The new power bank I received from Anker with the 10V wall charger charges much faster than the 5V and works perfect without overheating. Customer service was great and they were quick to respond and send a new power bank.Original: Doesn’t come with wall charger so I have been using my iPhone wall charger. I also don’t use it often so when I finally need to recharge, the Anker became very hot. It did fully recharge and I was able to use again, but when it was time to recharge the Anker, it stopped recharging. Only had a full charge 3 times. May need to buy a new portable charger. This didn’t last as long as I hoped.
title: Good Power Bank

author: browser.89
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2018
review_content: This is a great portable charger. I use it mostly at work to charge my phone (Samsung Galaxy Note 8) which has a fairly large battery. I am usually able to get about 4 charges out of it before I have to recharge. This portable charger does take a while to charge. I prefer to charge it overnight and it is usually finished in the morning. As far as using it to charge my devices, it charges them pretty fast. The size is perfect for carrying around all day. I would highly recommend buying a carrying case for it.
title: Great portable charger.

author: Susan Darling
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2019
review_content: I loved this device but it broke after 1 year. I wrote a 2 star review expressing my disappointment. Within 24 hours, Jane from Anker emailed me offering to send me a new one, free of charge. Within 7 days, I received a brand new Anker PowerCore (they did not have me send back the original, stating they didn't want to trouble me any further). Jane then followed up to confirm receipt and satisfaction.My statement back to Jane:"Yours has been customer service at a level I haven’t seen in a long time, if ever. I have already updated my Amazon feedback thread, and told many family members and friends. Thank you and your company for being a leader in your industry through quality equipment and impeccable customer service."Thank you Anker and Jane!
title: Amazed!!!

author: TeriLynn Rao
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2018
review_content: As a student who uses multiple devices all day at school, this portable charger (while more expensive than most) gives the MOST charging ability, and can hold a huge amount of power so that I can use my devices all day long. I can’t live without this charger! Thank goodness I saw this in an article about the best accessories students need, and found it easily on Amazon!!! SO Happy with this portable charger!
title: AMAZING PERFECT portable charger!!! BEST IN CLASS!

author: Ngozi Nweke
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2018
review_content: Pro: it can charge my phone about 3/4 full times before I need to completely recharge it.Con: it takes a while to get it fully charged, I actually have to leave it on the charger for a couple days for it to fully charge.I think because of its size and longevity that’s why it takes a while to fully charge. I don’t really mind since it don’t use it all the time. It’s is quite bulky but that’s only because it can last for days so it bigger! I think it’s great for travel especially when you don’t have access to a wall charger. Great product
title: Long battery life

author: Larry Block
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2019
review_content: Purchased a unit, it was immediately not holding a charge as indicated.  I exchanged it for a second unit and the USB ports didn’t work properly.  Both ports would charge for 60 seconds, then shut off.  Very disappointed!Update:  The Company contacted me promptly, sent me a new unit, and it seems to be working fine.  I am adding another star for their customer service, but leaving it at 3 starts bc a customer shouldn't have to go through the hassle of two defective units in a row.
title: 2 defective units in a row, then received a working unit

author: steph i
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2017
review_content: i bought this because i had the Anker 3500mAh battery, and that gives my iPhone 6S Plus about 80% battery.  Because I was using my phone a lot at work running lots of apps, at Disneyland for Snapchat, Instagram and such, and playing Pokemon GO, i needed a battery that could charge it more than once, and charge a friend's phone as well.  so far this has been a good investment.  the only downside is that it is much heavier than my 3500mAh battery, and definitely bigger, so it does weigh heavier in my purse, and takes up more space
title: great for those who need to charge their phones often

author: David A. Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2020
review_content: It took me about 2 hours to fully chare this when I received it.  The weight is a bit heavy but manageable.  We used it this past weekend and it charged miny phones and ran a speaker!  HAPPY
title: Charge On........

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2018
review_content: I have bought many, many, many chargers from Amazon over the last 5+ years.  This is the best one by leaps and bounds.  It is a bit heavy, but it will charge my cell repeatedly without stopping to be charged itself.  Even better, it will charge my iPad while streaming.  And gain charge, not just hold steady.  Never had a charger that strong before.  I keep it in my purse always, and I will definitely be buying more as gifts for the members of my family who are always on low battery.
title: Best charger I’ve ever owned

author: Chris W
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2016
review_content: I bought this along with the Anker PowerPort 10 Desktop USB charger hub and I'm having the exact same issue. One of the ports completely stopped working. I've tried multiple cords. When they both worked, and now with only the 1 port working, it does indeed charge very fast and last very long, but I'm afraid the second port will go out soon and it will be a brick then. 5 stars when it works, 3 stars due to quality. Seems fragile to be used for a travel battery?EDIT 1/25/15: Anker contacted me and sent me a new battery without hesitation. All seems to be working great now. Most DEFINITELY 5 stars.
title: AWESOME!

author: Nicholas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2020
review_content: Beach, golf, office, travel, around the house so you're not tied down to an outlet... also makes a great gift because the person you get it for will scratch their head at first and then question how they ever lived without in with a few weeks.
title: I Now Own Three Of These

author: TP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2016
review_content: Pros:-It's convenient if you want a charger with you and you have the spaceCons:-PowerCore has problems recharging to max-Can not charge iPhone and itself at the same time-BulkyUpdated 4/6:-Use the 2a wall charger if you want the external battery to charge quicker-the function that allowed the iPhone at the same time as charging the battery was allowed in the previous version but was removed due to the damage it could cause to the battery and/or iPhone-any problems can be resolved with Anker customer service. They make sure the customer is happy.
title: UPDATED after 3 months use

author: NickV_and_JessV
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2019
review_content: Although it takes longer to charge, it holds at least 2-3 full charges for an iPhone. Perfect for overnight charging and on the go traveling. Our family has 3 total and everyone loves this one! It may be longer and bulkier than others but very reliable if charged..
title: Best portable charger!

author: Shauna Hammac
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2019
review_content: Love this charger! I travel alot for work so having a back up battery is vital to ensuring I don't have to worry about finding a wall outlet during the day. This charger takes a long time to charge up but once it is charged, it lasts forever! It is large but not so large that it is inconvenient when traveling.
title: Charger for Days

author: Scott A Newland
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2020
review_content: I use this to charge my GoPro 7 Black while recording 4k video. I need the recording to last hours at a time and this works great for that. I get many days use out of a single charge and it keeps the camera recording past the 50 odd minutes you'd get on a charge. I think it's worth the money but I like to save a buck. If it goes on sale again, I'll grab another one.
title: Great power bank.

author: TaDarling
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2019
review_content: Love this product because it charges to 100% quickly.  However, for my taste, it is much too heavy and cumbersome to use for travel.  Although it would fit easily inside of a backpack, it might be a problem for some purses.  I use it exclusively at home and it works great!
title: Charges quickly but is rather heavy

author: Silver M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2017
review_content: Very satisfied with this product. Nicely packaged and received quickly. I have charged my iPhone 3x and my iPad 1x on one charge from this device and I still have a  bar left. My iPad was on 5% and my iPhone was on about 20% each time. I didn't time the charging except for once which was a couple hours. I plan on a European trip in September and wanted it for that. I love it. The company also seems very responsive and concerned that everyone be totally satisfied. Very impressive.
title: Totally satisfied!

author: Nick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2019
review_content: bought this for our Disney trip over a month ago. It saved us on the trip keeping all the phones charged. After charging it the final night i took it out of the draw the other day and the battery was still full.. After a whole month it is still full. I highly recommend buying this over any other one.
title: Battery is full after a month of sitting

author: Bobby W
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020
review_content: Bought this to charge an iPhone 11 and a Samsung Galaxy S9. I also use it to charge my Bluetooth speaker. Its charge lasts a long time, and it recharges quickly with a 24W wall charger.
title: Perfect charger for today's electronics!

author: EeyoreEeyoreOh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2017
review_content: Bought this for SXSW.  You cannot let your phone die at SX.  I can charge multiple phones to 100%  I now bring it with me everywhere.  Yes, it's a little heavier but so worth it.  It has saved us multiple times.  It's also perfect for flying.  I can charge our always dying iPad  (we watch a lot of movies) and keep our phones at 100% so when we land we can text, call and Lyft/Uber our way to our final destination.  This was my first product by Anker.  I now own several other Anker products and feel quite loyal to them.
title: It's also perfect for flying

author: J_Stevens
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2016
review_content: Bought this a few months ago because my work takes me out into the field, and constantly dealing with my phone. As far as portable chargers go, this one is pretty solid. It holds as many charges as it claims, (i use it on my iphone 6), and is durable enough to take a few drops (im a little clumsy). Mine was stolen from my car, and I came back to purchase a new one, because others I have tried don't hold up as well.Pros:DurableHolds a lot of charges (especially for the price)easy to useCons:does take overnight to get it to full charge initiallycharges relatively slowly compared to lightning chargers out there (but still substantially fast)writing this review purely because i enjoyed the product and wanted to share my opinion
title: Pros and cons

author: Brandon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2018
review_content: **EDIT**I am writing a new review because of the amazing customer service I received from this company. They reached out to me IMMEDIATELY regarding my issue with the battery pack. Within a day, I had a brand new battery pack sent to me. New battery pack works perfectly and the communication from this company was unparalleled! This is the perfect definition of “customer service”!*******I bought this battery because I attend a lot of music festivals, and needed something that would last for charging my phone over weekend long festivals. It worked like a dream for the first couple of festivals. At first, I could go 3 days on one single charge.Fast forward 3 months, and the the battery will not even charge past “1 bar”. I have tried different plug outlets and different wall chargers with no avail. Kind of disappointed that this $50 charger would have such a short battery life.
title: Does not charge after only 3 months!

author: Turtle Carey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2020
review_content: I never use this at all. I have normal chargers at home so I don’t need it there.  I have charged it. It is so darn heavy.  I never expected it to weigh that much. Too heavy to put in a purse or even a travel bag.
title: Product too heavy for every day use.

author: Corina Womack
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2019
review_content: It charges very quickly, which is great.  The problem with this charger is that after probably a handful of full charges now it will only charge up to two levels after 24 hours on the charger.  Very disappointed because now I’m stuck with a $50 charger that I can’t return since it has more than 30 days since I purchased it.  I’ll have to see how long it lasts.
title: Stopped charging all the way after five full charges

author: Rain
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2018
review_content: I keep this battery in my purse to use when out and about. I wanted something that could charge my phone multiple times so I don't have to worry about charging the battery constantly, and this works perfectly.The battery holds a charge even when not used constantly.I used this battery continually for a year and a half before it stopped charging my devices, however it would accept and hold a charge itself. I emailed the Anker customer service team, who gave me suggestions on resetting the battery, and then sent me a refurbished one when nothing worked. I was outside of the 18 month warranty available, but the refurbished one is charging my devices and I am very happy with it and with the Anker Customer Service.
title: Holds charge for a long time, is durable, charges phone multiple times

author: Marty T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2016
review_content: I like this thing a lot. Compared to my s6 edge plus, it's a little longer, a little more narrow, and maybe twice as thick, but not too heavy in my opinion. I just keep it in my backpack. I get 5 or 6 full charges on my galaxy s6 edge plus. I did a controlled test where I completely drained my phone battery then fully charged it, I did this until the power bank was dead, but now I can't  remember if it was 5 or 6 charges. Either way, plenty of capacity.  Only downside is it takes 32-36 hours to fully charg from a full drain. I've charged it maybe 5 times now and it always takes a day and a half
title: Great product, a bit slow to charge, though

author: MchalffeyA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2019
review_content: Okay so this thing is awesome. I bought it for my husband while he was deployed and for him to use during field training in the future. It is AMAZING. It charges his phone fully about 4 times and hasn’t scratched or anything with use. He is a tank mechanic so I tried my hardest to find the best charger for him to last.
title: Amazing battery

author: Hugo Oliveira
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2020
review_content: These power packs are very high quality. Will charge your phone very quickly and you will be left with lots of power left over. Highly recommended if you plan travel away from a plug in power source.
title: A nice companion for travel away from power sources.

author: Jem.ok
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2020
review_content: Worked great, battery lasted thru a 2 plus hour movie on a dead tablet with more run time.  But I returned it because the battery wouldn't take a full charge after the first initial full charge.  I was afraid it would give me problems, plus it was too heavy for a purse.
title: To heavy for a purse

author: Timothy Lewis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2017
review_content: Just got this today so if anything changes, I'll edit.Right now, it does an impressive job keeping all of my devices (Phone, tablet, 3DS, and Vita) powered throughout a work day. Yes, I use these devices at work. I bought it for the Nintendo Switch, which launches in three days, but the uses are limitless... provided those uses include charging things via USB.-I'll update how long it takes to charge from empty-I'll update turbo charging capabilities*Edit* As mentioned before, I bought this for the Nintendo Switch, even though I'm using it for a myriad of devices. I purposely let the Switch battery drain until it shut itself off. With the battery connected while playing, it didn't dip in power. That's good. Charging it from 0% is an extremely slow process, but the Anker power bank does appear to be more than capable of the job.As a side bonus, it seems to be fully capable of charging two devices at once. You may need to refer to a FAQ or YouTube video to get specifics on actual power output, though.
title: All the power you'll ever need!

author: AnCreek
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2016
review_content: I got this charger mainly for my cell phone. I'm on the go during the week and I forget to charge my phone a lot at the most inconvenient times it seems. So it's been really nice to be able to charge on the go and for it to be done really quickly. My phone is usually at least 50% up within the hour and I don't have to remember to plug/unplug all the time because I can just throw it in my purse. It's a little heavier than i'd like but I also don't have to recharge it except on the weekends. I can charge my phone up to 6 times from about 15% to 100% on 1 charge and I have a Samsung Note 5. Anker makes a good product and I would buy again if I should need another charger.
title: Never have to worry about a dead phone again!

author: Thomas T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2017
review_content: Been using this product for about 2 weeks. I work in law enforcement and this has been a life saviour. In the 2 weeks I've charged it once. And I've charged my phone 4 times from about 20% each time to 100% along with my partners. The battery is still good and does not need to be charged yet. Buy this product it is great!Just a side not it is a little large and heavy not something you can really walk around with. But great to keep in your backpack, laptop bag so on.
title: The battery is still good and does not need to be charged yet

author: Happywife
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
review_content: This battery took about 24 hours to fully charge but then completely charged my nearly dead phone three times and still was halfway charged.  It has 2 USB ports so can charge more than one device.  What a great charger if your power goes out for more than a day.
title: Can charge phone or laptop easily

author: IP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2018
review_content: I've had this for 10 months now and it doesn't matter how long I charge it, when you push the button to check charge level, it just blinks the left most light. It seems like it still has charge, but I can't trust it on long trips. This has been my back packing and camping battery pack, but now I can't be confident its charged without getting the 4 (or 2 or 3) lights.
title: Blinking light only after 10 months

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019
review_content: This thing is great.  It does take a while to charge it to full capacity but it is with the wait. It has charged up a several phones that were almost dead and still had more juice left.  I like the carrying case and the fact it can charge up two things at once.
title: Awesome product!!!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2019
review_content: The first one I purchased didn’t work. Returned it and got a replacement. The replacement worked for a couple weeks and now won’t hold a charge. I can understand that every now and then you get a bad unit but two in a row...??
title: Two failed units

author: Allison Justin C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2017
review_content: Insanely easy to use, durable, and I have NEVER run out of charge. We have kids, all with cell phones/devices, and when we all head out to the theme parks this thing is our trooper. We've even dropped it and it still works (not recommended though, not sure if it SHOULD be dropped), but we can go all day through the parks and only use 3 out of 4 lit LEDs.The block is bulky - as expected with a giant battery, but it's slim design fits perfect a backpack or purse. I actually have a small pocket for media players in my backpack with a wire hole. So I plop this baby in that spot, send the two charge cables out as I walk around and my wife and kids mooch off of it. Actually makes for a good tethering system for the distracted teens in theme parks. *laugh line*One thing though - don't use your phone while charging on the block - you're just wasting it. Give it 30-60 minutes of charge time and you'll be back in business. Supports fast charging although it normally doesn't register as such on your phone because of the IQ tech. But you'll be surprised when you leave it chilling for an hour and your phone is back from 14% to 85%+. Holds about 4 full charges give or take for a standard smartphone battery.To find out how much juice your battery needs, download cpu-z and get the numbers on it. Then divide it into 20100 and you have how many charges this gives your device.
title: Perfect for the Family that likes Theme Parks

author: Michael
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2017
review_content: It works. Idk if it fast charges my LG G6. I've tried both ports, the charge speed is acceptable but I'm pretty sure the 1.8 amp wall charger charges faster. I'm not sure if that's a mechanism in the phone that works only when applying a certain input? But, otherwise it's totally acceptable. It doesn't tell me it's charging slowly, which I've had issues with using other battery packs.The unit is big, and has some heft, but it probably has 6 18650 batteries inside so that's not unexpected. The build quality is great. Feels very sturdy, I'd expect it would hold up well enough to the accidental drops and such. I'd definitely recommend it, although now I see they have one with the dual fast charging ports, which would probably be worth the price if you had devices that matched up with those ports. As I said above, it doesn't actually fast charge my phone, but both ports do charge it at an acceptable rate, so for me this one is just fine.
title: the charge speed is acceptable but I'm pretty sure the 1

author: Dee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020
review_content: I had this product for nearly 4 years and it still works like a dream. Charges my ipod classic, my samsung 9+ and my Nintendo switch like a dream and even at the same time with 2 phones like it's nothing. I'm telling you, this thing is so amazing and durable if taken cared properly. Was able to fully charge my phone twice in one day due to a road trip and still had power left in it. Just get it. I absolutely love it.
title: JUST GET THIS CHARGING MIRACLE

author: Lilly Rose
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2020
review_content: The first one we had was stolen and that lasted us 3 years. We just bought another because we love it so much! The battery lasts forever and the drop proof case keeps it in perfect condition. Great charger!
title: Best portable charger

author: Jolee Bindo.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2015
review_content: This thing is AMAZING! Charged my Note 3 about 6 times on a 75% charge! Which means it will probably charge it 8 times with a full charge.I bought a cheap 50k mA power bank from eBay and it charged my phone 1.5 times..Trust me. Spend the extra dollars on this amazing Anker product and you will NOT be disappointed.UPDATE: I definitely notice my charge lasts longer when I charge with the power bank compared to when I use my wall charger.This is also the only device that will charge my HIGHLY Moody note 2014 tablet. (Not even the oem cable charge it that fast)
title: What the heck

author: Archana S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2019
review_content: I do not know if I have received a defective unit, but this just does not fast-charge. I tried using this with original Samsung fast-charge cable for my Samsung S9 Plus and I also tried using the Apple original cord for iPhone 6S and 11, it just does not fast-charge. My phone detects this as "Cable charging" which is NOT fast-charging. Sdly I have to return this.
title: NOT Fast Charging

author: whatdoiknow?
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2017
review_content: LOVE, LOVE ,LOVE THIS!  I use it while traveling to charge my IPhone or Kindle. I use it at home to charge while I am talking on the phone or reading my Kindle. I love being able to sit on the couch and talk on the phone while my phone is charging, if I have to get up and walk around, no worries, I can bring the charger with me.  same with charging my Kindle. I can keep reading while it is charging. no more waiting till it finishes charging while plugged into the wall.
title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

author: Fabian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019
review_content: I bought this power bank for my climb up Kilimanjaro. Since my phone was my main camera I needed to keep it charged for 7 days on the mountain with no electricity. Even in the freezing temps I was able to charge my phone every night to 100%. I also charged my iPad once. It never ran out of power so I don't know how long it lasts, but at least 7 full charges for my iPhone.
title: Exactly what I needed

author: C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2018
review_content: I purchased this product before international travel I had planned and it was such a lifesaver! It charged our phones and tablets multiple times and was so handy while we were on the go and had limited outlet use. I'd tested a lot of inexpensive portable chargers prior to making this investment and was always disappointed. This product can recharge devices many times without needing to be recharged.I emailed customer support when I had an issue and they immediately remedied things. Great customer service made me feel confident in my purchase!The only downside - it is heavy but that's the price you pay to have a battery with that much juice.
title: Great Customer Service

author: Guillermo Flores V
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019
review_content: Good charger from a very reputable brand. Bought 2 for traveling but one will definitely suffice. My Samsung Galaxy Note 8 gets about 6 full charges with this charger. Does support fast charging for my phone and the only downside is the time it takes to charge. Make sure to charge this a whole day before you need it.
title: Great product.

author: Jay H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2015
review_content: Holds tons of charge as the specs would indicate. Charged my phone (iPhone 6) fully from various states of discharge over 4 times and still shows it has half it's charge available after a week without recharging it at all. It's kind of heavy (only reason for 4 stars), so if you're going to carry it around as a backup in a purse or backpack etc. it is likely overkill. Long trips with questionable charging availability or options would be a great time to lug it around with you though. It's a nice shape to fit in wherever you need. It carries a lot of juice and holds it's charge for a long time- good for at least 5-7 days of heavy cell phone use. I haven't tried it with any tablets.
title: Lot's of charge- and weight

author: Jessica
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2020
review_content: I personally really do think you can not go wrong with this Portable charger💯It’s DURABLE, the charging speed is incredibly good, and when it runs out of battery I don’t have to worry about damaging my charger  when I leave it overnight charging.All I can say is that this portable charger is worth buying if you need high speed charging and long battery life. 10000% perfect as a gift 🎁
title: Awesome

author: Carolyn Friesz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2019
review_content: I originally purchased this for some important meetings; unfortunately, I didn't try it out before I left and it didn't work.  I did a bad review and they chose to replace it for me and I appreciated that.  I feel I owe them a thank you and an update; however, I haven't had a chance to use it yet . . I need to do that! Thank you so much for replacing my original order
title: Replaced original

author: keysa71
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020
review_content: This battery did not have much charging capacity and certainly was not speedy. My old faithful, lower watt battery did.When I went to look at returning it - no surprise, the window just closed.  Buy with extreme caution.
title: Doesn’t hold charge.

author: Amazon Customer Keb
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2019
review_content: A bit heavy for portability and travel, but that's alright in exchange for the # of times it can recharge a device before it too needs recharging.  Bought it for a dying phone, which I have now replaced a few months later. Yet not wasted money, as it's a great backup battery when electricity is out, etc. Makes me feel more secure,  given how much I rely on my phone and other devices.
title: Heavy, but good output

author: Emir
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2017
review_content: This is one of the best portable chargers I have ever bought. I usually take my time when it comes to buying things online because I want the best product and I struck gold with this portable charger. It charges my S6 in less than 30 minutes which really comes in handy when I'm on the go and very busy. The only downside is it takes a while for the charger to recharge, I'd say maybe up to 3 hours, but it's worth it because you can get up to 5 or 6 full charges for your phone. I definitely recommend.
title: This is one of the best portable chargers I have ever bought

author: Martina Morgan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2019
review_content: Slim and lightweight, but always ready to perform.  I have several of these, all ordered from Amazon.  They are all still operating without any issues.  One of them is 3+ years old.  I bought a case to carry them in so cords don't get lost.
title: The perfect product for being out and about as well as traveling

author: Ron
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2019
review_content: It's a great charger when it works. When it was working like new it would charge up my phone battery very fast and made it easy to carry around and use. However, similar to other reviews, the ports seem to have issues with holding in the usb correctly after time. Due to this, I now have an unusable battery since it no longer works correctly.
title: Both of the ports stopped working

author: Amazon Customer, L.A.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2018
review_content: Any company that,(1)Has an actual phone# gets 1 star...(2)Actually answers the phone gets 2stars...(3) Stands behind their product gets 3 stars...(4) Has a decent product that basically does what it says it will do gets 4 stars...What,I’ve learned in the process of picking the right battery charger is that the main difference in similar batteries with similar specs is the company behind the product.  They’re are no perfect battery packs.  If a company sells thousands if not millions of the product there are going to be complaints and problems.  My best advice is to research the company by reading some of the reviews, research their customer service and warranty then make your choice.  Oh by the way, this is a great battery pack 5 stars!
title: Customer service is tops...

author: Marylou
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
review_content: I use this while on my treadmill to either read or stream on my iPad. The charger fits nicely in the compartment on my treadmill and is easy to use. Top quality product. Highly recommend.
title: Long lasting power

author: Ergov
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2018
review_content: This power pack has a lot of power to share and works well but it just charges at a standard pace I have a cheaper one that is a 1/3 less power I like better that has one standard USB and one fast charge USB and that model is great! I would suggest looking for one of those if your phone is capable of taking a fast charge.
title: ... cheaper one that is a 1/3 less power I like better that has one standard USB and one fast ...

author: Ks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019
review_content: I like this product in some regards but it makes my phone heat up. It's really heavy. Ever since I used it in my phone has been acting weird. Could be planned obsolescence could be because of the product. Who knows? I recommend finding a different product
title: You're better off with a different product

author: Kimberly B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2019
review_content: I expected to get a lightning cord to be able to charge this device! Otherwise what is the point in asking me if i needed one for an i phone or an android or samsung device ???Also it would be nice to know that i need a bigger charger in order to charge this device as it wont charge with my i phone chargerI am very disappointed in both aenker and amazon for not making this clear, and i will probably return this product!
title: Very disappointed

author: Tiffany
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2019
review_content: Can't go wrong with Anker. I had many friends recommend this charger to me and now I recommend it to others. This particular one is a great in-between model of the Anker portable chargers. The two ports come in handy if a friend needs a charge or a second device. It lasts several phone charges, so you probably only need to recharge it a couple times a week for average use.  It's slightly bulky, but I don't mind since it lasts so long. I had another portable charger that is much smaller but of course it had a fraction of the battery power. This is also pretty sturdy- dropped it on sidewalk and it's fine.
title: Durable and reliable

author: EDWARD MORIN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2019
review_content: For six months it worked as advertised. No complaints at all. Then, it stopped recharging. I was ready to dispose of it but thought of looking at the warranty. Hallelujah! It was still covered. I contacted Anker website and followed directions. Within 24 hours we received a response and in a weeks time we had a new charger. I’m not ready to give the charger a good review, however, their customer department is wonderful. The new charger still needs to earn a good review, hopefully I’ll be able to provide it after some time. Meantime we hope...... and say thanks to their return department!
title: Negative but turning posItive.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019
review_content: We bought this for a 3-day camping trip to the Grand Canyon. We were able to charge two phones about 2.5 times each plus our kid’s Amazon Kindle once. It’s a large, heavy battery pack (reminds me of a laptop battery.) It does take quite a while to charge the battery pack itself, so don’t assume you can charge it in an hour or two right before you leave for a long trip. Definitely recommend charging the day before. I believe it took around 6-8 hours to get to a full charge. We will definitely use it again any time we go camping.
title: Great for camping

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2017
review_content: This might be the best portable charger out in the market today. (Unless you want to take it up a notch and go for the 26800 mAh power bank, but I don't think that is necessary).In the box you get your standard USB charging cable to charge the power bank, a soft carrying bag and your portable charger. I love how they included the carrying case because it is convent for when you throw it in your backpack or go camping. I brought this to scout camp and had three people asking me daily if they could use it, and it to my surprise when it was over the power bank was still at 2 bars. 1 week of multiple phone charges.My favorite feature of this product is the fact that it chargers faster than if you charge it in a standard house outlet. I kid you not this literally charges my iPhone 7 to 100 in roughly 60-90 minutes.I would definitely recommend this product and it is worth every penny.
title: This might be the best power bank out in the market

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2019
review_content: Worst charger I ever purchased.  Bought it for a trip and it was erratic, not working 75% of the time.  Very disappointing.  Would not charge a phone after fully charging the battery, and the battery lights would indicate full bars.  Then, 5 min later, there would be no bars and no life in the battery.  Be cautious with this particular battery. I had luck with other Anker chargers.  Fortunately, I should still be able to return this one.
title: Erratic Power Supply

author: Karina
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2019
review_content: After reading the reviews and seeing as it was highly recommended, I decided to give it a go and purchase this power bank. Sadly it does not work. I received this 3 days ago, I fully charged this bank, tried every cord I own (even the Apple charger cord) and it will NOT CHARGE. I’m lost, I’ve tried doing research on what I must be doing wrong but nothing works. It only charged for 20 seconds and suddenly stops. I wish I could of been another happy customer to write a 5 star review but unfortunately this power bank does not work. If only it had a return website I can reach because it sucks having to lose $50 on something that does not work at all.
title: Does not charge!

author: AC83
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2016
review_content: Pretty bad ass!  Charged my iphone 6s numerous times already and it's still at full! When I was charging it, I was worried at first because I charged it for about 8 hours and it was still at one blue light. After waiting a few more hours, the lights started to light up some more. I thought I had a defect, but it does take a substantial amount of time to charge. For the amount of charges it puts out, I don't even mind the charging time of portable charger. Charge it when you get home and by the time you need it the next day, it will be more than ready to be used.
title: Pretty bad ass

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2017
review_content: I bought these to provide charging backup for several cameras that now have charge in the camera capability for a 6 day whitewater trip I just got back from.  A photographer friend of mine had a couple on another river trip and had expressed his satisfaction with them.  I bought 3, fully charged them before I left and basically only used 1 and 1/2 of  a second to keep 2 waterproof Olympus cameras fully charged for the whole trip.  Very impressed with their capacity and the ease of use.  I had even taken a solar panel along to recharge these batteries and never had to get it out.
title: Great power storage

author: Kaitlyn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2018
review_content: Love this! I have one of the smaller Anker models n use it basically every day. Bought this as a gift for a friend that travels often. Someone saw it at the airport, has the same one n started talking about how much he loves his. Lasts both of those guys for a little over a week on one charge. Actually buying another for my dads Xmas present. Only down side is that it is large, and does have a bit of weight to it.
title: Love it!!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2018
review_content: Really liking this power bank. Feels very well built. I bought this so that I can charge my GoPro Karma Grip and Camera while on the go since the Karma's battery isn't replaceable.This power bank connects to the Karma Grip and sits in my water bottle pouch on my backpack. Now I can record all day without worrying about losing power. Well worth the money.
title: Great Power Bank

author: Sun
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2020
review_content: If you're using like Iphone XSMax which has big battery, you could charge your phone up about 3 times per fully charged power bank. I'm just bored and writing review for all the products i've bought. But, If I got a chance to change this product, I'd get the bigger one I saw but it's 20$ more expensive and that's why I bought this one at that time. Anker's has a really good quality. I've been a customer for this brand for 3 years and I knew it because my dad told me. HAHAHAHAHAHA
title: Worth its price.

author: Nicholas Q.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2019
review_content: I bought this battery last year on May 14 to use for travel. In the past year, I’ve only taken it on 4 trips and now when I try to charge it, it won’t charge past 50%. I have left it plugged in to charge for an entire day and will still only go to 50%. This battery was great in the beginning. It charged fast and I could charge my phone 5-6 times before I had to charge it. Now with the battery only holding the charge to 50%, I can only charge my phone once or twice. I wasn’t sure if I received a defective one or what, but now that I’ve read other reviews about the same thing happening to other people, I’m sure it’s defective. I’m going to send a message to customer support. Hopefully I can get a response and get this fixed.
title: Charger Died After One Year of Use

author: Xility
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2018
review_content: I purchased this battery pack for charging phones and tablets while we are out and about on vacation but I've found it useful for other things as well. I have a small, portable fan with a usb plug and I use this battery to cool off my son when we have to go outside in the summer in Phoenix. I accidentally left it running all day yesterday and it still had a charge when I got back home.
title: Very useful product

author: James N.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2017
review_content: I love this for both the form factor (easy to slip in a pocket or briefcase) and the amount of juice it holds.  I've used it all day to charge 2 S7s, as well as charging multiple other devices like e-cig batteries and portable speakers, and it's always been up to the task.  I don't think it's ever gotten below half charge... Until about a week after the warranty ran out.  Unfortunately, it won't charge any longer, so I watched the dots go away with a tear in my eye.That said, I liked it enough that I went ahead and bought another.  :)
title: Great power pack. Convenient, lots of juice.

author: blackthorne
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019
review_content: Luv it! It charges my Samsung more quickly than the other cheapos I have & need to get rid of. The battery life of this charger last a long time. I got 4 days of it before needing to charge it.  I also had no problems as a carry-on at the airport
title: Great product! 👍🏼👍🏼

author: Steve Cook
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2020
review_content: I’ve used this charger for almost 4 years and it’s been flawless.  I use it for off-grid bikepacking and camping.  For 5 days without access to electricity  it keeps my iPhone,  camera and GPS unit charged.  I highly recommend.
title: A great external battery/charger

author: Sothea Kou
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2016
review_content: okay, this little thing is pretty impressive i must say, i can charge my iPhone 6 about 5 times without my battery case, so it took me about 2 days until i drained this thing, what i found this most useful for is when I'm out on adventures or at tomorrowland or EDC and i usually carry my portable JBL speakers and my phone with a battery case, and yo, it can last me a whole day without worrying about battery life, RECOMMENDED! it charges extremely faster than a plugged outlet, but it does take pretty long to juice it back up.
title: this little thing is pretty impressive i must say

author: K. Monteith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2016
review_content: I purchased this high capacity battery to power my Stratux ADS-B receiver, and used it last week during four flights in a C-172 and C-182.  Total on time running the ADS-B receiver (which draws 2 amps) was over 5 hours.  I also used it to charge my iPad between flights.  After all of that usage, it still showed three of the four green lights, so I was most impressed.  My other battery would die after about 4-5 hours of ADS-B receiver use, so this is a huge step up.  I highly recommend it for those needing a lot of power and capability in a battery.
title: High power lasts a long time!

author: Maryann McAndrew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2020
review_content: Bought this battery and it did not work at all. Got a full refund though, so that was great. However, I think it’s very interesting that I could buy a product and it could not even work or charge anything in the first place.
title: Bought and didn’t work

author: Jacob Brown
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2019
review_content: Let me start by saying that a PS Vita has a 2210 mAh battery. With the 20100 mAh this promised, I should be able to charge it almost 18 times. However, after charging the Vita to roughly 98%, it gives out, and I have to recharge it before it will work again. That's not my idea of a stellar product. I'd venture to say that not only is this a pipe dream, power banks in general are a bit of a scam. I've never gotten a good one, and I hoped by spending more on a trusted brand, I would. However this one failed just the same.
title: Can barely charge my PS Vita once!

author: Jamal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2018
review_content: I’ve had the same power bank for coming up on two years! I’ve never had an issue with it. I’m currently deployed in the middle of the desert and it’s still running perfect! My second deployment with this device. It doesn’t keep the charge as long because to desert heat reduces the life of any battery device, that’s just nature of heat and batteries.Charges up and charges up my devices up with no issue at all. Some people have issues but it sounds like the customer service takes care of them. I will be buying again if there ever is an issue with the power bank.
