author: Geema Sue
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2018
review_content: I am from a Minnesota town that got hit by tornadoes last summer. No electricity and a dead phone. Great to have this now! Also use it for my phone projector when in a remote area.

author: Desert Dogs2
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2017
review_content: Great product!  I have recharged my Samsung Note 5 from 32% to 16% discharged to fully charged 6-times and the Anker Power Core STILL has one light on (probably indicating one more charge).  Great battery backup power for multi-day back country trips where electricity is not available but you want to be able to use the phone's camera.

author: William C - Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2017
review_content: Great Device!  It supports fast charging for my Galaxy Note.  The device can charge my phone like 6 times from 0 before running out of juice.  I carry with me always.Anker also has great customer service as well.  My unit starting acting weird and not charging anymore.  It was over a year so I said oh well... it was a good device and was going to purchase another one but saw that it had an 18 month warranty.  I took a shot and emailed support about my issue and a few days later after verifying that it couldn't be fixed, they sent me a brand new one.  It's very rare that a company backs up their quality this easily.  I will always recommend anker products from now on.
title: Great Device! It supports fast charging for my Galaxy ...

author: S. Jones
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2019
review_content: Loads of power, can charge and charge and charge. It is an "intelligent" device which detects voltage draw and shuts down when the device is near full. The problem is that if you want your device charged fully you must continue to turn the device on over and over. This is incredibly annoying.
title: Decent product with loads of power, but continually shuts off before the device is fully charged.

author: thomas  huelster
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2020
review_content: Does what I wanted, good backup that doesn't take forever.

author: lilrj3
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2020
review_content: Very good portable charger, get about 3-4 charges out of each battery charge. Charges phone pretty fast also.

author: Mark R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2018
review_content: This was my first ever powerbank purchased so I dont know what to expect from other products, but all I can say is I'm 100% satisfied with my Anker. I've charged it fully on the day it arrived (about 3-4days ago or more) and it's still got full bars and I've charged my bluetooth headphones on the commute to work as well as my phone.(30min drive 1hr round trip) Idk if other Pbanks let you use the device while its charging but my Anker let's me. Overall this does what it's intended to do and does it to the fullest in my honest opinion. (Again it was my first ever purchase so take my review with that I mind mind)

author: Jay C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2019
review_content: Bought this for my younger son at the recommendation from my oldest son. Both my boys love this charger and carry it everywhere. My oldest has had it for a year already and it still charges perfectly.

author: e-dolecki
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2018
review_content: I used this on a trip while traveling with family. It easily and quickly charged several iOS devices on the plane, extending their use. It does take a while to charge itself, but the benefits are quick and easy charging. Charge it overnight and you're good to go!

author: Heather
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2019
review_content: I've had it about a month(3weeks) now, I love it. It keeps my phone charged when I cant get at an outlet. Whether that be out and about travelling or at work. I also use it to keep a personal fan charged, it's charge lasts a long time and it's probably one of the most useful items I've bought in the last month.

author: Donald C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2017
review_content: I was nervous about paying $33.99 for this.  Got it for a hiking trip to keep my 6s plus charged.  I charged the pack up and it kept my phone charged for 2 days of gps use while hiking.  Out of curiosity, I wanted to see how long it would last so I have been using it to keep my phone charged when I'm working outside. So it's been almost 2 months and I have used it probably 5-6 times after the hike.  My phone is usually about 40-60% when I plug it in.  Now finally the anker has gone down from 4 leds to 3 on the charge indicator but it still charged my phone up to 96% before I unplugged it last time.  It's an absolute beast! It will be months before I need to charge it.
title: Love it!  Totally overkill for 6s plus!

author: Joseph Gallagher
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018
review_content: Update not worth buying does not hold charge for a full day even when not used.Purchase for a power source during a power outage.  The unit does not seem to hold a charge for A long period. I need to keep it plugged in when a storm is forecasted
title: Does not hold charge like reported

author: Just Another Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2018
review_content: It lasts forever.  A bit big, the picture of someone putting in pocket tricked me and didn't read the dimensions.  Bigger than I expected, but it lasts forever.  Kind of heavy and you likely dont' want to carry it aroudn in your pocket.

author: Scott McElhiney
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2016
review_content: Huge power capacity.  They now make one even bigger but this works great.  This much power does come with a caveat, it is heavier than your 10Ah packs  or the tiny ones running off a single 18650 cell.  But it is packing 20 freaking amp hours of energy... you can play Pokemon Go all day and power up your friends who's phones are dying all around you :)

author: Dave E
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2019
review_content: I've had this for over a year and I still love it. It keeps its charge for a long time and charges my phone multiple times between charges. I originally bought it for camping, but now I use it alot in the house too when I'm sitting somewhere that's not convenient to an outlet.

author: N. Vargas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2019

author: R678
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2019
review_content: The power bank itself stopped charging after maybe 2 full uses. It won’t charge past the 2nd blue light. Plugged in to the wall for 24 hours and only the 2nd blue light blinks. Won’t hold a charge. It worked for about 2 months.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2020

author: Wilson Elias
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2019
review_content: Bought this for a 2 week trip to Europe and it lasted the whole time.  Used it to charge our iPhones 10 times and it still had plenty of battery.  Extremely impressed.

author: Maleka
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2017
review_content: I've had to buy four of these things. Not because they keep breaking, but because my family members keep "borrowing" it, and love it so much they don't give it back. It's amazing. Very nice design, and super efficient product. I own this one and the 10500. I bring this one with me on longer trips (2+) days, or if I forgot to charge the smaller one. It has a bit of heft to it but in my opinion the slight weight is well worth the amazing product. It also makes a great gift for the tech nerd in your life (my brother is one and is completely suprised my non-tech savvy self discovered this gem before him). Long story short, buy 1! Or maybe 2. ;)

author: John
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2016
review_content: I'm pretty disappointed so far. The documentation says is takes 10-11 hours for a charge, but it took me over 14 hours to go from 50% to 100%. And that was using an Anker charger with Smart IQ. I bought this for vacation, but it's pretty much useless if it won't charge overnight.In the positive column, it is the approximate length and width of a quesarito.
title: I'm pretty disappointed so far

author: Jeffrey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2016
review_content: Hi! I like all of Anker's products (I own 3 other of their batteries) and all of them work just fine, this one though, has a specific issue that causes it not to work for a project I have. I'm using the battery to power a raspberry pi computer, monitor and all. Randomly, the flow of power ceases and it shuts down my system (I'll check my jerry-rigged setup to make sure there is no shorting out if it happened to be that). Is there any way to fix this? I will change my review to 5 stars once the problem gets fixed. Thanks!
title: Power Flow Stopping

author: MMF
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
review_content: I bought this to take it on a 5 day trip with me, knowing i was going to be using my phone a bunch while on the move. It lasts about 3 days of heavy use from 2 people. It is a bit too big and heavy to be carrying around in your pocket, but that worked for me.

author: K
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2017
review_content: I bought 3 of these as spare batteries for my TPCast wireless adaptor for my HTC Vive. They work perfectly and are in fact the exact same battery that the TPCast unit comes with. So far, one battery pack has been giving me 4 -5 hours of powering my Vive headset. I would definitely recommend this for anyone looking for a spare battery for your headset or even just for charging your devices.
title: Spare for TPCast HTC Vive wireless adapter.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2019
review_content: I have to admit.. find myself laughing at the silliness of this tread of correspondence between me and Anker....I purchased a battery back up.. late last year.. it failed in less than 6-months... Anker sends another..(thank you).. it last a few months and then it fails... Anker's response... ?  30% refund on a burned out pos that never delivered...Pound sand on the refund.. not worth the effort.. will post a review and never ... ever.. ever.. again allow my company and/or my household to purchase anker products again....
title: POS... burned out in less than 6 months...

author: K. Flores
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2020
review_content: Fabulous product while it lasted. Warranty is for 18 months and immediately after that it lost the ability to be charged (so they won't replace it).Update: Blew some compressed air into it and that seemed to do the trick. It's now charging.

author: John
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2018
review_content: I really like the product--easy to carry and holds an immense charge.  Furthermore, when the product failed after about 9 months, I contacted Anker and they issued a full refund.  Excellent customer service--very surprising in this day and age!!

author: Desert Punk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2016
review_content: I have come to trust Anker products in general, so when I needed a battery to recharge USB devices while away from home, I naturally chose the Anker PowerCore. I have owned this product about one month and  I will update this review if the battery does not live up to expectations.

author: Brandon esser
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2016
review_content: I have only used this for a total of 1 charge the charge did last a long time seeing that I didn't need or use it as often as I thought I would but now only its second charge and it will not charge it has been on a charger almost the whole day and the battery indicator hasn't changed yet.............so an update since I originally reviewed the product Amazon had refused to return said product since it had been after the 30 days but the manufacturer reached out to me separately and replaced the battery within in a week if you are looking to buy a battery back up I would strongly suggest anything from anker if nothing more then the customer service but the product is great I would say that the problem I had was not something normal so far so good on the replacement

author: JUDY RESNICK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2016

Not a big deal, as I have one for my phone, but it would have been nice to have one in the package so that I could recharge both my phone and this portable power pack at the same time from a wall socket.

author: Sandra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2018

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2019
review_content: This is the best power bank i have ever purchased. N its the size of a cable remote control. But ill keep it cus it works great n keeps a charge for days..

author: Emily
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2019
review_content: This is a really good portable charger! The only thing I don’t like about this charger is how long it takes to recharge. It takes about 10 hours for it to fully charge after dying. It’s a good size, easy to stick in most purses and definitely in backpacks, and the cover it comes with has protected it fairly well. I’ve already dropped it a couple times. Once on concrete and it doesn’t even have a scratch.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020

author: Otter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2019

author: Roe1577
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2018

author: MMA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2018
review_content: I purchased this item to use in power outages and when traveling. It has come in handy to recharge my cell phone when electricity did go out due to high winds. author: AS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2018
review_content: I’m giving this battery 5 stars for customer service and their excellent warranty! I’ve had my battery for a little under a year, it started acting weird and not holding a charge. I remembered it had a one-year warranty so I e-mailed Anker Direct, they sent me some troubleshooting directions, once that didn’t work they were quick to dispatch a new battery! No shipping cost was incurred! It was quick and easy, charges my phone from 0-100% super quick! My friends appreciate it too when I’m willing to share my battery! ;) Completely recommend!

author: Robert Cullipher
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2016
review_content: This is the BEST. I use this with the 21W Anker solar panel, and it charges it in 6 hours of sunlight. Yet, this can recharge my iPhone6+ 6-8 times before needing a recharge. Charging input is 20000mah and output it peaks at about 19000 mah, but I will assume that this difference is because the DROK doesn't account for it's own usage for the led display.

author: Peter from Clearwater
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2019

author: 8BitBert

author: Sativa Star
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2018
review_content: loved this product when it was working but ive had it for 2 months and it wont even charge my phone anymore. It lights up when its in the wall but its broken or defective or something.

author: Onision
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2016
review_content: I recently hopped on the Pokemon go bandwagon, and noticed the game was absolutely destroying my battery. I heard great reviews about this product, and i purchased it. I couldn't be any happier with this power bank, it charges my phone at full speed, and i no longer need to worry about swapping my phones battery if i keep this on me. I can walk with this in my pocket while it charges my phone.
title: One of the best portable chargers

author: Dakota S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2017
review_content: So I've had this cable for almost a year now. Which is way longer than any other cable has lasted me. Just last week the insulation at the base of the lightning connector started to break, however it still charges 100% of the time. I simply used a little hot glue to fortify the broken insulation and I suspect I will get another year of use out of this cable. Totally worth the money!
title: Best cable on the market

author: Kaje
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2019
review_content: I absolutely love this portable charger. I bought one that was $200. Stop working after about six months.  This one was so reasonably priced and so far so good.
title: This ones a Keeper

author: mariela
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2020
review_content: Waste of money Stopped working after a month
title: Waste of money

author: Dan Levy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2015
review_content: Great performer, great price, and overall a really nice battery pack. Anker is starting to make some really high-quality stuff, I bought this as well as a MicroUSB cable from them, and both feel very premium. This looks like one of those things that will last me forever, both because it will charge my phone repeatedly without needing a recharge itself, and it's solidly built. I'd highly recommend this.
title: Great Battery Pack, Quick charging, long lasting & well-built.

author: Darshan J.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2020
review_content: This product worked well in the beginning, but after not using it for some time, it never charged after that. I’d stay away from this product.
title: Dead after 5-6 months

author: Erick diaz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2017
review_content: Bought this on an impulse on Amazon day. A year later and I don't regret it at all. Takes about six hours to charge. Don't use a poor quality charger with it. Will take way to long to charge. Can easily charge my phone from 5% to 100% 5 or 6 times on a single charge. It is so useful when traveling.
title: Don't use a poor quality charger with it

author: Sparkola
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2018
review_content: The case finish and durability is the only reason its not 5 stars. I am careful to pack this around soft items as drops could easiky break this.  Great battery life, have charged my galaxy s8+ 4 times and still had capacity left.  Great capacity to weight ratio.
title: Good bang for the buck. Not fancy, but good.

author: Mellisa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2016
review_content: Do not think twice, just get it. Sooooo worth it. My Samsung battery was always dying because I'm on whatsapp, instagram, snapping etc all day n blv me this baby did wonders! Even charges faster than my own plug in charger for the phone! It comes with a cord but no hub but I jus use my regular Samsung hub with the cord that comes with it n charge it over night. Lasts me for a while, if i use it twice a day to recharge it lasts for 4 days. So imagine if u jus use it once, u get even more out of it. You won't regret it! Get it nw!!
title: Just get it!

author: Brandon Z
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2018
review_content: First charger did not last as long as i expected for only using it a few times. Lucky Anker has great customer service and reached out to me and replaced my charger. It works perfect and i'm a customer for LIFE now.. I will forever buy Anker products and recommend them.
title: UPDATED*** 100% HAPPY

author: Luna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2019
review_content: Good product, charges my phone with a lot of juice. A little heavy and I don’t like the size but works like it’s advertised

author: Nicholas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2020
review_content: Idk if it's me or just this one device I received but once I plug in my phone to charge it shuts off after like one minute of charging and I got to constantly press the power button to turn it back on to charge. Someone please help me.
title: Power On Issues.

author: Vienna Adams
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2019
review_content: I bought this a few months ago every time I try charging my phone the Anker charger turns off and I continuously have to push the button to keep it charging my phone. I have tried different cables. We use other Anker products without a problem this one is just not doing the job. Very upsetting to have so much money down the drain
title: Does not stay on to charge whatever needs charging

author: John Armstrong
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2016
review_content: Awesome PowerI purchased a smaller unit as I travel non stop for work.  It was ok.  It would hold a charge while I'm using my cell but wouldn't charge it unless I shut everything down.This unit will charge my cell while I am using it.  I've been using it for a week now and have not ran out of power yet.Very happy - definitely recommend
title: Awesome Power

author: nick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2017
review_content: Great power supply. Purchased to used on the WABDR and have been finding uses since. It is very handy to use this with a short cord when you phone is low vs plugging into the wall to charge and be tethered to the wall.Only gripe is that the power level based off the 4 led lights, seems that the first half of the charge lasts longer than the second. Not a issue though.

author: liz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2018
review_content: This charger is amazing and I use it all the time. I will not travel without it and if I have a long day where I may run out of power on my electronics, I will bring it with me.While it is not the smallest/lightest option out there, it definitely gives you many charges of your iPhone (I think 7?) and it seems to also charge devices more quickly. I have used when I'm not sure I will have outlets for multiple days and it has charges multiple devices like nothing.Love this device and would definitely recommend!
title: Game-changer for travel

author: Robert
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2016
review_content: This product is amazing. I kept a log and this product charged my I phone 5 over an eight day period about nine to ten times. Very satisfied.  10/25/16- I want to update my review to say that I'm only getting about five charges on my Google pixel phone.  I am not very pumped about that.  I called Anker to ask about this but they have not gotten back to me yet
title: Worked well on my Iphone 5

author: Liz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2019
review_content: Bought this for hurricane prep. I didn’t end up needing it but I use it for when I’m on the couch as outlets are far away. It lasted for many charges especially if your phone is not all the way dead.
title: Awesome

author: Brent
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2019
review_content: Definitely charges well.  It is a little big and long, but it works great
title: Super Charged

author: K. Strickland
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2020
review_content: I love this charger! It will charge my phone fully at least 3 times before I have to charge it again. Best customer service as well. Thanks for a great product and experience.
title: Best charger!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2018
review_content: This thing is great! I have taken it with me on numerous trips and I am very impressed. my most recent trip was 4 days and I only used this pack to charge my phone and it still had some juice left in it. it has def. become an essential when it comes to travel or day tripping. spend the money its worth it.
title: this charger is awesome

author: teamswat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2018
review_content: does not charge the galaxy s8. after three months of use, the battery stopped working completely. There is no warranty, so over all, this is a pretty terrible product. Very disappointed.

author: bob kahn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2020
review_content: This looks and feels like a very well made product. Sorry to say, I read a few reviews with comments about it not fully charging, and that is what I am experiencing. It charges to 3/4 and will not fully charge after 2 days of waiting. I will use it until it stops charging entirely, but will not replace it with the same brand.

author: Patrick C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2018
review_content: Charges so many devices and holds charges for days.  I don't leave home without it. It charges faster than plugging into the wall.  Sometimes my wife steals it and uses it around the house instead of charging her phone using a wall outlet.

author: Justin goyco
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2020
review_content: My favorite external battery ever. Unless there is some type of insane battery breakthrough I will be sticking with this one for years to come.

author: J. YIM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2015
review_content: Great external battery! The size makes it so portable and the dual ports makes it very convenient to charge two different phones or tablets. The product has exceeded my expectations. It takes a little while to charge but once it's fully charged, it provides enough juice to charge phones multiple times, up to 3-4x to be exact and pretty quick as well. The bag that comes with the charger is convenient to carry it in. Very satisfied and I would highly recommend this to anyone who's looking for a portable charger and at a reasonable price. It came in real handy while roadtripping seeing that there would be no access to electrical outlets and even more so when travelling on the plane.

author: Bryce The King
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2016
review_content: Another solid anker product..My one and only complaint is it is finicky about what kind of charger you use to charge this. Some chargers must not put out enough power. In my opinion this should come with a charger if I can't use any random one I have lying around. All in all however, it's great. I get about 4 full phone charges (Note5) out of each charge .

author: Spencer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2018
review_content: Amazing product, and even better customer service. I purchased a defective charger and immediately contacted Anker and they were helpful with addressing my concerns and sent me a new one within just 2 days. This product is great for travels and i use this product everyday. I typically charge the anker battery pack every 5-7 days depending on usage
title: Amazing product, and even better customer service

author: Gavin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019
review_content: This charger is amazing use mine almost daily because I am always moving around and sometimes I’m not by an outlet. This portable charger is a great addition to my backpack with amazing charging power at 20,000 mah it is able to charge just about anything I need it too and it keeps a charge for a while without needing to be charged again. Overall fantastic charger

author: SFPilot
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2016
review_content: We used this during our multi-week trip to Europe.  Although we had plug adapters, we found the socket locations often inconvenient to charging and using phones/ ipads.  Leaving the Anker plugged in while we were out and using it at night to charge 2 items at once was very convenient.  Also took it with us during drives to rural areas of southern Italy.  It's a great product.

author: Budd
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2015
review_content: Hands down the best mobile charger i have ever used. The capacity of this charger is perfect for heavy electronics users and it gets me through 3-5 days without needing to recharge it. I have alot of other mobile batteries but none can compare to the speed at which the charges, the capacity and the overall feel and quality of the product. I absolutely love it and might order a second one to keep in my travel bag.

author: wills_dad
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2018
review_content: Temper your expectations - it's a battery.  It showed charging levels when plugged in.  It provided charging power when a device was plugged into it.  The capacity is great for this size.If it exceeds my expectations for longevity - then it will earn the 5th star.
title: nice capacity for size

author: Bridge hand
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020
review_content: I have two of these for home and travel.  They are wonderful to keep your devices charged when you can’t be near an electric hook up.

author: Carrie J. Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2018
review_content: I love this charger. Last year I gave them out for Christmas gifts. This charger holds a charge for a long time. I charge it at a computer terminal. It's relatively lightweight to carry in my backpack. Sleek design. Works great. Quick shipping, as well.

author: Jim M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2016
review_content: I'm impressed with my new Anker portable charger & it's nice travel case.It charged fully quite easily & I've onlycharged my IPhone 6 once. It took about2 hours & 1/2 - not really impressive, buthandy for traveling. I'll do another reviewin 6 months as I don't expect to use ita lot. I thought the price was good forthe quality & promised results.

author: Michael Rosario
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2020
review_content: Best charger in the game! Better than the standard wall charger

author: Chad
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
review_content: Lost my original Anker power block.  Bought this to replace it and am very happy.  Will charge phone, laptop and iPad.  Would never buy another brand.

author: MKS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2015
review_content: I love this.  I travel every week and am not able to find an outlet everywhere.  It does take long time to recharge, due to the large capacity, but I can charge my iPhone about 6-7 times.  I also have extended Laptop battery for my laptop, if needed I can use this to charge the external macbook and get crazy long time.  It is heavy, but comes with the power capacity...Not recommended for a purse or pocket, only for laptop bags

author: Mark L Coren
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2017
review_content: I desperately needed a high-capacity recharger. Anker knocked it out of the park with this one. It's an incredible value and has already saved me a couple times. My college has dead spots in coverage everywhere, and my normally robust phone battery was dropping like a stone. Having this charger on hand keeps me from reaching into my bag and pulling out a bricked phone. The smaller battery I tried first just couldn't keep up. These are so effective that I'm thinking they may be a good choice for Christmas. I'd give them 10 stars if that was an option.

author: Brian B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2019
review_content: I've purchased 2 of these batteries now, and both of them will not charge. The second one I bought just came in today, and I immediately took it out of the box and tried to charge it, with the micro usb cable it came with, and after 6 hours its only blinking one dot still. Buyer beware, these batteries are either old and refurbished, or just plain junk. I will be sending both back.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2019
review_content: It changed my life!!! Always counting on it and it lasts me days!!! The only problem is it takes long to charge it but all in all it’s worth it! Got 2 already!

author: Tzviah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2018
review_content: This thing has saved my life, many times over. I feel like I've never recharged it, and it just keeps feeding my phone. It charges FAST, too. Just a warning, though: It's heavy (which makes sense, considering all the juice it's holding), but I don't care in the slightest.

author: Erin Bybee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2016
review_content: It charged my phone about 6 times right out of the box (I wanted to let it die once before charging it) and I'm sure it will charge more once it is fully charged. It charges fairly quickly, I can get an almost dead Galaxy s5 to fully charged in about an hour and a half while I'm still using the phone. I gave it 4 stars because to charge fully from dead took at least 24 hours, a little longer than I expected, but it is understandable since it holds so much power. Overall I would recommend this product.

author: K. Stone
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2016
review_content: Best battery I've ever owned. A real beast! I've taken this on weekend long cabin trips with heavy game/GPS use and barely used half of the charge. It's a bit large but who cares if you're camping? Ideal for my backpack but it actually does fit in my front jeans pocket as well, as long as nothing else is in there. 10 out of 5 stars. Cannot recommend enough!

author: Dr. G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2019
review_content: Charged iPhone X from 37% to 100% and iPad 2 from dead to 60% and needs a recharge. I’m sorry but this is WAY overhyped that is not that much charge power

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2018
review_content: Sleek, well built and comes with a stretchy cover. Fits nicely into my purse. I am happy with it, bit it doesn’t transfer the charge as quickly as others I have had. Took over 2 hours to charge my iPhone. The Ankar unit does hold the charge though and is reliable.

author: Mechanic Jay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2017
review_content: ...this thing is a beast of a charger.  Its larger and heavier, so carrying it in pocket is kinda bulky, but, charge this thing once, and you can go for a few days. It ran my iPhone6S+ for 6 days before i had to recharge it.  Great build quality, very sturdy.

author: Weldon L Johnson X
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020

author: MRILK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2019

author: Jeff Z.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2018
review_content: Perfect charger.  Larger than most and a little heavy but you can literally charge up SO many devices.  I have charged up phones right and left...  after several devices were ready to go, the power level went down by 1.  Game on!

author: Brittany Masetta
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2019
review_content: This anker charger was great for charging our phones while traveling abroad with unreliable access to regular power outlets. However, when it comes to charging back up the charger itself, I’ve had it plugged in charging for almost 48 hours and it was only 50% charged (2 out of 4 blue lights blinking). author: Fool79
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020
review_content: Takes forever to charge up itself, and then doesn't last long charging your stuff. It works ok and does have two USB outputs which is nice, but for the price I expected better.

author: JON
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2018
review_content: One of the first products I’ve given 5 stars too. After I’ve a year it’s going strong and has more than enough juice for my headphones(Bose qc35) phone (iphone7+) and a few other things. Traveled up and down the coast with me and hasn’t failed

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2017
review_content: Pretty hefty and solid but packs a ton of MAHs. author: Luke
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2019
review_content: Thisnis a pretty massive battery pack, so I guess charging is likely to take a while, but I didn't expect my Samsung fast charger to take all day to charge it.

author: Steve Parks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2017
review_content: I haven't had this product long enough to give it 5 stars, but I have had an Anker battery before that fit my phone and it outlasted the phone.  I handed it down to my grandson and he continued using it for over a year, bragging about how he always had battery left when his friends didn't.  Based on that experience, I ordered this from the same company and I have been very pleased with the performance. This charger charges my phone twice as fast as does the regular wall outlet.  Not only is the product a good one, the customer support is superb!  I highly recommend this charger.

author: JDh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2018
review_content: Great product! Holds charges very well and exceeds all my expectations. This charger comes with a pouch so that I take it with me or keep it in my car very conveniently. The only negative would be that I wish it came with a longer cable! Would absolutely buy this charger again.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2018
review_content: This portable charger is a beast! I purchased this to take on a trip to Disney World, since I knew that I would want to be taking pictures all day long. I was able to charge one iPhone 6s and one iPhone 7s three times each (both below 10% charge each time) before needing to recharge this portable charger. This has quickly become my "go-to" charger and would highly recommend it to anyone considering an upgrade with their portable chargers.
title: This has quickly become my "go-to" charger and would highly recommend it to anyone considering an upgrade with their portable ...

author: EggyD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2020
review_content: Don’t buy. These things break. Although I will say the company was great and sent a replacement immediately when my original one stopped working. Unfortunately the replacement one also stopped working after just a couple uses.

author: Kat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2016
review_content: I bought this for a trip to Europe to use on certain flights.  This thing is a BEAST!!! It charges  numerous items quickly and and still had tons of power.  I ended carrying it in my purse and plugging in my phone on long days walking around Italy.  It is a bit heavy, BUT if you want the power this is the item you want.  It's not very big.So glad I bought this!This would be a great present!

author: MedUSA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2019

author: Monte
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2018
review_content: Great decision to buy.  I can charge multiple items at once (iPhone and Earbuds).  The charger power can lasts a week, depending how much you use it.  Used it on a recent Disney trip, my phone was fully charged the entire time in the park.Con: If you drain the battery, it will take a long time to fully charge again.  Also, use certified apple cables, does not work with the cheap knockoffs.Awesome buy.  Highly recommend. author: Taylar M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2019
review_content: This thing is great! It takes a really long time to charge up, but I just plug it in overnight. It lasts for quite a few charges (like a solid 6-7 charges I'd say!) Totally worth it.

author: Ryo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2020
review_content: Great charger. Using it with a USB light at night and it can run for hours on it.
title: Great charger. Using it with a USB light at night and it can run for hours on it.

author: NNNN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2019
review_content: Very happy with this product. Definitely recommend this. It holds its own charge and charges vape pens to computers

author: Spyderryder
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2015
review_content: I bought two of these charging batteries. They are awesome! Keep this in mind this charger is only as good as the charging cable that is used with it! A lot of cables will only charge at 300 ma, while others will charge your smart phone at nearly 2000 ma! So if ya get this charger, and it takes a long time to charge, its not the charger, its likely the cable that you are using.These things are awesome!

author: AmazonATL
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2017
review_content: This is my new must have for any business traveler.  Having this in my work bag allows me to charge on the go and know that I don't have to search all over airports for power outlets.  Being that it has 2 ports, you can even make friends by offering to share your power with all the juice in this battery it'll charge up a cell phone 6-7 times before recharging. My coworker shared his with me and I went out and bought one after using his.
title: This is my new must have for any business traveler ...

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2018
review_content: It'll get you about 4-5 iPhone charges without needing to be charged. Definitely worth it when traveling or being unable to access an outlet easily in airports, coffee shops, etc.

author: Rishabh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2018
review_content: Great power capacity. Charges iPhone 7 almost 6-7 times. Charging is pretty fast too (takes ~ 1.5 hrs to fully charge iPhone 7). Not very bulky/heavy, easily portable. I always just keep it in my backpack to be tension-free about phone’s battery dying. It takes 8-10 hours to charge, so I typically charge it once a week in the night, and then it’s good to go again. I’d definitely recommend buying this product.
title: It’s great, just go for it

author: Nathan Parr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2019
review_content: This is a great product, feels strong and well built.  It takes a little while to charge, but its because of it being such a large battery pack.  I get about 4 good charges on my Iphone 7 Plus.  This is my 3rd or 4th ANKER product and so far I have not been disappointed.

author: Jen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2018
review_content: I’ve owned this product for less than 6-weeks and it no longer/barely takes a charge. I’ve had it plugged in for 24-hrs and only the second light is blinking. I hope someone will contact me to send a replacement.Otherwise, when the product was working, it was great!
title: Can’t charge the unit

author: Matthew Bertrand
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2019
review_content: There is nothing I dont like about this product. This is the fourth one I've purchased (2 were for friends). It holds its charge excellently and lasts for several days with intermittent use when I travel overseas.  I love the slim profile because there is very little footprint in my travel bag. I also keep one in my house in the event of a power outage.

author: Jacob Perrault
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2018
review_content: The PowerCore came in handy on my four-day camping trip. Never had to worry about my phone not having enough battery power (have a Blackberry Keyone). Charged it three times (charged it when it was 33% power) with my phone and an iPhone 6 twice with some power still left. Great device.
title: Worth it

author: Ben TenBroek
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2017
review_content: This power block gets 5/5 stars from me. First of all, It works very well and I'm able to get maybe 7 or 8 charges on my iPhone 6 out of it. Second of all it doesn't take very long to charge back up. I leave it plugged in over night and it will be charged almost all the way if it wasn't fully drained the night before. If it was it takes a little longer but the charge time is still very fast. Third of all is the carrying mesh bag it comes in. It will protect it from scratches and other things of that nature. One of the downsides is that the knot on the drawstring holder came undone very easily so I had to re-tie that myself. Pair with an Anker charging cord for the fastest charge of your phone you will probably ever see.
title: This power bank works wonders

author: Erin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2020
review_content: Absolutely love my Anker battery!!! Had a recent issue with one no longer charging and I reached out to the company and was issued a replacement within one week.  They even followed up to make sure that the replacement was working properly.  Highly recommend this company and would purchase from them again hands down.
title: Love my Anker!!

author: ooko
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2018
review_content: Bought this mainly for a trip to Korea, but love it so much that I pretty much take it everywhere I go now. Must have item. A full charge of this can charge my s7 about 4 or 5 times.

author: Eric Freeman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2017
review_content: Amazing backup battery! Charged my iPhone 7 very, very fast. Bought two of these (for 3 iphones) to take on a 9-day overseas trip and was NEVER without power (yeah, a double negative)! The units themselves take a while to charge, but they last for quite a long time. Highly recommend!!
title: Amazing backup battery

author: Andrew Kane
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2018
review_content: I very rarely have to charge this and is the best battery bank I've owned, its a bit heavy and big and you can't charge and discharge at the same time, but all in all I charge it once a week and overnight it is fully charged and ready for the week.

author: Unsatisfied customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2016
review_content: Although I had originally experienced the problem below, the compay was very professional and efficient in reaching out to me to make things right and send out a non-defective product on a fair time-line. I bought this to take with me on trips/travel. It worked great for the few occasions I used it, however, I have a trip to visit family out of state and went to charge it so that I could take it with and it simply won't charge. The lights shine blue the moment I plug it in, however, after about twenty seconds the lights go away and nothing happens. I kept it plugged in for 5+ hours and then tried plugging my phone into it and nothing happened--no lights, no charging, nothing! So bummed I wasted my money on this product
title: Great Customer service--reached out to me to fix the problem efficiently and kindly.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2017
review_content: Updated: Anker reached out to me and replaced the battery despite it being after the warranty. Great customer service and glad to have a working battery again. Upgraded from 1 to 4 stars. Didn't do 5 bc 1) it's a bit heavy and 2) just having to replace it and the trouble to begin with. Would recommend now.Three months after purchase it stopped charging to full (4 circles). Another month later it would only charge if the cable was twisted in a specific direction. Another week later it's completely useless and unreliable. It was great when it worked but $40 for 4 months of use seems like a rip off to me. Disappointed.
title: Another week later it's completely useless and unreliable

author: Will Randalle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2018
review_content: I’ve pirchased several external batteries. 2 things occur. 1, Most of them doesn’t last or 2, the capacity doesn’t match up with how many charges you’re supposed to get. With Anker, they have the best of the best! I have an iPhone 7 Plus and this battery charges it 4-5 times on a single charge and fast might i add! Very happy with any and all Anker products.

review_content: I have used this for several months and love it. It charges all of my devices quickly and so far I have had no problems. It is a little heavy and takes a while to fully charge, but it's the best I have had so far.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2020

author: BAM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2017

Why would I want to spend that kind of $ on another one of their products that may or may not last any longer than this one did???

author: Susan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2019

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2015

author: Cajun Prosser
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2015
review_content: My brother and i each bought one to carry with us kayaking/golfing or while im at work. Ive gone through quite a bit of rechargeable battery packs being prior army so of course day one is a stress test! After fully charging the battery my brother and i hit the golf course all the while having both a bluetooth speaker and the phone itself constantly charging off the pack. Streaming music through milk music, golfshot app (battery intensive) , the battery pack was able to keep the phone and bluetooth speaker at a full  charge for 36 holes approx 9 hrs. Now since owning one for a few months i do shift work at night. On average use one full charge can last about 1 week to 2 depending of course on how far i drain my phone. Overall incredible capacity, charge rate and seems fairly rugged. Weight could be an annoyance if youre looking for something light however. All we need now is a water proof case...
title: My brother and i each bought one to carry with ...

author: AmazonAddict
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2017
review_content: I used it for a camping trip of 4 days. I managed to keep 3 phones and a tablet fully charged (2 iPhones 6s + an LG G5 + iPad mini 1st  gen) The charger went down to 2/4 "dots" by the 3rd day of using it. I did notice that the iPhones charged slightly faster than the android LG G5. However, the portable charger does take quite a while to charge. Best bet is to charge it overnight ahead of your trip. I will lastly mention that this charger is on the bulkier side but not dramatically heavy and definitely not something to carry in your pocket. If you need this on the go put this inside a backpack/tote bag/purse.
title: Charges cell phones fast!

author: kenneth smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2015
review_content: Purchased before my annual trip to Michigan for the Holidays. I run 2 phones and a tablet pretty much all the time. It was handy to have an extra source of power so nobody got short on power. When I left New Hampshire everything was charged full. By the time I got to Michigan, the phones were down a bit as well as the tablet. I had used the full reserve of the Anker Charger, but the amount of use that everything saw was pretty intensive. I run a wifi hotspot off my main phone that feeds data to the other phone and the tablet. I was pretty impressed. I left the charger plugged in and charging that night and it was back up to full tilt boogie when I got in the car the next morning. I really like this alternative to having a bunch of stuff plugged into a lighter adapter and having to mess with swapping the power cord from item to item as they got tired. Thanks for a great product.

author: Stephen Horn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2016
review_content: Ordered this a couple of weeks ago, while it was on sale. Overall, product exceeds expectations. I'm keeping it in a man-purse pocket at all times now, and never worry about running out of power while scouring parks for rare pokemon. Seriously, this will keep even the most power hungry phone or tablet topped off for, like, forever. I've haven't seen it hit half charge yet, and I just plug it into my PC's USB slot overnight to recharge.I took it on a plane. I'd take it on a train, or even in the rain. This marks the end of my battery pain, mainly it's insane, I just can't complain. So don't abstain, it's to your gain to give your purchasing compulsions free reign, rather than contain and claim disdain. Board the train. Attain. And try not to let my alliterative praise seem too profane.
title: Surely, crafted by the gods.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2017
review_content: I bought this portable charger for a family trip of 13 to Disney World. I also purchased the wall charger and dual car charger to go with it. This charger was amazing. We never let our cell phones get completely low, because we were trying to capture as many moments of the grandkids as possible. Mostly my daughter and my son-in-law used it, but also occasionally also charge my son's, daughter-in-law's, my grandson's and my phone as needed. Charging the Anker using a wall charger is pretty slow.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2018
review_content: So far I've been using the heck out if this product and it works very well. I own two of these and over time they've both come to not charge with the cable provided, as the male part doesn't insert far enough into the battery. Luckily I have extra, more robust cables, so I can still use it fine with those cables.

author: Mohan Rangaraj
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2016
review_content: UPDATED REVIEW - Anker customer service team contacted me immediately once I posted the review and offered me free replacement powerbank. I received the new one and it works awesome. GOOD CUSTOMER SERVICE!! It says that we can believe and buy Anker products without any worries.I recharged it to full 100%, I took it with me on my trip. I could not charge my iPhone 6s from 20% to FULL 100% even after 5 hours of charging during my drive. The Power Bank appeared to have no more battery power in it. I tried to charge the power bank again on tested it on my return journey - still no luck. This is a brand new power bank and failed at very first time itself. Now I do not know how to return or whether it can be repaired or can I get my money back.

author: MROD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2018

author: Michael S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2015
review_content: Bought this as a gift for my husband to use while playing Ingress. The game requires the screen to be on and data communication with the server in the real world. We heard that Anker batteries are the "go to" for other "agents" and we were disappointed. I happened to pick this up as part of the "deal of the day" sale here on Amazon but I can tell you I'd gladly have paid the regular pricing. I'm actually looking at getting another (or one of another size) for myself soon.  This thing kept his phone charged and was even providing enough energy to the phone to outpace the energy consumption of the screen and the cellular data communication in a highly congested part of town. (read: phone battery filling up even with the phone being heavily used.) I've had external batteries before but none have worked quite this amazingly.
title: Simply Amazing

author: sandy holt1!
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2019

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2019

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2016

author: J. Royall

author: Breck Harris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2018
review_content: I purchased this charger for a backpacking trip (and travel in general) and it worked great. Charged multiple devices for 3 people over 4 days and still had 25% left. Great service and the product does exactly what I needed.

author: Tillman103
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2015
review_content: I bought this charger as a backup to my older version Anker charger. Item came within 2 days through Amazon Prime. It came precharged, it took about 8 hours to fully charge. This charger has 20000 mAh capacity which holds alot of juice for charging multiple devices. No more looking for wall oulets. Smudge and fingerprint proof and well made.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2020
review_content: I was looking for a charging pack for camping. I read a bunch of reviews and decided to pick this one..  I'm not sure if it is my charger pack that I got or the product, but it does not hold a charge for more than two cell phone charges that is not worth it.

author: John H. Power
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2018
review_content: You do not need to be an Olympic weightlifter to pick this up but it does have some size to it.  But then what do you expect for 7-10 charges before you have to reload?

author: SweetPickle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2016
review_content: Update 7.27.16- Changing my review to 5 stars. After posting my original review, company representatives reached out to me and arranged to replace the battery pack and even refunded my money for the cost of buying a wall adapter. The new battery pack gets warm but not hot like the first one. Its a great pack and can charge my cell phone all week on a full charge. Anker representatives have been very helpful and proactive in helping fix the issue.  The battery is great, but the company is more so. Once they found out I had trouble getting in touch with them they were very apologetic and worked really hard to put it right. More than the product itself that alone has got them a customer for life.Its a decent enough charger. Heavier than I would have liked but it does the job alright. My main complaint with it is that it doesn't come with a wall charger. Instead it just comes with a usb cable, and you are left to find your own. When I use the wall plug that came with my cell phone the wall unit gets dangerously hot, the unit itself also gets very warm. Being concerned about the risk of fire I decided to buy an Anker brand usb wall charger thinking it would be better since it was the same brand. That also became quite hot (although not as hot as my cell phone charger) The only way to not have it heat up while charging is to use the usb connection on my computer- which is fine when I'm home but useless if I am traveling without my laptop.My other issue is when I tried to contact Anker about this and inquire after safer ways to charge it I received no response from them.  This does not engender much faith in the company when they can't be willing to address such customer concerns.
title: Great product- super customer service.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2017
review_content: My own fault but this is much bigger and heavier than expected.  I have another Anker Powerbank from a few years ago and I just to the conclusion that it was the same size in general.  This is so big that you would not carry it around with you but need to find a spot to keep it at.
title: My own fault but this is much bigger and heavier ...

I love this portable charger because it provides a secure stability incase something like this happens.. again. I store it in the pouch that it came with and keep it in my car during the Winter season months because you never know!

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2016
review_content: I'm not quite sure how I feel about this charger. I got it out of the box and it was already at 25% charged. I plugged it in the outlet at 10pm. Came home from work at 8:30am. And the led light is blinking at 75%. I expected it to be fully charged by the time I got home, but unfortunately it was not. I've been using a Samsung note 4 USB charger. Could that be the case?UPDATE:I actually just bought the Anker PowerLine Micro cord and it has been charging quite well. It took my power bank from 10-11 hours of charging to just about 7 hours. They also reached out to me so I really appreciate the kind customer service.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2017

author: egreak
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2018

author: Steven Pham
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2016
review_content: This external charger has definitely saved me multiple times as my phone was about to die. I had a 10,000 mAh external charger but I decided to go with the Anker 20100 and I definitely do not regret it. It has a 4.8A charge speed on both ports which is ridiculous! I rarely see any chargers that allow both ports to be 4.8A speeds. Normally they are either 2A or 1A. Also, this charges my phone at about 1% per minute which is pretty damn fast for an external charger. I would definitely recommend this to other people and would buy again.

author: Justin B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2018
review_content: Have only had it a week but was very handy on my business trip. Loving it so far. Great product! Fully charged my Pixel XL 2 times and still shows to be full according to the light indicator for the battery.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2018
review_content: This is a solid portable battery. Charges everything well that doesnt require USB C boost (Laptop/Switch). She was able to correct my issue within minutes and I have not smiled as much on a customer service call. Fantastic affordable battery and amazing customer support!

author: Reviewer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2019

The charger came to my house within a matter of days. Hannah was great to work with. I give this company an A+
