review_content: Can't comment on longevity, but so far good.
title: works as expected

author: Tu34
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2019
review_content: Within 2 weeks it turns itself off. Double click it works again. Super disappointed as I wa going for a 100 mile hike the day after thisbstarted to happen. Maker sends you the Gettysburg address with a deadline of 5 days. No thanks I’ll wait. They send anyway because she isn’t listening. Just send a new one and I’ll send it back with a RMA. Simple
title: Completely disappointed

author: Lisa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020
review_content: Love that this has the capability to charge multiple items.  Will be putting it to the test when our son takes it to basic training for the military.  His phone will need a charge by the time he can use it again and not many options for plugging anything in to a wall socket there.
title: Charges everything!

author: Woo Han
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2016
review_content: This portable charger is the best I've purchased in a long time. I am rarely able to charge my phone and this anker product has been a life saver. I feel as if this charger charges for a lot more than it advertises. It's given me 3 full charges before losing one bar and I own the iPhone 6s. The matte black color and elongated design makes it quite portable
title: it even comes with a handy carry pouch that has room for not only the product itself but a usb you will need to charge your phone. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking for a power bank that offers an incredibly quick and efficient charge for a great price.

author: merryfl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2017
review_content: Got me through Hurricane Irma! I had a slightly smaller Anker but decided I needed another one to get through hurricane season. The two kept my phone (used as internet hot spot) and tablet going during Irma. Enabled me to watch those winds spin and spin. Provided entertainment like book reading and videos on long days without power.
title: Don't go into hurricane season without one

author: Jeff brunson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2020
review_content: Really like multiple charges from it for backpacking  The weight is a downer though weight is everything in backpacking and space was no problem though
title: Heavy  but worth it to pack

author: Kevin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2016
review_content: OMG. We charged TWO phones yesterday and didn't even get one light on the power indicator of this Anker 20100 to go off. THAT means it didn't even use up 25 percent of it's battery power!! This is great for my wife who has to work in houses and can't always get a recharge on her phone. I LOVE this charger/power bank.
title: This is great for my wife who has to work in houses ...

author: Mark Dwayne
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2015
review_content: It's so nice to have one of these. I know it will be useful for my phone/tablet/camera when I'm in the airport, hiking, camping,  etc.Update (March 30, 2016)I took off a star in my review because one of the USB port doesn't work anymore. I used to be able to charge 2 devices at a time and I can't do that anymore. Still a great product though.
title: No Ragrets

author: Bug
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2018
review_content: I really should have looked closer at the specs for this -- it's heavier than my laptop, ipad, and phone combined.I will probably not use it for traveling (original plan) but for power backup during emergencies.
title: It's heavy!

author: Rob O'Dwyer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2018
review_content: This is an upgrade for me over a cheaper version that crapped out. It works very well. We took it camping weeks ago, and just charged both phones again without charging it in between. Happy to have it and paired it with the Big Blue 28w solar charger.
title: Excellent

author: T. K. Sneed
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2016
review_content: I love these Anker portable chargers. I got a tablet with 4500mah battery. This power pack keeps my tablet and my phone going through a 12 hour shift and has power to spare. These also put out full 2.1 amp charges, so they charge devices quickly and you can use them while they charge. Same as being plugged into an outlet. Build quality is excellent.
title: Love these!

author: jason kander
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2017
review_content: It's been about 10 months since I bought this product. Plain and simple, it already stops recharging. Please be weary of this product and don't believe all the excellent reviews pushed to the top of the thread
title: Be careful

author: Terry G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2019
review_content: It has been only 35 days and I've noticed a faulty charging port. Tried multiple USB charging cords but none of them seemed to remedy the issue. It will charge a device foe 2-3 minutes and then cut out stopping the charging process. It worked flawlessly for the first month with very fast charging speeds but there is obviously a defect. Very disappointed, not reliable for travel.
title: Faulty charging port after 35 days

author: R. Lehner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020
review_content: Works great and holds charge.  I charged it and after 3 months it maintained its charge
title: Holds charge.  Works great

author: Kevin H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2020
review_content: I bought this in May 2019 and use it many times a month when traveling to charge my phone. The first 8 months worked amazing. Now on month 9 it will be longer accept a charge. The battery pack has one light left. Without being able to recharge it now, it has become a $50 paper weight.
title: Didn't last 9 months... probably not a good investment

author: Matthew Schwartz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2017
review_content: This portable charger has been a lifesaver! It has worked, without fail, to quickly charge multiple cell phones several times over the course of a day during long, outlet-starved days in airports, theme parks, and national park excursions. The re-charge speed is fantastic -- I'm so satisfied with Anker's PowerCore that I bought more as holiday gifts for family members.
title: Worth Every Penny!

author: Rebecca R
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2018
review_content: Although my original power bank died, Anker’s warranty covered it and my new one works perfectly. This thing is massive enough I only have to charge it once a week. Perfect for what I need.
title: Amazing company and service.

author: Henry Dawson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2020
review_content: Woyld not recomend. Iorderd the pack last night and got it today. I plug it in because I need it for a trip that is upcoming. I plug it in and i weigh 7 hours for it to charge.  It was still at the same amount of charge that it was seven hours ago. I changed sockets and cords just to be safe and let it sit over night ( 10 hours) and it was still at the same charge.
title: Didn't charge

author: Japan Touring
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2016
review_content: Travel a lot and constantly run out of charging possibilities?. Then this device is what you have been looking for. Extremely easy to use. Just plug in to charge. Turn the cable around, connect it to your device and charge it. Have gone places without it....and regretted it. Very reasonable. Only negative thing is that it doesn't lose weight as it discharges--but they are working on that (TIC).
title: A must for travelers! and power users!

author: Glenn Wong
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2017
review_content: This is the 3rd one I've purchased from Anker.  Awesome customer service!  The charger really holds a charge a long time.  Fast charging of my android phone on travel trips.  Really handy to charge multiple items at a time.  Great product!
title: Great Product

author: A.C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2016
review_content: This thing holds a ridiculous amount of power!!! On a trip I can charge an ipad, an iphone 6 and a Samsung note and it's still half full. During hotel stays when I can't be bothered to unplug the lamp and reach awkwardly behind the nightstand to plug in the converter/usb cable.. I just use this. Saved my life many times on the road.
title: holds a ridiculous amount of power!

author: SusieRule
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2016
review_content: Seems to be holding charge longer than any power bank I've owned and with a good cable charges my Note 3 within a couple hours (less when powered off) and does manage to charge albeit slower even when using phone.  Charges phone about 3x with phone off and 1-2x if using while charging. Power bank itself charges within acouple hours.  Again a good cable makes a huge difference.
title: Very Happy

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2019
review_content: I bought 2 of these, i love anker products. Have a lot of their things, car chargers, charging docks, wires etc. but both my portable chargers stop working after s few months and won’t charge anymore. I loved them while they were working and used it often so very disappointing I can’t use them anymore. Especially for the price it should last longer then a few months.
title: Won’t charge anymore.

author: D. Loz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2017
review_content: I travel quite a bit for work, and finding a socket at the airport is usually mission impossible, so buying a portable battery was a logical thing to do. I wish I've done it way before, because the battery made my life so much simpler. As for the battery, this particular one is a bit bulky and have, but for a reason - I can charge my iPhone 6-7 times from 0 to 100%. Also, Anker has new power banks that are smaller. They have a great customer service and the battery is the best one you can find out there. Very stylish, too.
title: Amazing power bank

author: Joe RoB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2016
review_content: I love all my anker chargers i have 4. I always keep them in a bag if i am camping or staying over at a party or something. If you go to NYC or a big city they are perfect just keep it in your bag and get a 3 foot cable. You dont want your phone to die there. For concerts i have a small one i keep in my jacket just in case this one is way better can charge 4 phones on it no sweat.
title: Love It!!

author: Jonathan Angliss
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2020
review_content: I can usually get 3-4 charges into a Galaxy S10+ before needing to recharge. Holds charge well, and relatively slim.
title: Works Great

author: EB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2017
review_content: These are great for travel and daily use. They can easily charge our family's four iPhones and still have power left over. They are big, though, not the tiny ones you see at the check-out. Don't forget the little adapter to charge your iPhone, it has a (micro?) USB connection.
title: Incredibly useful. Fast charge. Love it.

author: Geoffrey A. Fricker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2016
review_content: At first this battery pack didn't work very well for me.  It would just shut off after being connected to my phone/camera, etc.  It would connect for a second (the LEDs would all light up), leading me to believe that it was working, but then would just shut down.  It's possible I just got a lemon, but I wouldn't recommend this product.Amendment, after my first review of 1 star, Anker contacted me and sent me a replacement.  Their customer service was right on top of it and sent another battery.  I just sent the old one back and the new battery seems to be working well.  Will update if anything changes.  4 stars due to Anker's customer service.
title: but I wouldn't recommend this product

author: Ravi D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2019
review_content: I'm very upset I ordered 1 in the past it was it was amazing so I figured I'll order a few more both in a very short time lost there strong charge it only slow charges now idk what to say I'm very disappointed..... Not 1 but Two lost its charge wtf is that normal? Is that normal anker?
title: Wow 2 batterys

author: Sara B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2016
review_content: Love the charge capacity and ability to charge 2 devices at once. It is sturdy, simple, and seems well made. Much better investment than individual expanded batteries. Takes some time to charge to full capacity (which is totally understandable), so that's the only thing I have to remember to keep on top of. Definitely won't be my last Anker purchase.
title: Great for gadget heavy households

author: unks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2018
review_content: I bought this batter for transatlantic flights. Newer plans have USB power but not all of them. This permits me to watch movies on my phone for the entire crossing.
title: Can Do Transatlantic Flights

author: caligirl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2018
review_content: The first one I ordered did not work as expected. The power cord did not stay in the designated slot, but I wrote the company and they sent me a brand new one that works, and Im so happy with it..Small, but has a really great sound...
title: Im in love

author: paul
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2016
review_content: I've owned this unit for a few months and it's bailed me out a couple times. It's a bit heavy but I get 4-5 full charges out of it and is worth the piece of mind. Rock solid and a good purchase, I recommend it. (On a side note and won't effect most people, it can not be used with portable solar units even Anker's.)
title: Rock solid and a good purchase, I recommend it...

author: zone5001
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2016
review_content: Mine dies after charging my LG G4 3 times. I thought i could charge it 5 to 6 times as reviews have suggested.Update 09/20/16: added a star for customer service contacting me ragarding this product. I was asked to test battery and see maybev if it was a defective battery and they were willing to replace it if i continued to have any issue. Unfortunately i gave the battery away to a relative who was flying away and needed it. Kudos to the customer service.
title: Mine dies after charging my LG G4 3 times. ...

author: Hiten Patel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
review_content: This packs all the punch it promises and then some. The weight isn’t too bad and honestly feels good. One thing to keep in mind is recharging the powercore itself
title: standard iPhone chargers don’t have the amp outage needed to charge the core quickly. I purchased an anker 2.5amp charger separately to charge the powercore within 8 hours.

author: Jonathan Z.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2015
review_content: I am tired of running out of charges, even with the standard large battery packs I've found that I'd often still run out. With this I'm guaranteed robust charging, not only that all my friends always run out, they love me when I hook them up to this. My brothers iPhone 6plus went up over 1% per minute! A short can ride he was at 24% from 2% , design is nice as well.
title: FAST & ROBUST & LOTS OF JUICE

author: Joe E. Lepo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2017
review_content: I purchased this very model for a friend during a recent visit to Philippines. Hers was almost fully discharged and took almost a day to be charged. But once charged we were both pleased with its performance. Upon returning to USA I got one for myself. This is a must item for travelers in places with unreliable or spotty charging opportunities.
title: But once charged we were both pleased with its performance

author: Samantha Chang
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2017
review_content: The Anker 200000mAH Portable Charger is the best portable charger I have ever purchased, 100% worth the money! It will charge my galaxy S8+ quickly even as it is charging a different phone at the same time. Not only is the charger great for its intended purpose, but the customer service at Anker is also outstanding. I noticed that one of the ports on one of my two Anker 20000mAH chargers started charging a little slower than usual so I reached out to Anker and they replaced it right away with no questions asked! Excellent product and awesome company.
title: The Anker 200000mAH Portable Charger is the best portable charger I have ever purchased

author: Christopher Figueroa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2019
review_content: I bought this product on December 17, 2017. It works well until six months after purchasing it, one of the port stop working. I didn't mind at first, but yesterday the other one stops working. Other then that it worked well, I charged the device once a week, and it lasted the entire week. I charge my phone eight times a week, and it still had 25% of power left.
title: Great product until the port stop working.

author: Robertson Manalac
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2019
review_content: Good product if you want to charge your gadget faster and convenient while you using it that you dont have to charge in the outlet.Hint: for faster charging the anker powerbank for not make it warm and the battery life more expand you need a fast charger adapter atleast 30W ..
title: Quick Charger, Good and Handleable ..

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2020
review_content: Fou it’s size I was surprised at how quickly it discharges!
title: Pour quality!

author: MClarissa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2019
review_content: This is my 3rd one. Everyone in the home now has one and amazing for travel. Has juice for days and Anker's customer service is top notch
title: Must buy

author: Donnie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2016
review_content: I bought this because I was going on a camping trip for a few days and wanted to see how this held up. I am VERY happy with this battery. I used it everyday on my camping trip and it still had over half its charge left! Very tough, feels solid, and can take a beating. It takes a while for it to charge, but it will last at least a week on a full charge.
title: AWESOME

author: i. smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
review_content: My son likes e you about it and mostly uses it to charge his cell phone. he takes it everywhere he goes.
title: A great buy.

author: David Sheehan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2019
review_content: Used on our Europe trip. Saved having to carry different plugs on the trains and planes and fit in backpack for use when we were out all day.
title: Great for multiple cell phones

author: Anh Nguyen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2019
review_content: All right.  I’ve had this for almost a year and now it won’t charge past 2 bars.  Really disappointed as my old one didn’t start losing a charge until 3 years into it.  I don’t know if it was a dud but am not impressed.
title: Doesn’t hold a charge anymore

author: jctejada77
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2017
review_content: A little longer than expected but still fits in my front jean pocket comfortably. Charging the Anker PowerCore itself takes a little while which should be expected due to its large capacity. I've only been using it for a couple of days now and so far so good. It has two USB ports capable of charging 2 devices at the same time.
title: Large capacity that fits in your pocket

author: JJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2017
review_content: Solid charging block. We've been through a few and this one has great build quality and seems to last FOREVER. I fully charged my Galaxy S8 Active and the block still had 4/4 blue lights.
title: We've been through a few and this one has great build quality and seems to last FOREVER

author: Colombian Diva 86
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2018
review_content: Absolutely love it. It lasts forever. I actually use this for my breast pump which I used a minimum of 5 times a day for 20 minutes each session. And I only charge 1 a week or 11/2, probably lasts longer but I've never left it to die so IDK
title: Absolutely love it. It lasts forever

author: Kiri Xiong
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2020
review_content: Charges so quickly and anker is one of my favorite brands for electronics! They are very reliable for the price point.
title: Great Brand and Fast Product

author: K. Weil
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2019
review_content: Great for traveling and long battery life. Bonus to be able to plug in 2 phones at once. Expect several hours for it to reach maximum charge.
title: Great product

author: M. S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2019
review_content: Works great so far. Not a heavy user of it though. Quality build is very nice for the price. LED indicators are easy to read. I wish it would last a bit longer on a single charge because it takes some time to charge it via USB 2.0.
title: Great value for the money!

author: Ryan Alvarez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2018
review_content: I use this for a backup. Some flights don't have working plugs and it's great to know I'm ready. The product was heavier than expected but, BUT, I get many charges out of it. It's also great knowing it's ahead of the game and not your standard, 1v, 2v charger. Very good for travel! I rather be sure to have this good boy charged and ready as 2 extra LBs are nothing when traveling. Ankler has always been very cool with their customer support and always try and look for their products if available. .
title: Great and Sturdy

author: Cord
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019
review_content: Works well enough but it's a long time to charge. Has ran everything I've hooked to it. Including a portable fan.
title: Works Great but takes long to charge

author: S. M. Larson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2015
review_content: When you need power,  it needs to be reliable.  That's the bottom line with this charger.  It was charging my galaxy s4 to full multiple times,  approximately five,  even once while the device was on and in heavy use,  before I needed top charge it again.  I play ingress and I need to keep my device charged and ready to fight back if the other team is after my locations.  This battery pack facilitates that and more.I did not detract from the rating for this because anker contacted me directly abs this was intentional in their concept of selling this battery,  but the charger does not come with its own charging block.  It was designed to work with your phone charger. If you are using an older charger expect the charge to take over 24 hours. Anker does offer chargers but sells them separately.  My adaptive fast charger works great for this now that I upgraded to a note 4.
title: intelligent battery, bring a charger!

author: Dale A. Nacke
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2018
review_content: This is my second PowerCore.  I had to replace my first one because my wife lost it.  She said she didn't, but she's wrong.  Anyway, this thing is pretty great.  I get multiple charges for my phone and tablet on a single PowerCore charge.I'll be keeping much closer eye on this one as I'd hate to have to buy another one should it go missing under dubious circumstances.  Again.
title: Great portable power!

author: Brian G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2019
review_content: Had it for a year now. Sounds crazy but it's one of the most useful things I've bought. Went all around Spain... powered up girlfriend and my phone several times. Buy it.
title: The Best

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019
review_content: takes ten hours to recharge.  Pushes the charge so whatever it's connected to charges faster.  I believe that's a feature called IQ something.
title: Great Battery but...

author: MARYKATE
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2016
review_content: LOVE LOVE LOVE..Very happy w Anker products! I had a different charger that stopped taking a charge After a year. I was so upset.  I emailed anker they refunded me the purchase price..I was shocked! So I bought this for the same price. It's takes a very long time to charge...Bc it's so big! (As in the capacity not physical size) it takes all night and 1/2 of the next day to fully charge. I have an iPhone 7 I use this like once a day. I always keep it in my purse. It will last just about 5 days in my purse. It charges my phone really fast too! Great product would def recommend!
title: LOVE LOVE LOVE

author: Tonoccus McClain
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2020
review_content: Keeps the most power, charges fastest, dependable, and portable. I’ve tried many. This is the best.
title: This is the best.

author: zach
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2019
review_content: Charges so insanely slow that it wont keep up if you are using your phone. Plugged it in for an hour not using it and my phone battery went up 3% basically useless. Will be returning
title: Might as well be a stick of butter.

author: DARS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
review_content: Works very well when needed. Great to have a portable charger as a back up.
title: Works very well when needed. Great to have a portable charger as a back up!

author: Anne C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2017
review_content: This charger is a life saver! We took it on a recent bus tour of Ireland and used it EVERY day! We were even able to let some other people on the bus borrow it to charge their phones too and  it never ran out of juice. Ten stars for this baby!!! :-)
title: Indispensable!!!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2017
review_content: When I bought this it completely changed how I use my phone.Having an iPhone 7+ I was never really concerned about my battery life, but I was always consciously aware of how I was using my phone.Now that I have the PowerCore I just throw it in my backpack and use my phone the way it was intended. Any time I want to take a photo/video or play a game I don't think twice about it. I know that no matter what I do I always have the PowerCore on me and that I can rely on it to keep me going all day. As a heavy phone user (now) I only have to charge the PowerCore once a week. Highly recommend!!
title: Can not recommend enough

author: SuperDad
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2016
review_content: I gave this as a gift to my wife.  She loves how many charges she can get for her iPhone 6.  The only gotcha is that due to is Ah rating, it takes quite a long time to recharge.  Well worth it.I believe that every home should have one of these for emergencies and they are also great for several days of camping where you are 'off the grid'
title: Good battery backup for multiple smart phone charges.

author: LSavage
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2018
review_content: Called Anker customer service and spoke to Justin. He went above and beyond. To the point of calculating the draw from our phones, informing us which power bank was the best for our needs. He was honest and didn’t push the most expensive item. I’m more likely to purchase from a company with great customer service, like I received.  The item was boxed similar to iPhones but in a more simple fashion. I really researched the power banks and this was the best.  I also purchased two lightning cables and a quick charge.  Will be using the power bank at Dollywood and Disney World.
title: Anker customer service is top notch.

author: Richard D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2017
review_content: Same power as a previous one I purchased for my wife two years ago but much smaller physically. Older, larger one had 3 USB ports but there was more room. Like the smaller size for the same capacity, two ports are plenty. Charges stuff faster than our best 60 Watt wall chargers with 6 or 7, 3.2 amp ports.
title: Like the smaller size for the same capacity

author: Louis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2020
review_content: this thing is powerful. worth every penny
title: charges your iPhone fast!

author: G.G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2018
review_content: This has stopped working after only 2 months of owning it. My last Anker lasted 3 years which is why I repurchased an Anker... so this is very disappointing. I tried to exchange it but my “return window” is closed, per Amazon. A waste of $80 bucks
title: Stopped working after 2 months.

author: Semihg
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2018
review_content: Although slightly heavier than some of the other power packs, this one can charge fast, and can be used multiple times before it has to be recharged. I recommend it especially on long trips. You won't be searching for power outlets on the run.
title: I recommend it especially on long trips

author: johnny owens
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2020
review_content: Anker 20100mah power core portable charger has lots of power to charge several phones , iPad and more on a single charge
title: It’s a mighty powerhouse but small in size

author: J. J. Martinez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2020
review_content: I'm sure its powerful but huge n heavy
title: Definately not for travel or hiking

author: chuck
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2020
review_content: I love Anker products. I bought this portable charger and it’s great.
title: Great charger

author: Armando Ortiz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2018
review_content: It takes a lot of time to be fully charged. Even in a wall connection, it takes many hours.Despite the inconvenience I had with full charging the battery, customer service I have received has been great and awesome. The refund me the amount because my device could not work properly as it expected. I think it was a matter of luck only. I think it is still a good device for outdoor trips. Thank you to Anker for such a great following for my experience and quick response.
title: Three Stars

author: C. Scott Walsh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2016
review_content: By far my favorite external battery pack.  Small enough to fit in my backpack no problem yet provides enough power to keep all my devices charged on camping and hiking trips.  I lost my first one which sucks for me, but aces for whoever found it.  Well worth the money that I bought another one.  I can't leave home without it.  Ideal for a Go Bag.

author: Julie Higgins
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020
review_content: I use to really like this and it worked amazing while it lasted but for this price You would think it would last a few years......nope

author: GA Peach
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2019
review_content: This was great for our recent trip 2 week trip to Europe. Once fully charged, it had enough power to charge my Android device at least 2 or more time when power level was around 10-20% as well as a second phone or tablet.

author: Eric R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2017
review_content: Don't think just buy! The only thing to think about is the size and amount of power you want. These  things are great. They are well worth the money. These are very high quality and they are offered at a good price. I've had this for a while now and love that we can recharge or iPad's and our phones multiple times before this is drained. I have actually never run out of power so far. They are just solid. I wouldn't hesitate to buy another and will get one or two as presents.
title: Don't think just buy!

author: Derek
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2016
review_content: Have used this charger for almost a year now, and it is amazing!  It does take overnight to recharge, but that is expected for 20,000 mAh.  Once full, I recharge multiple devices (phones, wireless headphones, even other portable chargers) multiple times before it's completely discharged.  Solid connectors and handy status lights.

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2018
review_content: This charger is awesome. It is heavy... but carrying it in my back pack when I travel doesn't add too much weight. It holds charge for a long time. Just beware it takes FOREVER to charge itself. I have to plug it into the wall at least 18 hours before I plan to leave to ensure it gets a large enough charge. The charging process for my phone is excellent and fairly quick.

author: Robyn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2019
review_content: I am unable to score this a 0.  I charged it and tried to use it on a trip and it did not charge at all.  Waste of money.  Unfortunately my window to return is over so I can’t return.  So frustrated.  I never write bad reviews, but this deserves it!  I want my money back!!!!!
title: Looses charge - DO NOT BUY!!!!

author: Javier Medina
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2020
review_content: Very good product. I love how it charges all sorts of things. Quick Charge. The device itself takes a little long to charge.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020
review_content: Great product, purchased for our son and he loves it,

author: Kristina
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2018
review_content: Update: Anker sent me a replacement battery and it works great! So much easier to keep my phone with me while running around.Thank you so much for the awesome customer service !!!Today is my first day using it and I’m having an issue with it turning off occasionally before my phone is charged :/ so I guess I’ll see if it keeps happening. If it stops I’ll update my review :/

author: TW
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2018
review_content: Fantastic produce, but the charging port failed.  Currently have to place a weight on the cable near the port so it charges properly.  Will return the product and purchase another unit.

author: Harry Huey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2017
review_content: Endless power!  Highly recommended! Charged 3 iPhones and still had more juice left! Comes with a drawstring bag to keep it in. Product description doesnt mention the bag. My friend bought this model somewhere else before I did and told me it came with bag. I almost ordered a small cloth bag for mine at the time I made my order...glad I waited.

author: Andrew Babb
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2019
review_content: Fast charges a Galaxy S8 as advertised (around 1.8A). Great capacity.

author: Dan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2019
review_content: Been using it for almost 10 months and it's not charging anymore. When connected, my cellphone goes up to 3% and then to 0 within minutes... Seems it's drawing out energy instead of charging.Very disappointed.

author: Ivan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020

author: Dylan L.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2019
review_content: I bought this with charging 2 phones for mobile gaming with a friend. Outstanding quality on the product, charges both phones as advertised and battery doesnt drain when in use. (Galaxy Note 8 & iPhone 8). Have used this without charging the powerbank in 2 days and will not lose charge when not in use.I highly suggest this product for on the go charging.

author: Stan Corpuz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2020

author: Steven B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2017
review_content: This charger is awesome. The only drawback is a very simplistic meter indicating how much of a charge remains, but it really doesn't matter. You'll never use it up. I've been on vacation for a week. I haven't had to plug my phone into a wall outlet once. I've used this exclusively and haven't run it down yet. It was 50%drained after 3 days so I plugged it in. But I probably could have gone the whole week without even doing that. Highly recommend.It's bigger than I thought it would be and a little heavy, but I wanted a tank of a charger and that's what I got.

author: MVPisme
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2020
review_content: I’ve only had the charger for a few weeks and it can no longer fully charge. I was only able to get it to fully charge upon first use. This would be a five star review if it worked as advertised because upon first use it was fantastic.

author: kevin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2019
review_content: Absolutely solid investment. Worth shelling out the extra money for a quality product. My wife and I take this camping and we can both charge out phones while sleeping, often multiple times on a single charge. No dip in battery capacity and I've had it for almost a year!

author: Faraz Chowdhury
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2016
review_content: This thing is a monster. It's got some weight to it but its not annoyingly heavy by any means
title: surprisingly compact and a beast of a battery. This was delivered to me last night with about 50% life left in it. I immediately charged by iPhone 6S from 19% to 100%
verified: then charged my sisters 6S from 24% to 100%
votes_helpful: then took the iPad and charged it from 21% to 100% and then charged 2 additional iPhone 6S pluses and the battery still had juice left! I can see myself using this quite a bit when I travel. Really solid product. Anker never disappoints!

author: Rockel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2018

author: ryan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2019
review_content: Product worked great (5/5) however not even 3 months after purchase battery is no longer putting out a charge. For this reason alone I can’t give it a good rating as products are meant to last the consumer more than 3 months.

author: Rone811
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2016

I gave mine away because I'm getting another one. Highly recommend if you travel a lot.

author: Mike
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2016
review_content: Great Charger! title: Great Charger! Takes a while to get full charge ...

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
review_content: I purchased this product in May 2019 and was SO HAPPY with it....until this week, not even a year later, it stopped working. author: Jack
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2016

title: A must for mobile people !

author: leydi68
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2016
review_content: I recently wrote a complaint about a defective battery I received and ANKER customer service was really great. They emailed me about my complaint and offer to send me another battery free of charge.I received the battery and I must say it works really well. It charges really fast. So now I'm a happy customer. Anker customer service came through for me.they stood by their product and fix the issue I hadI don't usually write reviews but with this.... BUYERS BEWARE!!!! I was able to charge it completely twice. Now when I tried charging using the cable it came with, I GET NOTHING BUT A BLINKING LIGHT. I left it on charge for 2 days only to check it later still holding that one light.. plus, now it get really hot if I keep it on the charger for too long.... Talk about a fire hazard!!

author: Blissful Living
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2018

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2018

I ordered it knowing it wouldn't be slim, but I didn't think it'd matter at the time. Now, though, I wish I could fit it in my back pocket. Overall, it's wonderful.Note: Charging cord pictured below was bought separately.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2017
review_content: This is the third charger I've ordered from this company (1 for home, 1 for work and 1 as a gift) and they've all been phenomenal. Only difference I noticed between the first two chargers and this one is this one doesn't have the flashlight feature. Doesn't really matter to me as it was a feature I never used.

author: Jamie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2015
review_content: Really enjoy this charger. It only took about an hour to get it charged and ready to go. It worked great charging my cell phone when I was unable to plug in somewhere. author: Henri Aflalo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2016

Comes with a cord and a cute drawstring pouch for the charger.~I did not received this product for test and review purposes.

author: Brad Melchior
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2018
review_content: I had this charger for a little less than 1 year and 3 of the LEDs that let you know how much charge is left quit working. They quickly replaced the charger honoring their 18-month warranty policy.  Can't ask for much more than that.  Very pleased with charger and Anker as a company as it is clear they have pride in there product and it's quality.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2019

author: Chris, a college student
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2017
review_content: I made the mistake of buying this portable battery instead of the Anker PowerCore 20000 with Quick Charge 3.0. This portable charger also charges the Nintendo Switch but it must be in sleep mode as it will only sustain the battery at whatever percent you're at if you're playing and charging. This battery also gets very hot at the ports when charging or be recharged itself. I wouldn't use this charger on a hot day for fear of it catching fire or getting too hot to handle. Other than that I'm happy with it and does it's job on campus if I'm having a long day away from a wall plug for my phone. Planning on getting the quick charge one soon though and I really want to see if the Anker 21W Dual USB Solar Charger is a great tool to have too.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2019

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2019
review_content: This is my second Anker charger. My first one lasted a couple years and I loved it! It would charge extremely fast when it was out of battery life. This one takes 24 hours or more to fully charge to having 4 bars. I’m not sure if mine is defective or not but it’s nothing like my old one. Very disappointed, especially for the money spent. Won’t buy again

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020
review_content: I love this power bank! It fast charges my S10 in the same time it would take to charge from the outlet, has a great battery life, and is really convenient for traveling compared to its size and how much power it holds. I think everyone should have one of these!

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020
review_content: Product was great while it worked. Stopped working 4 months after use. Very unfortunate for being so expensive. **UPDATE they replaced my old power bank for a new one and it’s working great. Excellent customer service!***

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2020

author: Jason
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2020
review_content: I have it in my bag on my motorcycle,  charging my gopro batteries,  last a long time, fast charging.

author: qtrixie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2015
review_content: I got this to replace my previous pack that got lost. HUGE capacity in a form factor the size of a small laptop charger brick. I like that it's matte instead of gloss like the previous version. Makes it less slippery in the hand and feels nice. Gone is the LED light which I found kind of useless anyways. Just a single button to turn on with 4 lighted dots to show current charge status. It auto-offs and charges my phone and tablet fine.
title: Better than the original

author: Joe H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2017
review_content: This is a fantastic power bank that seems to be priced at just the right spot. The dual USB ports on this thing mean I can charge my Fitbit and my iPhone at the same time, and I can generally get 5-6 full iPhone charges out of this thing before I need to recharge it again (plugged into my laptop, it takes about one night). My iPad isn't quite so kind to it and can run the pack down if it's not fully charged, but this power bank is more than adequate for giving iPhones a (very quick) top-up in the middle of the afternoon. Even if you're not a frequent traveler, I'd still recommend this power bank.
title: A great option for the non-travelers among us, too.

author: dv8apex
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2015
review_content: Of the powerbanks i have used. This one easily tops the others thus far.Although bulky. I've been able to charge 3 different phones from around 10% or dead to 100% off a full charge. It it still going off it's first charge still.As said, it is bulky, but feels like it could stand to some abuse and time.Looking forward to the long haul.
title: Sturdy. Powerful.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2016
review_content: very good batteries charger for anything and everything you need to charge on the go. this is one of the best feeling and longest lasting portable batteries i have used. many consumers complain its to large and heavy but for a good quality charger and life of the batteries  i feel its worth every bit of size and weight. i use this to charge multiple galaxy note 4's with no problems and i also use it while playing my ps4 to keep my controller charging while still having that wireless freedom. i see this product on sale all the time but i would gladly pay full retail value and not think twice. it comes with a carrying bag with slight insulation in case of drops or aggressive travel and there is a charging cord only so you will have to use a usb AC charger, this is my only con for this item. I will be buying another one shortly.
title: Amazing for anyone looking for a good traveing companion.

author: Don H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2017
review_content: Powerful battery back up is a priority for me running a cell phone and tablet constantly while traveling. date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2019

I heart you Anker.

Great gifts for college students.

The powercore kept it powered for the 3 nights and I even had 1 indicator light lite up on the powercore after the trip ended that I used to charge my devices on the car ride to the next trail. It was very simple to use and had no issues leaving it out exposed overnight.

author: Roger J. Buffington
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2017
review_content: I am satisfied with this unit. I wanted a battery that would charge up my iPad Air **while I was using the iPad**.  Recently I was in Court with no access to a plug, and a stone-dead iPad Air (hadn't charged it in a couple of months).  This battery began charging the dead iPad Air such that I could use the iPad after a couple of minutes, and while I was using the iPad, the iPad continued charging and increasing the charge level.  Three hours later when it was time to leave, the iPad was at about 60% charge and continuing to charge.  The battery was at three dots.  This appears to indicate that this battery will keep an iPad Air going all day and more, especially if the iPad Air is initially charged.  That's what I was looking for, so I am pleased with this unit.  Other batteries that I have tried would not keep charging the iPad Air *while I was using it* -- they would charge it if it were turned off.  On a plane or in uncomfortable venues such as Court, where plugs are not available, this battery can be a lifesaver because it will charge the iPad Air while you are actively using the iPad Air.  RJB.
title: Charges the iPad Air while you are using it.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2018
review_content: Love it ... been using it for a year now ...Pros:- Charges mobile phones real fast.- Can charge 2 devices at the same time- Charging cable included comes in a very convenient length- Enough for around 7-10 charging cycles i think!- Looks niceCons:- Takes a lot to be fully charged (around 10 hours to get fully charged. Better leave it to charge over night)- A little heavier than it looks (not a big deal actually)

author: Jessica Standing
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2019
review_content: I got this due to going to a relay for life event and knew I wouldn’t be able to charge my phone for over 24 hours. title: Works great!!

author: J. Campbell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2017
review_content: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this thing!  I have absolutely no clue how many iPhones this thing can charge because it's never been low enough to gauge that stat.  I primarily bought this thing for long motorcycle rides.  I have a bag that is attached just below the headlight and I keep the battery pack in the bag and ran a 3' nylon-braided Apple cord to the handlebar mount where my phone rests.  This thing pushes juice to the phone so much that it not only keeps it from draining the battery, but charges it at the same time.  To be clear, I have an iPhone 6 with the screen on full brightness, and a GPS app routing my ride, and heavens knows what other apps might be tracking me and/or pushing data.  And with all of those things going on, my phone is GAINING battery power!  I may have to buy another one of these things because my wife has taken to stealing this thing when she goes out with the girls and whatnot, LoL! I also love that it has two ports for charging two phones as my wife did take this on an overnight trip and she and her friend both kept their phones in near full charge the whole night.  A word of note: this battery pack is not über portable; it's larger than you might be expecting.  I also have two other Anker portable chargers and they are truly portable as they aren't much larger than a roll of nickels, but they don't have a huge capacity for power.  This thing will power your phone for what seems like an endless amount, but again, it is quite large for something called "portable".  The smaller Anker charger I own can easily slip inside a jacket pocket or even a large jean pocket.  This thing?  No way, not even close.  A woman purse?  Yes, it would fit in there.  Again, not a deal breaker by any means, just know that it is quite large for "portable".  Again, I highly recommend this (and all Anker products really) and suggest you buy this if it sounds like it fits your needs.
title: Best portable charger I have ever owned

author: Austin Zaker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2018
review_content: I forget to charge my phone at night, so I got this guy. I leave it and my phone in my backpack and it’s done within a hour- hour and a half.LOVE IT!

author: Dogatron
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2017
review_content: I've never managed to fully drain this beast in 1 year of use.  Although the seller's claims are optimistic, I can get 3 full iPhone 6sP and 2 iPad Air charges, with some juice left to spare.  That's more than enough for a night of rocking out or a long haul flight.  It's proven sturdy - still works fine after a few drops.

review_content: If you're like me you're constantly on your phone. All in all I always thought the smaller portable backup batteries were useful, now I understand that my Anker portable charger puts all those to shame.  I will continue to use and be excited that I can be anywhere and know I'm covered with energy for my devices.

review_content: This is the second portable charger I've ever owned and I can honestly say I don't think I'll ever go to any other brand for one when this one goes kaput! Charges LIGHTNING fast! I never worked with the IQ charging before, but I think it's interesting. Seems to charge faster when battery life is critically low and seems to slow down incrementally as it gets closer to 100%. I'm assuming it's for the health and longevity of the charger and the mobile devices' batteries. I haven't tried charging two devices at once yet, but I assume it handles just as well! When the charger gets low, I plug it up overnight and it's ready to go in the morning for several DAYS if not a full week (depends on how 'out and about' I am)!

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2017

author: DevilK9
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2018

author: Magjim
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2017

author: Jim
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2018
review_content: I bought this to charge my phone while on my motorcycle.  I can get at least 3 full charges out of it.And it can handle a drop... or 2🙄I've always had good luck with anker products and this one is no different

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2019

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2020
review_content: It's still going strong today.

author: DJ Hurricane
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2017
review_content: This charger had a great rep.  I ordered an Anker PowerCore 20100 Sept 2016.  It was great for 5 months, then took 3 days to fully charge.  Its longevity sucks.  I am NOT a happy customer

author: MJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2015
review_content: This has been a life saver while traveling. No more searching for the elusive power outlets at airports. Has enough juice to power up my Nexus 7 tablet and my wife's iPad mini a few times. Have used with our Apple and Android phones as well. Great having two USB ports to handle more than one device at a time.

author: simone
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2016
review_content: This is my 2nd anker charger. I charge this one time for a few hours and can then charge my phone several times without the inconvenience of being tethered to a wall. I absolutely love this item. It is so convenient for airport trips and long flights. I have been purchasing them as gifts for family members because it is so convenient.

author: S. Hanley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2020
review_content: Probably the biggest waste of money ever. Lasted two months. Do not buy this .

author: Chris L.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2016
review_content: I've bought other portable chargers in the past and they've just all sucked. This portable charger is absolutely amazing and the capacity is insane. I held off on reviewing this product till I really got a lot of use out of it and so far I've been able to charge two Nexus 6 phones, two PS4 controllers, and a PS4 headset and still have some power left. I spend way more time charging other devices than I do charging the device itself. I'm almost convinced that Anker conjured this charging apparatus using witchcraft. If you're looking for a real portable charger that can keep up with the most power hungry phones and tablets, get out of these reviews and buy this right now.
title: The only portable charger I'll ever use

author: GINZA PIANTINIS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
review_content: I made a good use of it. but mine exploded

review_content: This is by far the best power bank I have found.  I travel a lot and this bank holds a charge for a couple of days.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2018
review_content: I used product once . I only bought so when traveling i could recharge my phone and hearing decide. After one use of an hour or two, went to use again and ZERO ! used once in 4 months. It kites up nut does not charge. No misuse , no dropping just do t work. It worked great the first use. Second attempt Zero.

review_content: Great charger when it is fully charged. The replacement has failed as well. I now have two useless chargers. I will have to go to another company.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2019

review_content: I love this product so much. It's probably one of the best buying decisions that I've made. I am a photographer and I also go to a lot of music festivals. date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2016
review_content: Looks and feels tough and it's full of juice. Not sure what this is about, but obviously disappointing when it happens. I've been using it with a Nexus 5X when this has happened.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2019

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2018
review_content: Sadly I am disappointed. My wife gave this to me for Christmas. But I have not had a need to use it yet until a few weekends ago. We have not hurt it at all, and no other precious use then one charge and discharge.Worked great for that first time. Charged our phones fast and multiple times.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2015

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2015
review_content: I used to have the 10,000mAh charger from Anker and I was satisfied with its performance. It was wearing out after nearly 3 years of constant use, and I thought I was probably due for a new one. I bought this one and I'm not having to charge it every night like I did with the previous. Sure the case is a little longer, but the quickness that it recharges my cell phone and the reduction in the number of times that I have to actually charge the Anker MORE than makes up for the larger size. Now I wish that someone would invent a case that would protect the connections on my USB chords..already bent three chords...but that isn't Anker's fault - that's my fault for sitting on the thing while it was in my pocket.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2018
review_content: Apple iPad Mini 2 has battery rated at 6,471 mAh.  I should be able to charge my iPad at least 3 times (or very close to it).  Thought maybe the batter needed to run through a few times so I've tested 4 full charge cycles and each time, I can only charge my iPad twice.  This means I'm getting just under 13,000 mAh or just under 70% of rated battery capacity.  Not sure why this is an Amazon's Choice or why the ratings are so high.  Should have stayed with Mophie.

author: Joyful56
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2017
review_content: This power pack is certainly functional but not high performing. I bought this primarily for power outages to keep my iPhone 6 charged since I use it a lot. On electricity, my iPhone charges from 20% to 100% in about 75 minutes. Same for my car charger (car charger actually faster). I did not expect the power pack to perform at that level but am disappointed with how long it does take. When the power pack is fully charged it will charge my phone from 20% to 80% in about 2 hours. If I really want a 100% charge it takes 6-8 hours. The last 20% is extremely slow. I read reviews and saw some people felt the cord to the phone could be an issue. I was using the original iPhone cord but bought the Anker lightening charge cord separately in case it mattered. Same performance. Now I will say that a charge from 20% to 80% only reduces the charger power by one blinking indicator, so I will get several 80% charges from a fully charged charger. I am not sending it back because I see reviews from many people having similar issues so odds are good this would happen again.  80% in a power outage can still be quite a blessing - especially when it is several 80% charges. But it does not live up to its billing and the price here is not inconsequential, so I am giving this a mid-rating in the hope of encouraging people to consider alternatives.
title: Only "Middling" Performance

author: M M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2015
review_content: I decided to purchase the Anker 20000mAh battery pack based on the reviews, I read, but I wanted to run my own tests and compare it's effectiveness against Apple's wall chargers. The first test consisted of charging and timing my iPhone 6S Plus with Apple's wall charger. The charge lasted for 19 hours and 22 minutes until the iPhone battery reached 2%.Next, I charged and timed the iPhone 6S Plus with the Anker Compact 20000mAh battery pack. The results were surprising.I was able to charge the iPhone 6S Plus 19 minutes faster than Apple's wall plug, using the Anker 20000mAh battery pack and the charge lasted for 20 hours and 2 minutes until the battery reached 2%. My opinion of the Anker 20000mAh battery pack was great, but I wasn't done.My next test was the Apple Watch. I repeated the same test by timing Apple's wall charger, then the Anker 20000mAh battery pack. The Apple Watch was finished charging 27 minutes faster and the Watch battery life lasted about the same amount of time as the wall charge. The Anker 20000mAh battery pack still had 4 blue LED's after these tests. So far so great.., but you guessed it, I still wasn't done..I performed a different test but the same general concept. I charged the iPhone 6S Plus and the Apple Watch simultaneously, using the Anker 20000mAh battery pack. As I expected, the Apple Watch finished first and I was happy to see once it reached 100% the Anker 20000mAh battery pack stopped charging in the specific port the Apple Watch was plugged into, but I didn't remove it from the battery pack. The iPhone 6S Plus continued charging and once it finally completed its charge it was still a faster charge than the Apple wall plugs. Apple Watch finished 11 minutes faster and the iPhone 6S Plus finished 3 minutes faster then Apple's wall plugs.Yes, I still had one test left. I charged my iPad 3 and the iPhone 6S Plus simultaneously. The results were as I expected based on the two previous tests. The iPhone 6S Plus finished first and stopped charging but I didn't unplug it from its port. The iPad 3 continued charging. Once it finished charging the timing of each charge was comparable to them both charging on their separate wall chargers. The Anker 20000mAh battery still showed 1 LED left.I put the Anker 20000mAh battery pack through its paces and it exceeded my expectation on every test, so far. I haven't owned the Anker 20000mAh battery pack long enough to test its charging longevity or if it decreases over time. If I experience any drastic changes in charging my devices, I will amend this review to reflect the results of my continued testing.At this point, I'm impressed with the test I've performed and would recommend it to anyone wanting a battery pack that holds a charge as well as delivers one. If this changes I'll let you know.. For now, it's my opinion, the Anker 20000mAh battery pack is a solid product.
title: iPhone 6S Plus, Apple Watch, IPad 3..No problem!

review_content: I really like this charger.  It provides a whole lot of power to charge a cell phone.  Very useful for me as I travel a lot and am sometimes in coffee shops where access to a plug is not always plentiful.  I do wish I could use it to charge my Mac computer, but you can't have everything I guess.
title: great for cell phone

author: Pat Kady
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2019
review_content: Easy to use.  Last long time. Great anytime you need extra battery power.

author: Erin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2019
review_content: Charges my iPhone 8 Plus extremely fast (possibly faster than the wall charger, but I didn’t time it). I used it for a three week long trip through Europe and only had to recharge it maybe three or four times from using it to charge my phone and sharing it with my three travel buddies. Holds its charge very well in between usage as well.
title: Buy this if you’re traveling!!!

author: Happydad
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2017
review_content: Had the smaller one for a year, 10,000 mph or whatever reading is. This one is definitely the bigBrother.  Highly reliable and super fast charging. A vacation cannot be complete without this
title: Highly reliable and super fast charging

author: kimpooh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2018
review_content: Sat down on a 5 hour flight with very little battery in my phone.  The woman next to me had this and let me plug in.  I bought one the minute I got home.  Fabulous purchase!
title: Yes!!!!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2019
review_content: Great product, super reliable and great for vacations. Holds enough charges for you to go on your adventures without worrying about finding a wall plug for your phone.
title: The best portable charger in the game!

author: Beth Wagner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2018
review_content: I bought this for a nine-day rafting trip through the Grand Canyon. Even though I wouldn't have cell service, I wanted to charge my phone for pictures and videos. I also wanted to keep my Kindle and Fitbit charged. This baby kept my devices charged for the whole trip and also was used by a number of my fellow rafters to charge their devices as well. As the end of the nine days, it still had half of the original power supply left.
title: Holds a charge forever!

author: c
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2019
review_content: I have owned anker battery packs before and hoped this one would live up to the name. After giving this product a solid week this unit does not live up to the anker brand. I constantly am having to press the power button to keep this battery pack charging I believed I received a faulty unit. Please be aware of this issue.
title: Bad charge

author: Frank - Augusta, GA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2017
review_content: This PowerCore 20100 is an exceptional high quality Anker recharge battery.  I like the fact that it will charge all other devices 8+ times before requiring a recharge. It also holds a charge when not in use, and it is comfortable to hold.
title: Great battery

author: Sherry Quinonez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2015
review_content: I've never been able to get any portable chargers to work on my phone (Nexus 6). I've tried at least four different ones of varying sizes and power strengths over the past two years. To my surprise and delight, this charger charger my phone to 75% in an hour! I'm hooked! Thank you Ankor!On the down side is a bit heavy and bulky.... But I'll take that in trade for its awesome power!
title: Finally a charger that actually works!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2019
review_content: Charge indicator on phone came on for less than 30 seconds and then quit charging. Anker still showed full charge.  Ubio batteries  charge the phone fine.
title: Does  not charge Galaxy S9+

author: Dustin Murphy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2017
review_content: This thing is awesome when traveling. Will charge phones and ipads no problem. It does take a long time to fully charge, but that's because it holds such a large charge. Probably enough to charge your phone 5-7 times. Highly recommended.
title: This thing is awesome when traveling

author: John J. Elert
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2016
review_content: This charger has repeatedly given my phone 3+ full charges at what seems to be a consistently fast rate. Four Stars so far because I have only used this sparingly since I bought it.It has held a full charge for months of non-use, and charges my phone faster than any car cigarette lighter port with an inverter and a standard AC plug, or any of the few cigarette port USB chargers I've bought over the years. It does as advertised in a timely fashion.I'll start use this in the car because it is faster than the car charging options (thanks Hyundai). I have to find a safe place to stow it so it won't become a lethal missile if I get in an accident.It charges fully overnight, so I sadly think this is a better option than using my Hyundai's multiple charging sources.Wherever I stash it so it won't kill me in an accident, it'll be great non-lethal weapon in the event of a car-jacking, I need to safely secure it in an easy to access location.John
title: Love it, mostly because my Hyundai's charging options disappoint

author: Jian Ying Zheng
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
review_content: I dont know why this power bank battery life is so short，I bought many anker charger before，but this one not good，something wrong with  it？

author: Mark Bozek
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2019
review_content: I think I might have got some bunk batteries. Bought two of these and both of them stop charging after a couple of minutes. I have to keep pressing the button to turn it back on.

author: GAR
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2017
review_content: It charges very very slowly.  It took 12 hours and wasn't half charged (using a 2.4A charger).  I returned the product for a refund.  The Seller did say it was possible mine was defective.  To their credit, Anker is very proactive and responsive.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2020

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2019

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2018

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2019
review_content: I really want to give this product a 5/5 but it keeps hitting off on me as I’m charging. The customer service is top notch but the product doesn’t seemTo work longer than 2 months. I love anker because of the customer service but the product is not as good yet

author: Jake
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
review_content: I like that it charges my phone fast, but my 4 year old Anker battery that is fast charge capable drains power at a slower rate.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2018
review_content: Left it plugged in to my 2016 MacBook Pro for over six hours and when I came back, it still hadn't finished charging. The only reason I'm not returning is because shipping costs would be more than its worth.  Two stars because at least I can use it as a backup power bank in case my other back up power bank fails.

review_content: I love how you're able to charge two things at once and how it shows the amount of battery life it has left.

author: GRADE-A-Reviews
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2017
review_content: What an excellent product! Having both the Google pixel XL 2 as well as the Google pixelbook my devices require a large amount of power. With this single charger fully charged I can fully charge my pixel book I can fully charge my pixel XL phone and then I can fully charge my tablet. I'm not sure if I could keep going with how much I could charge but it can charge a lot. And it does it intelligently, the foresight of this company into the craftsmanship of the device is not a regular occurrence in these particular items. They tend to have power issues and Regulatory issues but not this device it provides exactly how much the device is designed to take and not anymore. Plus when you're backed by a company like this you really get first class service. The customer service is excellent and they strive to make customers happy. Not prompted to say this, honestly, it's just because I had some interaction with customer service and they were quick to address my concerns and troubleshoot the issues and really go the extra mile to show that they are a company that is trying to raise the bar instead of just meet the bar. I know it's just the charger like I said but it's something that does what it says it's going to do and it does it well.
title: I was very happy to find out that you get more than what you pay for here. This is an excellent device I highly recommend to any

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2016
review_content: This battery only drains 25% acting as my phone's primary source of power for 8 HOURS! On top of the product, shipping was delayed, and I mistakenly contacted the company, and they were generous enough to send a request to Amazon in my favor. Great company, and a great product!

author: Nsiddons
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2016
review_content: Let me first start off with I AM AN ANKER FAN. I have been ever since I bought my first 13000mAh charger. Not trying to sound like a commercial but their products just work, and the 1 time I ever had an issue emailed them they sent me a brand new unit, didn't want me to send the old unit in for repair then wait for the fixed broken unit to come back truly hassle free. Now to review this PowerCore 20100 first thing I noticed is its almost the same exact size as my 13000. Next I noticed the flat black color as opposed to the glossy finish of my old product I have OCD so finger prints is an issue for me. Out the box I took it out on the road didn't charge it at all(I forgot to charge my iPhont 6s plus and my Apple Watch) plugged both in and got a full charge on both devices in no time at all. And the 20100 still has more juice. I have learned to trust Anker over the past year that I have been dealing with them. Didn't understand why there was a need for a 20100mAh when there is a 13000mAh (which didn't have enough power for my iPad, iPhone, & Apple Watch for a weekend at Disney) and a 26800mAh but 20100mAh is more than enough to do the job.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, and I promised that my review is fair and honest.
title: Not trying to sound like a commercial but their products just work

author: M5

Only thing this model is missing is a LED flash light like its larger models.

review_content: This thing is awesome! Lots of portable power when and wherever you need it. Charged it all the way up, then it charged my iPhone 6 four or five times from < 50%, my 7" tablet from 0%, and a bluetooth speaker, and still had one "bar" of juice left. Appears to be of very solid construction. Comes with a nice carrying bag and USB to micro USB cable for recharging it. As far as reliability, I can't say, as I haven't had it for very long, but judging from the way it's made and the use I've gotten from it so far, I don't anticipate any problems, but if there are, it comes with an 18 month warranty (unusual in this day).

author: Linda M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2018
review_content: If there's any chance at all that you might fly somewhere and want to take a power bank with you then don't even consider buying this. The capacity rating is almost impossible to read. The low contrast letters are less than 1/16" high, and  even with exactly the right lighting are almost impossible to read. I couldn't tell what it said until taking the attached picture (with a properly labeled power bank for comparison). Airport security is unlikely to even try to read the capacity, so they won't allow it on the plane. If you've got time to stand in line again maybe you can do something other than let security throw it in the garbage. There's absolutely no excuse for such poorly thought out labeling.Even if you know for a fact that you'll never fly you should buy one of the many better products available instead of rewarding bad design.
title: You can't fly with this.

author: MARK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2016
review_content: INFREAKINGCREDIBLE! I've had this for 6 months and it still shocks me at how powerful it is. It has a battery meter of 4 lights.I haven't gotten it below 2 before recharging; which takes a while. Our power went out about a month ago. My wife and I have I Phone 6's which were both dead before bed. I have to listen to white noise (ocean sounds) to sleep. Went to bed early 8:30 PM (because the power was out). Plugged in my phone playing ocean sounds and my wife's phone. Got out of bed at 5:30 AM. Both phones were completely charged. Keep in mind that mine was playing sounds all night long. It had used 1 of 4 lights. Took it to work to charge my phone. I work 24 hour shifts, so I have to charge around 5PM. That day everyone else was watching crap on TV so I was watching movies on my phone. Watched 2 movies. When I got off shift my phone was completely charged and the PowerCore was down 2 of 4 lights. Couldn't be happier! Still going strong!
title: INFREAKINGCREDIBLE!
