author: Oscar D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2016
review_content: I have waited 3 months to review this product since I needed time to fully test its capability, and it has impressed me very much. My main use for the portable charger is topping off my phone and tablet (at the same time) at work, and in the car on long drives where I use my phone as a GPS.The cellphone I'm currently using is an LG G3, which has a 3000 mAh battery which is in excellent condition. The Anker Battery pack has a stated capacity of 20,000 mAh, which I have tested to be extremely accurate. As a test one week, I charged the Anker battery to full capacity (four solid blue lights) and waited for my phone to get to below at least 10% before plugging it in each time, each day. I was able to fully charge my phone 6 times, plus charge my tablet another 32% (which has a 6000 mah battery). This is a fantastic result that gives me a lot of flexibility, especially if the power goes out in the house.Pros:- Accurate and long lasting battery capacity.- Has two "IQ" USB ports which detect the amperage needed for the device up to 2.4 amps each port. This makes me worry less about overcharging or having the battery heat up by charging faster than intended by the manufacturer.Cons:The power bank itself is somewhat long, doesn't quite fit in my center console.
title: Accurate and Smart Design

author: George
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2015
review_content: This is the best emergency batter pack ever!  It charges several power-hungry Androids before needing to be rechanrged.Beware!  It can take some time to recharge.  If you plug it into a computer, it can take two days to recharge - best to use a 2A USB 2.1 wall charger.

author: Jason
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2016
review_content: The anker 20000 mah portable charger packs a serious amount of power in such a sleek package. This portable charger features a total of 4.8A of charging power and a total capacity of 20000 mah which can charge a samsung galaxy s6 five times and a Ipad mini 4 two times. This unit is perfect for those who are often traveling or just want to charge your portable battery packs less often. This unit is extremely durable which features fire resistant polycarbonate, impacted tested, vibration tested, and extreme temperature tested up to 158 F. The unit comes nicely packaged and the unit comes with a carrying case and a micro usb cable. The included pictures shows the package of the unit, the accessories, and a comparison to the 5000 mah portable charger from anker. As you can see the 20000 mah charger is slightly larger than the 5000 mah charger but it packs 3 times the amount of power compared to the small unit.

author: Greylupes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2016
review_content: I'm really not sure what I'm more impressed with, this product, or Anker support.I was not paid, and did not receive a discount for my review, this is just a great product from a great company. I've bought several large capacity batteries recently for my MS Surface 3 (non-pro). While several of them have been equal or greater in advertised capacity, in testing they have faiIed to deliver anything close to the advertised capacity or full 2.4 amp charging rate. Additionally the built quality on all of them have been poor to middling. This unit is very solid, with no flex or poorly aligned seams. The case itself is a "soft touch" that is comfortable to hold and still nice to look at. It is about as heavy as a battery of this capacity should be, though I haven't weighted it, "Light weight" is not a description that fits. That being said, it's equal or lighter than the other 3 I've tried.I had a 5 hour flight recently, and spent the whole time playing "Grim Dawn" which pushes my Surface to it's limit power wise. Additionally my girlfriend in the seat next to me was watching movies on her Galaxy Tab 7. When we landed, this thing still had 2 bars on it, and that was the defective one.The original pack I purchased wouldn't finish charging, I left it plugged in for a couple days and it still wouldn't register as "Full". Anker support responded to my support request in under 12 hours, and replaced the defective unit promptly and politely. In a world of high technology, things will go wrong, even Apple makes a bad iPhone every now and then. The important thing is what the company does when something does go wrong. Anker support is as good as their product are. Buy this.PS, If you think I got paid for this review, just go look at how crappy most of my other reviews are, and realize I like this product enough to write more than 2 sentences about it.
title: Amazing battery, even more amazing support. Buy this one, it's worth the money.

author: Puablo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2016
review_content: I own a bunch of the Anker lipstick size chargers in the 3000 capacity range, but my last one seemed to always die out pretty fast. I tend to use them when travelling on airplanes, charging during the flight. The one I replaced seemed to only do one full charge of an HTC 10. That's great for a late night last minute recharge, not great for all day usage.So I bought this power behemoth at a great price. But I neglected to do one thing - check out how much it weighed. 12oz is more than you'd think if you already have a stuffed travel bag. Granted I don't really think it's a deal breaker - and hey maybe I would have still bought it anyways - but I would have reconsidered the 10000 size instead of seeing big charging numbers and blindly buying the bigger one.Having said that, this sucker holds a lot of charge. I haven't drained it yet but I can see this easily charging two phones and a tablet on a transoceanic flight. Odds are I'll just toss two 3000s in my bag for short trips, and only use this on long hauls.In summary, be careful what you wish for. :)
title: Unlimited power... but a little heavy.

author: Sam
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2016
review_content: I am glad I got this power bank, I don't even have to LOOK at an outlet for about a week after I charge this up.First Impression:-Nice Box.-Opened it and found the power bank and charger cord sitting safely/well packaged inside.-Came with a nice little pouch to put the battery and chord in.-Had a little paper containing customer support info, just in case.-This does not include the wall charger, it includes the battery, cord, and carrying pouch.After a bunch of use:-Charges my Bose QC35 and S5 Mini quickly, no charging speed difference from charging speed with the battery, or anker wall charger (that I bought at the same time)-I got a battery monitor app on my phone, and it shows that as my phone reaches 100% the charging slope makes a hill shape, with the charging speed gradually slowing until it reaches 100%. I don't know if its the phone of battery bank doing this, but this is how a lipo battery (phone battery) should be charged.-When the battery bank is completely dead, it takes about 8 hours for my Anker wall charger to charge it. (I kinda like Anker products)-There is a little crack that is starting to form near the charging end of the battery bank, and there is a slight bump where the crack is,it still works fine, but I will keep this review updated as to whether it gets worse or not.All in all, I should have got this long ago, and I am very glad I have it now.
title: For the Frequently Powerless (or Those With Terrible Battery Life)

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2016

He was so impressed he ordered himself one on the spot. lol Great deal and product!!My only Con is it takes some time to charge the PowerCore up.took about 7hours to charge it from half way to full.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2016

author: DT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2017
review_content: This is my third Anker battery that I have purchased. The others were a PowerCore 10000 and 13000. My experience with Anker has always been positive. The 10k and 13k provided my devices with quick charges and I always felt that they underestimated their recharge numbers. I often found it possible to squeeze out an extra .25 or .5 of a charge on top of what they advertised.The 20000 unfortunately let me down. The packaging itself is the usual Anker standard, clean and compact. The battery itself has a matte textured finish which is good for grip. It's about the size of a medium tv remote and has that quality feeling heft to it. It also came with the standard 1/2 charge out the box. I plugged it into my wall charger before going to bed. I figured an 8 hr charge would top it off and I'd be set for the next day in case I stayed out after work. After I plugged it in, the blinky LED light went on to indicate the charge. Imagine my disappointment the next morning when I woke up to find that it was still blinking and still at the 2/4 dots! I am waiting to hear back from Amazon about exchanging this battery for a different unit. Maybe I got a defective one?******edit 11/24/17*****Anker reached out to me and offered to send me a replacement battery. I received the replacement within a few days and it works perfectly! This is my first experience with anything from Anker that didn’t work as expected and I’m happy that their customer service is first rate!
title: Excellent battery, even better customer service

title: Best customer Service is worth everything.

author: Matthew M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2016
review_content: Excellent Power Bank that truly was a steal for Black Friday. Now that I know what this device is capable of, I would honestly be more than willing to pay the full price of it. It comes standard with 4 small circle indicator lights. Out the box it has 2 lights filled meaning half charge. I used it to charge my iPhone 6S Plus until it died which took me approximately 3.75 charges when my battery was 5% or less when first connected. I also purchased this because it is the last amount of mAh that is allowed on flights (20100). Out of the Amazon box it comes with a sleeve/ pouch which is really nice since that saved me about $10-$13. Comes with a micro USB to USB for charging the Power Bank. There's no power brick for your to plug into the wall. Thankfully in my house, the outlets have USB integrated into the outlets. Overall I'm beyond impressed with the Power Bank and I highly recommend this to anyone who travels or may need this for a rainy day when there's a hurricane or blizzard coming when there will be no power. This Anker Power Bank packs a punch!
title: Excellent Power Bank With Reliability and Performance

author: Michael E. Stewart
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2015
review_content: This Anker battery pack is something else. My wife and I love camping, and when I saw this pack on sale at Amazon for $40 I didn't even think twice. The pack has a combined output over 2 USB ports of 4.8A, which means two tablets can simultaneously charge quickly on it. I tested the pack with my Galaxy Note 4 and Nexus 9, and depending on the device, seems to charge at a rate of about 22-32mAh/min. My nexus 9 (with a battery size of 6700mAh) would charge about 4% every 10 minutes, and my Note 4 (3220mAh) would charge about 10% in 10 minutes. Very happy with the pack. I was also very pleased with the size. I have a much older 12000mAh Teknmotion powermotion battery pack that is HUGE...about 4" x 6.3" x .7". The Anker is about twice the charge at 20,000mAh, and is half as wide, same height, and barely thicker, not to mention WAY more aesthetically pleasing.NOTE: As I pulled out my old battery pack to measure it for the review, I found I had been hoodwinked. The powermotion 12000 (advertised on Amazon as a 12,000mAh pack) actually only has a 6,000mAh battery. Which explains so much now. So basically this new Anker pack is 3x the charge, and still smaller. I'm now even more impressed with the Anker pack!The pack also comes with a little instruction booklet, a relatively short micro USB cable, and a nice soft mesh carry bag. Very nice packaging, great product design, and a killer price made this an absolute no brainer.
title: So charge. Much wow.

author: Scarlet Fury
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2016
review_content: I bought this charger specifically for playing Pokemon Go, as that incredibly addicting, but fun app is a real battery killer. So far, on a full charge, it's been able to charge my Samsung Galaxy S5 from as low as 5% to 100% in roughly 1 hour as long as I'm not using my phone for the game, and if I am, then it saves my battery from depleting significantly and can charge it at a rate of about 1% per 10 min. I've charged my phone a total of at least 4 - 5 times with it and the pack still says it has 50% charge left in it, so if I ever go on a Pokemon spree longer than a day, I'm sure this thing will handle it with ease and last the whole time.It does take a while to charge the pack itself, but if you leave it overnight, it should be at full capacity by morning.The only drawbacks I can find so far is that it's slightly heavy, so while it does fit in your pocket, it could pull your pants/shorts down! xDThat, and it does get the wall adapter you use to charge it (In this case my phone charger) REALLY HOT, but that's not too big a deal. (Roughly as hot as a microwavable frozen meal after it's just finished cooking)Outside of Pokemon, it definitely is nice to be able to charge my phone when I'm nowhere near an outlet in class or just walking around while at work. I'd definitely take it (With a full charge) on a several day long camping trip to keep my phone alive for emergencies/flashlight apps and such, and I'm sure it'd be great for it!But-! All things considered, it is absolutely terrific! :D
title: A real battery life-saver/extender for playing Pokemon Go for extended periods of time!

author: Edward S Infald
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2017
review_content: When they work, they will give you plenty of charging power. Conversely, when they don't work, it is expensive and frustrating. I have had 4 of these. 1 out of 4 works. They just stop charging. It could take 3 - 5 days to charge with the Anker charger. They lasted anywhere from 6 months to about a year. Needless to say, without an order number from Amazon, the 18 month warranty is useless. They will not cover it. Over $100.00 in the trash. The 10,000 milliamp is much better. No problems with those. DO NOT BUY THIS MODEL!UPDATE 08-15-17The Anker customer service has been very helpful and very persistent in trying to resolve this issue. I appreciate their efforts. The initial review I had was a simple issue resolved at the recommendation of Anker customer support. I retract my statement to not buy. It was simply an issue with the cable I was using. Anker, please accept my sincerest apology. Thank you for your help. 5 STARS!
title: UPDATE TO 5 STARS!

author: KDunbar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2017
review_content: So, I have had three portable chargers, including this one. The previous two were an AmazonBasics 10000mAh that crapped out and stopped holding a charge six months after purchase and a 13000mAh Limeade that was around five years old and no longer holding a charge. So I was the proud owner of two smallish black bricks and out of options for portable charging—I’m a student and outlets aren’t always plentiful on campus.So I did a little research, and came to the conclusion that this Anker charger would be sufficient for what I need. On one full charge of the Anker portable charger, I charged my iPhone 7 to 100% at least 6 times. To reach 100% from 10%, it took around thirty minutes. This thing is an absolute beast. If you’re looking for a solid portable charger that isn’t enormous, this is the one.Edit: Almost a year later and this thing saves my skin daily, on campus or not. I bring this beast everywhere. It does take a few hours to charge the actual unit itself fully (it did even when first purchased), but hoo boy is the wait worth it. I can fully charge my phone a few times over a few days with this bad dog. Totally impressed, still.
title: Look no further!

author: Phil Durham
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2016
review_content: I have used several portable chargers over the last couple of years, and this one is the best by far.  It charges completely overnight, and can be used to re-charge phone/ tablet, etc, or to run the phone/ tablet if you have little battery life left and still need to use the product. There are four subtle LED lights indicating available charge.  When all four are lit, you have 100%; when three you have 75%, etc. I would suggest getting USB/micro cables of various lengths to use with this. You can charge a tablet and a phone at the same time as there are two USB ports. I will  note that it has NO wall charger with it.  The maker apparently assumes you already have a proper USB-style wall charger of appropriate output.  I would suggest getting a charger capable of at least 2 amp output, or I suspect that your charging times will be quite long..
title: Excellent Charger

author: KarenR
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2016
review_content: We were looking for a solution and found it in this sleek, sophisticated looking work of art.  And found it here.  Our new Harley trike does not have a USB or power outlet for charging things that need to be charged.  It's about the only thing that it doesn't have.  Anyway, we do a lot of touring over long distances on the HOG, and use Google Maps for navigation, which sucks up a ton of cellular battery. This will be used primarily for keeping us charged and en route. It was easy to use right out of the box, and arrived with a 50% charge. It works great with my Samsung Galaxy Note S5 which is what I will be using for navigation.  As a sidenote, it does NOT work with my Motorola Xoom tablet... when plugged in I get an error message to the effect that the Xoom doesn't support USB chargers.  No matter... I didn't buy it to charge my Xoom which apparently has a proprietary configuration.  I totally recommend this... it is clearly heavy duty... a real "looker" and will serve us well.
title: A perfect solution for cellular-based navigation on the Harley

I was still able to put my smartphone in the bag along with my lip balm and some cards. It charges by Samsung S6 Edge Plus fairly quickly. There are indicator lights (1-4 dots) that show you the battery level. When the battery level was at 2 dots, I recharged the battery and charging took several hours to get fully charged. I left it overnight charging and it was done when I checked in the morning.

Otherwise, this charges my iPhone and iPad just as fast as the charger they came with and it can charge my iPhone several times, but my iPad only once and a quarter. author: D. Bratman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2016
review_content: I have found this unit to be absolutely indispensable. Running out of power when away from an outlet can be a disaster. I never travel without this charger, which charges my iPhone to full power about 6 times before it needs recharging itself, which takes 6 to 8 hours and I typically do overnight. I've lost phone power at the worst times--once when I was trying to get an UBER and my phone died--all because I didn't predict how long I'd be away from an outlet. Modern devices and apps can drain your phone or iPad fast, especially when they get older. This device solves all of those problems for me and saved me from having to get a new phone this year. Anker has a great reputation and an excellent warranty. I first bought one for my son and once I saw all the utility it gave him, I knew I had to have one and I'm very glad I made the purchase. You can get less expensive chargers and I have thrown my money away on them. Don't make that mistake. Go with the Anker from the start.
title: What a feeling of security

review_content: Took it camping. Between this and my Anker solar panel and a little bit of sunshine, I managed to keep a phone and iPad alive for the two day trip. Because "roughing it" without our devices was just a bit too rough. And my 6-year-old won't sleep without his precious white noise. So actually it was the phone, the iPad and the speaker. We got to get away from it all, AND play Minion Run and post the obligatory pics on Facebook. And this little brick was there for us the whole way. At least I know that once the Apocalypse hits and the grid goes down, I'll always be able to keep my radio charged in case there's some guy in the big city on the airwaves daily wondering if he's the last person alive. And if my kid behaves himself in the zombie fights, he might get a treat of a few minutes of Minecraft every week or so. A++, Anker. Thanks from all the tech-crazy-but-also-too-broke-for-a-generator preppers out there.
title: The power bank that will outlast the apocalypse

author: michael a anatala
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2017
review_content: "High-speed charging: PowerIQ and VoltageBoost combine to deliver the fastest possible charge." I copied and pasted this right from part of the description of the PowerCore 20100.This is extremely misleading. I bought this battery because my LG G4 was having major issues with its battery. I actually switched to a Galaxy S7 a day before this battery came in the mail. So two brand spanking new products. I plugged my Galaxy into this battery, expecting a super fast charge, just like the quote I posted says, as did so many of the 5 star reviews. Well, after an hour and twenty minutes, I had gone from 2% to a whopping 19%. Yeah, I don't consider that fast. I called Anker and was told that this product does not support fast charge, but rather the PowerCore 20000 does. If this product doesn't support fast charge, don't put in the description that the product has technology to deliver the fastest charge possible. Not everyone is a techie, so the whole not having Qualcomm thing will go over a lot of people's heads (like mine). From what I gather, this battery is geared more towards being able to charge your phone, tablet, etc. multiple times before needing to be recharged itself, and not actually charge your products quickly. Which is fine and dandy. But that's not the type of battery I was looking for. I am returning the product.
title: Misleading description.

author: Lilah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2018
review_content: I bought this in preparation for my trip, and I am so thankful I got it. I put it on my carry on. Throughout my whole trip, it charged my phone to 100% multiple times and never died on me. It never even got lower than 2 bars of battery.
title: Best Portable Charger

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2015
review_content: I am an attorney. I drive to courts all over the state of New Jersey. As a result I need my cell phone to be operational at all times. Unfortunately I use it so much that i wear the battery down to zero almost every day. I am not always somewhere near a phone charger. As a result, I have missed very important phone calls and even lost a few prospective clients because they called the next attorney before I could get back to them. I have had smaller external batteries in the past, but usually those only give me maybe half a charge before they die. If you forget to charge them every night, your screwed. This product has been an absolute game changer for me. I charge it once over the weekend, throw it in my brief case, and rely on it to charge my phone and all my other electronics while i"m in court. it's Friday right now and my charger is showing 75% power remaining. ive been charging my phone on it all week. I would recommend this product to anyone who relies on there phone for business purposes. great product!
title: excellent product

review_content: Purchased the Anker to use with my iPhone 6 on a trip to Ireland. It worked out really well and I was well pleased. The Anker held its charge well during the entire trip (10 days). If I managed to plug in my iPhone the wrong way, the 4 blue lights on the Anker didn't light up and I knew to start over.
title: It worked out really well and I was well pleased. I had brought my iPhone (white) charging cord

author: Aj
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2016
review_content: This Anker product is functionally great. It holds charge for a long time, allows simultaneous charging of two devices,  and delivers the optimum charge for your decide based on  a technology that Anker calls IQ. In my tests, a fully charged bank provided enough juice to charge my phone 5 times and my tablet one and a half times. This was more than sufficient for me to get through the week when I am on road.Now for the cons, this has a smooth finish which slips from your hand quickly if not careful. This could cause accidental drops and damages. I wish Anker had changed the texture so that it feels firm in your hands.Secondly, the pouch provided was flimsy, not a deal breaker but would have liked a better pouch that would provide protection than just aesthetic appeal.  Overall,  a great product that is functionally well made with minor flaws in presentation.
title: Functionally good, could be better with presentation

I also charged this device via the USP off of a dell laptop.  I'm happy with the purchase.  This is fairly heavy.  I did not give it 5 stars because I am a firm believer that since I-Phones and I-Pads are so prevalent in today's business and personal use, why was there not an adapter included to fit the I Pad / Phone products ?  Now I'm juggling between products to share a common charger.

author: Muji
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2016
review_content: If you own an external battery pack and you’re look for an upgrade, you probably don’t need to read any further. 20100 mAh. 4.8A/5V. PowerIQ. VoltageBoost. What else needs to be said? Go buy it.For those of you who don’t know which battery pack and need further guidance, keep reading. I’m a frequent road warrior traveler and I need an external battery pack for my smartphone. I previously own several other brands battery  and I stuck with them because they’ve been so good to me. And they’re great to have especially in your luggage or in your car, because you never know when you’ll run out of juice. But there are several reasons why the Anker 20100 stands above and beyond its competitions:1. Simultaneously dual 2.4A/5V output through both USB port! This is extremely great to have around. No longer do you have pick and choose which device gets charge faster. The issue with New Trent is one of the USB is 2.1A/5V and the other is 1A/5V. Which meant one device would have taken a significant amount of time to charge. With a tablet and smartphone, it always meant one of them wouldn’t be charged in time. It’s a constant hassle to juggle the charging.2. PowerIQ and VoltageBoost! Means whatever device or whatever USB cable you have, your device will charged at the most optimal rate. I thought this was just some marketing lingo to attract customers, but when you compare the charge time between the New Trent vs Anker, it’s nearly half the time. It’s not a scientific analysis, but Anker 20100 is significantly faster than any of my New Trent external battery packs from what I’ve observed.
title: I previously own several other brands battery and I stuck with them because they’ve been so good to me

author: mahughes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2017
review_content: I am disappointed in how slowly this charges my iPhone 6+.  My phone was down to 47% and it took 3 hours to get it to 98%.  I tried charging with the original Apple cord, and I tried with a Anker PowerCore cable.  No improvement with the PowerCore cable.The power bank seems well contructed, I have no issues with that.  It charged up quickly enough that I have no issue with that.  But as far as charging my phone it is slow.12/05/17 Update.  Anker Customer Support contacted me about my review.  Asked for some information (Serial Number, Shipping Address).  Also said that based on my description of the charging time I was experiencing that there is something wrong with the power bank.  So I am assuming they are going to ship a replacement.  I will update this review with the outcome.12/17/17 Update.  Anker sent me another charger.  This one works much better than the first one.  A little over 2 hours from 29% to 100% on my iPhone 6+.  Very happy with the replacement and extremely happy with the customer service.  This is one of the best sellers I have dealt with on Amazon.  I am upgrading my review from 3 stars to 5 stars!
title: VERY HAPPY WITH CHARGER AND CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2016
review_content: First of all I will admit I have a problem - I'm addicted to portable chargers. Even my wife makes fun of me, but hey - our family's gadgets are always charged! I own more than a dozen of these from various manufacturers (Jackery, Monoprice, several others) and in various capacities. While some of these have been solid units this Anker is my favorite for a few reasons. The first reason is size - this is the smallest 20,000+mAh charger I've found. The second reason is weight - also the lightest one I own. The final reason is output - not every charger that claims to supply 2.4mAh or more to each outlet (especially simultaneously) does. The Anker, however, is rock solid. As a side note, for anyone who has had issues with the charging of this charger (or any other one for that matter) the issue is almost always with the cable you are using and not the charger its self. Use the high quality Anker cable that comes with this bad bot and you will be fine. Use a 10ft no-name usb cable from el-cheapo-cables.com and don't be surprised if this or any other device won't charge. So... if you need crazy big charging capacity (and who doesn't these days) bang for your buck this is the one to get!
title: Even my makes fun of me
